column1: Microprofile Fault Tolerance Timeout not throwing TimeoutException until method finished
column39: A @Timeout annotation on a service method does not throw TimeoutException after specified timeout but rather when the method is done. The timeout should occur after the specified timeout and the execution thread should be interrupted. This has been tested on both wildflyswarm 2017.12.1 and 2018.1.0.
column40: Windows 7 running JDK1.8.0_131. Also tested on macOS High Sierra with JDK1.8.0_131
column422: 19/Jan/18 8:57 AM;heiko.braun;You might have to wrap your method in @Asynchronous to see that outcome you describe. I believe that synchronous remain out of direct control. But it could well be that I am wrong.
column423:
19/Jan/18 9:47 AM;enbohm;Tried with  @Asynchronous and when I do a get() call on the future I get a ExecutionException that wraps a fault tolerance TimeoutException (so that works as expected). 

But looking at https://github.com/eclipse/microprofile-fault-tolerance/blob/master/tck/src/main/java/org/eclipse/microprofile/fault/tolerance/tck/TimeoutTest.java (#testTimeout) and https://github.com/eclipse/microprofile-fault-tolerance/blob/master/tck/src/main/java/org/eclipse/microprofile/fault/tolerance/tck/timeout/clientserver/TimeoutClient.java (see row #49) it looks lite it should interrupt the execution thread but I'm not sure if that is correct. 

I'm trying to understand https://microprofile.io/project/eclipse/microprofile-fault-tolerance/spec/src/main/asciidoc/timeout.asciidoc and it do mention that under a few situtation the interrupt won't work such as:

* The thread is blocked on blocking I/O (database, file read/write), an exception is thrown only in case of waiting for a NIO channel
* The thread isn’t waiting (CPU intensive task) and isn’t checking for being interrupted
* The thread will catch the interrupted exception (with a general catch block)

but not sure if the above applies to my test case.

Anyhow I will for now skip the usage of @Timeout in synchronous scenarios since I need to abort the execution in some other way and not wait (forever potentially) until the execution is done.
column424: 21/Feb/18 9:52 AM;mkouba;Well, it seems the tck {{TimeoutTest}} does not test this use case properly. However, I think your interpretation is correct and {{InterruptedException}} should be thrown in your test.

column1: Can not configure microprofile-config fraction in yml file
column39:
I had a simple app with a custom main doing fraction configuration:

{code}
    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
        Swarm swarm = new Swarm();

        swarm.fraction(new MicroProfileConfigFraction()
                .configSource("numbers-dir-config-source", (cs) -> {
                    cs.ordinal(600)
                            .dir("/etc/config/numbers-app/");
                }));

        swarm.start().deploy();
    }
{code}

I am trying to replace that by configuring the fraction in a yml file:

{code}
swarm:
   logging: INFO
   microprofile-config:
     config-sources:
      openshift-config-map:
        dir: "/etc/config/numbers-app/"
{code}

The doc at http://docs.wildfly-swarm.io/2018.1.0/#_eclipse_microprofile_config is not correct, the keys are swarm.microprofile-config.XXX, not swarm.micro-profile-config.XXX

When I run my Swarm app with this yml file, it fails to start:

{code}
$ java -jar target/numbers-swarm.jar
2018-01-17 15:50:59,857 INFO  [org.wildfly.swarm] (main) WFSWARM0013: Installed fraction:                  Logging - STABLE          org.wildfly.swarm:logging:2018.2.0-SNAPSHOT

column422: 17/Jan/18 9:55 AM;jmesnil;[~heiko.braun] that's the issue I mentioned in our conversation about OpenShift.

column1: Can not run Swarm demo app on OpenShift/MiniShift
column39:
Code was generated using WildFly generator and taking microprofile dependency.
For reference, the codebase is at https://github.com/jmesnil/demo-swarm-openshift

I created a Dockerfile for it based on https://github.com/wildfly-swarm/wildfly-swarm-examples/blob/master/docker/docker-jaxrs-dockerfile/docker/Dockerfile

The app runs fine in a plain Docker installation:

{code}
$ docker run -p 8080:8080 jmesnil/demo-swarm-openshift
...2018-01-15 19:58:35,926 INFO  [org.jboss.as.server] (main) WFLYSRV0010: Deployed "demo.war" (runtime-name : "demo.war")
2018-01-15 19:58:35,941 INFO  [org.wildfly.swarm] (main) WFSWARM99999: WildFly Swarm is Ready
...
{code}

The client can call the app without any issue:

{code}
$ curl  http://192.168.64.4:8080/hello
Hello from WildFly Swarm!
{code}

I pushed the created Image on docker.io at https://cloud.docker.com/app/jmesnil/repository/docker/jmesnil/demo-swarm-openshift/


If I create now an OpenShift project and deploy the image based on the spec jmesnil/demo-swarm-openshift, the pod repeatedly fails.
I am not able to get any logs for it.

If I now try to deploy this image in my local MiniShift, it also fails with this error:

column422:

That DockerFile is not something I've worked on for a very long time, so it could easily be missing something.

For deploying to Minishift and OpenShift Starter I tend to use fabric8-maven-plugin
column423:
02/Feb/18 6:38 PM;dcdh1983;I am facing the same issue when running my wildfly swarm application with arquillian cube. It occurs since the introduction of elytron starting in 2017.12.0 version of swarm.
As you report, permission is denied for the running app on audit.log file created on the root directory.

However I found a workaround (which may be ugly).

In my dockerfile before the cmd command I switch the user to the root one by adding *USER root*

So my dockerfile look like this:

{noformat}
FROM jboss/base-jdk:8

WORKDIR /usr/src/server
COPY ${deployableFilename} /usr/src/server/${deployableFilename}
EXPOSE 8080

USER root

CMD ["java", "-jar", "${deployableFilename}", "-Dswarm.http.port=8080", "-Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true"]
{noformat}

Regarding OpenShift I don't know if it will work because I have not used it yet (soon I will).
I've heard that root user is disallowed...

*Workaround*
Exclude fraction:
{code}
...
<groupId>org.wildfly.swarm</groupId>
<artifactId>microprofile</artifactId>
<exclusions>
	<exclusion>
		<groupId>org.wildfly.swarm</groupId>
		<artifactId>microprofile-fault-tolerance</artifactId>
	</exclusion>
</exclusions>
...
{code}

Unfortunately this means we can't use both fault tolerance patterns and Guava within a single app.
column373: See Gist: https://gist.github.com/dansiviter/db4a11bd1f814f5b65895dcc6f05cba3
column404: Use {{jboss-deployment-structure.xml}} and declare a dependency on the WildFly built-in guava module.
column422: 03/Jan/18 7:13 AM;mkouba;MP Fault Tolerance depends on {{com.google.guava}} module and that's probably the reason why guava artifact is removed from your WAR (there are some open issues which seem to be related). As a workaround you may try to use {{jboss-deployment-structure.xml}} and declare a dependency on the WildFly built-in guava module: {{<module name="com.google.guava" />}}, see also https://docs.jboss.org/author/display/WFLY10/Class+Loading+in+WildFly#ClassLoadinginWildFly-JBossDeploymentStructureFile.
column423:
03/Jan/18 7:23 AM;dansiviter;Yea, that worked.

If anyone else needs it until this issue is fixed:

{code:xml|title=/WEB-INF/jboss-deployment-structure.xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<jboss-deployment-structure xmlns="urn:jboss:deployment-structure:1.2">
	<deployment>
		<dependencies>
			<module name="com.google.guava" />
		</dependencies>
	</deployment>
</jboss-deployment-structure>
{code}
column424:
13/Jun/18 10:26 AM;ivan_stefanov;I have a similar problem. I am using Google's Firebase SDK in my MicroProfile app. The Firebase lib itself brings in Guava. So, no direct dependency from my app, but still I got the ClassNotFoundException.

I first tried the workaround with jboss-deployment-structure.xml. As I am running my app as uber jar, I placed the above file in src/main/resources/META-INF. This didn't help.

Then I applied the initial workaround with exclusion of fault tolerance. It worked. So far I am fine with this workaround, but I am not sure until when, as I plan to use some MP FT features soon. So I would appreciate an official solution. :)

Thank you very much! :)

column423: 29/Mar/18 5:50 AM;mkouba;It seems that security constraints are only generated for methods annotated with {{@Path}}. However in JAX-RS the resource methods are all methods of a resource class annotated with a _request method designator_ ({{@GET}}).

column1: MP metrics - fix support for user-defined metric producer methods
column39:
MP metrics spec is not clear in this area but it expects that a user is allowed to declare metric CDI producers which would normally result in ambiguous resolution error in CDI ({{@Metric}} is not a qualifier) and it's the responsibility of the implementation to resolve these ambiguities during bootstrap. Note that this requires a non-trivial extension "magic". In fact, it's definitely an uncommon approach and might even be considered a bad practise.

The relevant TCK tests would be probably ignored in the scope of MP 1.2 and MP 1.3. A clarification is expected in MP 2.0.

See also https://github.com/eclipse/microprofile-metrics/issues/188 and https://github.com/eclipse/microprofile-metrics/issues/188#issuecomment-350975427 (this comment also describes the solution we'd like to use).
column422: 12/Dec/17 4:50 AM;mkouba;Implementation note: since metrics spec expects the user-defined producers to be only invoked if a metric does not exist we would have to +wrap+ the producer logic, i.e. observe {{ProcessProducer}} events and modify the existing producers.
column423: 23/Aug/18 5:03 PM;kenfinni;[~pilhuhn], has there been any progress on this issue in Metrics spec?

column1: Metrics must return a 406 for OPTIONS and text/plain
column39:
MP-Metrics requires that an OPTIONS request for a media type other than application/json results in a 406 respsonse.

The MP-Metrics 1.0.1 TCK enforces this

Expected status code <406> doesn't match actual status code <200>.

        at org.eclipse.microprofile.metrics.test.MpMetricTest.testPrometheus406ForOptions(MpMetricTest.java:648)
column373: Use 1.0.1 for the tck version for MP-Metrics

column1: Docker shutdowm - exit code
column39:
If we stop a Docker-container, containing a Wildfly-Swarm application, then the exit code is 143.
The application graceful shutdown, everything fine, except the exit code.
Currently we have not found any solution/workaround like "ENV LAUNCH_JBOSS_IN_BACKGROUND 1" from Wildfly/Jboss EAP etc.

We start Docker with:
{{ADD maven/my-swarm-app-swarm.jar /opt/my-swarm-app-swarm.jar
ENTRYPOINT ["sh","-c", "java $JAVA_OPTS -jar /opt/my-swarm-app-swarm.jar"]}}
column40:

Following maven modules are in place: swagger-webapp, jaxrs, swagger, monitor
Docker version 1.13.1
column422: 27/Jul/20 4:32 AM;lthon;Thorntail is now end-of-life: https://thorntail.io/posts/the-end-of-an-era/ Closing all open issues.

column1: Exception mapperfor JsonParseException is ignored
column39:
Microprofile in Wildfly Swarm 2017.8.1 is shipped with {{com.fasterxml.jackson.jaxrs:jackson-jaxrs-json-provider:jar:2.7.4}} which contains built-in exception mappers for {{JsonParseException}} and {{JsonMappingExceptionMapper}} annotated with {{@Provider}}. Those exception mappers are picked up by Resteasy's auto-scanning and thus custom exception mappers cannot be registered (https://github.com/fasterxml/jackson-jaxrs-providers/issues/22).

This issue could be easily fixed by upgrading  {{com.fasterxml.jackson.jaxrs:jackson-jaxrs-json-provider:jar}} to version {{2.8.0+}}.

mvn clean install
# to see the CDI class loader errors you can add -Dswarm.logging=DEBUG

{code}

column1: Increase DataGrid 7.3 image tag version to 1.5
column39:
New image version for DataGrid is available. We should change DataGrid 7.3 image tag to '1.5'.

In our HA template is for specifying datagrid image env. variable "DATAGRID_IMAGE", default value of this variable is set to "registry.redhat.io/jboss-datagrid-7/datagrid73-openshift:1.4".

In BA operator we have specified Datagrid image tag version in constants. There is set Image tag version to 1.3 - see https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-cloud-operator/blob/release-v1.4.x/pkg/controller/kieapp/constants/constants.go#L114

column1: Stunner - it is possible to corrupt diagram and lose all made changes
column39:
If you try to connect Event sub-process with itself you will see an error (in attachment) and it is not possible to continue your work, all changes will be lost.

P.S. I guess we can disable quick menu entirely for Event sub-process (except delete and morph buttons) since it is not possible to append nodes to Event sub-processes.

h2. Manual PR Acceptance test
- [Stunner] Try connect to itself
-- Start events (/)
-- Intermediate events (/)
-- End events (/)
-- Tasks (/)
-- Subprocesses (/)
-- Gateways (/)
- [Stunner] save and reopen (/)
- [Stunner] moving existing connection to achieve self-reference (?)
-- Not possible achieve self-reference, however user is not informed with error/warning
column373:
# add Event sub-process
# try to connect Event sub-process with itself

Actual Result:
It is not possible to continue your work, all made changes will be lost.

Expected Result:
It shouldn't be possible to do any append actions including outgoing sequence flow from Event sub-processes.

column1: CS-D: Loss of incremental performance when using groupBy()
column39:
In some OptaPlanner examples, we have seen major performance degradation when switching to Constraint Streams. (As much as 95 % of DRL performance can be lost.) This has been shown to come from the way that the groupBy() building block is implemented using Drools.

The problem gets progressively worse with bigger data sets, clearly pointing to a scalability issue.

The solution is to redesign the CS-D implementation to handle groupBy() more efficiently. More specifically, the use of more than one from() DRL statement needs to be avoided.

Some more information can be found in the following working document:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1s4pMSN3qLO5LLE7PeMAwj5RQfpzvu8wkqj_t5jB3cEc/edit
column332: This is a known issue, which hasn't been fixed yet. The only workaround is to use a different score calculation (e.g. DRL or incremental).
column404: There is no workaround.

column1: [DMN Designer] Java Date field is not converted to DMN date type
column39:
DROOLS-4694 introduces possibility to generate DMN data type from a Java class. There is an issue that if Java class has a {{java.util.Date}} field, such is not converted into a DMN {{date}} nor {{date and time}} field.

Note, regarding java built in types, there is one more not expected conversion, java {{Character}} is converted into DMN {{string}}. However I am not sure as Character is single character, if it shouldn't be converted into DMN number.

h2. Acceptance criteria
{{java.util.Date}} is converted to DMN {{date and time}}
column332: Generation of DMN data type from Java data objects doesn't work as expected for 'java.util.Date' fields.
column373:
# Opena  project in business central
# Add a java data object, that will have one {{java.util.Date}} field
# Save and close the java class
# Open a dmn file
# Select {{Data Types}} tab
# Click {{Import Data Object}}
# Pick the java class from this Steps to Reproduce
# Click import
# Check if the given java {{java.util.Date}} field was converted to DMN {{date}} nor {{date and time}}

column424:
28/May/19 7:47 AM;danielezonca;Some additional information related to Matteo's commet:
Every time an editor ask to WB services to have the {{KieContainer}}, the project is built if nobody did it before and in any case it "clone" the KieContainer using these steps
https://github.com/kiegroup/drools/blob/9b5e720dcca99ee7cb2bbe7ccc9748b1a41dbc4f/kie-dmn/kie-dmn-core/src/test/java/org/kie/dmn/core/DMNUpdateTest.java#L284
That code internally clone the resources and for DMN files invoke this method for deserialize DMNModel
https://github.com/kiegroup/drools/blob/54abc934e2ed59edf8292075b87f767c5a722d74/kie-dmn/kie-dmn-core/src/main/java/org/kie/dmn/core/impl/DMNModelImpl.java#L441
But during that compile(..) invocation, DMN compiler has no information about other models so no import is resolved

and deletes all the other templates.

Previous to 7.3.0, no templates were ever released except for:

The decision made was that the postgresql template would become supported as a reference implementation that customers could easily use, and serve as an example to follow for customization. It would remain as the only template, and the others (which were never released) would be removed.

column1: ScoreCalculationCountLimit termination with multi-threaded solving freezes TennisBenchmarkTest
column39:
TennisBenchmarkTest doesn't finish once multi-threaded solving is turned on.

jvisualvm doesn't show any deadlock, move threads are alternately running and waiting. Attaching application snapshot.

Turning multi-threaded solving on in benchmarks for different examples (tried with NQueens) didn't show the issue.
column422: 04/Mar/19 2:15 PM;emmurphy;[~ge0ffrey] should I add this to the Known Issues section of the 7.3 RN or will it be resolved before GA?
column423: 08/Mar/19 10:57 AM;emmurphy;[~rsynek] [~ge0ffrey] if this will not be fixed by GA, I'll add it to the Known Issues section of the RN. In that case, would you please give me the steps to reproduce and any workaround?
column424:
11/Mar/19 8:13 AM;rsynek;[~emmurphy] the issue basically means that:
https://docs.optaplanner.org/7.18.0.Final/optaplanner-docs/html_single/index.html#scoreCalculationCountTermination
does not work with multi-threaded solving.

the symptoms:
- OptaPlanner configured with the score calculation count termination does not terminate

workaround:
- use any other kind of termination

Note: the score calculation count termination is mostly used for testing purposes, not for a production use.
column425:
14/Mar/19 2:42 PM;emmurphy;[~rsynek] thanks. Please review this entry:
4.5. RED HAT BUSINESS OPTIMIZER
The ScoreCalculationCountLimit termination with multi-threaded solving freezes the TennisBenchmarkTest [RHDM-740]

Issue: Red Hat Business Optimizer configured with the score calculation count termination does not terminate. The score calculation count termination is primarily used for testing.

Workaround: Use another type of termination.

Does it apply to PAM as well?
column426:
15/Mar/19 4:06 AM;rsynek;[~emmurphy] although the issue manifests in this particular test, it does not tell the user much information. If the release note must contain exact name of this issue, I would suggest renaming it to "ScoreCalculationCountLimit termination does not work with multi-threaded solving".

> Does it apply to PAM as well?
Business Optimizer is available in PAM, too, as far as I can tell. So the answer is yes.
column427: 15/Mar/19 2:42 PM;emmurphy;Updated, thanks [~rsynek]

column429: 17/Jun/20 5:43 PM;ge0ffrey;It's still an issue, I've confirmed it again recently. No one external waiting for it, but it's a bug that needs to be solved. I'd like to change the target for 7.9 - not sure how to do that.
column430: 17/Jun/20 6:27 PM;tirelli;Moved target to 7.9 as per previous comment.
column431: 16/Sep/20 10:01 AM;ge0ffrey;We won't be able to get to this non-critical issue for 7.9 unfortunately. It's a bug, we need to fix it sooner or later, so we don't want to close it, but no customer nor user is complaining about it, so it should be fine to kick this can down the road.

column1: Please update CRW 1.2 / OSD 4 Instructions to reference needed namespace
column10: Documentation for products delivered by the Red Hat Developer Group.
column39:
CRW did not allow installation on OpenShift Dedicated until recently, because the Operator was not available.  
Thanks to SREP-2230 [1], this is no longer true.  The Operator is available and is known to work.  There is a limitation, though.

Per SREP-2245 [2], the following restrictions exist:
- Installation should target the namespace `openshift-codeready-workspaces` for both the Operator and the Custom Resource 'CheCluster'.

Please update the CRW doc to reflect these restrictions.

[1] https://jira.coreos.com/browse/SREP-2230
[2] https://jira.coreos.com/browse/SREP-2245
column373: N/A
column422:
15/Oct/19 1:47 PM;rkratky;[~rick_wagner], I updated the doc to say:

_From the *A specific namespace in the cluster* drop-down list, select the *openshift-codeready-workspaces* namespace to install the Operator to._

However, AFAICS, we don't have docs (for 1.2) on configuring CRW using the CheCluster CRD (we only mention its existence).

column1: CDK GSG shouldn't suggest sudo
column10: Documentation for products delivered by the Red Hat Developer Group.
column39:
Section (1.3.3.) *Setting Up the xhyve Driver* uses instructions with "sudo". This should be changed to the root (#) prompt.

* RHEL doesn't have 'sudoers' set up out of the box, so the instructions wouldn't work on a vanilla installation.
* Because of ^, other DevTools docs use (or should) use just "#" to indicate that a command needs to be run with super-user privileges (leaving the method of gaining such rights to the user).
column422: 11/Dec/18 11:26 AM;kowen1;The xhyve driver is available for macOS, which should have {{sudo}} available. All of the instructions for RHEL hosts use "#" to indicate root privileges are necessary.
column423: 11/Dec/18 11:33 AM;rkratky;Heh, stupid me :)

column1: Add recommended VB version for VirtualBox Compatibility
column10: Documentation for products delivered by the Red Hat Developer Group.
column39:
As devsuite is no longer exists, so we need to recommend CDK VirtualBox compatibility matrix. As per the latest 3.4 release doc [1] there is no particular recommended version instead a range of versions, however all the minishift testing for CDK 3.5 has been done on Virtualbox Version 5.2.12. So should we suggest a range of version including the tested VB version. For example 

Red Hat Container Development Kit 3.5 has been tested with VirtualBox 5.1.14 and higher (recommended Virtualbox 5.2.12), but is known to not work correctly with VirtualBox 5.1.11 or older. Ensure that you have VirtualBox 5.1.12 (recommended Virtualbox 5.2.12) or higher if you intend to use VirtualBox as your virtualization provider.  

[1] https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_container_development_kit/3.4/html/release_notes_and_known_issues/release_notes#virtualbox_compatibility 

[~lalatendum] Please add your valuable suggestion

column1: Typo in CDK 3.1 known issues doc
column10: Documentation for products delivered by the Red Hat Developer Group.
column39:
"3.1.4. Don not use MINISHIFT_HOME folder for anything but CDK"

Obviously you could just change this to:

"3.1.4. Do not use MINISHIFT_HOME folder for anything but CDK"

But maybe you want to relabel this to something more descriptive and less proscriptive:

"3.1.4. MINISHIFT_HOME folder wiped on every `minishift setup-cdk` run"
column422:
23/Aug/17 8:48 AM;rkratky;[~nickboldt], I updated the KI to say:

`MINISHIFT_HOME` directory rewritten on every run of `minishift setup-cdk`

The directory set in the `MINISHIFT_HOME` environment variable is rewritten whenever the `minishift setup-cdk` command is executed. Do not set it to a directory that contains data that cannot be discarded. The `minishift` command displays a warning about the deletion of the directory.

Please, let me know if it sounds OK.
column423:
23/Aug/17 10:05 AM;nickboldt;Looks good, thanks. 

But... how about this addendum? 

"Do not set it to a directory that contains data that cannot be discarded, *such as your home directory*."
column424:
23/Aug/17 11:07 AM;rkratky;You got it. Thanks for reporting it.

The updated doc has been published on the CP: https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_container_development_kit/3.1/html/release_notes_and_known_issues/known_issues#literal_minishift_home_literal_directory_rewritten_on_every_run_of_literal_minishift_setup_cdk_literal

column1: Misc. mistakes in devsuite RN
column10: Documentation for products delivered by the Red Hat Developer Group.
column39:
* Don't use an article for product names, such as "the CDK"; see https://mojo.redhat.com/docs/DOC-1088906
* Use double minus ("--") to render as proper dashes.
* The following para is confusing and unclear:
   bq. Red Hat Development Suite 1.3 includes products such as Red Hat JBoss Developer Studio 10.3 and Red Hat Container Development Kit 2.4, as well as some dependencies for each of these products. One or more of the products that Red Hat Development Suite installs may require a separate Red Hat subscription. Development support for any of the installed products requires a relevant and active Red Hat subscription.
** It should say which products require what subscriptions
** It should be combined with the admonition that's right above it -- it's also about subscriptions. Perhaps a separate section with its own heading -- seeing as the subscriptions are such a confusing matter?
** Perhaps a table with all products and their resp[ective subscriptions?
* _"An Online Installer that is a 40 Mb download"_ -- it's not "Mb" but "MB".
* _"As a result, they must not be used in production environments."_ That's not true. Ppl can use it anywhere they want, but they cannot expect RH support if something goes wrong.
* _"For more information on Red Hat Technology Preview features support scope, see http://access.redhat.com/support/offerings/techpreview/."_ -- Don't use bare URLs -- use the page's title.
* _"3. What is new in Red Hat Development Suite?"_ -- Use capital case.
* _Red Hat Development Suite includes the following components:_" -- There should be a version number behind the product name in this instance.
* _"When a component is selected or deselected for installation, it’s dependencies are automatically selected or deselected for installation. For example, when Red Hat Container Development Kit is selected for installation, it’s dependencies -Vagrant, Cygwin and Oracle Virtual Box are automatically selected for installation."_ -- "it's" = "it is"; "its" = possessive.
* _"Vagrant, Cygwin and Oracle Virtual Box"_ -- Always use serial comma.
* _"Vagrant, Cygwin and Oracle Virtual Box"_ -- Use correct product name: "VirtualBox".
* _"-Vagrant"_ -- Missing space after dash.
* _"Try the Red Hat Development Suite installer using the following instructions: Red Hat Development Suite 1.3 Installation Guide"_ -- Missing end-sentence period.
column422: 28/Feb/17 3:43 PM;psargent;[~rkratky] I like your idea of a table. Where can I find the subscription information i.e products with their respective subscriptions ?
column423: 11/Mar/17 6:42 AM;rkratky;On review
column424:
11/Mar/17 6:52 AM;rkratky;[~psargent],

* _"A user who wants to download and use Red Hat Development Suite must become members of the Red Hat Developer Program."_ --> s/members/a member/
* _"The program provides developer tools and content, allowing users to download and use Red Hat Enterprise products..."_ --> Io think the whole sentence can be removed.
* When you use "--", don't surround it with spaces. (Apologies, I probably confused you when I complained there was a missing space after the regular hyphen/minus sign. To sum up: when there's a hyphen/minus used, there should be spaces around; when an n-dash or an m-dash is used, there shouldn't be spaces around it.)
* _"For example, when Red Hat Container Development Kit is selected for installation, it’s dependencies -Vagrant, Cygwin and Oracle Virtual Box are automatically selected for installation."_ – "it's" = "it is"; "its" = possessive.

column1: Insecure instructions in CDK IG (gpgcheck)
column10: Documentation for products delivered by the Red Hat Developer Group.
column39:
Section "5.2.1.1. Registering a Red Hat Enterprise Linux System and Enabling Repositories" notes that to install Vagrant, you must use a CentOS repo over an insecure protocol (HTTP) and on top of that disable GPG check:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en/red-hat-container-development-kit/2.2/paged/installation-guide/chapter-5-installing-container-development-kit-on-red-hat-enterprise-linux#registering_a_red_hat_enterprise_linux_system_and_enabling_repositories

This is strange since the packages are definitely signed:

$ rpm -qpi http://mirror.centos.org/centos-7/7/sclo/x86_64/sclo/vagrant1/sclo-vagrant1-vagrant-1.8.1-7.el7.noarch.rpm 2> /dev/null |grep -i Signature
Signature   : RSA/SHA1, Wed 24 Aug 2016 03:40:26 PM CEST, Key ID 4eb84e71f2ee9d55

Can the docs be corrected please to remove the step to disable 'gpgcheck'? Also, maybe it's worth researching if there is a way to get the package over HTTPS.

------------------

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1391414

column1: Recommended Docker version with bad API version
column10: Documentation for products delivered by the Red Hat Developer Group.
column39:
In chapter 6.2. Learning about the Docker Environment text says that actual version of Docker at CDK 2.2 is 1.9.1 with API 1.21. But in CDK 2.2 the version of Docker is actually 1.10.3. with API version 1.22. This leads to potential incompatibility between Host's and Client's Docker.

Despite that basic Docker commands like version, pull, ps etc. presented in Getting Started guide works properly. However this API incompatibility can cause problems in future and lower user experience.
column373:
Install CDK 2.2
Install Docker 1.9.1 following Getting Started Guide
run "vagrant up"
run "docker version" to see API versions of Host and Client are incompatible
column404: When user sees incompatible API versions after running "docker version", she can download compatible Docker version, for example 1.10.3.
column422:
12/Sep/16 6:48 AM;rkratky;Hi Andreas, I updated the Docker versions. Apologies, that was just an oversight on my part.

See http://jenkinscat.gsslab.pnq.redhat.com:8080/view/Devtools/job/doc-CDK_Release_Notes_and_Known_Issues%20%28html-single%29/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/index.html#_component_versions for component versions that are used throughout the entire CDK docs set. (I haven't checked the k8s version yet.)
column423:
12/Sep/16 7:38 AM;agajdosi;Hi Robert,
no problem I guess, I am just going through all CDK docs step by step as a CDK QE newbie and try to spot some problematic parts. Thank you for fixing it.
column424: 21/Sep/16 5:58 AM;agajdosi;Hi Robert, checked updated Docker versions and API, it is fine in whole text except for 6.2.1. where both Docker version and API stayed same. It's not really a problem as user knows which version is correct, however these examples of "docker version" output can be a bit confusing. Just wanted to inform you, if you think it is not a problem, we can close it. Thank you.
column425: 29/Sep/16 12:03 PM;rkratky;Thanks for pointing it out. I fixed the versions in the output.
column426: 04/Oct/16 3:46 AM;agajdosi;Everything seems fine now. Closing it. Thank you, Robert.

column1: Improve devsuite inst doc
column10: Documentation for products delivered by the Red Hat Developer Group.
column39:
Please, modify the devsuite IG to make it less confusing. Currently, the guide tells users to install devstudio through devsuite [1], which is inconsistent with the rest of the doc, which talks about installing or uninstalling devsuite.

In other words, we should stop referring to devsuite as an 'installer' and start treating it as a regular product. So, instead of saying "use the devsuite installer to install devstudio and CDK", we should say "install devsuite".

Thanks to Mike Guerette for pointing this out.

column1: Bad path for CDK Vagrant box
column10: Documentation for products delivered by the Red Hat Developer Group.
column39:
According to 3.4.2. of Installation Guide Vagrant boxes should be at %USERPROFILE%\cdk\components\rhel\misc\shared_folder\rhel-ose\ and %USERPROFILE%\cdk\components\rhel\misc\shared_folder\rhel-k8s-singlenode-setup\.

Real location is however: %USERPROFILE%\cdk\components\rhel\rhel-ose\ and %USERPROFILE%\cdk\components\rhel\misc\rhel-k8s-singlenode-setup\. "shared_folder" is no longer in path of boxes, so they moved one level down in hierarchy.

(Could be also an issue in 3.4.1. for HyperV.)

column1: Simple doList(endpoint calls) are increasing times from few ms up to 80secs during performance tests
column39: Timeboxed to 2 days.
column373: We are doing a simple dolist (/mbaas/sync/) to 4 endpoints during a period <=10min and it was observed times creeping up from 10ms to 80sec. This is dramatically affecting performance and all pointing to the wfm handlers (unable to scale).

20/Jun/17 12:19 PM;jnunes;adding some folks for future comments.

[~dcawley]
[~cbennett]
[~pcurry]
column423:
20/Jun/17 12:47 PM;wtrocki;Response from email:
"Our team done intensive performance testing on RainCatcher. We done this using internal tool and noticed timeouts as well. 
Then we just made change in mediator itself to fix that.

After some investigation I noticed that timeout for mediator was increased globally in this commit:
https://github.com/feedhenry-raincatcher/raincatcher-mediator/commit/f99ad0b5984e1695856b2908304739eb033781b4

That change was released in mediator v0.3.4. Using that or any later version of mediator in demo-cloud should help to resolve mediator timeouts.

Note: Some modules now may require timeouts to be supplied as part of the config.
See my comment here: https://github.com/feedhenry-raincatcher/raincatcher-mediator/pull/25#issuecomment-292241133

Timeouts are documented but they are optional. If you do not supply timeout default module timeout may be applied 
(usually too small for production)

Additionally we may also update version of the sync, but that will have much larger impact and may require much more testing
If we still notice some performance problems after increasing timeouts let us know. 
We have complete set of performance tests that we can execute on RainCatcher to check for possible bottlenecks."
column424:
20/Jun/17 12:51 PM;wtrocki;Proposed actions:
* Increase timeouts by changing version of mediator
* Provide more details for the actual calls: What payload, How much calls in overal duration etc.
We can try to replicate this on current master. 

Once this is done we can think how we can move forward with this issue.

ping [~bofarrel]

column1: [BLOCKER] - The Keycloak JS Adapter Contains Bugs Affecting Offline Access & Mobile Auth
column39:
*What*

The Keycloak JS Adapter is currently experiencing some issues:
# The 'login-required' value passed to the onLoad function in a Keycloak.init() causes an application to constantly refresh the view after authentication. This appears to be related to a Keycloak iframe crashing.
# Manually calling the login() action (required for offline login) is also causing some auth issues.
column422:
24/May/17 5:57 AM;wtrocki;[~tjackman] - If we store roles in user metadata then we do not need to use this adapter. Let's kick that out of the 1.0. 
We can still evaluate this later.
column423: 29/May/17 10:28 AM;wtrocki;No longer target or 1.0
column424: 30/May/17 5:13 AM;tjackman;Not entirely surely why this was closed. Its a blocker to overcome to support authentication and access control via Mobile and I see it being used in the Portal app too.
column425:
30/May/17 5:37 AM;wtrocki;[~tjackman] This isssue is valid, but not relevant to 1.0

1) We do offline login by pin
2) We hide elements basing on user metadata (more constitent)

Feel free to reopen
column426: 30/May/17 5:40 AM;tjackman;Re-opening as without telling Keycloak we need offline access, it will ask us to login to keycloak even if we have pin support and entered the right pin.
column427:
06/Jun/17 7:29 AM;tjackman;To fix the angular looping issue, don't use ng-app, but instead use angular.bootstrap(...). Otherwise there's an issue with Angular rewriting the URL after Keycloak removes the code query param, which is what's causing the redirect loop.

For offline capabilities, a "regular" token is associated with a user session. That means the user is present whenever the token is used. When a user logs out all "regular" tokens are invalidated. An offline token on the other hand is aimed at a background service or a different application that should be able to perform actions on behalf of the user when the user is not present. There's a token that contains the users identity as well as the time it was issued. You could design the app so a user is authenticated as long as the token is still valid even when offline. If on the other hand you're protecting remote services (that for instance is used to sync data once the phone is back online) then you can rely on the token.

TL;DR - JS Adapter Issues resolved.

column1: Intermittent unexpected null in raincatcher load test scripts
column39:
When we run load tests using the [raincatcher-demo-load-testing scripts|https://github.com/feedhenry-raincatcher/raincatcher-demo-load-testing], we sometimes see the following error:

{code}
[TypeError: Cannot read property 'id' of null]
{code}

We believe this to be an issue with the scripts, but the underlying cause is probably something unexpected being returned from the cloud app.

Our current thinking is that it's either the {{GET /api/wfm/user}} [here|https://github.com/feedhenry-raincatcher/raincatcher-demo-load-testing/blob/master/scripts/mobile-flow.js#L46], or a {{syncRecords}} call gets some response that [doesn't have the expected shape|https://github.com/feedhenry-raincatcher/raincatcher-demo-load-testing/blob/master/util/syncDataset.js#L7..L8].

Our experience with this issue has been that it's usually rare and difficult to reproduce.

column1: Hashed User Passwords are Recoverable in the Portal UI
column39:
*What*
Hashed User passwords are recoverable through the Portal UI. 

*Why*
Plaintext or hashed passwords should not be shown in the UI.

*How*
The password field should be empty or display 10 asterisks or similar. The password value should have an on-change listener so new passwords values can be entered and then saved. Furthermore, it would be better if the password was not returned from the database on a user read.
column373:
* Open the portal application.
* Go to the workers view, Edit a worker.
* Inspect the password element, in the HTML, change the input type from 'password' to 'text'.
* You should see the password, as from the database.

column1: Mitigate Vulnerable QS Dependency in Demo Apps and Modules

*Why*
To mitigate a vulnerability marked as _High Severity_ by Snyk/NSP.

*How*
Upgrade qs to version 6.4.0 or higher.

3rd Party Module Fix Status

(/) *express* - 4.15.2
(/) *body-parser* - 1.17.1

(/) fh-mbaas-express - 5.6.10
(/) fh-reporting-client - 0.5.5
(/) fh-mbaas-api - 6.1.8

Aerogear Components Fix Status

Raincatcher Demo Apps Fix Status
(/) raincatcher-demo-portal
(/) raincatcher-demo-auth
(/) raincatcher-demo-cloud
(/) raincatcher-demo-mobile

Raincatcher Modules Fix Status
(/) raincatcher-file - 0.1.1

column1: CS-D: Loss of incremental performance when using multiple groupBy() in one constraint
column10: Planning engine for business resource optimization
column39: PLANNER-2003 made significant improvements to constraints where only one groupBy() is used. The goal of this issue is to replicate the same for less utilized cases where more than 1 groupBy() is used within a single constraint.
column404: There is no workaround.

column1: CS-D: Loss of incremental performance when using groupBy()
column10: Planning engine for business resource optimization
column39:
In some OptaPlanner examples, we have seen major performance degradation when switching to Constraint Streams. (As much as 95 % of DRL performance can be lost.) This has been shown to come from the way that the groupBy() building block is implemented using Drools.

The problem gets progressively worse with bigger data sets, clearly pointing to a scalability issue.

The solution is to redesign the CS-D implementation to handle groupBy() more efficiently. More specifically, the use of more than one from() DRL statement needs to be avoided.

Some more information can be found in the following working document:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1s4pMSN3qLO5LLE7PeMAwj5RQfpzvu8wkqj_t5jB3cEc/edit
column404: There is no workaround.
column422:
15/Oct/20 4:25 AM;lpetrovicky;The code is ready. However, it can not be currently merged - tests are failing on account of missing fixes in Drools. The following needs to happen first:
 # KOGITO-3505 is merged, making it possible to bump Drools to the version that brings the necessary fixes (DROOLS-5704, DROOLS-5706).
 # The Drools version has to be bumped, either as a regular release or as a one-off tagged release.
 # Wait for the next Kogito SNAPSHOT to be built and deployed.

column1: Multithreaded solving fails on TSP/VRP because Supply's are inside Chained Moves and don't get rebased.
column10: Planning engine for business resource optimization
column39:
{code}
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The entity (Kiev) was never added to this ScoreDirector.
Maybe that specific instance is not in the return values of the PlanningSolution's entity members ([visitList]).
	at org.optaplanner.core.impl.score.director.drools.DroolsScoreDirector.update(DroolsScoreDirector.java:197)
	at org.optaplanner.core.impl.score.director.drools.DroolsScoreDirector.afterVariableChanged(DroolsScoreDirector.java:186)
	at org.optaplanner.core.impl.score.director.AbstractScoreDirector.changeVariableFacade(AbstractScoreDirector.java:434)
	at org.optaplanner.core.impl.heuristic.selector.move.generic.chained.ChainedChangeMove.doMoveOnGenuineVariables(ChainedChangeMove.java:70)
	at org.optaplanner.core.impl.heuristic.move.AbstractMove.doMove(AbstractMove.java:40)
	at org.optaplanner.core.impl.heuristic.move.AbstractMove.doMove(AbstractMove.java:30)
	at org.optaplanner.core.impl.score.director.AbstractScoreDirector.doAndProcessMove(AbstractScoreDirector.java:175)
	at org.optaplanner.core.impl.heuristic.thread.MoveThreadRunner.run(MoveThreadRunner.java:145)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
{code}
column422:
30/Aug/18 3:53 AM;ge0ffrey;This is a PITA for ChainedChangeMove and other chained moves:
- A) Either it's no longer cacheable (potential regression?) - because we pre-fetch the supply values (so they can't be reused in other steps).
- B) Or we force the move threads to provide and track the Supply's that are really only needed for move selection which happens on the solver thread.

In practice, the need for A) is rare and the need for B) is common (because it's a perf gain).
column423:
30/Aug/18 4:49 AM;ge0ffrey;Do we need cacheable moves? Can SelectionCacheType become deprecated?

* Pillar moves break when being cached, because a step can affect the pillar.
* Subchain moves break when being cached, because a step can affect the subchain. This will even crash.
* Caching moves gives little performance benefit - it's the random or shuffle selection that costs perf, not the object creation.
** The only exception might be in advanced move filtering - but move filtering is only really interesting if it depends on the state - which means you can't cache it - otherwise you should use ValueRangeProvider from entity to being with.
* SelectionCacheType was invented in 5.5 because I feared that it might be a perf loss of not doing it. In all these years since then, I haven't see any proof of that and almost no-one using it.
column424:
30/Aug/18 5:29 AM;ge0ffrey;Valid use cases for cacheType PHASE:

* Dinner party: generic swapMove's that filter out swapping different gender
* TTP: generic swapMove's that filter out swapping inverse match

Valid use cases for cacheType STEP: plenty (non-chained moves mainly)
column425:
30/Aug/18 10:56 AM;ge0ffrey;Meeting decision goes for proposal B):

* Remove usage of Supply from moves
* Add information of moves are phase cacheable
** If a move is not phase cacheable and phase cached, fail fast
* Mention impact in upgrade recipe. This breaks behaviour compatibility.
column426: 03/Sep/18 11:29 AM;ge0ffrey;TailChainSwapMove is a PITA because it uses the supply inside the doMove to traverse the chain...
column427: 05/Sep/18 7:38 AM;ge0ffrey;Fixes for 7.12.0.Final and backported to 7.11.x for BA 7.1

I would like to confirm if this is a bug or if an additional setup is needed in order to enable the feature.

column422: 06/Aug/18 3:35 PM;ge0ffrey;Additional setup required, title adjusted accordingly :)
column423: 06/Aug/18 3:36 PM;jdonzet;Nice, Thank you!
column424:
09/Aug/18 10:14 AM;jcharra;Hi,

We encountered the exact same problem.

Unfortunately, we are using a CountableValueRange<Instant>, on one of the Variables of one of our PlanningEntities, which is instanciated using ValueRangeFactory.createTemporalValueRange(...). But the code then complains that the Instant class does not have a @PlanningId.

What would be the best way to overcome this problem? We thought about extending the Instant class, adding a @PlanningId in our extended class, but that would means we have to use this extended Instant class everywhere in our code instead of the basic Instant class, which would really not be practical. Is there a better approach?

column1: ScoreCalculationCountLimit termination with multi-threaded solving freezes TennisBenchmarkTest
column10: Planning engine for business resource optimization
column39:
TennisBenchmarkTest doesn't finish once multi-threaded solving is turned on.

jvisualvm doesn't show any deadlock, move threads are alternately running and waiting. Attaching application snapshot.

Turning multi-threaded solving on in benchmarks for different examples (tried with NQueens) didn't show the issue.
column422:
20/Aug/18 7:29 AM;ge0ffrey;[~rsynek] I cannot reproduce on my machine with moveThreadCount=2 in tennisSolverConfig.xml
I do see that the score doesn't improve, but I've got debug log on and the solver thread is clearly doing steps.
column423: 24/Aug/18 11:15 AM;rsynek;Truth, it does steps without scope improvement. For me, moveThreadCount=NONE finishes in 30 steps with score 0/-27239/-23706. Once I change moveThreadCount to 1 or 2, the it keeps doing steps but never terminates, although the Benchmark is configured to terminate with scoreCalculationCountLimit=1000. The non-improving score is the same that moveThreadCount=NONE finished with.
column424: 28/Aug/18 5:32 AM;ge0ffrey;Probably due to move score calculation count termination doesn't work in multithreaded solving.
column425:
05/Sep/18 11:49 AM;ge0ffrey;Proposal A)

Each move thread sends it's score calculation status to the solver thread in the MoveResult objects.
The solver thread then updates those accordingly so the termination can just run on the solver thread alone.

2 ways:

- A1) send the entire number (solver thread needs to keep a Map<moveThreadIndex,LastKnownScoreCalc> to only add the diff with previous
- A2) send the diff (moves arrive in order, but some moves get skipped/cleared so not possible!)
column426:
06/Jun/20 12:57 PM;ge0ffrey;There's a second issue: the termination in multithreaded solving is only checked after every step.
If a LS doesn't do any steps, it will never terminate.
Sometimes LA gets stuck and doesn't do any steps.

If my theory is correct, this dangerous.

column1: Real-time planning with daemon solving: starting with an empty VRP must be allowed to return an empty valueRange
column10: Planning engine for business resource optimization
column39:
From dev list:

"I found that when start with and empty solution (0/0 customer/vehicles) the solver raise an << 'java.lang.IllegalStateException' exception. The @ValueRangeProvider annotated member (method getVehicleList on class xx.xxxx.xxxxx.domain.VehicleRoutingSolution) called on bean (TimeWindowedVehicleRoutingSolution-0925182702) must not return an empty valueRange ([]). If this a valid dataset, apply overconstrained planning as described in the documentation."

The unit test CloudBalancingDaemonTest doesn't see it because it doesn't start from an empty solution.

First we need a unit test, but the fix will go deep I fear: removing the fail fast is easy, but making sure it doesn't crash, NPE, uselessly loop once that fail fast is gone, that's another matter...
column422: 07/Apr/17 5:30 AM;ge0ffrey;It doesn't always break "daemon real-time solving": the entity list (CloudProcess etc) can still be empty, just the value range (CloudComputer etc) can't.
column423:
03/Apr/19 5:14 AM;ge0ffrey;Actually, in daemon mode:
- there could be vehicles, but no visits
- there could be visits, but no vehicles
- there could be neither visits nor vehicles

And this is all fine. OptaPlanner should detect this and just bypass the actual solving.

column1: RHD site search can't search by blog author.
column10:
Issues related to the development of web applications/services hosted at jboss.org apart from:

  • JIRA Issue Tracker (issues.jboss.org) - use JIRA project
  • Nexus Maven Repository (repository.jboss.org/nexus) - use NEXUS project

Story Points

  • 1, 2, 3 = Before Lunch
  • 5, 8 = 1 or 2 days
  • 13, 20 = 3 to 5 days

Epic Points

  • 40, 60 = 2 or 3 weeks
  • 80, 160 = 1 or 2 months
  • 250, 500 = 1 or 2 quarters
  • 800, 1000 = 3 or 4 quarters
column39:
The RHD site search (still dcp?) doesn't seem to be picking up blog authors.   Try searching for Mower to see if you can find Harry's recent announcements.

https://developers.redhat.com/search/?t=mower

Note: no announcements (or much of anything else) from Harry show up.  

Using the wordpress username 'harrymower' gives some blog results from 2015-2016, but is still very incomplete. 

NOTE: there is a separate but related issue for the Wordpress built in search - see [DEVELOPER-4754] but hopefully we'll be able to turn off the WP specific search to use the site wide search soon.
column422: 11/May/18 12:31 PM;mikgue;I believe we'll not improve visitor engagements unless we make site and blog search solid.  Can this be part of the I Train please?  This needs to be a priority IMO.
column423: 13/May/18 6:02 AM;paul.robinson;[~unibrew] What would it take to add author information to the DCP's index of a blog post? I understand the requirement here is to have the author's name be part of the content searched over when using /search. For example, https://developers.redhat.com/search/?t=mower&f=type~blogpost should return blog posts for Harry Mower (or any other posts with 'mower' in them).
column424:
13/May/18 9:41 AM;rterzi;FYI the author taxonomy will need to deal with other content too.  Don’t know if that needs to be a separate ticket. Searching for “mower” should give this video, google finds it. 

https://developers.redhat.com/video/youtube/g11iakIQYDY/ 

(The video might not have the right tags)
column425:
13/May/18 5:01 PM;unibrew;Searching for 'harrymower' returns those two blogposts because they are tagged with 'harrymower' tag. 

In order to improve author searching for blogposts from DRC/blog first it would be good to have the name surname being available in the RSS/ATOM feed that is later indexed by planet/DCP. At the moment in dc:author tag of the xml is the 'harrymower' username, it's not search friendly, if you want to search just by surname. Not to mention that somebody can have a totally random username, not related to his/her name or surname.
Secondly either by improving planet.jboss.org way of pushing author to DCP data or by tuning the index and search query we would get it working. The query already looks on fields related to authorship but those are empty in this case.

Regarding the video, it's a completely separate case although with a similar issue. The Drupal feed with videos doesn't contain any information about author. So, the indexer that Dan configured in DCP is not pushing any authorship information to the index.
column426:
14/May/18 2:39 PM;rterzi;Thanks - I think I see one of the problems, Harry's profile in wordpress was set to show nickname as Display name.  I've changed that.  We'll need to review all of the author's settings to see who else is defaulting to nickname as display name.

[~visuale] - I don't see a change in the feed page yet.  I don't know if that's cached or when it gets updated.

 [~unibrew]  What would need to be done to get any of the articles reindexed?
column427: 14/May/18 7:22 PM;unibrew;I think it's possible to enforce refresh manually in planet's admin section. I don't remember how often it checks for data changes by default, [~lkrzyzanek] prolly knows.
column428: 14/May/18 9:48 PM;visuale;I had looked at re-indexing the blog on Friday, but when I did, I checked the log for last index and as of that afternoon it was actually all up to date. The most recently indexed post ID was the most recent post at the time. I could still push the indexing but it didn't appear to me that this will do much good.
column429:

(Newest was 2007 [~joeschram] - should the RHD site search really have forum threads indexed from 10+ years ago?).  None of his recent blog articles show up.  The atom feed has lines line 

<author>

3. Note: I did check that blog articles are still being indexed. https://developers.redhat.com/search/?f=type%7Eblogpost seems to show plenty of recent results including the article where the text "Harry Mower" appears.

]
{code}

Blog post author is stored in "author" field - it's copy from the RSS. So we have author in DCP's data.
Only what is needed is to copy "author" to the  "sys_contributors.fulltext" and everything will start working.
[~unibrew] is it correct?


Regarding author field in planet I checked one of the latest content pulled from RSS and it now correctly shows full name of the author:
https://planet.jboss.org/post/red_hat_summit_functions_as_a_service_with_openwhisk_and_openshift
So everything is fine from planet.jboss.org side. However only last 10 items has been reindexed because RSS provides only last 10 items. Historical items are not refreshed because there is no source of it.
column434: 22/May/18 6:03 AM;unibrew;[~lkrzyzanek] you're right. Actually we could add the author field to the searched fields in the query but at the moment I see in the mapping that it is set to 'index="no"' so it wouldn't work anyway. We would have to change it and reindex from persistence. Or as you say update planet to push the value to sys_contributor.fulltext. I don't mind any of those options really.
column435:
22/May/18 6:34 AM;lkrzyzanek;I think input preprocessor that would copy data from "author" to "sys_contributors" would be the best choice.
I'll work on it during next sprint.
column436: 22/May/18 6:58 AM;unibrew;Indeed, I forgot that we can do preprocessing in those providers, definitely the best option, thanks!
column437:
22/May/18 10:56 AM;rterzi;So I think "Definition of Done" will be:

1. The work Libor/Ryszard described above to correctly map the author field into the sys_contributor field.
2. Fixing and correcting blog author "Display name" to make sure a reasonable "First Last" appears in the author/creator field and not a WP username or email address.  [DEVELOPER-5084] 
3. Re-indexing blog articles 

[~lkrzyzanek] - Regarding the RSS2/atom feed giving only 10 articles - It is paginated.  You can get the subsequent pages with paged=N  (note the D)

https://developers.redhat.com/blog/feed/?paged=2
https://developers.redhat.com/blog/feed/atom/?paged=2

I don't think there is a query parameter in wordpress to return more than 10 at once, though I think we can change a default setting to have the feed default to more items,
column438: 22/May/18 11:01 AM;visuale;[~rterzi] [~mikgue] on the blog end I think I've made some headway. Using our test from yesterday I'm now able to see recent results for entering the single search term 'guerette'
column439:
23/May/18 3:57 AM;lkrzyzanek;[~rterzi] regarding paging - is it possible to do a paging + have at least 100 entries on each page? Maybe temporary change it to 100 if there is no parameter.
Currently there are 145 pages with 10 entries so it would be crazy to reindex it manually.
15 pages with 100 blog posts each would be doable.
column440:
30/May/18 5:59 AM;lkrzyzanek;I changed the preprocesor so "author" is copied to "sys_contributors" if there is no better match.

I also reindexed all blog posts in DCP from persistence.

Now we see blog posts from Harry
https://developers.redhat.com/search/?t=harrymower&f=type~blogpost

However the historical blog posts still have the "harrymower" instead of current first last name which is more search friendly.

Resync of historical blog posts from RHD Blog to planet needs to be done in separate issue.

column39:
In some cases clicking on Login link user is redirected to httpss://planet.jboss.org (doubled ss).

How to reproduce:
# Visit http://planet.jboss.org in Safari
# Login
# Click on Logout link
# Click on HOME
# Click on login - you're redirected to sso.jboss.org and but then back to httpss://planet.jboss.org which is invalid

*Workaround:*
on gray page "Safari can't open ..." just go back and reload home page

column1: Make User Name and Password Configurable For Each Session or Together
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39:
Currently the user name and password get default values in weird way. They are configured globally in the configuration file, but they are read from "stage" or "prod" environment configuration, which causes them to contain default values.

 

It should be possible to configure them both locally "per environment" and globally. Per environment should take precedence, but if not supplied, the default should be taken from the global configuration.

 

NOTE: DO NOT FORGET TO ADD THIS INFORMATION TO DOCUMENTATION.
column117: If docs needed, set a value

column1: missing md5 for jbosstools parent artifacts
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39:
Hi,

first dsorry if this request does not belong to the correct project. i do not know where i can get this fixed / ask for help. 

I'm releasing the JBossTools/Codeready Devstudio bits and i noticed that the md5 are not  present in this hierarchy : 
https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/jboss/tools/parent/4.14.0.Final-SNAPSHOT/
it was present in the previous release : 
https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/jboss/tools/parent/4.13.0.Final-SNAPSHOT/
We're using scripts that did not change since the two versions. 

Is it possible to re-generate the missing md5 ?
column422:
16/Mar/20 5:04 AM;dhladky;There is no need for any apology and you hit the right project. The reason, why you do not see the checksums is you do not see what you actually deployed, but what is cached on the proxy servers. If anyone requests https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/jboss/tools/parent/4.14.0.Final-SNAPSHOT/parent-4.14.0.Final-20200206.155143-3.pom.md5 , it will get downloaded and the file will appear in that directory listing (actually there are two nodes so there is 50-50 chance it will appear there). 

Here https://origin-repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/jboss/tools/parent/4.14.0.Final-SNAPSHOT/ you can see what you actually deployed. The older versions were auto-cleaned. I requested the MD5 files on both proxies so now you can consistently find it in directory listing. 

Let me know, if you want me to clean the old versions of the proxy.
column423:
16/Mar/20 9:35 AM;stephane.bouchet;Hi [~dhladky] ,

thanks for your explanation, i did not know there was proxy and caching for nexus until now. 

You pointed me to the origin repo that contains really what is deployed, and everything looks good. I think we're fine and i'll close the issue. 

Thanks !

column422: 24/Jan/20 12:28 PM;tcunning;From https://fusesource-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/fuse-8.0-base-jdk11/69/console
column423: 27/Jan/20 4:28 AM;dhladky;Thank you for reporting the issue. I investigated both your log and Nexus application log. There is a correlation between the global outage  of authentication services. There is a big peek of network IO errors and authentication errors in Nexus log during the build time. Fortunately things got recovered and  I am happy you were able to finish the download on Saturday.

column1: Klipfolio Datasources Lost Access To Nexus Stats
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39: For some reason the user got  lost in the system.

column1: Error in Authenticating during Build
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39:
Received this error again:
https://fusesource-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/fuse-7.6-sb2/10/console
column422:
12/Dec/19 7:44 AM;dhladky;Thank you for information. https://repository.jboss.org/nexus is a weird URL for deployment though. This URL will  redirect you to the authentication server (on Thursday when the build ran to developers.redhat.com/auth, now to sso.redhat.com). So the configuration really needs to be checked. 

Also, have a look if you are using altDeploymentRepository . On Monday I solved similar issue, that resulted in 401. With Maven 2 it has correct value id:default:repository , but in Maven 3 the middle part was removed and if not removed it causes weird 401 failure even if it does not touch the server at all. Can you check it is not the problem here?
column423: 06/Jan/20 4:04 AM;dhladky;[~tcunning] ?
column424: 14/Jan/20 5:40 AM;dhladky;[~tcunning], can you have a look at my message from December 12th?

column1: 401: Unauthorized while trying to download from repository.jboss.org/nexus
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column422: 12/Nov/19 6:51 AM;dhladky;Can you give me link to the failed job and the user name of the deployer?

column1: Unauthorized During Deployment
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39:
I have started this night a "test" job that deploys new artifacts (with 7.30.0-SNAPSHOT) to https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/snapshots/org/ - so the artifacts are on the server
before I update our master branch to 7.30.0-SNAPSHOT - to prevent people complaining about non existing artifacts when they want to build something on master branch after the update.
I started the job yesterday and everything worked great until drools/droolsjbpm-bpm-distribution - there suddenly I get a 

[WARNING] Encountered issue during deployment: Failed to deploy artifacts: Could not transfer artifact org.drools:droolsjbpm-bpms-distribution:pom:7.30.0-20191029.194558-1 from/to jboss-snapshots-repository (https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/snapshots/): Access denied to:

All reps/modules before have been deployed correctly without any warnings or errors

[INFO] Uploading to jboss-snapshots-repository: https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/snapshots/org/drools/droolsjbpm-bpms-distribution/7.30.0-SNAPSHOT/droolsjbpm-bpms-distribution-7.30.0-20191029.194558-1.pom
[WARNING] Encountered issue during deployment: Failed to deploy artifacts: Could not transfer artifact org.drools:droolsjbpm-bpms-distribution:pom:7.30.0-20191029.194558-1 from/to jboss-snapshots-repository (https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/snapshots/): Access denied to: https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/snapshots/org/drools/droolsjbpm-bpms-distribution/7.30.0-SNAPSHOT/droolsjbpm-bpms-distribution-7.30.0-20191029.194558-1.pom, ReasonPhrase: Forbidden.

I don't understand why suddenly the ReasonPhrase is forbidden? Why I can't access any more?
Can you see where is the problem here?
column423: 31/Oct/19 7:20 AM;manaRH;re: "midnight run" - just a wild guess if the snapshots timestamp was deployed next day and the authorization token was invalidated going to another day ;)
column424:
07/Nov/19 4:37 AM;dhladky;I see. The problem with the authorization token is the time is a number in milliseconds and it should not matter if the flow goes through midnight or not. I can imagine the midnight problem might eventually lead to 404 error (when part of the deployment has one timestamp and the other does not have it. But it should not be 403).

It rather looks like a problem, that appears from time to time, where Nexus can not be authorized for some unknown reason (401 is returned back from the authentication server).
column425: 11/Nov/19 8:39 AM;dhladky;I am closing this issue as a duplicate to NEXUS-211.  This one contained useful additional information, but the likely cause is the same as in the same.

column1: A Lot of Unable to login the service account! Erros
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39: 2019-10-11 13:54:31,815-0400 ERROR [qtp253131020-209712] *UNKNOWN org.jboss.security.realms.utils.KeycloakUtils - Unable to login the service account! 401: Unauthorized
column422: 15/Oct/19 11:48 AM;dhladky;This error may be behind NEXUS-211. At least its last appearance.
column424: 16/Oct/19 8:01 AM;dhladky;So the problem is actually in logging, not the failure of the login process. The service account might not be involved in this at all.

column1: 401: Unauthorized while trying to deploy to repository.jboss.org/nexus
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39:
Hello, 

currently we have the following error happening on our CI:


{code:java}
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.sonatype.plugins:nexus-staging-maven-plugin:1.6.8:deploy (default-cli) on project karaf: Execution default-cli of goal org.sonatype.plugins:nexus-staging-maven-plugin:1.6.8:deploy failed: Nexus connection problem to URL [https://repository.jboss.org/nexus ]: 401 - Unauthorized -> [Help 1]
org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal org.sonatype.plugins:nexus-staging-maven-plugin:1.6.8:deploy (default-cli) on project karaf: Execution default-cli of goal org.sonatype.plugins:nexus-staging-maven-plugin:1.6.8:deploy failed: Nexus connection problem to URL [https://repository.jboss.org/nexus ]: 401 - Unauthorized
{code}

This is causing some of our builds to fail because the artifacts cannot be deployed
column422:
06/Sep/19 6:45 AM;dhladky;Hi [~opiske], will you, please, tell me what user do you use for the deployment? 401 means either completely missing or incorrect user credentials. There could be some other issue, but it is a good start for me to know what user we talk about. 

Can you also try the user credentials can be used to login to developers.redhat.com or customer portal? If the login does not work there, it would not work in Nexus either.
column423:
06/Sep/19 8:07 AM;opiske;[~dhladky] we haven't changed our credentials for a while, so I am not sure that they would be incorrect. 

[~tcunning] Hey Tom, would you know what username is used for the deploy? I tried searching for it, but I couldn't find.
column424:
09/Sep/19 9:57 AM;dhladky;I checked the perfectus-7.0.x user in Keycloak. It says it does not have verified e-mail so it is possible it will not accept the credentials for other purposes than e-mail verification. The same for perfectus-ose3-6.2.x . I tried to convince the e-mail is already verified. It did not help though. 

Will you, please, try to login the two accounts with user credentials in developers.redhat.com? I wonder if Keycloak blocks the accounts, because they do do not have some terms and conditions accepted.
column425:
09/Sep/19 10:26 AM;dhladky;After closer investigation of the two user accounts I found the reason. Nexus requires a minimal information of first name, last name and e-mail in order to be able to work with an account. Both of the two accounts did not have first name and last name filled. 

On the Keycloak level I added some text to the two fields and now Nexus recognizes them as the valid accounts. Please, test your builds. 

However: the first name and last name are stored in the user service. I rewrote the cached values in Keycloak where I have access. This value is refreshed from time to time so unless you fix the accounts, it will eventually revert to null values and at that moment Nexus will start failing to authenticate them again. 

I will try to modify the authentication plugin to supply some value if the first name and last name are not present, but it will take a while. Please, login to customer portal with the two account credentials and add something to first and last names there, so when the information in Keycloak gets refreshed, the account will not stop functioning.
column426: 09/Sep/19 11:27 AM;tcunning;I've logged in to developer.redhat.com and put sane values for first/last name, but I don't think this was the issue.    We've seen this problem intermittently on and off.
column428: 10/Sep/19 4:16 AM;dhladky;Hi [~tcunning], both accounts do not have first name and last name filled at this moment. So it appears there was some propagation error in the user service. I am trying to investigate it with [~velias]. But in the Nexus site it is still the same problem - unfilled first name and last name.
column429: 10/Sep/19 4:37 AM;dhladky;So I filled first names and last names to all perfectus accounts. I verified the values were propagated to user service. If the null values reappear, then there is some unknown process in a way, that is messing with the user data and we will have to contact teams responsible for the user service.
column430: 10/Sep/19 6:45 AM;dhladky;I am checking the accounts after two hours and they still seem to contain the first names and last names.
column431: 10/Sep/19 8:53 AM;dhladky;fusesource_releases_external-18935 created properly with perfectus-7.0.x account.
column432: 11/Sep/19 3:32 AM;dhladky;I see couple of repositories successfully deployed to Nexus by perfectus-7.0.x account. I am closing the issue.
column433: 11/Sep/19 4:15 AM;dhladky;NEXUS-251 will contain fix, that would allow using user accounts, that do not have first name and last name filled.

column1: Nexus : uploaded artifacts aren't appearing on origin / ea
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39:
Our build built karaf karaf-4.2.6.fuse-750009 : 
https://fusesource-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/view/Fuse%207.5/job/fuse-7.5-base/16/consoleFull

However, when I go to origin/ea, I don't see 750008 or 750009 - the latest build that is available there is 750007 :

https://origin-repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/ea/org/apache/karaf/bundle/org.apache.karaf.bundle.core/
column422:
04/Sep/19 11:06 AM;tcunning;It looks like from the log the repository was staged and closed correctly :

[INFO] Uploaded to fusesource-nexus-staging: https://repository.jboss.org:443/nexus/service/local/staging/deployByRepositoryId/fusesource_releases_external-18818/org/apache/karaf/apache-karaf-minimal/4.2.6.fuse-750009/apache-karaf-minimal-4.2.6.fuse-750009.zip (16 MB at 2.5 MB/s)
[INFO]  * Upload of locally staged artifacts finished.
[INFO]  * Closing staging repository with ID "fusesource_releases_external-18818".

Waiting for operation to complete...
...

[INFO] Remote staged 1 repositories, finished with success.
column423:
05/Sep/19 5:18 AM;dhladky;The repository was closed, but not "Promoted". I do not see the promotion anywhere in the log. I am not sure, but I think it has something to do with the build setting: 

{code}
== Parameters:
STAGE_BUILD:         true
PROJECT_BUILD_TYPE:  DR1
PROMOTE_BUILD:       false
SKIP_UNCHANGED:      false
TAG_BUILD:           false
PNC_STAGING_BUILD:   false
{code}
column424: 05/Sep/19 5:20 AM;dhladky;You can promote the build manually if it was accidentally just deployed and not promoted. You need to do it soon as closed builds, that are not promoted get wiped out after 2 weeks after they were created.
column425:
05/Sep/19 9:35 AM;tcunning;[~dhladky] I think something has changed in the last two days here - we don't really want to promote the builds because we want them to remain temporary and disappear after two weeks.    Two days ago, our builds would show up on ea without promotion (and disappear after 14 days).

See : https://fusesource-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/view/Fuse%207.5/job/fuse-7.5-base/13/consoleFull
The fuse-build-yaml portion of this build shows up on ea : 
https://origin-repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/ea/com/redhat/fuse/fuse-build-yaml/7.5.0.fuse-base-750012/

I don't see a difference in the logs as to why...

[INFO] Uploaded to fusesource-nexus-staging: https://repository.jboss.org:443/nexus/service/local/staging/deployByRepositoryId/fusesource_releases_external-18772/com/redhat/fuse/fuse-build-yaml/7.5.0.fuse-base-750012/fuse-build-yaml-7.5.0.fuse-base-750012-sh.sh (3.2 kB at 9.1 kB/s)

column427: 06/Sep/19 6:47 AM;dhladky;This problem is not Fusesource exclusive. The staging suite does not work atm.  I am raising the priority to blocker.
column428: 09/Sep/19 6:33 AM;dhladky;The problems appears to be connected with corrupted integrity of configuration files. I fixed the problem on Friday and now when I checked last Fusesource releases:   jboss_releases_staging_profile-15920  (up to 15926) and fusesource_releases_external-18839 everything is properly closed and published to the right repository groups.
