This build (https://rhba-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/KIE/job/master/job/deployedRep/job/appformer/lastFailedBuild/consoleText) failed during deploy of the artifacts with multiple
Caused by: org.apache.maven.artifact.deployer.ArtifactDeploymentException: Failed to retrieve remote metadata org.uberfire:uberfire-workingset-client/maven-metadata.xml: Could not transfer metadata org.uberfire:uberfire-workingset-client/maven-metadata.xml from/to jboss-snapshots-repository (https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/snapshots/): Not authorized , ReasonPhrase:Unauthorized.

So now we have inconsistent version with for instance jar/pom update but sources not
https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/snapshots/org/uberfire/uberfire-workingset-client/2.21.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml
column422:
17/Jul/19 9:47 AM;dhladky;This is a very strange error. I checked Splunk for the 
[traffic|https://splunk.corp.redhat.com/en-US/app/launcher/search?q=search%20source%3D%22%2Fvar%2Flog%2Fsyslog%2Ff5%2Flb02-dist-eng-prod.mgmt.phx2.redhat.com%2Fmessages%22%20%20%2Fnexus%2Fcontent%2Frepositories%2Fsnapshots%2Forg%2Fuberfire%2Fuberfire-services-backend%2Fmaven-metadata.xml&display.page.search.mode=smart&dispatch.sample_ratio=1&earliest=1563228000&latest=1563400800&display.prefs.events.offset=20&sid=1563370424.358744_A18D6D56-D175-4B9C-8A3B-38C94E63C414]

It does seem like one specific build ended up with 401 errors, otherwise the files are being fetched and uploaded normally. It may look like a stupid question, but can you check, that that specific build, that was trying to read [/nexus/content/repositories/snapshots/org/uberfire/uberfire-services-backend/maven-metadata.xml] has the right user name and password? It does seem like this specific part of the build has set it wrong - in fact the file is readable without any authentication, but if the wrong user name and password is supplied, the request ends with 401 and the fact it would succeed without any authentication is not important. 

Dashbuilder appears to be configured properly. The problem appears to be in uberfire, maybe even narrower URL range.
column423: 17/Jul/19 9:49 AM;dhladky;Interesting thing for the traffic is, that all 401 errors were on GET attempts. Uploading the maven-metadata.xml finished successfully with 201 status.
column424:
17/Jul/19 9:56 AM;danielezonca;I don't know the user that is used to deploy the artifacts. [~mbiarnes] Can you help with that?

Btw the same job has been executed two hours before without any issue
https://rhba-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/KIE/job/master/job/deployedRep/job/appformer/lastSuccessfulBuild/consoleText
column425:
17/Jul/19 10:50 AM;dhladky;I carefully compared the logs of the two builds with log on Nexus. Interesting difference is, that while in case of the failed build F5 reports sending the traffic to the proxy servers while in case of the OK build the same GET requests went to the master instance. 

[Splunk log|https://splunk.corp.redhat.com/en-US/app/launcher/search?q=search%20source%3D%22%2Fvar%2Flog%2Fsyslog%2Ff5%2Flb02-dist-eng-prod.mgmt.phx2.redhat.com%2Fmessages%22%20%20%2Fnexus%2Fcontent%2Frepositories%2Fsnapshots%2Forg%2Fuberfire%2Fuberfire-services-backend%2Fmaven-metadata.xml&display.page.search.mode=smart&dispatch.sample_ratio=1&earliest=1563228000&latest=1563400800&display.prefs.events.offset=40&sid=1563370424.358744_A18D6D56-D175-4B9C-8A3B-38C94E63C414]

The important times are 13:40 (unauthorized error, where the traffic was sent to proxies) and 12:27 (OK build, where the traffic was directed to the master instance).
column426: 18/Jul/19 8:11 AM;dhladky;I checked Jenkins and the last two builds succeeded. I will check them for a while, but it appears to be some temporary issue.
column427:
22/Jul/19 3:06 AM;mbiarnes;[~dhladky]the user for Jenkins fro deploying from kiereleases (for releases or daily builds) is: kiereleaseuser
for all other Jenkins nodes is has to be  the user *kie-ci* and *kie-ci1--> kie-ci10* (especially for appformer pullrequest the user *kie-ci2*) .
This depends on the Jenkins jobs but finally it has to be a user in between kie-ci users.
column428:
23/Jul/19 5:47 AM;mbiarnes;[~dhladky]
the user kiereleasuser is needed for release and for prod tags - everything done on kie-releases.lab.eng.brq.redhat.com: this user can deploy , do PRs etc.
Please don't change nothing. I mean it is working right now.
This user doesn't have to do anything with the kie-ci users, needed for all jenkins nodes to access and push/pull to gihub.
what I don't understand is, that there are only this error  for uberfire and not for other reps.
Uberfire has all this users. Maybe there is missing ssomething more in uberfire?
column429:
23/Jul/19 5:55 AM;mbiarnes;[~dhladky] [~danielezonca]
looking at the deployed job of appformer and the PR of appformer
both are green! 
Did anyone change anything?
column430: 23/Jul/19 5:57 AM;danielezonca;I did not change that job. I think the error is a random failure that happen only sometimes
column431:
23/Jul/19 8:02 AM;dhladky;There is a collision of names for kiereleaseuser Red Hat account name and native Nexus account of the same name. I can not prove it, but if the two have the same name and password, there might be some random problem with authentication. 

We really should get rid of one of them and it should be the internal one. I will not change anything unless  you are ready for it, but when you are ready, I would like to delete the native account and you will verify the builds still work properly with the Red Hat account. If you set the RH account to have the same credentials as the native account, there should not be any other work on your side except for checking the builds still work properly.
column432: 23/Jul/19 9:09 AM;dhladky;After a call with [~mbiarnes] it is clear he is not behind the kiereleaseuser Red Hat account. I tried to contact the person behind it (I sent an e-mail to the associated e-mail address).

column1: proxy02 Unstable
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus

column1: Caching Issue with maven-metadata.xml
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39:
We (business automation team) are running more and more into issues where we need that our Nexus instance is serving different content.  For example:
https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/snapshots/org/kie/kie-api/7.24.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml
When opening this file, it seems you either get snapshots from either today or you get snapshots from 2 days ago.
Looking at origin-repository, the file there seems to correctly contain the snapshots from today.  But when maven tries to download the same file on my local machine, I'm getting outdated snapshots instead.

Just to clarify why this is causing severe issues for us: not just because some people are then served outdated jars, but sometimes it even leads to situations where people can no longer build their projects because it's first saying to download specific snapshots but then it's saying those versions can't be found.  And then other people don't see any issues at all.

Is this a known issue?  I know we are being asked to avoid using origin-repository instead, but if this prevents people from building their code I don't think this is an alternative.
column422: 11/Jul/19 9:29 AM;dhladky;As for the caching as we discussed on the BlueJeans call, would it be possible to invalidate the F5 cache if the file is being deployed? I am not sure, whether maven would not be confused if the new version of the file is uploaded and then it would be still cached the old value.
column423:
11/Jul/19 9:34 AM;dhladky;{quote}
David,

Actually the url I pasted is incorrect, we're just using https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/public/ as the base url everywhere.  So maven would be trying to download:
https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/kie/kie-api/7.24.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml

But the caching issue is something we're currently seeing for snapshots mostly.  I guess in theory it might be visible on other repos maybe as well then, but I guess even if that's the case it would be much less likely we would run into it as released versions don't change as often.  So a solution that would make at least snapshots behave more consistently would definitely help imho.  Or can we use origin-repository for snapshots for example?

Note that the maven-metadata.xml file is not unique to the snapshot repos, it's being used for release versions as well.

Thx,
Kris
{quote}
column424: 11/Jul/19 10:14 AM;KrisVerlaenen;[~dhladky] when new versions are deployed on nexus, the maven-metadata.xml file is updated to point to the latest jars that are uploaded as well.  I think that in that case the cache should indeed be invalidated somehow for that file, so that it makes sure to pick up the latest version from that point forward.  Note that what makes it even worse is that the behavior seems to be inconsistent across nodes, so while one node might be serving the new metadata file already, the other node might not yet, which can lead to random errors during our builds.
column425: 15/Jul/19 8:51 AM;dhladky;I tried to use an undocumented option in Nexus and the first test with [~mbiarnes] looks promising. One of the snapshots was properly distributed to both nodes. It could have been coincidence though. We will see what will do the next build.
column426:
16/Jul/19 9:11 AM;dhladky;We made a [test|https://rhba-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/KIE/job/Test-jobs/job/deployNextDevelopmentVersion/36/consoleFull] with [~mbiarnes] and it appears both nodes are in sync with the new releases. For the old one you can still encounter wrong sync, but as of the future build the nodes seem to be both in sync with the artifacts copied to both automatically. Please, let me know when you finish some build so I can check it again. 

However if the sync works as it did in this particular case, you should not be encountering similar issues.

column1: Authentication Problem in Fusesource Quickstarts Deployment
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39:
Transcript from Google Chat:

*Torsten Mielke:*
Hello David, Jon Anstey suggested to reach out to you. I have problems getting a dev build for Fuse 6.3 to succeed. Not sure you can access https://fusesource-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/perfectus-6.3.0/. All the builds since yesterday fail with the same error: 
"Failed to transfer file: https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/fs-tmp630/org/switchyard/quickstarts/switchyard-bean-service/2.1.0.redhat-630399/switchyard-bean-service-2.1.0.redhat-630399.jar. Return code is: 401, ReasonPhrase: Unauthorized."
I checked that the three repositories
  https://origin-repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/fs-tmp630/
  https://proxy01-repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/fs-tmp630/
  https://proxy02-repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/fs-tmp630/
are all up and runinng and don't know what else I can do to resolve the problem. Any idea on your side?
And apologies for pinging you directly. In case you are not the right contact to ask on this kind of problem, can you recommend someone else?
Also according to http://grafana.pnc.dynamic.host.centralci.eng.rdu2.redhat.com:3000/d/fa8Ubvumz/status?refresh=1m&orgId=1&from=now-7d&to=now all systems are up and running during the time of the builds

*David Hladky:*
Hi, no apology necessary.
401 error means error in user credentials (missing or incorrect)

*Torsten Mielke:*
Yes but it is an intermittent error.
Other uploads to the same site succeed

*David Hladky:*
Can you check you Maven settings, that you have the right repository identifier and the right credentials there?

*Torsten Mielke:*
Search for "Uploading" on https://fusesource-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/job/perfectus-6.3.0/776/consoleFull

*David Hladky:*
I would expect this particular build is using the old credentials
And therefore it is unable to authenticate

*Torsten Mielke:*
No, it should not as we have seen this error many times and typically it goes away after some retries a few days later without changing any credentials on our side.

*David Hladky:*
I see.
Thank you.

*Torsten Mielke:*
I checked with Jon Anstey on this error before and he said that he typically checks that all the three repos (listed above) are functional as we seem to get load balanced across them and sometimes one is down.

*David Hladky:*
The log then makes investigation of this particular problem possible.

*Torsten Mielke:*
But they all seem to be up.

*David Hladky:*
I will check if there was some outage on Keycloak.

*Torsten Mielke:*
Thanks.
We see this error very regularly when building.

*David Hladky:*
If there was, it would behave exactly this way - Nexus would be functional for anonymous operations, but it would not authorize anyone

*David Hladky:*
https://issues.jboss.org/projects/NEXUS/issues/NEXUS-163?filter=allopenissues
This is the right place for reporting similar problems

*Torsten Mielke:*
Thx, should I kick off a new build or wait until you got a chance to check?

*David Hladky:*
No. I will check the logs first if there is some clue about what was going on.

*Torsten Mielke:*
Many thanks. Whats interesting to note is that the build seems to always fail on the same artifact
Caused by: org.apache.maven.wagon.TransferFailedException: Failed to transfer file: https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/repositories/fs-tmp630/org/switchyard/quickstarts/switchyard-bean-service/2.1.0.redhat-630399/switchyard-bean-service-2.1.0.redhat-630399.jar.
This is fairly consistent.
while it seems to succeed on others before
Previous builds on the same day had the same problem.

*David Hladky:*
This is a very good clue
Just to be sure: does this particular file ever uploads?

*Torsten Mielke:*
Yes, it does eventually
At some stage (a number of retries) the build succeeds
Last time it took me 3-4 days of trying

column1: Missing Artifact on Proxy
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39:
We have a returning error in Nexus -SNAPSHOT repositories.
We have a PR failing because a dependency (*.jar) could not be found:
it is trying to download it from here:
https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/optaplanner/optaplanner-examples/7.24.0-SNAPSHOT/
but the artifact optaplanner-examples-7.24.0-20190617.102554-24.jar is not present - but it is in https://origin-repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/optaplanner/optaplanner-examples/7.24.0-SNAPSHOT/
Because of performance issues we don't use the origin-repositories rather the repository.jboss.org.

I see there is a reported Nexus problem for this.
Can we do anything here or do we have to live with this recurrent issue? 

Is it possible to add the origin-reps to the settings.xml so in case an artifact can't be downloaded from repository.jboss.org he looks at origin-repository.jboss.org?
column422: 19/Jun/19 8:30 AM;dhladky;Nexus proxy are not able to reach many of their sources. Probably some networking issue. I will have to resolve this with DevOps.
column423:
19/Jun/19 9:17 AM;mbiarnes;thanX [~dhladky] - 
in optapanner itself the rep was synced - so problem here resolved, but it is another rep  (jbpm) now - same issue - repository.jboss.org shows different content as origin-repositories.jboss.org
Lets wait if devOps could fix this.
column424: 20/Jun/19 5:05 AM;dhladky;One of the proxies auto-blocked all repositories from the master instance, so it stayed behind the second one with its content. It should be fixed now. Will you, please, try to do your builds and let me know if the issue is resolved? Thank you.
column425:
25/Jun/19 3:31 AM;mbiarnes;[~dhladky]
The daily builds work - so I suppose everything can be downloaded.

column1: JBoss Maven repository at https://maven.repository.redhat.com/ga has missing artefacts
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39:
Quoted from https://redhat.service-now.com/surl.do?n=PNT0509141 : 

Hi I tried to raise this problem at service-now.com, but they sent me to you. The JBoss Maven repository, which is used by just about everybody, inside Red Hat and outside, to build Fuse/EAP applications, has a bunch of missing artefacts. To take just one example, the directory https://maven.repository.redhat.com/ga/org/springframework/boot/spring-boot-starter-actuator/ has no artefacts in. Worse, requesting a missing artefact results in a redirection to access.redhat.com, which appears to Maven to be successful, so a proper artefact, like a JAR or a POM, is replaced by an HTML file with the same name. This completely corrupts the developer's local Maven installation. I hope I am describing a problem that makes some kind of sense. Best wishes Kevin
column422:
15/Mar/19 9:21 AM;dhladky;I checked the content of the repositories and it appears it was somehow undeployed and only checksum files remained cached. I can not find any trace of spring-boot-starter-actuator files (except for in Maven Central https://search.maven.org/search?q=spring-boot-starter-actuator ). 

Can you, please, specify where the file should come from? At least narrow the search to a specific product?
column423:
19/Mar/19 5:31 AM;dhladky;I asked [~vladimir_v] to search for spring-boot-starter-actuator artifacts in our file system. It took a while, but the search did not reveal anything useful. I might be wrong, but Spring is not developed by Red Hat so I would have been very surprised if he found anything useful. 

Strange thing is, that the checksums in the reposigtory group, that is behind MRRC, do exist. So it is possible something was there. But it rather does seem like someone added a proxy repository to the product-ga group and then removed it. 

As for com.fasterxml.jackson/jackson-bom/2.8.11.20180217 it does look like a snapshot version of jackson-bom. We can ask [~janstey] if he knows something about it.
column424:
21/Mar/19 4:34 AM;mielket;Adding to the camel-servlet artifact from Federico's previous update, I can find them in these repositories

https://origin-repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/ea/org/apache/camel/camel-servlet/2.15.1.redhat-621222/
https://origin-repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/m2-proxy/org/apache/camel/camel-servlet/2.15.1.redhat-621222/
https://origin-repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/m2-release-proxy/org/apache/camel/camel-servlet/2.15.1.redhat-621222/

and they should have been released to our public Maven repos when we released Fuse 6.2.1 R10.
column425:
21/Mar/19 6:04 AM;dhladky;Hi folks, thank you for the feedback. It is really helpful to have more stuff to investigate. This is quite a lot of missing stuff. I believe what happen is the repositories, these artifacts belonged to were dropped. 

7.2.0.fuse-720020-redhat-00001 - this one is part of Product: FUSE 7.2.0 repository. That is why it is there and it does not disappear

7.2.0.fuse-720035-redhat-00001 - not a trace of it. Was it deployed to Nexus? And if so how? If it was deployed to staging suite, was it promoted? Not promoted/released repositories are being cleaned up (not closed staging repositories after three days, closed and not promoted/released in two weeks). 

6.2.1.redhat-222 - is present in fusesource_releases_external-12169 . The repository was promoted, so it is there and gets not wiped out, but based on the log it was not succesfully released. The error message was "Failed: Repository Writeable". This is very interesting  finding and it might actually be the root of the other problems. [~vladimir_v] will verify what is happening with permissions in the file system. I can imagine the "release failed" and as a result the stuff you are missing was then cleaned up as "not used".
column426: 21/Mar/19 6:12 AM;dhladky;Ticket for DevOps created: https://redhat.service-now.com/surl.do?n=PNT0514191
column427:
21/Mar/19 8:59 AM;janstey;Let me chime in too :-)

1. org/jboss/redhat-fuse/fuse-karaf-bom 7.2.0.fuse-720020-redhat-00001 - yes, this is what we released so really hope nothing is missing related to this one! Full list of build numbers are in the description of https://issues.jboss.org/browse/ENTESB-9823 BTW

2. org/jboss/redhat-fuse/fuse-karaf-bom 7.2.0.fuse-720035-redhat-00001 - never existed. We don't even have a tag of this :-) I wonder if we are referring to some other artifact???

3. 6.2.1.redhat-222 - this one is on my TODO list already. I know how to fix it, just need to find the time. Fortunately for 6.2.x we defined the ea group in the kit so customers can still access the patched artifacts.
column428:
21/Mar/19 11:53 AM;dhladky;I thank [~janstey] for his explanation. So it appears the fuse stuff is as it is supposed to be. The question remains the Spring stuff. I have no idea how it can be part of MRRC as Spring is developer by other company and I would find it strange being hosted in our repository dedicated for "our supported artifacts".  

The  spring-boot-starter-actuator artifacts are in Maven Central so they should not block our releases in any way. If you think they should be published by us, then it needs to be clear who is responsible for it (and that we can legally do it).
column429: 02/Apr/19 6:14 AM;dhladky;Hi [~kboone], as [~janstey] said he planned to add some of the missing artifacts. I would like to ask if the issue has been resolved by the added content (or fixed dependencies) and it is now possible to make your build. If it still does not work, we would probably need to find someone to add the missing dependencies.
column430: 17/Apr/19 5:01 AM;dhladky;Thank you. I created https://projects.engineering.redhat.com/browse/RCM-55561 . rel-eng would need to check what went missing.
column431:
24/Apr/19 7:03 AM;dhladky;Based on the [~cobrien_redhat] comment (see the RCM ticket) the content was accidentally deployed and the removed from Nexus. So the question here is, whether something, that should be in MRRC is missing, or the build you are trying to do is supposed to only work with the offline repository supplied by Red Hat. 

Feature or bug? that is the question.
column432: 24/Apr/19 8:27 AM;kboone;This problem has now gone away. I have no idea why. While I would like to know the cause of the problem, in case it happens again, I recognize that we are unlikely ever to know. Please close.
column433: 24/Apr/19 8:33 AM;dhladky;Thank you for confirmation.
column434:
18/Jun/19 9:03 AM;fvaleri;Hi, sorry to reopen this one, but I'm still not able to download 7.2 artefacts from GA repo using the new-style BOM.
The *035* build is the one available inside the distribution on the CU portal and the examples use the old-style BOM.

*OK (old-style)*
https://maven.repository.redhat.com/ga/all/org/jboss/fuse/jboss-fuse-parent/
{code}
<dependencyManagement>
  <dependencies>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.jboss.fuse</groupId>
      <artifactId>jboss-fuse-parent</artifactId>
      <version>7.2.0.fuse-720035-redhat-00001</version>
      <scope>import</scope>
      <type>pom</type>
    </dependency>
  </dependencies>
</dependencyManagement>
{code}

*KO (new-style)*
https://maven.repository.redhat.com/ga/all/org/jboss/redhat-fuse/fuse-karaf-bom/
{code}
<dependencyManagement>
  <dependencies>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.jboss.redhat-fuse</groupId>
      <artifactId>fuse-karaf-bom</artifactId>
      <version>7.2.0.fuse-720035-redhat-00001</version>
      <type>pom</type>
      <scope>import</scope>
    </dependency>
  </dependencies>
</dependencyManagement>
{code}
column435:
18/Jun/19 9:57 AM;dhladky;Afaik you did not reopen this issue, fortunately I noticed your comment in this issue. The problem here is not with Maven itself, but the one, that fuse-karaf-pom and jboss-fuse-parent are completely different artifacts . The fact they have the same version ID does not mean Maven will see any "new approach" for the old stuff. 

The new style KO may only work for stuff, that was deployed to Nexus under its new coordinates, but it appears it did not happen in this case. Why this did not happen is a question for the Fuse team. I would not be surprised, if it was more "feature" than a "bug", but I am not involved in the release process in any way so I can not tell.
column436:
18/Jun/19 10:11 AM;fvaleri;[~dhladky] now I see that the build numbers are completely different between the two styles and it makes sense.
I was just surprised to see the old-style in 7.2 release.

column1: Due to Jive API Changes Nexus Does Not Authenticate Properly
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39: After the last upgrade of Jive Nexus is not able to read the user roles properly. Therefore many people report inability to deploy artifacts.
column422:
01/Dec/17 4:40 AM;dhladky;The information about the membership in  security groups used to be in an array. However now if the user belongs to just one security group, Jive converts the array into just the item. So Nexus can not parse it properly. 

Until we fix it, if you are affected, please, write an e-mail to help@jboss.org. As a workaround we add you to a dummy security group so you are no longer blocked from your release.
column423: 01/Dec/17 4:41 AM;lkrzyzanek;The workaround is to add affected user to any other security group.
column424: 01/Dec/17 4:53 AM;lkrzyzanek;Created separate issue to fix Jive's api: ORG-3761

column1: org.wildfly.extras.creaper sync to Central doesn't work
column10: Issues for Nexus powered jboss.org Maven Repository running at https://repository.jboss.org/nexus
column39:
Synchronization of {{org.wildfly.extras.creaper}} to Maven Central used to work for some time (all Creaper versions up to 1.5.0 are available from Central just fine), but stopped working for some reason.

Versions 1.6.0 and 1.6.1 have been released couple of weeks ago, but they don't show up in Central. There was a big delay between 1.5.0 (September 2016) and 1.6.0 (April 2017), so probably something stopped working in the meantime.

The artifacts are available from JBoss.org Nexus, but some users like to consume them from Maven Central.

Thanks!
column422: 08/Jun/17 7:05 AM;dhladky;Hmm, the third similar error in one week. It appears Sonatype has some bug in the synchronization of Maven Central.

column425: 13/Jun/17 5:58 AM;dhladky;I can see both 1.6.0 and 1.6.1 versions in Maven Central. Hopefully the new way of syncing will be better.

column1: DMN fix regression on Kogito not highlighted by Jenkins/CI
column10: Cloud-native business automation for building intelligent applications, backed by battle-tested capabilities.
column39:
Since moving to generic `java.time` interfaces, Jackson is no longer able to deserialize InputSet using generic dates on Kogito.
This was not highlighted by Jenkins/CI and informed by Mario which by chanced noticed this issue locally.
This fixes the regression and use Strongly Typed test suite to ensure this no longer regress on drools.git repo directly.
column422: 27/Aug/20 3:05 AM;tari_manga;resolved with [https://github.com/kiegroup/drools/commit/cb735bde9d26bc4569827335632409fe3bd72293]

Hitting the endpoint a second time recompiles properly.
column373:
1) Clone the following repository: https://github.com/DuncanDoyle/kogito-ruleunit-hotreload-issue
2) Start the application in Quarkus dev-mode: mvn clean compile quarkus:dev
3) Open the Swagger UI at: http://localhost:8080/swagger-ui
4) Edit the "com.redhat.PersonUnit" file and uncomment the "private int adultAge" attribute.
5) Uncomment the getter and setter of the "adultAge" attribute and save the file.
6) In the "com/redhat/adult.drl", replace the value "18" in the constraint of rule "Is Adult" with "adultAge" and save the file.
7) Reload the Swagger-UI. You will see the exception as mentioned in the description.
8) Reload the Swagger-UI again. Compilation now works fine.

column1: [DMN Designer] ACE Editor is not shown for invalid DMN content
column10: Cloud-native business automation for building intelligent applications, backed by battle-tested capabilities.
column39:
When opening an invalid DMN file with the most recent DMN editor, it's expected that Ace editor shows up and displays the contents as text. However, due to a recently discovered bug, probably originated by this commit, an empty diagram shows and no error messages are displayed.

*Acceptance criteria:*
Ace editor should show DMN contents as text on invalid DMN file input
column422:
03/Mar/20 9:47 AM;manstis;The issue is caused by {{EditorEnvelopeController.receive_contentResponse}} [function|https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-tooling/blob/master/packages/microeditor-envelope/src/EditorEnvelopeController.tsx#L61].

This sets the content of the editor first to an empty String and then the real content.

Setting an empty String causes a new Diagram to first be created that leads to initialisation of the Monaco editor.

Setting the real content (if invalid) then causes ACE Editor to be initialised while Monaco is still initialising; leading to the failure.

column1: account-console client doesn't have all scopes of account client
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
The "account-console" client (which is used by the new Account Console) has a wrong scope. It includes only "manage-account" from the "account" client (which is used by the REST API) which is not enough. This is because "manage-account" is misconfigured and doesn't include all account roles as composites, e.g. "view-profile" is missing.

This leads to significantly limited options for managing user access to the Account Console, e.g. it's not possible to limit the user to just view their profile.

h3. Proposed solutions

The preferred solution would be to include all roles as composites under "manage-account". But we'd need to consider possible backward compatibility issues.

Another solution is to update the scope of "account-console" client to list all roles from "account" client.
column373:
# Create a user with just "view-profile" account client role (not "manage-account" role).
# Login as this user to Account Console.
# Navigate to "Personal Info".
*Expected:* User is able to view (but not edit) personal info.
*Actual:* Error message is displayed.
column422:
03/Sep/20 6:41 AM;sebastian.laskawiec;[~vmuzikar] I tried to follow the second proposed solution (add all roles from the {{account}} client to the {{account-console}}) but it doesn't seem to work.

Please see my Account Console Client Configuration ({{Account Console Client Scopes.png}}) and Test user Role Mappings ({{Test user Role Mappings.png}}). According to your proposal, this setup should allow the test user to view the Account Console but it ends up with an error.

I'm not an expert in Scopes (as the matter of fact, it's the first time I'm playing with them) but maybe the Admin Console tries to requires "manage-account" but it should "view-account"? Maybe the problem is in a different place?
column423:
03/Sep/20 7:00 AM;sebastian.laskawiec;[~vmuzikar] [~abstractj] [~ssilvert] I started digging a bit deeper and I'm not sure if this is a bug. Again, please correct me if I'm wrong - I don't have any experience with the Account Console nor with Scopes.

The [AccountFormService#forwardToPage|https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/blob/7501e429694b2902c6963fb809d10afba0f1ca2d/services/src/main/java/org/keycloak/services/resources/account/AccountFormService.java#L203] method is responsible for displaying User Account Console. This method requires {{AccountRoles.MANAGE_ACCOUNT}} for a good reason - it displays a page where a user can modify his own settings. Even though all the methods from the {{AccountRestService}} are guarded by inspecting {{AccountRoles.MANAGE_ACCOUNT}} or {{AccountRoles.VIEW_ACCOUNT}} roles, we display a page where all the input boxes are not grayed out. We allow users to type some stuff there. Once they hit "Save", all modifications will fail (as they are guarded on the REST level) but nevertheless, it's pretty bad user experience.

So if fix this issue, we expose users for a very poor user experience, which I think is even worse. Unless I misunderstood something (or my investigation is wrong), I'm advocating for not fixing this issue.
column424: 03/Sep/20 7:58 AM;vmuzikar;[~sebastian.laskawiec] Yes, that's a good point it'd have to be fixed at the UI side as well. The question here is, is the new Account Console meant to be working in read only mode? Because if it isn't, it still deserves a fix. The old console displayed a nice Forbidden page when missing manage-account role and didn't display the Console at all. The new console is displayed in such cases implying it should work but then user gets many error messages while navigating it.
column425: 03/Sep/20 8:31 AM;sebastian.laskawiec;[~ssilvert] [~vmuzikar] Stupid question - how can I enable the new console to check it up?
column426: 03/Sep/20 8:33 AM;vmuzikar;[~sebastian.laskawiec] There's no such thing as stupid questions. :) The easiest way is {{-Dkeycloak.profile=preview}} and then set the new theme in the Admin Console.
column427: 03/Sep/20 10:11 AM;ssilvert;I think this does need to be fixed, but I don't think it's critical for the release.
column428: 04/Sep/20 6:15 AM;sebastian.laskawiec;[~ssilvert] [~vmuzikar] I checked the new console and indeed, we need to implement this.

column1: [7.4.z] Unable to remove keycloak CRs during uninstallation
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
h4. What

Uninstallation of RHSSO gets stuck due to the following issue:

RHSSO uninstallation [removes the users and clients|https://github.com/integr8ly/integreatly-operator/blob/master/pkg/products/rhsso/reconciler.go#L247-L285] first before removing the realm. We currently do not wait for the user/clients to be deleted first before attempting to remove the realms. There are cases where the users/clients are still being deleted when the realm gets removed.

If the realm was deleted first, users/clients will gets stuck on deletion as the realms associated with it has been removed. This is caused by the [validateList|https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-operator/blob/10.0.0/pkg/common/controller_utils.go#L91] function called by [GetMatchingRealms()|https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-operator/blob/10.0.0/pkg/common/controller_utils.go#L71] which is called during the [user|https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-operator/blob/10.0.0/pkg/controller/keycloakuser/keycloakuser_controller.go#L136] and [client|https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-operator/blob/10.0.0/pkg/controller/keycloakclient/keycloakclient_controller.go#L116] reconcile. Keycloak operator logs can be found [here|https://gist.github.com/JameelB/71759c6768617b56cffe24a070b1b827]

When you ensure that clients and users gets deleted first and wait for the next reconcile to remove the rest of the Keycloak custom resources, the cloud resource operator will remove the Keycloak postgres which breaks the keycloak pods. Realms gets stuck on deletion because it can no longer access Keycloak. The following error can be seen in the KeycloakRealm CR:
 !image-2020-06-03-13-03-39-058.png|thumbnail! 

Need to confirm e2e tests will work with these changes also.
column373:
2 ways of reproducing:
1. Uninstall RHMI (Longer)
    - Install RHMI
    - Run {{./scripts/setup-sso-idp.sh}}
    - Uninstall RHMI
    - RHMI uninstallation will get stuck due to remaining Keycloak users/clients CR


2. Remove a realm before deleting a user (Quicker)
    - Install RHMI
    - Run {{./scripts/setup-sso-idp.sh}}
    - Remove the *testing-idp* realm
    - Remove a test-user KeycloakUser CR associated with the *testing-idp* realm
    - The KeycloakUser will not get removed as it cannot find the realm associated with it.

column1: Login Error - Redirected too many times
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
Cookies created prior 10.0.2 causes the infinite redirect loop in 10.0.2.
This seems to be reproducible only in Chrome.

----
h2. Original description
When I created initial admin account, provided credentials and clicked login button to log in to _Keycloak_ (admin or account console), then a browser show page with error _TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS_ with hint _Try clearing your cookies_. Keycloak log contains a lot of (about 20) error events with specified _expired-code_ error.  Always, there are different _authSessionParentID_ and _authSessionTabID_. With anonymous window, everything works well.
column373:
# Login to 10.0.1.
# Migrate to 10.0.2. (Technically, you don't need to migrate. Just start 10.0.2 and make sure you use a realm with the same name as in 10.0.1.)
# Login to 10.0.2.
column404: Remove cookies.
column422: 04/Jun/20 6:18 AM;mabartos;In version 10.0.1 everything works well, so problem should be in additional commits. See https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/compare/10.0.1...10.0.2
column423: 04/Jun/20 6:46 AM;mabartos;In version 10.0.2, there are some minor changes with cookies. Just remove old cookies from the site and then everything will works fine.
column424:
04/Jun/20 10:33 AM;vmuzikar;This is a valid issue after all. Cookies created prior 10.0.2 causes the infinite redirect loop in 10.0.2.

Steps to reproduce:
# Login to 10.0.1.
# Migrate to 10.0.2. (Technically, you don't need to migrate. Just start 10.0.2 and make sure you use a realm with the same name as in 10.0.1.)
# Login to 10.0.2.

This seems to be reproducible only in Chrome.
column425:
04/Jun/20 11:26 AM;vmuzikar;This happens at very specific conditions:
* When the user does not reset the browser session (i.e. close the browser) after migrating to 10.0.2, so that the old {{AUTH_SESSION_ID}} cookie is preserved.
* AND when SSL is not used.

This happens because prior to 10.0.2 {{AUTH_SESSION_ID}} had {{Secure}} attribute only when SSL was used, i.e. it didn't have {{Secure}} attribute when SSL was NOT used. Starting with version 10.0.2 this cookie is always set as {{Secure}}, but the browser rejects it when SSL is not used (that's why we have {{_LEGACY}} cookies). When 10.0.2 tries to rewrite {{AUTH_SESSION_ID}} (which was previously set by 10.0.1 and older), the browser rejects it if SSL is not used. But at the same time the browser is still sending the old value for {{AUTH_SESSION_ID}} (because it was not rewritten), but then KC tries to overwrite it again, and the loop continues...
column426: 08/Jun/20 10:28 AM;vmuzikar;Given the specific conditions (it probably affects only dev environments) and that there [weren't any complains on keycloak-dev|https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/keycloak-dev/KDLec5n77Ns], I'm closing this.

column1: SAML brokering with POST binding is broken by new SameSite policies
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
New SameSite policy in Chrome sets {{SameSite=Lax}} by default to cookies without {{SameSite}} attribute.

# Let's have a SAML IdP using POST binding.
# User initiates authentication using this IdP.
# User logs in to the IdP.
# IdP performs final POST "redirect" back to Keycloak. {{SameSite=Lax}} removes cookies from this request and therefore Keycloak losts its session (AUTH_SESSION_ID cookie).

*Solution:* Set {{SameSite=None}} to AUTH_SESSION_ID cookie.

----

h2. Original report

When using SAML POST-binding to identity provider, Keycloak issues SAML AuthnRequest in http-POST request
After authentication, Identity provider answers with http-POST request containing SAML Response 

There is AUTH_SESSION_ID cookie

If SameSite is not set (current behaviour in 9.0.3 and in master), then it will be treated as `SameSite=Lax`
If Keycloak sets `SameSite=Strict` (As in acceptance criteria), then it is `SameSite=Strict`

In both cases AUTH_SESSION_ID cookie will not be sent in POST request from idp site to keyloak site, as per rfc:
{code}
If the cookie's "samesite-flag" is not "None", and the HTTP
          request is cross-site (as defined in Section 2.1 then exclude
          the cookie unless all of the following statements hold:

          1.  "samesite-flag" is "Lax"
          2.  The HTTP request's method is "safe".
          3.  The HTTP request's target browsing context is a top-level
              browsing context.
{code}

POST method is not considered as "safe" = everything that is not `SameSite=None`  will be rejected when using saml post binding.

What happens if cookie is not present:
{code}
2020-04-15 ;07:26:47.413 [default I/O-2] DEBUG io.undertow.request : Matched prefix path /auth for path /auth/realms/master/broker/saml/login
2020-04-15 ;07:26:47.414 [default task-3424] DEBUG org.keycloak.services.managers.AuthenticationSessionManager : Not found AUTH_SESSION_ID cookie
2020-04-15 ;07:26:47.414 [default task-3424] TRACE org.keycloak.events : type=IDENTITY_PROVIDER_LOGIN_ERROR, realmId=master, clientId=null, userId=null, ipAddress=x.x.x.x, error=invalid_code, identity_provider=saml
{code}

Defaulting to SameSite=Lax (if no SameSite is present) may stop work in the future when chromium starts to enforce Lax and remove workarounds.
see: https://www.chromium.org/updates/same-site

{quote}“Lax + POST” is an intervention for Lax-by-default cookies (cookies that don’t specify a `SameSite` attribute) which allows these cookies to be sent on top-level cross-site POST requests if they are at most 2 minutes old. “Normal” Lax cookies are not sent on cross-site POST requests (or any other cross-site requests with a non-idempotent HTTP method such as PUT). This intervention was put in place to mitigate breakage to some POST-based login flows.
{quote}
column373:
1. Download Chrome Canary https://www.google.com/chrome/canary/
2. Enable SameSite feature:
 !image-2020-04-17-06-58-51-018.png|thumbnail! 
3. Run chrome with flags: chrome --enable-features=SameSiteDefaultChecksMethodRigorously --enable-features=ShortLaxAllowUnsafeThreshold
To disable temporary POST+Lax intervention that makes everything work in current released chrome

4. Try to login using IDP that requires SAML POST Binding. If Keycloak is used as IDP, then it is this option:
 !image-2020-04-17-07-02-04-197.png|thumbnail!

column425:
17/Apr/20 3:38 AM;vmuzikar;Unfortunately, I was still unsuccessful with reproducing it.
We're not setting SameSite for {{AUTH_SESSION_ID}} (which defaults it to Lax here) because it's not needed in any cross-site POST requests. The initial POST request is made to {{auth/realms/\{realm}/protocol/saml}} endpoint which doesn't check this cookie. This endpoint then responds with 302 and redirects to {{auth/realms/\{realm}/login-actions/authenticate}} which is an "inter-site" request so there's no reason why this cookie wouldn't be included in the request by the browser.
[~mitko] [~hmlnarik] Am I correct?
column426: 17/Apr/20 3:50 AM;andrei.bastun;Maybe video  [^Welcome to Keycloak - Google Chrome 2020-04-16 20-26-50.mp4] will help. 8091 is SP, 8092 is IDP. sp initiates saml flow

Cookies from both instances then clash because they have the same path. This is how it's supposed to work.

[~andrei.bastun] Please try to use different realm names (or different hosts) for IdP and SP.

17/Apr/20 12:34 PM;andrei.bastun;To prevent CSRF to admin console,

All other cookies can be set with SameSite=None allowing saml post binding to work


(I'm a bit surprized that at the moment KEYCLOAK_SESSION  and KEYCLOAK_IDENTITY are set with SameSite=None, but maybe Bearer token is enough to avoid CSRF or I don't know something about how these cookies are used in the application)
column438:
20/Apr/20 3:57 AM;vmuzikar;[~andrei.bastun] I was finally able to reproduce it. Thank you for your patience. :) It was really because I used subdomains which are not considered cross-site.

KEYCLOAK_SESSION and KEYCLOAK_IDENTITY needs to be {{SameSite=None}} due to the JS adapter, IIRC.

Fix for this issue should be as simple as setting {{SameSite=None}} for AUTH_SESSION_ID. However, we'll need to update tests too to use different hostnames (e.g. by combining nip.io and xip.ip).
column439: 20/Apr/20 4:01 AM;vmuzikar;This does not affect SAML login (with POST binding) as such but so far I've discovered it affects SAML IdPs and SAML logouts.
column440: 20/Apr/20 4:47 AM;hmlnarik;Thanks [~vmuzikar] and [~mitko] for the triage! This needs to be fixed.
column441: 20/Apr/20 4:55 AM;vmuzikar;[~hmlnarik] Just a small heads up. This is reproducible probably only with Chrome Canary which is apparently not available for Linux, only Windows and macOS.
column442:
22/Apr/20 11:23 AM;vmuzikar;Before making any fix for this, we need to investigate more. Mainly the plans for the full blocking of 3rd party cookies by browsers (KEYCLOAK-13695).
See related discussion: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/keycloak-dev/RVCwXWgC5jU
column443:
23/Apr/20 2:08 AM;andrei.bastun;I think this can and should be fixed separately.

3-rd party cookies needed if request to keycloak performed from some other site via JS/iframe (for silent refresh, etc). (think ads/banners - they will stop getting cookies when 3-rd party is blocked)

This task is about request in top browser context.

SAML protocol has post binding.
Unless we want to say that keycloak does not fully support SAML, cookies used in code that handles SAML must be set with SameSite=None. 
(Or removed completely and session should be restored from SAML assertion (InResponseTo, for example))

Since removing cookie usage or implementing custom session is much larger task than just setting SameSite=None,
and chrome was about to start rolling out SameSite=Lax restrictions (corona helped to postpone that :) https://blog.chromium.org/2020/04/temporarily-rolling-back-samesite.html ) 
and having in mind that they can resume rollout at any time.

I suggest to do quick fix for now.

column1: "You took too long to login" after first login request after SSO session idle occurs
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39: We have set the SSO Session Idle to 13 minutes to match our access token lifespan of 15 minutes in order to workaround the fact that browsers may not delete session cookies. This has caused another issue, whereby the user receives the error "You took too long to login. Login process starting from beginning" even when they spend no time waiting on the login screen in a certain scenario (see steps to reproduce).
column40:
Edge/Chrome
Windows 10
Angular JS + keycloak javascript adapter
column373:
1). Log into application.
 2). Close browser tab containing application.
 3). Wait 15 minutes (SSO idle + 2 minute grace period)
 4). Open application again. You'll be directed to the login page by keycloak.
 5). Attempt to login and receive the error "You took too long to login. Login process starting from beginning."

column1: Applications UI has erroneous "Remove Access" button
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39: In new account console, the Applications section allows you to remove access for granted permissions.  However, the button for "Remove access" still shows up for applications where the user never granted permissions in the first place.  For instance, the button shows up for the Account Console application itself.

column1: NPM lint errors and warnings on MyResources page
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
h2. What
* When building the new account console `npm lint` report an error related with `handleTabClick` function. This was certainly introduce after some upgrade, PatternFly had `FormEvent`, now it seems they switched to [MouseEvent|https://github.com/patternfly/patternfly-react/blob/74ab953dde4662f0d521626cdb0da5dc2605278e/packages/patternfly-4/react-core/src/components/Tabs/Tabs.tsx#L83]

h2. Expected Results
* Run `npm lint` and no error or warnings

h2. Actual Results
{code}
> keycloak-preview@1.0.0 build /home/abstractj/github/keycloak/keycloak-server-11293/themes/src/main/resources/theme/keycloak-preview/account/resources
> tsc --noImplicitAny --strictNullChecks --jsx react -p ./ && npm run lint

app/content/my-resources-page/MyResourcesPage.tsx:226:68 - error TS2322: Type '(event: FormEvent<HTMLInputElement>, tabIndex: number) => void' is not assignable to type '(event: MouseEvent<HTMLElement, MouseEvent>, eventKey: string | number) => void'.
  Types of parameters 'event' and 'event' are incompatible.
    Type 'MouseEvent<HTMLElement, MouseEvent>' is not assignable to type 'FormEvent<HTMLInputElement>'.
      Types of property 'currentTarget' are incompatible.
        Type 'EventTarget & HTMLElement' is not assignable to type 'EventTarget & HTMLInputElement'.
          Type 'EventTarget & HTMLElement' is missing the following properties from type 'HTMLInputElement': accept, align, alt, autocomplete, and 50 more.

226                 <Tabs isFilled activeKey={this.state.activeTabKey} onSelect={this.handleTabClick}>
{code}

After fix this we get some warnings:

{code}
> keycloak-preview@1.0.0 build /home/abstractj/github/keycloak/keycloak-server-11293/themes/src/main/resources/theme/keycloak-preview/account/resources
> tsc --noImplicitAny --strictNullChecks --jsx react -p ./ && npm run lint


> keycloak-preview@1.0.0 lint /home/abstractj/github/keycloak/keycloak-server-11293/themes/src/main/resources/theme/keycloak-preview/account/resources
> eslint --ignore-pattern *.d.ts ./**/*.ts*


/home/abstractj/github/keycloak/keycloak-server-11293/themes/src/main/resources/theme/keycloak-preview/account/resources/app/ContentPages.tsx
   79:58  warning  Missing return type on function  @typescript-eslint/explicit-function-return-type
  154:62  warning  Missing return type on function  @typescript-eslint/explicit-function-return-type
  157:86  warning  Missing return type on function  @typescript-eslint/explicit-function-return-type

/home/abstractj/github/keycloak/keycloak-server-11293/themes/src/main/resources/theme/keycloak-preview/account/resources/app/PageToolbar.tsx
  43:37  warning  Missing return type on function  @typescript-eslint/explicit-function-return-type

✖ 4 problems (0 errors, 4 warnings)
{code}

column1: [GSS][7.3.z] Credentials tab on clients can only be displayed with view-realm
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
Very similar issue to KEYCLOAK-9489 but in the {{clients}} tab. Although the admin user has {{query-clients}} and {{manage-clients}} permissions the administrator cannot access the {{credentials}} tab of a confidential client (Forbidden page). The two endpoints that return the 403 are:

# [/admin/realms/<realm>/authentication/per-client-config-description|https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/blob/master/services/src/main/java/org/keycloak/services/resources/admin/AuthenticationManagementResource.java#L1098]
# [/admin/realms/<realm>/authentication/client-authenticator-providers|https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/blob/master/services/src/main/java/org/keycloak/services/resources/admin/AuthenticationManagementResource.java#L138]

The reason is the same, they only check the {{requireViewRealm}} method. Don't know what you want to add here, maybe {{query-clients}} or similar like you did with the users menu option.
column373:
# Create an admin user in a realm and add to him permissions in the realm-management client: manage-clients and query-clients.
# Login with user in the console.
# Got to clients and select one of confidential type.
# Click on Credentials tab.
# Forbidden page.

The only workaround is adding the view-realm perm.
column422:
14/Oct/19 2:59 PM;e-tool;Since the problem described in this issue should be resolved in a recent advisory, it has been closed.

For information on the advisory, and where to find the updated files, follow the link below.

If the solution does not work for you, open a new bug report.
https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3050

column1: I18n doesn't work
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
The keycloak-preview theme shows empty list of supported locales. The locales are also missing in the Admin Console.

This is probably because {{theme.properties}} doesn't specify any locale (even though English is technically supported, so it should be present there).
column373:
# Enable i18n in Admin Console
# Go to Account Console

column1: LastSessionRefreshUnitTest triggers many scheduled tasks
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
When running the tests against auth-server-wildfly with enabled DEBUG logging for package `org.keycloak.services.scheduled` , I can see that the thread to persist updated lastSessionRefreshes is executed many times from that point.

Even after LastSessionRefreshUnitTest is finished and next tests are executed, the messages that thread was scheduled is still reported many times. The expected behaviour is to have the background scheduled just once per each 5 seconds.

This can have some side-effects, so likely should be investigated. Snippet from the server.log:

column1: DBLockTest.testLockConcurrently fails with mariadb_galera
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39: https://keycloak-jenkins.com/job/keycloak-jpa-matrix/DB=mariadb_galera_101,jdk=local_oraclejdk8,label_exp=rhel7_large/1318/testReport/org.keycloak.testsuite.model/DBLockTest/testLockConcurrently/
column373: run base testsiute with mariadb_galera
column422:
03/Jun/19 12:10 AM;mposolda;Few issues identified when working on this:

- LiquibaseDBLockProvider.waitForLock method - There are 3 attempts to call "lockService.waitForLock", so LockEntryException can be catched 2 times. Problem is, that if it is caught for 3rd time, the method LiquibaseDBLockProvider.waitForLock is executed with success and further code assumes that lock was successfully obtained, which is not true. So the exception should be re-thrown in that case rather then method successfully exited.

- In case there are many threads racing for obtain the lock, the 3 attempts are not sufficient. Will be good to introduce exponential back-off algorithm ( Retry.executeWithBackoff) for waiting and use 10 attempts similarly like it's used for infinispan/cross-dc related code.

- In case of MariaDB Galera, it can happen under some circumstances that SQL query used in StandardLockService.isDatabaseChangeLogLockTableInitialized throws the database exception in case there are many threads trying to call the query and call "Select for Uodate" at the same time. MariaDB throws the DB exception with suggestion to rollback the transaction. But liquibase re-throws this as UnexpectedLiquibaseException, which is not handled by Keycloak ATM. Will be good to handle it and re-throw as LockEntryException, so that transactio can be rolled-back and another attempt can be tried.

column373: run base testsuite with mvn clean install command

column1: Stage script sometimes fails when a conflicting PR is detected
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39: At some specific conditions (probably git version, type of the conflict), `stage.groovy` completely fails (instead of just skipping the PR) when it detects a rebase conflict.
column373:
# Create at least two mutually conflicting PRs (only one of them could be merged without conflicts).
# Run the stage script

column1: FuseAdminAdapterTest.jmxLoginTest failing intermittently

column39: FuseAdminAdapterTest.jmxLoginTest fails intermittently with Fuse 7.3.0.fuse-730065-redhat-00002 when following command is executed: {noformat}config:edit org.apache.karaf.management; config:property-set jmxRealm keycloak; config:update{noformat} with Error: {noformat}Error executing command: /path/to/keycloak/testsuite/integration-arquillian/servers/app-server/karaf/fuse7x/target/containers/fuse-karaf-7.3.0.fuse-730065-redhat-00002/etc/org.apache.karaf.management.cfg (No such file or directory){noformat}
column422: 12/Apr/19 6:41 AM;vramik;It turned out it's not possible to configure fuse within building the app-server module. The configuration has  to be done within testsuite itself.

column1: aud includes RP
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
The aud claim should not include the RP by default. The access token aud should only contain services. 

In cases the RP is also providing services and is protected with client roles the RP *won't* be added by the automatic aud provider, so a separate "Audience" mapper for adding hardcoded audience should be used.
column422: 14/Jan/19 6:59 AM;tolleiv;This kind of broke downwards compatibility with older Keycloak instances which use a newer Keycloak as their Identity Provider. Not sure if that's considered a bug, but worth noting. The older Keycloak would then see "Wrong audience from token." errors because they still validate the access token which doesn't carry their ID within AUD anymore.
column423:
31/Jan/19 5:43 AM;mm-matthias;I think that this is does not work as the ticket description advertises.

What I do:
1. start new keycloak instance (4.8.0.Final)
2. login as master realm admin
3. create new client "testclient"
4. in client view. go to "Roles" tab and add new role "testrole"
5. in client view, go to Scopes tab, set "Full Scope Allowed" to "off". Note that effective permissions for "testclient" include "testrole".
6. in client view, go to "Client Scopes" -> "Evaluate". Enter master realm user and look at "Generated Access Token".
7. no "aud" member is present in generated token.

I expect "aud": "testclient" to be present in the token, because the ticket description says "In cases the RP (testclient) is also providing services  and is protected with client roles (testrole) the RP will be added by the automatic aud provider (does not work)". 

[~mposolda] If this is a bug, I can file another issue. I'd appreciate though if you tell me whether the behaviour is as expected or not.
column424: 31/Jan/19 5:51 AM;mposolda;[~mm-matthias] Sorry, just updated description. The RP shouldn't be added even if there are client roles. So if you really want the RP added, you may need separate "Audience" mapper for that.
column425: 31/Jan/19 5:53 AM;mposolda;[~mm-matthias] You can take a look at the docs for more details: https://www.keycloak.org/docs/latest/server_admin/index.html#_audience_resolve
column426: 31/Jan/19 8:56 AM;mm-matthias;[~mposolda] Thank you for answering this.
column427:
05/Sep/19 3:31 AM;sungjinhong-1;Please have a look at issue KEYCLOAK-8954 

This change directly impacted the usage of Keycloak Gatekeeper.

Even the documentation mentions this as a known issue: https://www.keycloak.org/docs/latest/securing_apps/index.html#known-issues

So... who is right??

column1: resource_access is included in token when there are no mappers for it
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
When there are no mapper for client roles or when there are no client roles the resource_access claim is still included in the token.

This is caused by:

https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/blob/master/core/src/main/java/org/keycloak/representations/AccessToken.java#L126

Setting this to null may result in NPE in code relying on this, so it may be better to return an empty map in the getter if it is null, which should still result in the field not added to the json.

column40: single keycloak server with local mysql and no further traffic
column373:
# Create 10.000 clients
# Login at Account Management Console
# Press Logout
column422:
12/Sep/18 12:07 PM;a.stanik;I made a performance hotspot analysis and identified the getClientScopes method as very slow.

 !Logout.png|thumbnail!
column423: 12/Sep/18 12:13 PM;a.stanik;I would suggest as a solution to retrieve in RedirectUtils.getValidRedirectUris() only the redirect URIs and not all the clients of a realm.
column424:
24/Sep/18 11:01 AM;a.stanik;Currently, all clients are retrieved from the database to validate the redirect URI. The reasons for this are
* each client can use all redirect uris of any client of that realm
* the root url have to be appended if a relative uri is specified
* the RealmModel does not have an appropriated method to retrieve redirect URIs in RealmAdapter (JPA module) efficiently

According to [OpenID Connect Session Management - 5.1. Redirection to RP After Logout|https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-session-1_0.html#RPLogout], _"In some cases, the RP will request that the End-User's User Agent to be redirected back to the RP after a logout has been performed."_. In my understanding that means clients can only direct to oneself and not to any other client. Furthermore, in section 8. Security Considerations, they explicitly write_ "The id_token_hint parameter to a logout request can be used to determine which RP initiated the logout request. Logout requests without a valid id_token_hint value are a potential means of denial of service; therefore, OPs may want to require explicit user confirmation before acting upon them." _

In my opinion only the redirect uris of that client that initialed the logout should be validated!? And if no post_logout_redirect_uri or valid ID token is passed the user should be redirected to a default client e.g. "account" or a logout page or the info page with an appropriated text?

column1: [RH-SSO for OpenShift images] Update templates for RH-SSO 7.2 and RH-SSO 7.3 TP CD images to start using Red Hat Terms Based registry
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
[RH-SSO for OpenShift images] Update templates for RH-SSO 7.2 and RH-SSO 7.3 TP CD images to start using Red Hat Terms Based registry

See [CLOUD-2751|https://issues.jboss.org/browse/CLOUD-2751] and the following [comment|https://github.com/openshift/library/pull/108#issuecomment-415036946] for explanation why this is necessary.
column422: 29/Aug/18 6:17 AM;iankko;Clicked the "Link Pull Request" button too early. I also need to test corresponding RH-SSO 7.2 image stream change yet.
column423: 29/Aug/18 8:59 AM;iankko;Confirmed the proposed change from Ben Parees works for RH-SSO 7.2 image streams too.
column424: 24/Sep/18 6:10 AM;iankko;Re-opening the PR to add necessary info how to configure secured Red Hat IO registry to the documentation too (no other change will be made to the templates).
column425: 27/Sep/18 3:32 AM;iankko;All of application templates changes for RH-SSO 7.2 and RH-SSO 7.3 TP CD images, and RH-SSO documentation update are done (see PR links for details). Closing.

column1: [Docs] [RH-SSO for OpenShift image] Drop unused *.adoc files from the documentation
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
{noformat}
$ tree | grep -B3 get
├── content
│   ├── advanced_concepts
│   │   └── advanced_concepts.adoc
│   └── getting_started
│       └── getting_started.adoc
--
├── pom.xml
├── topics
│   ├── before_you_begin.adoc
│   ├── get_started.adoc
{noformat}

The _content/getting_started/getting_started.adoc_ seems to be just outdated (and unused) version of _topics/get_started.adoc_.

Drop the former and / or synchronize with the latter, which is actually included in _master.adoc_.
column422: 11/Sep/18 9:54 AM;mhelmke;After some discussion, it was decided not to cherry-pick this back to CD02 or CD03, but the fix is merged and will be included in CD04.

kcreg create -s clientId=test15 -s protocol=openid-connect -s

column1: Deny authorization requests when upgrading RPT and permissions are not granted
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
Currently, when upgrading RPTs, a new token is issued even though the permissions being requested (in addition to those represented by the RPT sent along with an authorization request) are denied.

Behavior should change to deny the request in case additional permissions are denied by the server.

column1: Only upgrade RPT when new permissions are granted
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
Currently, RPTs are marked by {{upgraded}} by just considering whether or not a previous RPT is set in the authorization request.

This behavior is not compliant with UMA specs, which states that {{upgraded}} should be set to true only in cases when all permissions previously granted by a RPT are included in the new RPT.

column422:
26/Sep/18 6:48 AM;mposolda;I think this may be already fixed. Do you have a chance to try with latest Keycloak 4.4?

Answer to the question: Yes, from 4.4 there is support for the "prompt=consent" . In other words, if you try to authenticate with your application using "prompt=consent" attached to the login URL when opening Keycloak, it will always require to grant consent. See the documentation for the adapters how to "nicely" ensure that prompt=consent will be included in the login URL.

column1: UMA token introspection endpoint does not conform to specification
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
There are several issues:

* The UMA specification says that RPT token introspection requests are authorized by sending a PAT as a bearer token (cf. https://docs.kantarainitiative.org/uma/rec-uma-core.html#token-introspection and  https://docs.kantarainitiative.org/uma/wg/oauth-uma-federated-authz-2.0-08.html#token-introspection vs. https://www.keycloak.org/docs/latest/authorization_services/index.html#obtaining-information-about-an-rpt)
* The introspection response does not have to correct structure unless the "token_type_hint" = "requesting_party_token" is set. In particular, the "permissions" object is wrapped inside an "auhorization" object if the hint is missing.
* In the introspection response the attribute name of the attribute that is used to identify a protected resource is specified to be "resource_id" whereas KeyCloak uses "rsid".
column422: 20/Aug/18 10:43 AM;pcraveiro;[~stefan.wachter], we should be able to fix these issues in next releases. Just need to check the first one related with using PATs.
column423:
28/Aug/18 4:04 PM;pcraveiro;[~stefan.wachter], I will be able to deliver the fix #3. I think the issue with "resource_id" and "resource_scopes" claims are more critical as they are really a blocker if you are parsing the response based on UMA specs.

For the other two, I will think better how to fix them in the next sprint. 

The reason is that bearer authentication is not currently supported by our token introspection endpoint and RPT introspection is basically an implementation of our token introspection spi. It will require a bit more discussions with the team in order to enable bearer token.

Regarding token_type_hint, because we are relying on token introspection spi, that is the only way we can select the proper "introspection provider". Also need to discuss about this with the team.

What do you think ?
column424: 12/Sep/18 3:08 AM;stefan.wachter;That's fine for me. I can work around issues #1 and #2.

column1: CLIENT_INITIATED_ACCOUNT_LINKING_ERROR with invalid_token
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
When I try to call the Identity Broker with the following link:

https://{BASE_URL}/auth/realms/social/broker/twitter/link?client_id=frontend&redirect_uri=https://localhost:4200/&nonce=someString&hash=someHash

I'm getting the following error:
WARN  [org.keycloak.events] (default task-42) type=CLIENT_INITIATED_ACCOUNT_LINKING_ERROR, realmId=social, clientId=frontend, userId={properUserID}, ipAddress=x.x.x.x, error=invalid_token, redirect_uri=https://localhost:4200/, username={someEmailAddress}

This is related to https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51039986/keycloak-client-initiated-account-linking-error-with-invalid-token - all information has been set according to the guideline in the manual but it's simply not working like that. The server seems to parse the token correctly, since it can at least code my username. However if you read the Stackoverflow post, the problem with the realm was that it was broken, it's not working with a pristine realm too. 

I guess I'm missing anything to configure here, but there was nothing described in the manual for it, so I'm assuming it's a bug.
column40:
Docker-Image: 4.0.0 Final
Frontend: Angular 4 with keycloak-angular 2.0.2
column422:
22/Aug/18 9:20 AM;ssilvert;Are you still having trouble with this?

Have you tried this with a more recent version of Keycloak?  I've grepped the code and I don't see where CLIENT_INITIATED_ACCOUNT_LINKING_ERROR is ever produced in 4.3.

I am having success with this in Angular 2+, but I'm doing it in a much different way.  I'm creating a REST API that will generate the broker URI on the server instead of the client.  So you call the REST API on the Keycloak server, get the properly formatted URI, then do a window.location.replace(accountLinkUri).  This calls the Keycloak broker, which redirects you to the social provider.

The new API should be available as a tech preview in 4.3.

column1: Token endpoint doesn't add cors headers to successful request.
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
When trying to use an access_token in the header identifying my client and a user, send over cross-domains to the keycloak backend token endpoint, I get Cross-origin Read Blocked because there are no CORS headers on the response.

Prefligh request seems fine, but the actual request only reponds with a Content-Type header.

I would expect the response to have the following headers too:
* access-control-allow-credentials: true
* access-control-allow-origin: http://localhost:4200
* content-length: 123
column373:
1. Login with a client hosted on localhost to a cross-origin keycloak at tha uth endpoint.

2. Use the bearer access_token as Authorization header in the next request.

3. Do a Http POST request with Content-Type application/x-www-form-urlencoded and add the following parameters to the body: 
    * {{grant_type: urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:uma-ticket}}
    * {{audience: policy-enforcer}} (my resource-server)  

4. 200 OK, but no CORS headers present, hence response is cleared by browser and blocked.
column422: 20/Aug/18 3:31 AM;stianst;Did you add permitted web origins for the client you are using?
column423:
20/Aug/18 10:40 AM;pcraveiro;[~tdupont], I've tried to reproduce the problem with one of our quickstarts [1]. Here is the {{OPTIONS}} response I get from server prior to actually accessing the token endpoint:

{code}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Connection: keep-alive
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: http://test:8080
Access-Control-Allow-Headers: Origin, Accept, X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Request-Method, Access-Control-Request-Headers, Authorization
Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true
Content-Length: 0
Access-Control-Allow-Methods: POST, OPTIONS
Access-Control-Max-Age: 3600
Date: Mon, 20 Aug 2018 14:35:49 GMT
{code} 

[1] https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-quickstarts/tree/latest/app-authz-uma-photoz
column424:
20/Aug/18 10:49 AM;tdupont;[~stianst] Yes i added them, by means of a `+` after adding the origins to the Valid Redirect URls.

[~pcraveiro] Yes the preflight  (OPTIONS) is fine, it is the actual POST request following that that fails to respond with the correct CORS headers.

bq. Prefligh request seems fine, but the actual request only reponds with a Content-Type header.

We've patched it now, with some proxy magic (fancy word for ugly fix), but this should not be necessary I think.
column425:
20/Aug/18 11:07 AM;pcraveiro;I see now. Did you try to configure web origins to the client application {{policy-enforcer}} ? I got the correct CORS headers in the response when defining the web origin.

{code}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Cache-Control: no-store
Pragma: no-cache
Access-Control-Expose-Headers: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
Date: Mon, 20 Aug 2018 15:06:42 GMT
Connection: keep-alive
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: http://test:8080
Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: false
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 3213
{code}
column426:
20/Aug/18 11:14 AM;tdupont;In our case _policy-enforcer_ represents our APIs on our microservices-stack. So any client that authenticates/authorizes through keycloak, gets a token that they are meant to hand over to our server APIs (hence: audience:policy-enforcer). So the web-origins for each registered client will be set to the client's redirect url-origins themselves. This should not be related to which audience the RPT token is for, right?

Are you saying that I should add the public origin address of our webservice APIs to the web-origins of each client I register with our keycloak to solve this?
column427:
20/Aug/18 11:30 AM;pcraveiro;The way it is working, the resource server (in your case, the policy-enforcer client representing your APIs) has control over which origins are allowed to access the token endpoint. So, you would need to set the origin for each client to the web origins of policy-enforcer.

I can't remember now why we have it working this way and why just not set CORs based on the *client* making the request, and not the resource server / audience.

Don't think this makes sense, will change to configure CORS based on the actual client making the request,
column428: 20/Aug/18 11:35 AM;tdupont;Ok thanks, for the explanation. It seems more logical to me too, that it is based on the client request. But for now, I know what to do, thanks!

column1: Importing resources is failing if the resource owner is other than the resource server
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
With the introduction of user-managed resources, the import functionality is not working properly when there is a resource owned by a user. Policies using these resources are not failing to import because the resource can not be found.

We need to change both export and import functionalities. During export we need to also export the resource owner in case the owner is different than the resource server. In import we need to check if the resource defined in a policy is defined with an owner (e.g.: user-id:resource-id) and if so, search for the resource with a name and the owner.

Note, resources can have the same name if the owner is different. That is the cause of the error, so we can not just rely on the name all the time in order to import resources into Keycloak.
column373: Import the attachment configuration file.
column422: 29/Aug/18 6:22 PM;pcraveiro;Only resources owned by resource server are exported.

column1: [RH-SSO] Drop the definition of HTTP service and HTTP route from RH-SSO x509 application templates
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
The existing x509 RH-SSO application templates:

* [sso72-x509-https|https://github.com/jboss-openshift/application-templates/blob/master/sso/sso72-x509-https.json]
* [sso72-x509-mysql-persistent|https://github.com/jboss-openshift/application-templates/blob/master/sso/sso72-x509-mysql-persistent.json]
* [sso72-x509-postgresql-persistent|https://github.com/jboss-openshift/application-templates/blob/master/sso/sso72-x509-postgresql-persistent.json]

define both HTTP and HTTPS services / routes / endpoints. The HTTP route is [known to cause issues|https://issues.jboss.org/browse/CLOUD-2216] on OpenShift Online tiers. Although the workaround exists (is to configure the realm in question with *requireSSL* realm definition flag set to *false*, it is not applicable / usable by default on OpenShift Online environment. Since user credentials are in the case of the HTTP route sent via unencrypted channel, setting *requireSSL* set to *false* is not desired).

Therefore the proposal is to completely drop the HTTP service / route / endpoint definitions from RH-SSO x509 application templates (which are intended to be used on OpenShift Online environment), and keep just their HTTPS counterparts.
column373: See [CLOUD-2216|https://issues.jboss.org/browse/CLOUD-2216] for details.

column1: mvn-golang-wrapper depends on arbitrary internet access
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column422: 16/May/18 6:00 PM;aszczucz;If the plugin isn't nessessary for the product build, I'll disable it. Otherwise it may be possible to configure it so it doesn't try to access the internet.
column423:
16/May/18 6:20 PM;aszczucz;The URL the plugin tries to download from can be changed with the [sdkSite configuration parameter|https://github.com/raydac/mvn-golang/blob/960fb8e0172d92d5193a83d0dd2eb0911e62d78c/mvn-golang-wrapper/src/main/java/com/igormaznitsa/mvngolang/AbstractGolangMojo.java#L200-L205]. In theory I could set it to an internal URL, but it also seems that the two executions of the plugin will attempt to download go code from github repositories: github.com/inconshreveable/mousetrap and github.com/keycloak/kcinit.

It's looking like the proper way to structure this new go stuff is with a two new go builds, wrapped in maven, so the go stuff can be handled as maven artifacts, removing the need for arbitrary internet access.

That's quite complicated though. In the short-term I think changing the bound phase of the two plugin executions will allow skipTests to disable them. The default phase of the get goal is initialize.
column424: 16/May/18 6:53 PM;aszczucz;That approach didn't work, nor did adding the stronger mvn.test.skip property. I've added a product profile to the pom that sets skip=true for the mvn-golang-wrapper plugin, and that seems to prevent it from doing anything.

column1: PNC build fails to disable the community profile
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column422: 16/May/18 3:35 PM;aszczucz;The simplest solution is going to be adding -Dproduct=true to the properties list in prod-arguments.json, although I'm going to check if the community profile activation can be done in a different, backwards-compatible way.
column423: 16/May/18 3:47 PM;aszczucz;No. The only way I can see is something like -Dmode=community / -Dmode=product, so I'll have to add the property to the json.
column424:
16/May/18 3:52 PM;aszczucz;Turns out there is a way to directly disable a profile on the command-line with ! syntax:

{code:none}
$ mvn -q help:active-profiles -Ppnc -Pproduct '-P!community' -Pjboss-release -Doutput=/tmp/kc-profiles
$ grep 'community' /tmp/kc-profiles | wc -l
0
{code}

I'll use this solution instead of -Dproduct, as then it's much clearer what's trying to be done with the extra argument.
