column1: Unexpected Server Error when calling resource_set endpoint (ProtectionService.java)
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
When calling the "/auth/realms/$realmName/authz/protection/resource_set" endpoint Keycloak returns a HTTP 500 Server Error. After some debugging it showed, that the retrieval of the the corresponding ClientModel in ProtectionService.java returned null, because identity.getId() returns an User-ID and not the related Client-ID.

org.keycloak.authorization.protection.ProtectionService.resource() (line 60, master-branch)

This endpoint is requested by an users access-token. 

Current Code (master-branch), fails: 
ClientModel client = realm.getClientById(identity.getId()); 
--> client = null 
--> identity.getId() = user-ID of the user requesting the Endpoint 

Based on the Documentation, this endpoint should return an array of resources. Which it only does if the corresponding ClientModel object is not null. Since the resources are related to a certain client. 
https://www.keycloak.org/docs/latest/authorization_services/index.html#_service_protection_resources_api
column373:
* Start Keycloak on a local machine (debug-mode preferred) 
* Create some resources in a specfied realm and client 
* Call GET /auth/realms/$realmName/authz/protection/resource_set Endpoint
* Authorization Header including Bearer Token is required 
* HTTP 500 should be returned

column1: Group Claims should be optional
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
The "user-impersonated" permission doesn't appear to function correctly when a "Group" policy is used. Suspect the group list for the user isn't populated before the policy is evaluated.

It also doesn't appear the "Group" policy is designed to work with _Keycloak groups_ but rather a token claim or user attribute that is a list of group names.
column373:
In any realm, but maybe setup a fresh one:

# Create a group called "super".
# Create a user called "super-user" and add it to the "super" group.
# Go to Users -> Permissions and enable permissions.
# Edit the "user-impersonated" permission.
# Create a "Group" policy.
# Set "Groups Claim" to "groups" (I'm really not sure what to set this too..)
# Select the "super" group and add it.
# Set the "Logic" to "Negative".

Expected: Unable to impersonate "super-user" under any circumstance.
Actual: Can impersonate "super-user".

If you replace the negative group policy with a negative user policy with "super-user", the permission works. This is our current workaround.
column422:
28/May/18 11:19 AM;pcraveiro;[~shousper], you are on your assumptions. We need to fix that.

The fix should be quite trivial as we just need to change Group Policy provider to obtain user's groups in case none was provided in the token.

Next release we'll work on making "Groups Claim" optional and update docs.

column1: keycloak-authz.js and keycloak-authz.d.ts do not work with TypeScript
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column422:
06/Apr/18 5:12 AM;marceln;At the moment, there are multiple projects on github which try to bring advanced Keycloak functionality into angular 2+ projects.

There are projects which are based on the official keycloak javascript adapter (these projects copy files from or import the official javascript adapter) for example :
https://github.com/ssilvert/keycloak-schematic (works with angular 2+)
and
https://github.com/mauriciovigolo/keycloak-angular (works with angular 4.3+ and provides the implementation for HttpInterceptor which adds bearer tokens to http requests)

both of these projects are missing the implementation of Authorization flow, and it is not easy to implement this when one tries to use the official Keycloak javascript adapter with TypeScript. For example, KeycloakAuthorization returns undefined when constructed and does not return an observable after executing async HTTP request to /.well-known/uma-configuration .

There is another project:
https://github.com/ebondu/angular2-keycloak

which is not using the official keycloak javascript adapter. Instead, the authors have rewritten the code from official JS adapter into TypeScript. It seems to address issues which I was not able to solve with the official javascript adapter. For example, it notifies the initialization of Authorization object (see https://github.com/ebondu/angular2-keycloak/blob/b8dd423fefc98305ac2f2f9efd1178020a8a2966/src/services/keycloak.auth.service.ts#L154). 

But this project is not updated as often as the official javascript adapter. For example, it does not support uma2 which is coming with 4.0.0.

I believe it would be good to invest some effort into making the basic keycloak javascript adapter working well with angular/typescript. There is clearly interest in building good libraries, but these have to be based on working, official and updated basic adapter. One option would be to pull the code from https://github.com/ebondu/angular2-keycloak. Or endorse some working implementation for TypeScript.
column423: 06/Apr/18 5:31 AM;sebastienblanc;If you believe that the import is wrong, please propose a pull request with the fix. Thanks.
column424: 06/Apr/18 5:50 AM;stianst;The correct and official typescript definitions can be found in https://www.npmjs.com/package/keycloak-js
column425: 09/Apr/18 8:59 AM;marceln;Yes. I think they are wrong. Even more so now, since the keycloak-authz.js has been upgraded to support uma2 in 4.0.0.Beta1 now but the typescript definitions were not updated yet. The parameter of authorize() function is now an authorization request object where it was a string previously. I have made it work locally with few changes. I needed to also slightly change the keycloak-authz.js itself not only the typescript definitions. I will post another update here soon.
column426:
10/Apr/18 8:16 AM;pcraveiro;[~marceln], do you want me to wait for your update or may I start checking those issues you found ?

If you have something already, that would be great. Otherwise I can look what we need to change in order to make it usable with TypeScript.
column427:
16/Apr/18 5:53 AM;marceln;Hi [~pcraveiro],

this commit shows the changes that I needed to make to make keycloak-authz.js and keycloak-authz.d.ts work in the angular: https://github.com/marcelnem/keycloak-angular/commit/8f32b0f48d9b2121efee38b173f7f0cb64b4f698

If these changes can be propagated to official repo, it would be great. 

If you need me to make a PR, let me know, otherwise, I think it is faster if you can just edit the files directly. 

These are the minimal changes to make it work, but further improvements could be made:

1. Define the KeycloakAuthorizationRequest interface better than I did (I just put any type everywhere because I was not sure how stable the current interface in beta is). 
2. make the init() function and KeycloakAuthorization() constructor function asynchronous and return observable/promise.  Currently, they use synchronous(blocking) HTTP requests. I have only made one edit to keycloak-authz.js to at least return the reference to an instance when the KeycloakAuthorization is initialized. Before it returned nothing. https://github.com/marcelnem/keycloak-angular/commit/8f32b0f48d9b2121efee38b173f7f0cb64b4f698#diff-a62856ee89b916792852f70b019c6622R208
3. export the keycloak-authz.js properly. Currently, when I want to import authorization from the npm package I have to import it as 

{code:javascript}
import * as KeycloakAuthorization from 'keycloak-js/dist/keycloak-authz';
{code}
column428:
16/Apr/18 6:14 AM;marceln;Also the new authorize() function could be improved. For example when this "if" expression
https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-js-bower/blob/dda0f359daec6e0457bd050392def1da434b2973/dist/keycloak-authz.js#L52

evaluates to false, then the promise does not return anything. There should probably be an "else" statement which calls onError or onDeny when no ticket is provided.

I suggest adopting the minimal changes as linked in https://github.com/marcelnem/keycloak-angular/commit/8f32b0f48d9b2121efee38b173f7f0cb64b4f698. And optionally you could include other improvements if there is time to develop them now. Otherwise, the additional improvements can be copied to a new Jira issue.
column429: 16/Apr/18 8:33 AM;pcraveiro;For now, I'm going to cherry pick those "minimal" changes you did. Created https://issues.jboss.org/browse/KEYCLOAK-7180 to track improvements.
column430:
20/Apr/18 4:14 PM;pcraveiro;I did the initial round of changes but I still need to see them in action with a fresh angular app based on https://github.com/mauriciovigolo/keycloak-angular.

Is https://github.com/mauriciovigolo/keycloak-angular what you are using ?
column431:
20/Apr/18 7:11 PM;pcraveiro;I think is worth mention that next versions of Keycloak will not require clients to obtain RPTs in order to access protected resources on a resource server. They will be able to just send the access token and if PEP (resource server side) is properly configured properly it will manage the communication with the server in order to check for permissions.

You can still have clients managing RPTs though and use JS adapter. But not forced too ...
column432:
23/Apr/18 3:30 AM;marceln;Yes, I did a fork of  https://github.com/mauriciovigolo/keycloak-angular  added the RPT interceptor (which - as you claim - will be unnecessary in the future) and submitted PR to  https://github.com/mauriciovigolo/keycloak-angular. It was merged to 2.0.0 branch there.

The keycloak-angular wraps the keycloak js adapter and after my PR it also wraps keycloak-authz.js. To use the keycloak-angular library you have to build it with a build script (npm run-script build) and use it inside an angular application (add a dependency in packajge. json with a path pointing to a build of keycloak-angular), the config is described in the readme (in my forked repo or in the 2.0.0 branch of the keycloak-angular: https://github.com/mauriciovigolo/keycloak-angular/tree/feat/release-2.0.0#httpclient-rpt-interceptor ). 

To test it you need a policy enforcer and some resource server and a realm configured. I guess you could use the rest api and backend configuration from the keycloak-photoz app to test it. 

Let me know if you need assistance.

column1: Authorization evaluation requests performance (4500 resources)
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
Hi Pedro,

We have multiple resource servers, where one of them currently has +-4500 resources registered.  We have picked up that evaluations for both single and multiple resources take a large amount of time, irrespective of the complexity of the polcies+permissions linked.  A single resource id+scope based entitlement check can take up to 5 to 10 seconds.  I am aware of the rewrite for UMA 2.0, just wondering if our case is extreme or are you aware of the performance?

We are using the MySQL backend.

Thank You,
Marco Muller
column422: 09/Apr/18 6:54 AM;mmuller99;We are currently using the 4.0.0 beta in dev, and with about 3700 resources, evaluating a single scope for a resource type, the requests are timing out.
column423: 10/Apr/18 2:57 AM;mmuller99;After the 4.0.0 update, the evaluation request to a single resource are fine.
column424:
10/Apr/18 8:13 AM;pcraveiro;[~mmuller99], I'll check both scenarios: single and multiple resources.

Can you describe in more details how your resources are defined ? You mentioned "evaluating a single scope for a resource type". Are you setting a type for each resources then ?

Recently, we have some discussions about how to properly use resource type attribute on resources. Can you check this JIRA https://issues.jboss.org/browse/KEYCLOAK-6621 ? There are comments about resource type usage and performance improvements we did.
column425:
10/Apr/18 10:55 AM;mmuller99;Hi Pedro,

We have multiple resource servers, each housing a specific resourse type, ex. "urn:accounts-rs:resources:accounts".

Each resource is assigned the same type, with 3 scopes currently (View, Update, Remove).

Each specific resource also has a group policy tailored to it's specific parent entities, that gives you access to the resource.  Then there is the permissions foreach of the resources, which includes a role based policy for the scope and the group based policy for access.

Since everyone of our resources have a different group-based policy, there is no sharing of resource-based permissions applied to resource type.

So since 4.0.0 the auth request for a single resource for any number of scopes are fine, but doing a "give me all my permissions for this resource server" request is extremely slow, both through the Admin UI and using the new UMA 2.0 token endpoint auth request.

Please let me know if you need more info.

Thanks
column426:
10/Apr/18 1:39 PM;pcraveiro;Much more clear now, thanks. I'm just surprised because before v4 we also did not perform well when requesting all permissions for a resource server. My suggestion for users was to initially ask for a group of resources and pass the RPT on further invocations to enable incremental authorization.

But it seems that the "all permissions" approach was working fine for you until now and I need to figure out what we may have changed that make it worst.
column427:
10/Apr/18 1:56 PM;mmuller99;Thanks for the speedy reply. Maybe I should try the incremental authorizations, so I should be able to page through all the resources by using the previous calls RPT with the "response_permissions_limit" query parameter? Can this be done without having all the resource ids beforehand?

Sorry, the "all permissions" check definitely did not get worse for us with the v4 build.  When I initially opened up the issue, it was mainly due to the single resource authorization request that took a long time, which did not make sense to me as to why it could take a long time.  For the "all permissions" check, I'm guessing that paging could be an option, because we foresee some RS servers going to over 10k resources. (We had one in dev. recently with 56k resources, but for that one, we don't ever need to do a "all permission" check)
column428:
10/Apr/18 6:27 PM;pcraveiro;[~mmuller99], incremental authorization is all about keeping previous permissions in the token by passing a previously issued RPT when asking for a new one. In this case, the server is going to keep both "old" and "new" permissions in the new token. The {{response_permission_limit}} is just a parameter that you can use to limit the number of resources in the token. Useful to avoid huge permission lists when only a sub set of the permissions are going to be used.

But .. now I'm a little confused :) So, are you saying that the performance issue you are facing is happening when asking for a single resource authz request ?
column429:
11/Apr/18 3:32 AM;mmuller99;[~pcraveiro], the single resource requests are fast and working 100% (y)(y)(y) the 4.0.0 upgrades fixed it.

Our problem is that we have frontend pages where users query a list of resources(ex. Buildings, where thousands can exist) and the list of which building you can see is governed by the aforementioned group policies. The data spreads across various clients, so only seeing your buildings is of the upmost importance security wise. 

Without the ability to page through a "all permissions" request, we would have to fetch the resource ID's beforehand and then do the incremental authorization requests, am I understanding this correctly?

Thanks for all your help.
column430: 23/Apr/18 8:19 AM;pcraveiro;Yes. You should be able to map your resources to their representations in Keycloak (protected resources) by name or id.
column431: 30/Apr/18 11:26 AM;pcraveiro;[~mmuller99], any other consideration to this issue ? Is there something else we should consider before closing it ?
column432: 02/May/18 3:11 AM;mmuller99;[~pcraveiro] Thanks for the assistance.  There is nothing else at this stage.

column426:
23/Feb/18 11:13 AM;pcraveiro;I need more input in order to be able to give you any feedback about your usage.

Why you are using resource type ?

Resource type is related with a feature where a resource can be used to correlate different resources sharing the same access constraints. The typed resource is always a resource with the client itself as the resource owner where resource instances (the other resources sharing the same permissions and scopes) have an user (some entity other than the client) as the resource owner. Think about an use case where you have a {{Bank Account Resource}} and {{Teddy Bank Account Resource}}. In {{Bank Account Resource}} you define scopes and permissions that will be also evaluated when checking permissions for {{Teddy Bank Account}} or any other resource with the same type that the owner is not the client, but some user (resource instances).

So, without entirely understanding your use case, I would say that have so many "typed resources" is not correct. And they can indicate a wrong usage or a different use case that was not considered during the design.

I think answering the question above will help to clarify your use case and see how we can help you.
column427:
23/Feb/18 11:40 AM;t.chambard;Thanks again for your answer Pedro.

Indeed it clarifies the resource type concept.
And in fact the type we need to identify (through the URI now) is only used for our application logic.

Anyway, we did our own keycloak build removing the code blocks that are critical for us (mentionned above and in the pull request).

Hopefully it will be removed also in 4.X
column428: 23/Feb/18 12:04 PM;pcraveiro;I see. But are you still facing performance issues without using the resource type field ?
column430:
23/Feb/18 1:25 PM;pcraveiro;Yeah, that last block should not be a problem anymore. In fact, you are contributing a lot and anticipating some work we are about to start around performance tests. Will spend the rest of the day looking at this.

I'm really interested in your user story and how you are using our solution. If you are able to, feel free to contact me on {{psilva@redhat.com}} and provide more details about what you are doing.

column432:
17/Jan/18 10:27 AM;jh409;We're seeing this error again in our application now, but this time we're only seeing it when using Firefox 57 and refreshing a page for the second time - it is consistent in that the first refresh will work as expected and the second will fail. 

The flow to break it appears to be:

* Browser URL of http://localhost:9098/#/mailbox
* Refresh page
* keycloak.js initialises and calls parseCallback() with an href of: http://localhost:9098/#/mailbox
* Browser is redirected to the Keycloak server at: http://localhost:8080/auth/realms/test-realm/protocol/openid-connect/auth?client_id=test-client-id&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A9098%2F%3Fredirect_fragment%3D%252Fmailbox&state=931c1d55-cdb7-4ed2-8f22-e330283b3f52&nonce=5790e2ff-502a-40bd-8b6b-fa63bcd52843&response_mode=fragment&response_type=code&scope=openid&prompt=none
* keycloak.js initialises again and calls parseCallback() with an href of: http://localhost:9098/?redirect_fragment=%2Fmailbox#state=931c1d55-cdb7-4ed2-8f22-e330283b3f52&code=DdTUwl3T9RNaF5rsdbJMOej4oERFKspLRnPxy2En7ZY.84c3be0f-3c69-4ac7-9b0a-2e605a94d741
* Browser URL is once again http://localhost:9098/#/mailbox
* Refresh page
* keycloak.js initialises and calls parseCallback() with an href of: http://localhost:9098/?redirect_fragment=%2Fmailbox#state=931c1d55-cdb7-4ed2-8f22-e330283b3f52&code=DdTUwl3T9RNaF5rsdbJMOej4oERFKspLRnPxy2En7ZY.84c3be0f-3c69-4ac7-9b0a-2e605a94d741
* Browser is redirected to the Keycloak server at: http://localhost:8080/auth/realms/test-realm/protocol/openid-connect/auth?client_id=test-client-id&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A9098%2F%3Fredirect_fragment%3D%252Fmailbox%26redirect_fragment%3Dstate%253D931c1d55-cdb7-4ed2-8f22-e330283b3f52%2526code%253DDdTUwl3T9RNaF5rsdbJMOej4oERFKspLRnPxy2En7ZY.84c3be0f-3c69-4ac7-9b0a-2e605a94d741&state=bd2c2e49-60ea-432d-ae21-e835de966df9&nonce=bdb4c598-5ed9-4944-89a0-75784b4e3e8d&response_mode=fragment&response_type=code&scope=openid&prompt=none
* keycloak.js initialises again and calls parseCallback() with an href of: http://localhost:9098/?redirect_fragment=%2Fmailbox&redirect_fragment=state%3D931c1d55-cdb7-4ed2-8f22-e330283b3f52%26code%3DDdTUwl3T9RNaF5rsdbJMOej4oERFKspLRnPxy2En7ZY.84c3be0f-3c69-4ac7-9b0a-2e605a94d741#state=bd2c2e49-60ea-432d-ae21-e835de966df9&code=73TQjPbd20tA2vr10ptlu9hm58ZASlKtCAA2buGwSMM.2bab4184-d648-406c-af41-b41590217efb
* Error occurs as the Angular router can't find the /#/state route
 
I can see why it's going wrong - the second redirect_fragment being added due to the second hash in the href on the second refresh. However, I haven't got any idea why the second refresh first calls parseCallback() with what seems to be a previous window.location.href, i.e. one containing /#/state. Nothing else in the application is manipulating the window.location.href. Also I have no idea why Chrome and IE work completely as expected.

[~ssilvert], apologies for the longwinded comment but is there any chance you could push me in the right direction to investigate from here?

Changing the source code of an imported module like keycloak is the last thing we want to do to solve our problem, especially if we don't know the ramifications of pushState over replaceState at that location.

column1: LDAP group names containing "/" in the name violates SIBILING_NAME constraint in db
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
If a LDAP/AD group name contains a "/" in the name, using RHSSO 7.0 (Kecloak 1.9.x)  it will create a new group entry in the database each time a user with this group is loaded; using RHSSO 7.1 (Keycloak 2.5.x) it logs an exception due to constraint SIBLING_NAMES on group table.

After some investigation seems it is related to method KeycloakModelUtils.findGroupByPath as it splits the group hierarchy path by "/" . If the group has a "/" in the name it treats it as a top level + group name, and not as a single group name.
column40: Tested in RHSSO 7.0 and 7.1 with Oracle.
column373:
- Create a LDAP group name containing a "/" , like "Team of 2016/2017"
- Associate 2 users ('a' and 'b') to this group
- Search for user 'a' at Keycloak admin screen: the user loads correctly and the group is created on DB
- Search for user 'b' at Keycloak  admin screen: the user loads but clicking at "Groups" tabs yields exceptions at the server log.

column423: 13/Dec/16 3:16 AM;sebastienblanc;But this happen when the JS do the "local" ajax request to retrieve the keycloak.json and it seems that with iOS/cordova  when a local file is requested 0 will always be returned.

column425: 13/Dec/16 3:46 AM;sebastienblanc;It was [~corinnekrych] that discovered this bug and her fix was to check both on 200 and 0 but as you said how can we then detect timeouts ... Currently I haven not mac available to test that, probably later this week or make Corinne can do the PR ;)
column426: 13/Dec/16 7:59 AM;stianst;Seems rather stupid for iOS to return 0, but then again it's Apple and they pretty much do whatever they feel like ;)
column427: 12/Jan/17 8:50 AM;stianst;Postponing to 3.x as we don't have anyone that has access to a iOS that can work on it.

column429:
07/Apr/17 5:00 AM;mstruk;I can look.

So, keycloak.js should be modified to take zero as success in addition to 200? Or only when it's running in cordova? Is there a way to know?
column430: 07/Apr/17 5:11 AM;stianst;I don't know. zero status code makes no sense to me, so please look into that. Also, not sure if 0 can be a failure as well and that it would need to be handled somehow. column1: Validation of "aud" in adapters
column10: Used for Keycloak as well as Red Hat Single Sign-On
column39:
The OIDC specification mentions in 3.1.3.7 (see http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#IDTokenValidation for details):

{code}
The Client MUST validate that the aud (audience) Claim contains its client_id value registered at 
the Issuer identified by the iss (issuer) Claim as an audience. The aud (audience) Claim MAY 
contain an array with more than one element. The ID Token MUST be rejected if the ID Token does 
not list the Client as a valid audience, or if it contains additional audiences not trusted by the Client. 
{code}

It seems that our server-side adapters ( OAuthRequestAuthenticator ) currently doesn't verify the audiences of IDToken or AccessToken after code-to-token or refresh token response is received.
column422: 07/Nov/16 2:36 AM;stianst;[~mposolda] not sure we should implement this for 2.4. Would it not require the ability to specify the audience for a token (KEYCLOAK-1201)?
column423: 15/Nov/17 7:31 PM;maksym.gendin;And shouldn't the audience from access token be checked against "resource" in adapter configuration also if the client is in bearer-only mode? This would prevent substitution attacks. Currently I am able to use the same access token for successfully requesting resources in different clients...
column424: 16/Nov/17 12:56 AM;stianst;[~maksym.gendin] Yes, that's correct, see KEYCLOAK-3058. You can use roles/scope to achieve the same thing in Keycloak though. With mapping roles to users and controlling the scope of the client you can control what services an application/JWT is allowed to invoke.
column426: 23/Nov/17 3:25 AM;stianst;Checking the audience isn't really the problematic part. Getting the right list into the audience in the first place is the tricky part.
column427: 24/Nov/17 3:53 AM;sebastian_schuster;What about putting all client identifiers of granted client roles in the access token and some realm identifier if realm roles are included? ID Token stays as it is.
column428: 24/Nov/17 4:05 AM;stianst;[~sebastian_schuster] we had a lengthy discussion about this at some point, think it was on the mailing list. That was one of the ideas, but I don't think it covers all use-cases as not everyone uses client roles. If you rely on client roles in the first place then the aud checks are less important anyways as you are already checking if the token is intended for the specific resource server (client), just in a non-standard way.
column429: 24/Nov/17 6:58 AM;sebastian_schuster;My point is that aud checks are not less important as they are mandatory according to the JWT spec. Even Keycloak itself should reject the access token provided by the security-admin-console to be JWT spec compliant. Adding resource servers as aud claim would fix this and it would mostly be compatible as only additional values are added. You can still add other types of audiences for people that don't use client roles. Adding them if client roles are used is definitely a step into the right direction.
column430: 16/Apr/18 3:45 AM;gaetan.bogaert;I check in Spring Boot Adapter (2.4.3), there is no control of audience.
column431:
04/Sep/18 12:25 PM;jenserik;The comments above discusses validation of aud in the access token. This is not what this issue is about. The description is about the id token. Audience for the id token is the client requesting it through the scope openid.
Validation is the client's responsibility.

Having introspection to check the caller's clientId against aud(ience) in access token is a *requirement* which KC is missing. There should be an issue about this, but I can't find any - is it KEYCLOAK-5445?
column432:
12/Sep/18 4:16 AM;jenserik;Validation of an id_token is the responsibility of the client requesting it. There is no service in OAuth2/OpenID Connect for this (as I am aware of), There is one exception: If an id_token is used in the "id_token_hint" request parameter (authorization request). The validation could be done by the id_token_hint identity provider (requesting client matches the aud list)

Validation of an access_token is either done by the resource server itself or by passing it to the introspection service. Checking that the caller's clientid/clientUrl is in aud should be done by the token validation logic in introspection. Introspection should not return any access_token contents in its response unless the caller is in the aud list.

Being backward compatible letting the token requesting client use introspection shouldn't be a concern as it is illegal according to spec.
[OAuth 2.0 Token Introspection|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7662]

column1: Stunner - Escalation Catch Event always fail validation
column10: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.  (Please note that you might have to be logged in take advantage of all the JIRA features / widgets)
column373:
# Model Start Event-> Escalation Catch Event -> End Event
# validate process

Actual Result:
Process validation fails with error. If you try to set Escalation Type property it won't help.

Expected Result:
Process should be validated and builds successfully.
column422:
06/Sep/18 7:08 AM;wmedvede;[~roger600]  [~tdolphine] [~KrisVerlaenen]

I've spent some time on this and even when it seems like a silly issue there are some more "complex" things to solve to have this 100% good.

Considerations:

Consideration 1)
According to the BPMN2 standard the intermediate "EscalationCatchEvent" can only be applied as a Boundary event and not in the normal flow of the process.
So first solution is to try to configure the main process rules in order to not accept the "EscalationCatchEvent". Re-configuring the rules the following results were found:

Scenario 1.1) 
    When the user drags the "EscalationCatchEvent" from the palette into the main process, the main process rules are evaluated, and the action is refused. Good, this is the expected behavior. 

Scenario 1.2)
   When the user drags the "EscalationCatchEvent" form the palette into e.g. a "UserTask" with the aim of docking the event into the task, the main process rules are also evaluated and the action is refused. In this way it's not possible to create the boundary event, so we have a problem here.
Initial question is: why are the "main process" rules being evaluated when I'm adding a boundary event to a "User Task"?
By construction the docked elements are implemented in this way. (following the scenario above)
1) the EscalationCatchEvent is added to the parent process
2) an "Edge" is added from the "EscalationCatchEvent" to the "User Task"

So with this way of modelling the boundary events and the rules we have right now, it's not possible to model the restrictions we want.

Possible solutions might be:
       	1) change the current way of modelling the boundary events in the graph. i.e. "when a boundary event is created, don't add it as a child of the main process". This change must be evaluated and might be important since everything is modeled with this definition.
	2) change the rules evaluation mechanism somehow in order to detect at rules evaluation time if a node is "Boundary" or a "Standard Node". If the node is a "Boundary" node, then skip the containment checks on the node parent.
	3) whatever any other solution.

(see that it's not enough to just avoid the "containment rule" verification at the moment we are adding a node that will be a docked node. Because, even if we don't evaluate the "containment rule" at this time, and we still add the node to the graph for this particular use case, as soon the user validates the process, we'll get a validation error since the complete graph will be evaluated will all the containment rules.)

Consideration 2)
by adding e.g. a StartNoneEvent to the top-level process, we can still morph it into a StartEscalationEvent and run into the issue again.
A special task was added for considering "smart morphing options calculations:  https://issues.jboss.org/browse/JBPM-7725

Given that the original reported issue have low probability of occurrence since EscalationEvents are not the most used ones, but also because Consideration1 and Consideartion2 "problems"  have AFAIK not easy solution, I believe this JIRA must be shifted for 7.2

Let's talk in next Stunner meeting, but feel free to add you thoughts in mean time.
column424: 06/Sep/18 8:20 AM;wmedvede;Hi [~kgaevski] I don't think so. The message "Node 'null' Event should specify an event type" is produced at a very low level place in the bpmn2 parser in jbpm. And at this point the parser only knows that the "event type" is missing, but not that "the event type is missing because of that the event is placed in a wrong place in the diagram".
column425:
19/Sep/18 8:36 AM;kgaevski;Hi [~wmedvede],

as small improvements we can forbid incoming sequence flow to Escalation Catch Event as it is done for old Designer if it is easy to do. It make sense since there are no income sequence flow connection allowed for Boundary events in general and it is not possible to use Escalation Event as non Boundary.

column422:
17/May/19 7:50 PM;roger600;Hey |[~kgaevski] [~tdolphine]

I'd been doing some analysis on this issue and found the root problem/s.

The main issue is on the [copy|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/blob/master/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-core/kie-wb-common-stunner-commons/kie-wb-common-stunner-client-common/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/core/client/session/command/impl/CopySelectionSessionCommand.java] / [cut|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/blob/master/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-core/kie-wb-common-stunner-commons/kie-wb-common-stunner-client-common/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/core/client/session/command/impl/CutSelectionSessionCommand.java] / [paste|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/blob/master/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-core/kie-wb-common-stunner-commons/kie-wb-common-stunner-client-common/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/core/client/session/command/impl/PasteSelectionSessionCommand.java] implementations.

*Acutally* it works as:
* Copy selection just keeps a reference to the objects copied (nodes,edges, etc) into a collection in memory
* Cut selection also keeps the references into a collection, as copy does, but it also fires the execution of "delete" commands for all selected item
* Paste - it just obtains the elements copied/cutted, from the collection in memory, and fires a clone command for each one

But this approach implies some downsides (*issues*):
* If  cutting an edge, for example, as it's really being "deleted" from the process, the edge is loosing its references to source/target nodes. So once trying to paste it, as the reference to the edge object has no source/target nodes attached, it's not even being cloned and so does not appears on the canvas - that's the bug that [~kgaevski] is reporting here
* Stunner is keeping a reference to a deleted object, as it's referenced from the copy/cut/paste shared collection in memory. So thi s can lead to memory leaks easily... If the collection is not properly cleared, for whatever reason, the instance will be not eligible in the GC tree, and so the instance itself and all references will be not able to be de-allocated from memory
* It also implies this strange behavior -  doing copy/paste, with connectors, is working fine, as the underlying edge model instances are not being "deleted" from the process, rather than doing cut/paste, in which situation the connectors are not "pasted" anymore.

So my proposed *fix* is about:
* Instead of keeping the reference, once copying or cutting an element, to the "real" instance in the graph, and then cloning the intance when pasting, I would revert it - So once copying/cutting an element (or multiple), let's clone the instances at that point, and then just keep the reference in memory to the "cloned" instances
* By cloning at copy/cut time
** It ensures that all references, such as source/target nodes for a connector, are the ones that exist actually on the process
** It also avoid keeping reference to elements which can potentially be removed from the process (when cuting them)
* Finally when pasting the elements, instead of cloning all selection as it's doing now, the elements in the selection will be already "cloned", so it's only necessary to attach the elements into the process, so they'll finally appear on the canvas

Sooo what do you think about the proposed fix?? It's a bit hard to do now because it implies changing all 3 classes and tests, but anyway I think it's the right way to go to avoid further issues....

Thanks!
column423:
17/May/19 7:59 PM;roger600;Hey [~kgaevski] [~tdolphine]

Also adding some *improvements* that could be done as well:
* Moving the copy/cut/paste logic, acutally only present on client side, to some core (shared) command/s, like some new CloneElementsCommand class, which will also contains a collection of elements (selected from the UI). This way we can reuse this logic across server and client and easily make it compatible with other commands (eg: can be composited)

* In the [CloneCanvasNodeCommand|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/blob/master/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-core/kie-wb-common-stunner-commons/kie-wb-common-stunner-client-common/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/core/client/canvas/command/CloneCanvasNodeCommand.java] - The [execute|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/blob/master/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-core/kie-wb-common-stunner-commons/kie-wb-common-stunner-client-common/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/core/client/canvas/command/CloneCanvasNodeCommand.java#L77] method is doing same logic as the [CloneNodeCommand|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/blob/master/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-core/kie-wb-common-stunner-commons/kie-wb-common-stunner-core-common/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/core/graph/command/impl/CloneNodeCommand.java] is doing ,but just firing "canvas" commands, instead of "graph" commands, as CloneNodeCommand does. This can be improved by providing some callbacks in the CloneNodeCommand, which are implemented by CloneCanvasNodeCommand, and it just creates "canvas" commands instead of "graph" ones. This way same logic in the CloneNodeCommand is reused across both CloneNodeCommand and CloneCanvasNodeCommand

column1: Stunner - Bendpoints on SequenceFlows does not move when user moves entire diagram
column10: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.  (Please note that you might have to be logged in take advantage of all the JIRA features / widgets)
column39:
When a selection is made surrounding an entire diagram and user move it, the bends from sequence flow seems stuck in main canvas and does not move.

There are two behaviors observed:
1) After moving the selection, user see directly that bends didn't move
2) Sometimes it is re-rendered correctly in canvas and the flow bends seem in correct position, but after saving the diagram and reopening it is a completely mess and the bends are not in the correct position

It seems related to RHPAM-1106, however the main canvas is the container and it is not needed subprocess or swilnes to reproduce the problem. 

It is a critical issue as it may mess up complex diagrams and users will only notice it after reopening.

*Update*
After some analysis here are the root causes:
*  On multiple selection, the bendpoints for selected connectors were not updated on the runtime model, only were upadted on the view (canvas) side. This causes that bendpoints are not on the right place on the Preview screen neither when saving/re-opening the diagram.
* If any operation was failing, for example adding a task into some invalid parent, everything is rollback to initial state but the connectors' bendpoints were not
* Was not possible to move the bendpoints for a given connector when grouping all them using the multiple selection area
column373:
1) create a process or import the evaluation here attached
2) select the entire diagram and try to move
3) save the digram and reopen it

See the attachments.

column1: Stunner - Start and intermediate caching event shapes are not following the spec (dashed lines)
column10: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.  (Please note that you might have to be logged in take advantage of all the JIRA features / widgets)
column39:
Due to some performance reasons, the _path_ "intermediate-noninterrupting" and "start-noninterrupting" have been removed from the actual SVG shape declaration for events (see [event-all.svg|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/blob/master/kie-wb-common-stunner/kie-wb-common-stunner-sets/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn/kie-wb-common-stunner-bpmn-client/src/main/resources/org/kie/workbench/common/stunner/bpmn/client/resources/images/shapes/event-all.svg]). This way, instead of adding these expensive paths, Stunner actually just uses the attribute _dashArray_, which results in a faster computation.

On the other hand, the goals are:
* Being able to re-enable the paths from the SVG view once Lienzo computations have been improved
* Fix start events (not interrupting) shape, it's not following the spec, as it contains double line dashed borders, but it must be just a single line dashed one.
column422: 02/Apr/19 7:32 AM;kgaevski;Hi [~roger600], is it already the time to fix this issue?
column423:
02/Apr/19 8:52 PM;roger600;Hey [~kgaevski]

Well IMO not yet - there is a bug behind this but actually the workaround works good and results on the same results, so this bug is not really affecting the user. Also the fix for this is not just re-enabling some paths, etc, the thing is once doing that, do the right performance improvements to make it work properly. So due to these reasons, I would postpone this bug, at least until the future bug fixing phase for 7.4.
column424: 05/Apr/19 8:49 AM;kgaevski;ok [~roger600], will add it to the next bugfixing sprint, let's decide it on the planning meeting. Thank you!

column422:
08/Jun/18 11:16 AM;wmedvede;I've been debugging this a bit and yes, the mortgages project contains a "<bpmn2:serviceTask" node currently not supported by Stunner. However, with current sources in 7.7.x an unexpected popup error is not shown any more, instead when the process cannot be parsed/processed the xml editor is opened instead. This last is something that was requested don't know exactly in which jira right now.

Since it's not direct/easy to know exactly the cause why the parsing failed with the marshallers we have right now, I believe that what can be done by now is:

If the parsing fails:
1) open the xml editor as it's being done right now. (see that the xml editor is opened inside the stunner editor, i.e., instead of the "Canvas" we show the xml editor")

2) Additionally raise a flying error message with a message like:
"It was not possible to open current process. The file might be wrong or might contain unsupported nodes in current version. Try to open it with the Legacy Process designer"

[~roger600] [~KrisVerlaenen] WDYT?

p.s. message can be changed/removed when we remove the legacy process designer.

column424:
18/Aug/18 5:44 AM;josephblt;Hi [~kgaevski].
Tested it again and the error does not happen anymore. 
Just as you mentioned to the description this error was introduced by this change:

column1: Stunner - arrows keyboard buttons move entire canvas
column10: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.  (Please note that you might have to be logged in take advantage of all the JIRA features / widgets)
column39: When I am trying to move selected nodes using Arrows Up/Down/Right/Left not only selected node is moving but also scrolling entire canvas.

3. Try to move it using arrows on Keyboard

Entire canvas will be scrolled

Expected Result:
Only selected nodes will be moved.
column422:
25/Jun/18 9:36 PM;danieljs;[~roger600] [~pere.fernandez]
* * The GWT KeyDownEvent is captured at _LienzoPanelView_ and a CDI event is fired passing only the pressed keys;
*  _LocationControlImpl_ handles the pressed key(s) as parameter, so we don't have access to the GWT keyboard event to call _preventDefault()_ when some object are moved by arrows and we don't want the browser to scroll;
* We don't want to call _preventDefault()_ always, because if there's nothing selected the default browser behavior should happen.
* A possibility to fix is to pass the GWT KeyDownEvent encapsulated with keys pressed as parameter, using CDI event (so _LocationControlImpl _can call _preventDefault()_ if it is the case). Not sure if it works.
* Maybe have to call _stopPropagation()_ too to stop event bubbling
* Another thing that may work is to change _LienzoPanel_ to ignore scroll or something like that.

Calling _preventDefault()_ always at _LienzoPanelView_ (*for test purposes*) after keydown worked in my tests (but it never scrolls). Didn't find any other obvious issue.

column1: Stunner - Align and distribute gets broken after an exception
column10: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.  (Please note that you might have to be logged in take advantage of all the JIRA features / widgets)
column39:
The goals for this task are:
# If any exception occurs during A&D computation, although the distribution lines may not be rendered, ensure that the shape operations are still working - it can be moved, added into parent, docked, etc
# If any exception occurs during A&D computation, ensure that the state for it doesn't get corrupted, so ensure that next time some drag event will start again for the shape, the A&D is in the right state again and ready to perform the computations

About [2] -> Bug reported by [~mark.proctor] - The align and distribute control is actually caching into memory its state, the result for this is after an exception happens, it gets broken and the information remains there, it's still eligible from the GC root, so it's not being GC as it should.
column422:
02/Mar/18 7:02 PM;roger600;Adding discussion with [~mark.proctor] here:
************************************************************
if an exception happesn
it screws up the alignment indexing
not sure if you've noticed that
so distribute/alignment break

I'm wondering ifw e need ot keep that information cached
and instead re-index on mousedown
right now I believe it caches all the index information
but I'm not sure if tha'ts necessary
it would be trivial to fix that
so you have two choices
cache or re-calcuate on mousedown (clear on mouse up).
 believe right now it caches
even after the mouseup
it keeps it
n next mousedown it only removes the current selection from index
it's efficient
but if there is a bug
it'll be there until they refresh
if we recalculate every time on mouse down (or drag start), it'll always work.
dragstart would be better
just have to hope performance isn't an issue
but it would have to be a truly huge diagram, imho, to not be able to index on the fly.
that way if there is an exception when dragging something around.
the bug will not persist beyond that drag event

I would make a switch
sset it as a boolean
so you can toggle between the two modes
************************************************************
column423: 06/Mar/18 2:11 PM;roger600;[~kgaevski] - not really a performance issue, it's more important the bug itself, as it stops working.
column424: 17/Oct/18 4:36 PM;josephblt;We are going to wait a little before we consider this fix.

column1: Stunner - Child elements should not be larger than their parent container
column10: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.  (Please note that you might have to be logged in take advantage of all the JIRA features / widgets)
column39:
Child elements should not be larger than their parent container. If we allow this it won't be possible to move elements unless they are constrained within their parent's boundaries. This behaviour might be perceived as strange by the user.

Video demonstrating the problem:

3) Text should NOT be presented over event (or any node icon). It should wrap, then truncate. Set a char limit 25~ chars to wrap to a second line. Ideally truncate after 50~. Should hover/tooltip for full label.

* For longer names - to fit in the node, change (scale) the font size automatically, and then truncate the name (nodeName...) if it doesn’t fit.

column425: 29/Jun/18 7:28 AM;ibek;[~roger600] recheck it
column426:
05/Jul/18 10:39 AM;wmedvede;For next Stunner meeting discussion.

Assuming the browser has e.g. only one open "tab" (the one wih the WB) we can reduce this problem to the "problem of preventing the browser closing".

This are my thoughts after some quick investigation:

1) This is a semantic that we don't have in UF, it can probably be implemented, but we don't have it. Solution to this might be tricky, but also prone to per browser different implementation/tricks. I've asked people in the UF/Foundation team and this is probably not a "two days task".

2) Probably (I'm not sure here) but the only way for preventing the browser from closing is by using some low level code that will launch a sort for confirmation dialog like the one in the screenshot taken form my experiments (not that user friendly)

3) We might probably have to do some more changes at UF for "iterating" all the open editors, and give the chance for each editor (in dirty state) for "being saved prior to close", "or not being saved" prior to close. This is not the behavior we have right now, currently the behavior is: "Cancel" (will not close the editor) or "Discard unsaved changes and proceed"

4) I'll give this 8 story points, but I'll believe we must discuss if this is something we want to invest time right now. My opinion is that we might probably use this effort in other higher priority tasks.
column427: 09/Jul/18 10:17 AM;wmedvede;It was discussed in Stunner meeting 9/July/2018 to postpone this JIRA to be reconsidered in the future since in the medium-term we'd like to implement the ability of "auto-saving" for all the WB editors. And probably the auto-save will make this unnecessary.

column1: Launcher wizard: improve user experience
column10: The defacto JBoss development environment for Eclipse.
column39:
The launcher wizard that we implemented in 4.9.AM3 works but it lacks explanations that would help a novice user.
Suggested improvements:
* A novice user has no idea what a mission is all about. We should maybe add an explanatory label that tells the user what he's picking with a mission. And then we should explain what the mission that he has chose will provide.
!mission-infos.png! 
* A novice user has no idea what the maven artifact elements are for.
 !maven-artifact-elements.png! 
* Generally speaking it is preferable to decorate missing input fields with a "*" than to mark them as errors (as one can see in most web forms). OpenShift tooling does this as a rule of thumb. 
 !error-markers-for-missing-info.png!
* Location is not decorated with an "required value" (or error) marker
 !location-missing-decoration.png!
column422:
13/Sep/18 9:53 AM;adietish;The PR changed the wizard to look like this:
 !new-wizard-page.png!

column428:
13/Jun/18 12:05 PM;adietish;Couldn't reproduce this in several attempts so far. 
(Currently engint seems defunct, no build is started. If you try to start it manually, it'll complain about a missing "builder" serviceaccount)
I also tried https://open.paas.redhat.com/ where I also can't reproduce the issue. https://open.paas.redhat.com/ is very slow though. If you dont wait for the build to finish and start the adapter right after creating the app, you get a timeout while starting the adapter (which keeps waiting for the pod to appear until it reaches a timeout). Restarting the adapter into debug once the pods are there, works fine though.
I filed JBIDE-26095 to allow a user to set (and persist) the initial timeout.
Resolving.

24/Jan/18 8:40 AM;aurelien.pupier;Which FIS image are you using?
If using the same than in the screencast it is not working.  The Fuse Tech preview 3 FIS image need to be used (which is not yet publicly available)
To have the project correctly configured you need to use Fuse Tooling 10.2.0 and set Camel version to 2.20.1 in the wizard.

You can see this comment for steps: https://issues.jboss.org/browse/OSFUSE-548?focusedCommentId=13522545&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13522545

column1: [build] update jobs to use maven 3.5
column10: The defacto JBoss development environment for Eclipse.
column39:
Jobs currently use mvn 3.3.9, unless pointed as "mvn3-latest", which was recently updated to be a symlink to 3.5.0 instead of 3.3.9.

We should get 3.5.2 [1] installed and use that in the jobs as it supports JDK 9.

[1] https://maven.apache.org/docs/3.5.2/release-notes.html

cc: [~psrna] [~mmalina]
column422:
26/Oct/17 10:52 AM;mmalina;Update: Jenkins global tool config [1] was tweaked to have these versions installed automatically from apache website:
maven-3.3.9
maven-3.5.0
maven-3.5.2
Additionally, maven3-latest will use maven-3.5.2.

Conversely, on the tools share [2] maven3-latest points to maven-3.5.0 and 3.5.2 is not there at all. So I created a ticket to update those:
https://redhat.service-now.com/surl.do?n=PNT0088025

[1] https://dev-platform-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/configureTools/
[2] nfs-int.rhev-ci.eng.rdu2.redhat.com:/rhev-ci-all-tools
column423:
21/Nov/17 6:23 AM;mmalina;There was a followup ticket for maven installation on the nfs share:
https://redhat.service-now.com/surl.do?n=PNT0093635
That was done and verified a few weeks ago.

So maven3-latest in both Jenkins config (when you use a maven build step) and the nfs share now point to maven 3.5.2.

So I guess now it's up to you, [~nickboldt], to make sure the jobs are updated to use this and check that it actually works.
column424:
22/Nov/17 12:06 PM;nickboldt;Jobs updated to use maven-3.5.2, rather than maven3-latest (so we don't get surprises when new versions are released):

https://fusesource-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/view/Fuse%20Tooling/job/jbosstools-fuse_PullRequest/jobConfigHistory/
https://fusesource-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/view/Fuse%20Tooling/job/jbosstools-fuse_master/jobConfigHistory/
https://github.com/jbdevstudio/jbdevstudio-ci/commit/b9ac8d0ade405e091091319774c2a8588e528b6c

and these 182 jobs too:

https://github.com/jbdevstudio/jbdevstudio-ci/commit/1e2a8da8565f105a11b84826c349cd8df63b8835
column425:
06/Dec/17 8:27 AM;lvalach;Some jobs weren't updated (cdi.itests.smoke, openshift.full.itests, docker.itests) probably because they had been renamed before you pushed your changes (Pavol want us to change "it" to "itests"). In your commit \[1\] the older names are mentioned. 

\[1\] https://github.com/jbdevstudio/jbdevstudio-ci/commit/1e2a8da8565f105a11b84826c349cd8df63b8835

I updated them and now all the jobs under "devstudio_master" "devstudio_integration_tests" views are configured to use Maven 3.5.2. Closing.

column1: Deadlock when tokenProvider is invoked during start
column10: The defacto JBoss development environment for Eclipse.
column39: If a service call the tokenProvider during start, this may lead to a deadlock because the browser is displayed using syncExec. Replace by a UIJob which does call asyncExec
column373:
(from [~jeffmaury])
1) make sure you have no OSIO account configured (Prefs -> JBoss Tools -> OpenShift.io -> Remove if there is an account
2)  make sure you have the Fabric8 analytics plugin installed
3) open a pom.xml file from your workspace
The fabrics8 analytics plugin should start the LSP which will request a token -> a browser should be launched but a there is a contention on the display you shoud face a timeout instead of a deadlock

column404: restart the adapter in debug, it works either immediately or eventually in latter tries
column422:
08/Sep/17 5:22 PM;adietish;This very much looks like we're trying to connect to nodejs when it's not fully up yet. Implying this is that the issue wont happen in the 2nd restart. The same is suggested by the fact that it also doesn't happen if you start the adapter in debug while the app already is in debug mode (check env vars in the service/dc, verify that it has devmode set to "true" and the debug port to some numerical value).
We're waiting for the pod to run, but not for nodejs to be up.
column423:
08/Sep/17 5:24 PM;adietish;Ideally we'd have the debugger to try a few times (with a timeout) before erroring.
My workaround for this would be to try to reach the debugger socket and only launch the debugger launch config once this succeeds.

[~ibuziuk] do you know how to make the chromium debugger try to connect a few times (with a timeout)  or how to check if nodejs is (up and) listening on the debugger port?
(for the understanding how we do things: to enable debugging we set env vars in the dc which causes a new pod to be created. We wait for the pod to be running, but not for nodejs to be running)
column424:
08/Sep/17 5:39 PM;adietish;I talked to [~vrubezhny] about that, quoting what he told me:
{quote}
But you know... Your stack trace leads into 

at org.eclipse.wst.jsdt.chromium.debug.core.model.DebugTargetImpl.attach(DebugTargetImpl.java:74)
at org.eclipse.wst.jsdt.chromium.debug.ui.launcher.LaunchTypeBase.launch(LaunchTypeBase.java:101)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:885)

And probably *connector.attach(...)* in *DebugTargetImpl.attach(...)* is really a call to *SocketConnection.attach()*... But I'm not really sure...
{quote}
We agreed on having chromium debug launch config trying a (configurable amount of) few times with a given (configurable) timeout.
column425: 09/Sep/17 4:40 AM;ibuziuk;[~adietish] not really in the context, but isn't it readiness probe issue i.e. you trying to connect to pod which is not ready (node is not running in the pod). Retrying should help but with reliable readiness probe there should not be such issue
column426: 11/Sep/17 4:27 AM;adietish;[~ibuziuk] sure that's exactly what I suggest to be fulfilled by the framework, not the user code.
column428: 28/Sep/17 9:30 AM;adietish;I can't reproduce this in my current CDK which seems faster after a fresh install. Since this can be worked around by restarting the adapter, I deem this not critical and postpone it.
column429: 13/Dec/17 7:47 AM;adietish;Couldn't reproduce for quite some time. Resolving for now.
column430: 13/Dec/17 4:37 PM;adietish;reopening: this always happens when using OpenShift Online
column431: 23/Jan/18 8:21 AM;adietish;I cannot reproduce this any longer. Instead i now face the adapter waiting for a long time before failing to start up: JBIDE-25611
column432: 25/Jan/18 4:56 AM;adietish;I can reproduce this on our internal instance at https://open.pass.openshift.com
column433:
03/Jul/18 8:53 AM;adietish;I tried 2 approaches, but both didn't work:
* catch the connection error and try again:
  doesn't work, the error occurrs in a different thread
* connect beforehand via a dummy socket to see if the port is ready:
  doesn't work, port forwarding lets you always connect but this wont tell you if the end of the pipe is ready.

It looks to me as if the only way to achieve this is to make sure that there's a readyness probe for the debug-port, too?
[~jeffmaury] Thoughts?
column436: 31/Jul/18 6:56 AM;adietish;No obvious solution so far. Putting back into backlog given that this isn't a blocker but rather just annoying.
column437:

column427:
15/Feb/17 6:04 PM;adietish;[~jrichter1] [~jeffmaury] thx for spotting. I dont know how my patch in openshift-restclient-java even worked at some point. I can perfectly replicate the issue and found the reason(s):
* the java process builder (that's being used to launch the oc binary) wont accept commands (nor arguments) with spaces.
* the openshift-restclient-java ([AbstractOpenShiftBinaryCapability#startProcess|https://github.com/adietish/openshift-restclient-java/blob/master/src/main/java/com/openshift/internal/restclient/capability/resources/AbstractOpenShiftBinaryCapability.java#L156] splits the command line by whitespaces and thus  trashes a command with spaces in it's path.

Nevertheless I didnt find a proper solution:
If I put the command in double quotes (like it is suggested in many entries on the net), the binary is still not being found. Any other quoting that I tried (like "\\" or "%20" or even new FIle().getCanonicalPath()) dont work either. 
Postponing this non-critical issue to later.
column428: 15/Feb/17 6:37 PM;adietish;[~jeffmaury] [~bdshadow] As workaround for now I am suggesting that we dont allow a path to "oc" in the preferences, that contains a " ": https://github.com/jbosstools/jbosstools-openshift/pull/1420

column430: 16/Feb/17 2:00 AM;jeffmaury;It is perfectly possible to launch a process with spaces in its path in Java. You must pass an array of strings the first one being the process to launch. The patch seems quite simple to me. Instead of building a string with the path to oc and the parameters, build an array of string and this would work
column431: 16/Feb/17 2:07 AM;jeffmaury;Tested on Win10 with a space in the oc path and it works but we still have an issue when the workspace path contains spaces as well. Will propose PR

column433: 16/Feb/17 5:26 AM;jeffmaury;The problem is that this array is build from a string, where we should work from the start with an array/list. But It will break binary compatibilty

column456:
12/Jul/17 2:49 PM;rob.stryker;This really seems like a bug to me in 'oc'.   The original issue was that you couldn't find or run oc.  Once that was "fixed", the next issue was that oc couldn't launch rsync properly because it was not escaping the spaces. 

I've pinged hardy to get some info on the topic.
column458:
13/Jul/17 12:08 PM;rob.stryker;The issue seems to be that oc calls rsync, and passes itself (ie oc rsh) in as the command that rsync should call to complete the copy.  When rsync tries to use this command, it craps out with the spaces. 

So we are successfully calling oc, and oc is successfully calling rsync, but when rsync tries to call oc rsh, it cannot find it, because of the space in the path. 

This seems 100% an upstream issue.
column459:
13/Jul/17 2:16 PM;rob.stryker;Comment from origin guys on linked issue:

it's a bug and we'll fix it, i'm just trying to assess the urgency. I can't promise it's going to make the 3.6 release and it doesn't sound like something we'd backport to 3.5, so i think you will want to consider trying to handle it in your tooling.
column460: 30/Aug/17 10:38 AM;adietish;[~dbocharov] [~rob.stryker] I believe that this is rather critical, shouldn't we try to tackle this in the next sprint?
column461: 30/Aug/17 10:42 AM;dbocharov;[~adietish] there is an upstream bug, so it looks like it's hard to do something before it is fixed. [~rob.stryker] am i right?

column463:
30/Aug/17 11:19 AM;dbocharov;[~adietish] hm, ok. They're quick this time. 
So it'll work in the next versions. I'm not sure if it is possible to fix it on our side for the previous versions of the oc binary.
column464: 30/Aug/17 11:33 AM;jeffmaury;I don't think we could fix it on our side because the pb that oc was launching itself not checking if its own path has spaces. The only was to fix it would be to copy the oc binary to a non spaced folder when oc has spaces in it.

Jeff{quote}

column423:

column424:
12/Jan/17 9:20 AM;nickboldt;Please define WHICH flag was reported missing. Can you attach your console log? I need tea leaves if you want me to read your future. My crystal ball's in the shop being repaired. :D

JIRAs are automatically closed if your github commit email matches your JIRA email, and you use Smart Commits: https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/using-smart-commits-298976812.html

Thus pushing a commit to github with a comment like "JBIDE-23623 #close" will cause this JIRA to be closed. But only if the above condition is met (github email == JIRA email).
column425:

2. JIRA: https://issues.jboss.org/browse/JBIDE-23755?focusedCommentId=13347315&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Aall-tabpanel#comment-13347315

column1: Find out how to run mvn clean verify -Dtest.installBase=path/to/devstudio/rpm
column10: The defacto JBoss development environment for Eclipse.
column39:
We need to find a way how to run automated tests agains devstudio rpm.
I've tried the following paths:

1) (as root) mvn clean verify -Dtest.installBase=/opt/rh/rh-eclipse46/root/usr/shareclipse/droplets/devstudio/eclipse/

2) (as hudson) mvn clean verify -Dtest.installBase=~/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_283378046_linux_gtk_x86_64

But none of the above works.
column422:
14/Nov/16 4:07 AM;odockal;We may exclude also this option:
mvn clean verify -Dtest.installBase=/opt/rh/rh-eclipse46/root/usr/bin/
which is the path where eclipse binary executable is located. Usually the problem is that user under who the maven command is executed has no rights (and should not have) to write to that location and thus, this results in error:

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.eclipse.tycho:tycho-surefire-plugin:0.26.0:test (default-test) on project org.jboss.tools.freemarker.ui.bot.test: Execution default-test of goal org.eclipse.tycho:tycho-surefire-plugin:0.26.0:test failed: Exception creating test eclipse runtime: /opt/rh/rh-eclipse46/root/usr/bin/dev.properties (Permission denied)

After some digging, maybe [osgi.user.area|http://help.eclipse.org/neon/index.jsp?topic=%2Forg.eclipse.platform.doc.isv%2Freference%2Fmisc%2Fruntime-options.html&anchor=osgiuserarea] parameter (or some other in section "Locations") is the way how to change the location of folders where user has access. Although, I have yet to figure out how to pass/set this parameters.
column423:
14/Nov/16 9:31 AM;nickboldt;Why not try this?

{code}(as hudson) 
scl enable rh-eclipse46 bash
mvn clean verify -Dtest.installBase=/opt/rh/rh-eclipse46/root/usr/lib64/eclipse/
{code}
column425: 15/Nov/16 8:15 AM;nickboldt;Well, that's the folder where ./eclipse executable is located, so it SHOULD work from there. What's the error message you get?

By the way, when I started the build again then I got different error, because the first build overwrited MANIFEST.MF.
If you hit the same problem, try to start tests from their parent "jbosstools-integration-tests". It shouldn't override manifest.

{code}
cd path/to/jbosstools-integration-tests

git reset --hard

mvn clean verify -DskipTests=false -Dtest.module=org.jboss.tools.freemarker.ui.bot.test -Dtest.installBase=/opt/rh/rh-eclipse46/root/usr/lib64/eclipse/
{code}

We are missing this line \[1\] in integration-tests pom \[2\].

\[1\] <testRuntime>p2Installed</testRuntime>
\[2\] https://github.com/jbosstools/jbosstools-integration-tests/blob/master/tests/pom.xml#L122

It solved problem with dev.properties but now I am getting another error message:

{code}
INFO] Installing IUs [org.jboss.tools.freemarker.ui.bot.test, org.eclipse.tycho.surefire.osgibooter, org.eclipse.tycho.surefire.junit4] to /opt/rh/rh-eclipse46/root/usr/lib64/eclipse

Whole log with debug messages: [^Freemarker_testRuntime_p2Installed.log] 

I guess that we have to remove/change value of the "destination" parameter. I went through Tycho code and it seems that it is not possible because destination has always the same value as <work> attribute in pom.xml. (The work attribute contains the same value as test.installBase.)

If you would like to check the code I propose to start here \[3\] and then you may continue here \[4\].

column428:
17/Mar/17 5:51 AM;lvalach;I have discused this problem with [~vkadlcik], he has test working against RPM. He doesn't use Tycho.
This way is less confortable, but I just letting you know about this option.

There is what he does:
# White SWTBot or Red Deer test and upload it to update site
# Install Devstudio RPM
# Install test as plugin
   eclipse \
     -application org.eclipse.equinox.p2.director \
     -repository file://$UPDATE_SITE \
     -i $FEATURE_WITH_OUR_PLUGIN
    (Plugin will be installed in $HOME/.eclipse/)
# Start test
   eclipse \
     -application org.eclipse.swtbot.eclipse.junit.headless.swtbottestapplication \
     -testPluginName $OUR_PLUGIN_ID \
     -className $OUR_TEST_CLASS

Demo: http://pkgs.devel.redhat.com/cgit/tests/eclipse/tree/Demo/rhbz910369_by_swtbot
column429: 10/May/17 12:20 PM;nickboldt;Will this be done for 10.4.0.GA or do we need to slip this to 11.0.0.AM1?

column431:
23/May/17 3:56 AM;lvalach;There is test which is running as Vaclav suggested \[1\], PR \[2\]. This job tests if is possible to install all stuff from RH Central to Devstudio installed from RPM (JBDS-4295).

\[1\] https://dev-platform-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/view/Devstudio/view/devstudio_rpm_tests/job/rpm_rh_central_UI_test.weekly/

\[2\] https://github.com/jbdevstudio/jbdevstudio-qa/pull/136

Running tests this way isn't so easy as running tests using Tycho, but works fine in the end.

----

I have also tried to modify tycho code to be able to change "destination" parameter which tycho passes to the p2director. Even though p2director is now installing plugins to ~/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_283378046_linux_gtk_x86_64 the Eclipse is ignoring these plugins.

This issue don't seems to be related to Tycho. I have tried to install some stuff from RH Central using the p2director, it worked fine till I added -destination parameter. 

For example, this command will install "Android Development Tools" from RH Central but eclipse won't load installed plugins.

{code}
eclipse -consolelog -console -debug -clean \
-application org.eclipse.equinox.p2.director \
-metadataRepository https://devstudio.redhat.com/10.0/snapshots/updates/discovery.earlyaccess/4.4.neon,https://dl-ssl.google.com/android/eclipse/ \
-artifactRepository https://devstudio.redhat.com/10.0/snapshots/updates/discovery.earlyaccess/4.4.neon,https://dl-ssl.google.com/android/eclipse/ \
-installIU com.android.ide.eclipse.adt.feature.feature.group,com.android.ide.eclipse.ddms.feature.feature.group,com.android.ide.eclipse.hierarchyviewer.feature.feature.group,com.android.ide.eclipse.gldebugger.feature.feature.group,com.android.ide.eclipse.traceview.feature.feature.group \
-destination /home/lvalach/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_283378046_linux_gtk_x86_64/configuration/
{code}

I tried to experiment with various configuration of p2director but without success.
----
[~psrna], [~nickboldt], are you satisfied with Vaclav's solution or do you want me to investigate more deeply to find out how to resolve problem with Tycho/p2 director?
column432:
30/May/17 5:34 AM;lvalach;It is not enought just to change the destination, because in that case the Tycho/p2 director is not aware of pluings which are already installed from RPM, so the p2 director will install all the dependencies e.q. eclipse.core etc. 

Seems that only way to get it running is to run P2 director from inside of target platform. (/opt/rh/rh-eclipse46/root/lib64/eclipse/eclipse -application org.eclipse.equinox.p2.director ...) but tycho doesn't offer this feature.

I have opened the discussion on tycho-users mailing list, I will wait for a while for responses.

I guess that the possible solution may be to fix the p2 director or to add possibility to run external p2 director from Tycho.

column435:
03/Aug/17 3:21 AM;vkadlcik;Just a side comment on this bit:
??Václav Kadlčík said that the only thing it does is adding eclipse to PATH. He said that he tests eclipse without enabling scl.??

Not that strongly. PATH is the most important factor but there are more environment variables which affect various scenarios; see /opt/rh/rh-eclipse47/enable. You can get by without scl if you know exactly what and how to set in the specific situation. In general, scl is always the safest way.
