column1: Progress does not reflect actual amount of work done
column10: Red Hat CodeReady Studio (formerly Developer Studio) is an IDE which includes a subset of the plugins from JBoss Tools plus various third party plugins in an installable package together with Eclipse and JBoss platforms.
column39: It seems the current way the progress tracking is implemented is simply by giving an initial time estimate for each component. The progress bars then just count down the supplied time with no relation to the actual progress achieved.
column422:
08/Mar/16 9:58 PM;dgolovin;It should show progress for download, because we can calculate exact progress based on js events. 
When installation is in progress it should be indeterminate progress bar to reflect that fact that in most cases we are dealing with running process that does not report any progress back.
column423: 09/Mar/16 8:51 PM;jowilson;[~dgolovin] is this something we are going to do anything about? Or can we mark it as "not going to fix"?
column424: 10/Mar/16 2:29 AM;jrichter1;The point here is the way it is implemented now is counting on a time estimate for the download. That's a static number and it looks fairly overshot. The downloads usually end in the first 20% of the progress, because the initial estimate just sets the maximum to some (high) value. So then the progress bars just keep moving slowly towards 99% no matter their state until they are set to complete.
column425:
15/Mar/16 2:34 PM;dgolovin;We'll take care of it when all blockers are fixed.
We'll update to real download progress if possible.
Installation will trigger indeterminate progress.
column426: 01/Sep/16 9:38 AM;jrichter1;Done.

column1: have installer build actually use M6 p2 product build
column10: Red Hat CodeReady Studio (formerly Developer Studio) is an IDE which includes a subset of the plugins from JBoss Tools plus various third party plugins in an installable package together with Eclipse and JBoss platforms.
column39:
talking with [~prapicault] I learned that since M6 the following changes are required for proper working p2 product/osx build:

{code}
<products>
         <product>
           ...
           <rootFolders>
             <macosx>MyProduct.app</macosx>
           </rootFolders>
         </product>
{code}

column433:
22/Apr/15 12:14 PM;dgolovin;yes, using 0.23.0-SNAPSHOT it works for me on Mac.

To force p2.director materialize product in Mac OS X .app package target directory should have .app suffix.
Default location for JBDS on Mac is /Application/jbdevstudio. Then installer adds three more sub-folders:
- runtimes (where runtime detection takes place by default and where EAP installed if included in installer) 
- studio (is used as -destination parameter for p2.director to materialize product)
- Uninstaller (generated by IzPack and contains Uninstaller.jar)

Currently even if installer built with tycho 0.23.0-SNAPSHOT when jbds is installed into /Application/jbdevstudio/studio p2.director falls back to old layout for Mac when jbdevstudio.app is placed into /Application/jbdevstudio/studio/jbdevstudio.app along with features and plugins folders. If we rename studio to studio.app  or jbdevstudio.app then p2.director will create right application package with internal structure the same as Eclipse.app Mars M6 downloaded from Eclipse.
column435: 27/Apr/15 2:48 AM;mmalina;I wonder if we could go all the way (as Eclipse did) and just have the jbdevstudio.app, without ${target-dir}/studio. But then we wouldn't have anywhere to put the uninstaller, so I guess that stops us from doing that.
column436:
27/Apr/15 4:18 AM;maxandersen;we also wouldn't have the runtimes in the same location.

What we *could* consider is to use "~/Library/Application Support/jbdevstudio.app" (Actually, we should probably move to jbevstudio9.app to avoid version overlap in future) which I believe is the "proper" way to put user specific content.

Also its worth noting that on Mac uninstalling is to just delete the .app folder so maybe uninstaller does not make sense here ?
column437:
27/Apr/15 3:45 PM;dgolovin;It should probably be "/Library/Application Support/jbdevstudio" without .app suffix, I see all other apps have folders without it. But before we switch to using it I would go ahead and applied PR to have studio working under mac.

Then we fix issues that requires fixes on installer and jddevstudio sides:
1. change runtimes folder location to "~/Library/Application Support/jbdevstudio9/runtimes" requires to change installer and runtime detection plugins
2. change runtime-locations.properties file and put it in the "~/Library/Application Support/jbdevstudio9/" requires to change installer and runtime detection plugins
3. Remove files none relevant for Mac installation form ibdevstudio.app 
4. Move relevant files (as readme.txt" inside jbdevstudio.app as root files (?)

column1: Universal installer step4 Java statement needs updating
column10: Red Hat CodeReady Studio (formerly Developer Studio) is an IDE which includes a subset of the plugins from JBoss Tools plus various third party plugins in an installable package together with Eclipse and JBoss platforms.
column39:
Universal installer, step 4 states:
"JBoss Developer Studio works with Java 6 and 7 and has been tested with OpenJDK, Oracle and Apple JDK."

According to the approved QE test plan (mojo DOC-932620):
* Only Java 7 and Java 8 are supported for running the IDE (Java 6 support for app development only)
* Apple JDK (which is Java 6) is not supported for running the IDE; it's supported for app development only

For clarity, suggest changing text to:
"JBoss Developer Studio can be run with Java 7 and 8 and has been tested with OpenJDK and Oracle JDK."

column1: JBDS 7.1.1 installer contains jars signed by GTECyberTrust, which may not be installed on all linux systems
column10: Red Hat CodeReady Studio (formerly Developer Studio) is an IDE which includes a subset of the plugins from JBoss Tools plus various third party plugins in an installable package together with Eclipse and JBoss platforms.
column39:
We have jars in JBDS 7.1.1.GA which were signed using GTECyberTrust. Some linux installs do not include this root cert, so when installing, p2 rejects the cert:

{code}One or more certificates rejected. Cannot proceed with installation.{code}

Full details: https://community.jboss.org/message/866868

*Platform details:*

{code}
Debian Jessie 64 bit
$ uname -a:
Linux Name 3.13-1-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 3.13.7-1 (2014-03-25) x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ java -version
java version "1.7.0_51"
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (IcedTea 2.4.5) (7u51-2.4.5-2)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 24.51-b03, mixed mode)
{code}

Note that Debian 8.0 "Jessie" is not yet released nor has a date for release been announced [0]. The latest stable Debian [1] is 7.4 "Wheezy", released on Feb 8, 2014. [2] The description for "testing" releases like Jessie is "Security updates are irregular and unreliable." [3] So... I don't think we support this OS yet. :)

[0] http://www.debian.org/releases/jessie/
[1] http://www.debian.org/releases/
[2] http://www.debian.org/releases/wheezy/
[3] https://release.debian.org/

*Steps to repro on the above platform:*

1. Downloaded jbdevstudio-product-eap-universal-7.1.1.GA-v20140314-2145-B688.jar
2. Ran java -jar jbdevstudio-product-eap-universal-7.1.1.GA-v20140314-2145-B688.jar stuck to the defaults and clicked thru
3. Install failed with an error re certificates not being trusted
4. Log message in ~/jbdevstudio/studio/p2/director/configuration/1396752621141.log  as follows:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine 8 0 2014-04-06 08:21:42.061
!MESSAGE One or more certificates rejected. Cannot proceed with installation.
column373:
# EXEC: cd /usr/lib/jvm/java-7-openjdk-amd64/jre/lib/security
# EXEC: mv cacerts cacerts.bak
# EXEC: Run installer as {code}/usr/lib/jvm/java-7-openjdk-amd64/jre/bin/java -jar installer.jar{code}
# ASSERT: Installation phase ended without errors
column404:
As root:

cd /usr/lib/jvm/java-7-openjdk-amd64/jre/lib/security/
mv cacerts oldcacertsold
cp /etc/ssl/certs/java/cacerts .
keytool -keystore /usr/lib/jvm/java-7-openjdk-amd64/jre/lib/security/cacerts -importcert -alias GTECyberTrustGlobalRoot -file /usr/share/ca-certificates/mozilla/GTE_CyberTrust_Global_Root.crt

As user, you should then be able to install JBDS 7.1.1.GA
column422: 11/Apr/14 1:08 PM;dgolovin;proposed fix https://github.com/jbdevstudio/jbdevstudio-product/pull/166 for 7.1.x stream

column431:

Why do we need this rcp app to solve this issue ?
column432: 23/Jan/14 7:04 PM;dgolovin;My suggestion is about developing installer as RCP application without IzPack not implementing IzPack.
column433:
24/Jan/14 3:55 AM;maxandersen;Okey, but we would need similar mechanisms that izpack provides. splashscreen, legal text, panels etc.

Just trying to understand what the value we get by reimplementing these ?
column434:
24/Jan/14 1:54 PM;dgolovin;{quote}Okey, but we would need similar mechanisms that izpack provides. splashscreen, legal text, panels etc.{quote}
Current solution is a hack into IzPack which runs p2Director app as external process, reads process output, analyze it and reports progress in IzPack panel. It also checks process return code to see if it is finished correctly or failed. All this is working fine in most cases but:
1. It is slower than just running installation process inside the same JVM
2. It doesn't support Unicode names for target folder under windows (see JBDS-2260)
3. It is a hack done in forked class that needs migration every time we migrate to new IzPack.

Why Eclipse RCP? Because we know how eclipse works and can match every feature IzPack has like:
1. Multi-platform support
2. Panels are just wizards steps
3. What is going to be installed should be provided as p2repository instead of IzPack packs (additional files can be delivered as root file features (?))
4. UI translation do different languages (can be done, but we're not using it)
5. Splashscreen

What is missing in eclipse (n):
1. Support for creating Groups and Launchers in menu under windows and linux
2. Native installers (but we don't use it)
3. Launching eclipse RCP from jar file

{quote}Just trying to understand what the value we get by reimplementing these ?{quote}
We would have everything eclipse based, even installer (y)
Installation would be faster (y)
Installer would be smaller if packed pack200 (y)
We can handle  JBDS-2874 and make BYOE happened (y)

column1: jbcs-httpd24-openssl-perl depends on perl(WWW::Curl::Easy) from base-os optional
column10: Apache HTTP Server, JSVC and more.
column39:
With currently added openssl into JBCS distribution, there was added also {{jbcs-httpd24-openssl-perl}} package. Although this package is not directly required to make openssl working in JBCS, customers that want to install it will be required to also install {{perl-WWW-Curl}} package from -optional base-os channel as it is a dependency for it. We should put this information into our JBCS documentation somewhere.

----
Original Jira description follows:

With openssl currently added into JBCS distribution, there is also introduced new dependency on a package from base-os -optional channel ({{rhel-X-server-optional-rpms}}). More specifically, there is added {{jbcs-httpd24-openssl-perl}} package, which requires {{perl-WWW-Curl}} which is available from -optional channel.

As mentioned also in JBCS-31, we don't like to depend on packages from optional channel, because of [this|https://access.redhat.com/support/offerings/production/soc], [this|https://access.redhat.com/support/offerings/production/scope_moredetail] and [this|https://access.redhat.com/articles/1150793]; excerpt from latest link:
{quote}
Software packages in the Optional and Supplementary channels are not supported, nor are the ABIs guaranteed.
{quote}

Marking this as a blocker as I believe this should be determined before release.

column423: 23/Sep/16 10:43 AM;huwang;[~jfclere] could you please confirm if jbcs-httpd24-openssl needs jbcs-httpd24-openssl-perl and its dependency of perl-WWW-Curl from -optional channel? Thanks!
column425:
26/Sep/16 4:57 AM;jfclere;In fact jbcs-httpd24-openssl-perl provides the CA.pl and c_rehash we don't use them  (we use the shell CA only).
I never used tsget which is the one causing the problem...

column427: 27/Sep/16 8:30 AM;huwang;By the suggestion of Jean-frederic, mark this jira as won't fix.
column428:
30/Sep/16 3:43 AM;jstourac;Ok, just to clarify so I understand correctly - although we don't use anything from the 'jbcs-httpd24-openssl-perl', we still want to keep this package in our distribution of JBCS openssl. Is that for potentional use by some customers?

Also - I think, this dependency should be documented at least in our installation guide, thus I will reopen this Jira for documentation component later.

column1: Fabric8: Is Activemq Load Balancing Cluster topology suggested only for non-persistent messages ?
column39:
"Load-Balancing Cluster Toplogy is ideal for load balancing non-persistent messages across brokers and for providing high-availability." This is mentioned at 7.3.1. Load-Balancing Cluster, please refer doc[1].

We are not able to understand why it is just mentioned for non-persistent messages. We believe that we should also  append more information so that it is more useful for all of us.
More information should be:

{code}
This topology is most useful if one have a scenario where producer is generating a heavy load but do not really care if all  messages make it to the consumer. This tends to the scenario where non persistent messages are used.  
As this topology doesn't have shared storage so If one is looking for better guarantees regarding delivery, probably best to combine networks and master slave as it is defined in subsequent sections.
{code}

column1: Terraform apply timeout

Solution is here https://github.com/expressjs/express/issues/2512

column1: mock_uuid cookie should not be allowed to be empty
column39:
There is a case where the `mock_uuid` cookie can be empty (an empty string).
This will cause unexpected results in the sync framework as it requires a non-empty cuid to be provided from the client.

https://github.com/feedhenry/fh-js-sdk/blob/master/src/modules/device.js#L16

In this case the uuid should be generated and the cookie should be updated.
column422: 28/Apr/17 8:22 AM;akeating1;[~jusanche] Around this change to the Client SDK. Is there anything we're missing or overlooking with this change?
column423:
28/Apr/17 8:31 AM;jusanche;Not sure if I follow

The cookie is only used if there is no fhdevice or device plugin installed, so in those changes it will be null.

If the cookie was already empty is won't be recreated as it compares to null, not to empty

column1: fh-component-metrics reports excessive cpu usage if the process is blocked for more than the sample period
column39:
Currently, if the process is busy and blocking for a long time (greater than 1 second), the read of /proc/<pid>/stat will not happen at the expected timeout of 1 second, and therefore give an innacurate cpu usage. 

See gist here for example of this in action, and how to avoid this by comparing timestamps of the start and end read of the stat file instead.
https://gist.github.com/david-martin/2355ef4ecc3dc26186cb1c89b1e1bb81

column1: Hitting Enter in name field of client app creation screen deselects chosen template
column39: Minor UX annoyance, see steps to reproduce.
column373:
1. In any project, go to the "Create New App" screen (Client App)
2. Choose any template *other than* "Cordova Light App"
3. Click "Choose"
4. Click into the name field to focus it (this also should be automatic)
5. Write any name
6. Hit Enter key on the keyboard (thinking that it will submit the form)
7. Nothing happens (seemingly)
8. Click Create Client App

Actual Results: 
A Cordova Light App gets created. This happens because hitting enter key in the name field actually (very counter-intuitively) deselects your chosen app template, and jumps to the first one (happens to be Cordova Light App).

Expected Results:
Hitting Enter key should either submit the form, or not do anything. It definitely shouldn't silently deselect your chosen template.

column1: fh-fhc tests fail on NodeJS 4.4
column39:

In that PR, there are 2 commits. The first tests that the job works with nodejs 0.10, and completes successfully. The second changes {{engines.node}} to {{4.4}} in the package.json, which the job picks up on and uses nvm to switch to nodejs 4. This build fails.

column1: Investigate how to solve 'fh:dist' target in grunt-fh-build sometimes missing dependencies if they have been de-duplicated
column39:
The way that the plugin deals with packing dependencies from the node_modules directory is a bit flawed. The way it currently works is that it matches exactly the {{dependencies}} list from the package.json, and excludes everything else. The reasoning for this was to avoid packing {{devDependencies}}.

The problem with this approach, is that npm (at least some versions of it), may pull up dependencies if they match across more than one subtree, to deduplicate them. One of the features of npm@3+ is that this will be done as eagerly as possible, but it also seems that maybe some versions of npm@2+ will do this in some cases.

That behaviour of npm only becomes a problem with the grunt-fh-build plugin, if a transitive dependency gets pulled up to the top level of the node_modules directory, as it will now be excluded from the built artifact that contains the dependencies, and will no longer exist in the subtrees in which it's depended upon. As you can probably imagine, this issue will present itself a lot more once we move to npm@3+.

I believe this issue should be solvable by using {{npm pack}} and dynamically fiddling with the {{bundledDependencies}} field of the package.json at build time. This probably doesn't sound very nice at first; but if it works as I think it should, I think it would likely be the most elegant solution to our problem, if we want to keep all of our existing functionality.

*Investigation timeboxed to a day*

*Questions:*
* good reproducer for the missing dependencies issue ?
* good regression test to verify we didn't break anything?
* what is scope of changes in grunt-fh-build ?
* what is the scope of changes in package.json of the components ?

*Issues with npm pack:*
* Native dependencies need building which results in a `build` directory (https://nodejs.org/api/addons.html#addons_building). {{npm pack}} excludes this directory from the artifact. The behaviour is not mentioned on the {{npm pack}} documentation (https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/pack) but was found here https://github.com/Automattic/node-canvas/issues/233
* If a native dependency directory is not available in node_modules, {{npm install}} installs the dependency and builds it
* If a native dependency directory available in node_modules but the build is missing from, {{npm install}} does not build it

*Possible solution 1:*
* Extend the fh-artifact cookbook such that when provisioning, after artifacts are extracted, the cookbook finds native dependencies by looking for the binding.gyp files and explicitly builds them
* The build command can either be {{node-gyp rebuild}} or {{node-pre-gyp rebuild}}. If node-pre-gyp can be found in package.json then the latter one is used, otherwise the first one is used. (If a native dependency implements node-pre-gyp, only the node-pre-gyp works. Otherwise, only the node-gyp command works. An example of a dependency implementing node-pre-gyp: https://github.com/MayhemYDG/iltorb/commit/5f25d0559a51e4a2fb76cce9bd08d27964798437)

*Possible solution 2 (implemented):*
* Bundle the directories listed by `npm ls --parseable --production`. This will not include devDependencies
column404: The current workaround for this if it's encountered, is to add the de-duplicated dependency to the list of {{dependencies}} in the package.json.

column1: Fix build of ZSTD library
column39: The ZSTD library (its native part) seems to be badly built and sending messages with {{zstd}} compression on shoots down the broker. We need to fix the library and rebuild everything with the new version.

column1: Kafka Connect S2I is not reconciling connectors during periodical reconciliation
column39: The idea is that when both KafkaConnect and KafkaConnectS2I with the same name exist, the connector reconciliation will be done only for KAfkaconnect which takes precedence. However, the condition in the Kafka Connect S2I operator works in a way that when no Kafkaconnect is found, the reconciliation of connector is skipped. And only when KafkaConnect with the same name exists it will be done. This PR fixes it and does it the right way.

This is later fixed when the status is set. But it looks bad to have the exception in the log because user might not understand it. This PR adds additional status check with exponential back off which backs off when HTTP 404 is returned. That solves the exception and makes the experience better for the user.

column1: Connector operator does not work when Connect is running in a different namespace
column39:
The connector operator is using only the service name to connect to the Kafka Connect REST API. However that is not enough when the operator does not run in the same namespace as the operator. In that case it needs to use the qualified name {{<connect-service>.<connect-namespace>.svc}}. 

This is opened by [Strimzi#2417|https://github.com/strimzi/strimzi-kafka-operator/issues/2417]

column1: Unhandled exception when decoding invalid JSON
column39:
When HTTP client tries to consume an invalid JSON message using a JSON consumer, following exception seems to be printed to the log:

{code}
2019-07-29 09:40:44,291 INFO OpenAPI operation = poll (io.strimzi.kafka.bridge.http.HttpBridgeContext) [vert.x-eventloop-thread-1]
Jul 29, 2019 9:40:44 AM io.vertx.core.impl.ContextImpl
SEVERE: Unhandled exception
io.vertx.core.json.DecodeException: Failed to decode: No content to map due to end-of-input
 at [Source: (io.netty.buffer.ByteBufInputStream); line: 1, column: 0]
	at io.vertx.core.json.Json.decodeValue(Json.java:190)
	at io.strimzi.kafka.bridge.http.converter.HttpJsonMessageConverter.toMessages(HttpJsonMessageConverter.java:89)
	at io.strimzi.kafka.bridge.http.converter.HttpJsonMessageConverter.toMessages(HttpJsonMessageConverter.java:20)
	at io.strimzi.kafka.bridge.http.HttpSinkBridgeEndpoint.lambda$doPoll$5(HttpSinkBridgeEndpoint.java:239)
	at io.vertx.kafka.client.consumer.impl.KafkaConsumerImpl.lambda$poll$16(KafkaConsumerImpl.java:560)
	at io.vertx.kafka.client.consumer.impl.KafkaReadStreamImpl.lambda$null$39(KafkaReadStreamImpl.java:729)
	at io.vertx.core.impl.ContextImpl.executeTask(ContextImpl.java:320)
	at io.vertx.core.impl.EventLoopContext.lambda$executeAsync$0(EventLoopContext.java:38)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.AbstractEventExecutor.safeExecute(AbstractEventExecutor.java:163)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.SingleThreadEventExecutor.runAllTasks(SingleThreadEventExecutor.java:404)
	at io.netty.channel.nio.NioEventLoop.run(NioEventLoop.java:495)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.SingleThreadEventExecutor$5.run(SingleThreadEventExecutor.java:905)
	at io.netty.util.concurrent.FastThreadLocalRunnable.run(FastThreadLocalRunnable.java:30)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{code}

This should be handled in a more graceful way. I also wonder how does it affect other messages received in the same block.

column1: [DOC OCP] Configuration for external clients is unclear in documentation
column39:
It seems that every customer who starts to use MQ Streams asks the same question -- what steps must I take to configure access to my installation from outside OpenShift? "Outside" might mean in a different OpenShift namespace, or outside OpenShift entirely.

The information to do this is to be found in the documentation, but it is distributed in a way that makes it hard to assemble a plan of action. For example, there is a section on certificate handling, which is relevant, and a section on setting up routes, which is relevant, but they have no association one to the other in the documentation.

I think the documentation should set out the various ways of connection an 'external' client (both inside and outside OpenShift), listing the costs and benefits of each. It should then expand each option into numbered steps. I appreciate that there will be some duplication of information in doing this, but it will make the process easier to follow.
column422: 01/Nov/19 10:31 AM;scholzj;I wonder if the [Evaluation guide|https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_amq/7.5/html/evaluating_amq_streams_on_openshift/index] helps with this issue. WDYT [~kboone]?
column423:
01/Nov/19 11:27 AM;scholzj;> There was one thing that confused me a little, however: in s2.6, in the list of prerequisites, there is one item "Cluster CA certificate for access to the cluster". On the face of it, this looks like a reference to some other document, that has more detailed information. in fact, it is link back to s2.5 in the same document, which the reader will (presumably) have read a couple of minutes ago. In my, it would be clearer if it just said "as described above", or something, rather being a link. Linking the previous paragraph is always a bit confusing 

Yeah, I think that relates to how the modular documentation works. It doesn't create a single consistent text but you can see how it is stitched from the independent modules (CC [~pmellor] [~laidan6000] [~naciao]).

> It would be good to have a Java example

Yeah, I think we can add it. WDYT [~pmellor] [~laidan6000] - would it make sense to follow up on the {{kafka-console-producer}} / {{kafka-console-consumer}} with another chapter with some Java client examples?
column424: 15/May/20 10:30 AM;scholzj;[~pmellor] Examples as in a command to run? Or examples as a Java code?
column425:
18/May/20 1:53 PM;scholzj;I'm having a bit second thoughts about it althought it seems it looked ok to me 6 months back :-o. Some of the problems I see:
* Is really just a Java code snippet enough? Or do we need to start with things from 0 ... Maven project, adding dependencies, etc.
* This is not unique to connecting from the outside of OCP. The Java code and configuration looks exactly the same if you run it inside.  
* What is the probability than next we will be asked to add details for 50 other clients?

I guess that these two examples match the requirement quite closely:
* https://github.com/scholzj/kafka-enablement-2020/blob/master/consumer-producer/src/main/java/cz/scholz/kafka/ssl/ConsumerAPI.java
* https://github.com/scholzj/kafka-enablement-2020/blob/master/consumer-producer/src/main/java/cz/scholz/kafka/ssl/ProducerAPI.java

We can copy paste them to the docs if you want.
column426:
19/May/20 3:22 AM;kboone;[~scholzj] I don't think it's the Java code that's the problem, although there are specific features of the Java client that do need to be documented. I think the problem is the interaction between what you do in Java (or whatever language) and what you do on OpenShift. It seems to me that at least four steps are involved in setting up an external client:

1. Configuring the Streams set-up on OpenShift to allow external access, with a route with the right termination type. I guess that's done by the operator using custom resource configuration. 
2. Getting access to the certificate that the client will need, from the appropriate place on OpenShift
3. Deciding on a type of authentication, which will require additional configuration, perhaps on both client and server
4. Configuring a Java (or whatever) client to use the relevant certificate(s), provide credentials and, in some cases, to relax certain certificate checks that the client will normally make.

All of these steps are documented, but in different places. When a customer calls in to ask "how to I connect my Kafka to XYZ", we have to reference a bunch of different documentation sources. 

FWIW I have an example on github

https://github.com/kevinboone/kafka-hello

that explains what to do step-by-step for a specific usage scenario. However, it's not very general.

I have to point out that the steps I'm describing probably seem absolutely obvious to somebody who works with the product all the time. But they aren't at all obvious to customers.
column427: 19/May/20 5:27 AM;kboone;I don't think there needs to be a lot of detail -- just an outline of the various steps involved, with links to where they're documented.
column428: 21/May/20 6:07 AM;scholzj;That is fine for downstream but not really for upstream. We should use loadbalancers or node ports there I guess
column429:
26/May/20 3:33 AM;scholzj;I think that using node ports upstream is fine.

[~kboone] Upstream is the open source project - Strimzi in this case. Downstream is the Red Hat product. Since Strimzi is an independent project under CNCF, not all documentation can be same there as it is for the Red Hat product - for example when it comes to pushing Red Hat specific technologies etc.

column1: Topic Operator scalability
column39: The Topic Operator should scale to to large numbers of topics without generating errors. It has been reported that during periodic reconciliation of as few as 20 topics, errors get logged. We should resolve this and we should also add a system test for this.
column422: 05/Dec/18 3:11 AM;scholzj;[~tombentley] Out of curiosity - who reported this?
column423: 05/Dec/18 3:15 AM;tombentley;[~scholzj] it was [~jgodoy]
column424: 11/Dec/18 9:25 AM;scholzj;Related upstream issue: [Strimzi#153|https://github.com/strimzi/strimzi/issues/153]
column425:
11/Dec/18 9:29 AM;scholzj;Initial estimation: 3SP for testing what the bottlenecks are and identifying scenarios which cause problems such as:
* X topic created at the same time
* Reconciling N topics
* etc.

After the initial investigation, this will be estimated again for the fix.
column426:
19/Dec/18 10:22 AM;tombentley;Running the TO locally (i.e. not within OpenShift) I can happily reconcile 500 topics with `-Xmx300M` with CPU peaking at ~30%, stable GC and no errors logged.

On discussing this with the folks who reported the issue, it turns out the real problem was due to the topic naming rules, and not an issue with TO scalability.

column373:
- Start Kafka cluster
- Create topic: oc create -f examples/topic/kafka-topic.yaml 
- Edit replicas count for topic: oc edit kafkatopic my-topic
- check topic operator logs
column422:
02/Aug/18 9:45 AM;tombentley;The cause of this is that the TO simply does not handle changes to replication factor yet. It's a relatively large task to add that support. There is some largely untested code in the TO currently which would use the Kafka CLI tools to do this. That would require that the JVM in which the CLI tool runs would need to work with the current TLS setup. It also means we get the batching behaviour that the {{kafka-reassign-partitions.sh}} imposes. There's also a TODO in the code which explains a way to mostly avoid the batching behaviour at the cost of coupling to the JSON representation that Kafka uses in the reassignment znode. 

[~scholzj] I vaguely recall we discussed this before (partly in the context of changing upstream Kafka to make this whole thing less nasty) and decided we should leave all this reassignment stuff as a manual thing in AMQ Streams initially. If we do pursue that option for beta/GA we will need to add in appropriate logging and ignoring of this kind of change (instead of throwing an NPE) and also document the procedure for changing this manually using the kafka command line tooling. 

Thoughts?
column423: 02/Aug/18 10:44 AM;scholzj;I'm not sure we can leave this as "User does it manually" because I'm not sure there is a way how the user can do that manually. Is if done through the AdminClient API? Or only through the CLI tools directly in Zoo? I guess only directly in Zoo since you mention the shell tools. Zoo is not opened for access to anyone. So we have to implement this I'm afraid.
column424: 02/Aug/18 10:49 AM;tombentley;Yeah, I think the discussion about having users doing it manually predates all the TLS work and we probably overlooked the ramification of TLS at the time we thought having the user do it was acceptable.
column425:
21/Nov/18 4:29 AM;sknot;PR https://github.com/strimzi/strimzi-kafka-operator/pull/1057 changes handler from `null` to printing warning about that changing replica factor is not implemented yet. It should avoid printing NPE (and maybe malfunctioning) into TO log.

Also if you take a look at log in description, it says `Number of partitions cannot be decreased`. This is fixed in mentioned PR as well.

column1: [DMN Designer] Multiple DRDs support - Information requirements are duplicated into the DMN XML
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
When users create a new DRD, the information requirement entry is being duplicated into the DMN XML.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create the Traffic Violation example
- Create a new DRD from the "Driver" node

column1: DMN DT Analysis Misleading rule definition refinements
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
The original definition is:

bq. P tables can be “misleading” when rule contains hyphen  input entry (“irrelevant”) and output is not lowest priority

as in the following example:

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

which was implemented with [DROOLS-3785].

( ref: https://youtu.be/eQRDc6fq2yw?t=1293 )

Further refinements checked to avoid duplicating "Misleading rule" reports when in fact the rules were already reported as "Masked", with: [DROOLS-5368]

However, a table such as the below would inadvertently still report misleading rules:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

So the new definition is refined to:

{quote}P tables can be “misleading” when:
* rule contains hyphen  input entry (“irrelevant”)
* and output is not lowest priority
* the hyphen in the misleading rule, correspond to a value (not an hyphen) in the mislead('d) rule
{quote}

column1: DMN strongly typed class compile errors for collection types
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
If we have an itemDefinition with isCollection="true", it will cause a compile error for InputSet and OutputSet when typesafe is enabled. Note that itemComponent with isCollection="true" works fine.

    DMNRuntimeTypesTest.testCollectionType()

{code:xml}
  <semantic:itemDefinition label="tPersonList" name="tPersonList" isCollection="true">
    <semantic:typeRef>tPerson</semantic:typeRef>
  </semantic:itemDefinition>
{code}

Consider separating TypeSafe specific tests:
https://github.com/kiegroup/drools/pull/2993#discussion_r463500865
column422: 07/Aug/20 4:51 AM;tkobayashi;Done by https://github.com/kiegroup/drools/commit/545bb2616f7b8242cf16cab792e5b26dce2a3ae0

column1: DMN strongly typed class compile errors for capitalized/non-capitalized properties conflict

- DMNRuntimeTypesTest.testCapitalLetterConflictWithInputAndDecision()

05/Feb/20 7:39 AM;ge0ffrey;[~rsynek] Drools has 2 systems: "plain DRL exe mode" (AKA legacy mode) and "exe model exe mode" (AKA new mode).
By default, Drools uses the new mode.
But optaplanner currently changes it to use the legacy mode.
After the 7.7 cut-off, luca will switch it to use the new mode, with this jira.

Radovan, *can QA run a benchmark of optaplanner-examples (almost all use cases at least 1 dataset) to compare performance between the legacy mode and the new mode?*
The flag code is in ScoreDirectorFactoryConfig (do git blame and look for Luca's changes), should be easy to switch.

The performance should be the same, in theory... :)

column1: [DMN Designer] Data Types - Inline add action button
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
Change the behavior and tooltip for the inline add icon-button (+). Currently it converts the type to Structure before adding a row below. Instead, we want it to add another row without converting the type. 

Acceptance criteria:
* Tooltip: "Add row below (Ctrl + B)" 

Behavior - Clicking the (+) inline add button:
* from a type defined as Structure, will add a field row below.
* from a Field row (within a Structure), will add another field row below. 
* from a Simple type, such as "Person(string)", will add another row of the same type below.

column1: [DMN Designer] Code Completion - When users press Escape on suggestions the edit mode is closed
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
This bug was created by this comment: https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/pull/3000#issuecomment-553442743

{quote}*Reported by Jozef:*
Once completions are shown, then pressing Escape hides them however cancel also edit mode of the cell, I am not sure what customers will think about this.
{quote}
Check with UX the expected behaviour, and implement the expected behaviour for the Escape key in the described case


The severity of the issue is higher if we follow this steps:
- Put some value into cell, confirm it == finish edit mode
- Edit the same cell, type new expression
- Very probably autocompletions will be shown
- However imagine you do not want to use any hint, so you press *Escape*
- Now the completions are hidden, however also edit mode was canceled and typed value was not stored

column1: [DMN Designer] Grid performance is dire
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
There have been reports that the performance of the DMN editor's grids does not scale. On examination performance for anything other than simple examples is pretty dire.. something is seriously wrong.

On closer inspection the following issues were found:
- Multiple {{NodeMouseDownHandler}}, {{NodeMouseMoveHandler}} and {{NodeMouseUpHandler}} are registered because multiple {{DMNGridLayer}} are (incorrectly) instantiated due to a flaw in {{GridLienzoPanel}} and {{GridLienzoScrollHandler}}.
- Calls to {{GridWidget.getHeight()}} and {{GridRow.getHeight()}} can be _very_ expensive for due to the dynamic calculation in {{ExpressionEditorGridRow}} and {{LiteralExpressionGridRow}} rows.

h2. Manual Acceptance test
Environment: wildfly14 with following memory settings: {{JAVA_OPTS="-Xms64m -Xmx1024m -XX:MetaspaceSize=96M -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=1024m -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true"}}

h3. GDT
- Merge view (/)
- Pinned mode (/)
- Change column width, save and reopen (/)
- Search the table (/)
- Scroll the table (/)
- Edit the cell (/)
- Reorder columns (/)
- Reorder rows (/)

h3. DMN decision table
- Save and reopen (x) not able to save in reasonable time
- Change column width (/)
- Search the grid (/)  
- Scroll the grid (/)
- Reorder columns (/)
- Reorder rows (/)
- Adding column (/)
- Removing column (/) 
- Edit the cell (x) not able to invoke edit mode by double click, if the table was scrolled   [^edit-cell.webm]

An imported {{Node}} does not have all of its properties set.

* Create another DMN file and import the first.
* Add the {{Decision}} to the diagram.
* The original properties are empty.

There are probably additional changes needed [here|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/pull/2620/files#diff-e04e2d5c0575c9013d9850d8aa8bf150R82].

column1: [DMN Designer] Included Model Name marshalling issues depending on imported model name
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
There is issue in marshalling, if the included model name contains *whitespace* character. In such case xml editor is opened instead of the dmn editor. See the attached picture and steps to reproduce for more details.

Issue spotted during review of DROOLS-3720 and DROOLS-3721. However it is probably not related.
column373:
# Create new dmn model *a.dmn*
# Create new dmn model *b.dmn*
# In the *a.dmn* include the *b.dmn*, however use white space, see second attached screenshot
# Save the *a.dmn* and reopen
column422: 10/May/19 3:06 PM;karreiro;I think that we have two approaches for this JIRA: 1) validate the imported model name (to avoid whitespaces); 2) set the nsContext by using a normalised name. I prefer the second one, but the first one is easier to implement, so I think that some discussion before the implementation about the approach is important (Daniel, talk to Mike and Edson).
column423: 15/May/19 7:38 PM;tirelli;[~dadossan] [~karreiro] I am confused why a whitespace in the name would cause any problem? Whitespaces are valid characters in names.
column424:
16/May/19 7:29 AM;manstis;[~dadossan] I'd put a breakpoint in {{AbstractVFSDiagramService.getDiagramByPath(..)}} on L#179 to understand _why_ there is a parsing error.

I'd have thought, at this point in the code, it might be KIE's DMN marshaller that is having a problem.. but we'd need to debug to be sure.
column425:
16/May/19 9:53 AM;dadossan;[~tirelli][~manstis] The issue is the namespace. I've imported an model with the name "Best Player" and look at this:

xmlns:{color:red}Best Player{color}="https://kiegroup.org/dmn/_47F64FEB-F517-4B98-B270-E049FC5E21CE"

I changed it manually to "BestPlayer" (without space) and it worked in DMN Showcase (before that change the model was not being loaded), but I'm not sure about the side effects of having the declaration here without space and the name with spaces in the other places:

<dmn:import id="_A55C41D2-E76A-467A-B97A-3C8F3A063F0D" {color:red}name="Best Player" {color}namespace="https://kiegroup.org/dmn/_47F64FEB-F517-4B98-B270-E049FC5E21CE" locationURI="default://master@system/stunner/diagrams/nrBzl8oV.dmn" importType="http://www.omg.org/spec/DMN/20180521/MODEL/"></dmn:import>
  <dmndi:DMNDI>
    <dmndi:DMNDiagram>
      <di:extension>
        <kie:ComponentsWidthsExtension></kie:ComponentsWidthsExtension>
      </di:extension>
      <dmndi:DMNShape id="{color:red}dmnshape-Best Player{color}:_B5CE43A7-B81C-4A41-AD9C-6019453912D6" dmnElementRef="{color:red}Best Player{color}:_B5CE43A7-B81C-4A41-AD9C-6019453912D6" isCollapsed="false">
column426:
17/May/19 5:05 AM;manstis;[~dadossan] I don't know the details of this JIRA but I assume the _alias_ given for the import is used in the namespace declaration?

If this is true; then I think we simply need to add validation of the alias to exclude spaces; or more strictly adhere to the W3 definition of a namespace [prefix|https://www.w3.org/TR/xml-names/#NT-Prefix]. You can follow the links to {{[NCName|https://www.w3.org/TR/xml-names/#NT-NCName]}} to find the characters permitted. You might be able to find a [regex|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2519845/how-to-check-if-string-is-a-valid-xml-element-name/15188815#15188815] to perform the validation!
column427: 17/May/19 9:22 AM;tirelli;This is not correct. A dmnElementRef should not use the name.  Please take a look at the spec.
column428:
17/May/19 9:33 AM;manstis;[~dadossan] I just did a quick try with another tool. ThIs is XML generated:
{code}
<definitions ....  xmlns:include1="xyz/_c08ca96b-23bb-4552-bbbe-b9226e71f226" ...>
...
<import namespace="xyz/_c08ca96b-23bb-4552-bbbe-b9226e71f226" .... />
...
<dmndi:DMNShape id="_3e69293c-cae7-4639-8800-7befd776464b" dmnElementRef="include1:_7ef611b3-6e70-44ee-8983-8a2512603044">
{code}
So the namespace prefix used in DMNDI is resolved from the namespace in the import and that declared in the definitions.
column429: 17/May/19 9:48 AM;tirelli;This makes sense.
column430: 17/May/19 12:36 PM;dadossan;[~manstis] So in the example that you provided, I should use "include1" (for example) instead of "include[space]1", removing all spaces, is that right?
column431:
17/May/19 12:39 PM;dadossan;[~tirelli] [~manstis]
There's one thing that can go wrong with this approach (allowing models with space): 
A model with name: "SomeImported"
And another model with name: "Some Imported"

If we import this 2 models in another file, since we're removing the spaces in the alias, it may lead to errors. Is that right?
column432: 17/May/19 1:12 PM;tirelli;[~dadossan] no, I think you are mixing things up. Lets talk on bluejeans and I can explain it better to you.
column433: 17/May/19 2:28 PM;dadossan;As we talked in the BlueJeans, we have to change how we create the alias. Now we're creating the alias using the same name of the imported model (example: "foo import"). We have to change it to be something like "include1", "include2", etc.
column434: 23/May/19 3:51 AM;jomarko;[~dadossan] Hi, thank you for changes, I am able to import model and use whitespace as its alias. However there seems to be an issue if I connect imported node with the rest of diagram, see the attached error, video and project. Let me know if you think it is unrelated to your changes.
column435: 23/May/19 6:52 AM;dadossan;At first doesn't look to be related, because the test you did is the basic test that I did too, but I'm checking.
column436: 23/May/19 8:30 AM;tirelli;[~dadossan] can you keep me posted on the status of this please?
column437: 23/May/19 9:29 AM;jomarko;[~tirelli] [~dadossan] there is a good progress. I am now able to create the DMN while import alias has whitespace, however I am not able to test it using Scenarios. See the attached project   [^routes-v2.zip] . Import it to workbench and click the Test button. The  [^routes-v2.log] erro will appear in server log.
column438: 23/May/19 2:46 PM;dadossan;I'm checking.
column439: 23/May/19 3:13 PM;dadossan;[~tirelli] I think I've found the issue. Just making some tests before update the PR.
column440:
23/May/19 9:17 PM;dadossan;[~jomarko][~tirelli] I tried to recreate a project like you did, step by step, without the changes introduced in this PR and without using model names with spaces, and the same error happened. Also I tried to edit the project that you send by hand undoing the changes that this PR introduces and reimporting it again, but without success. 
So I'm not sure that this issue was introduced by this PR. Can you please confirm? I'm still investigating. I'll be here sooner to try to get you on your timezone, [~jomarko]. Thank you!

column1: [DMN Designer] TextAreas can no longer be multi-line
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
{{TextAreaSingletonDOMElementFactory}} extends {{BaseSingletonDOMElementFactory}} that attaches a {{KeyDownHandlerCommon}} handler.

This handler intercepts {{KeyCodes.KEY_ENTER}} that flushes the content of the editor.

The {{KeyDownHandlerCommon}} handler should not respond to {{KeyCodes.KEY_ENTER}} for {{TextAreas}}.

- Context (/)
- Relation (/)
- Invocation (/)

- Decision Table (/)

If user adds enumeration constraints and they do not fit the dialog size, there appears vertical scrollbar. However  the scrollbar moves to the beginning of the list every time the add button is pressed. This forces user to scroll to the latest added entry every time the add button is pressed. 

We have already this functionality of scrolling to latest in the data types list view component - list of all declared data types.

The scrollbar in the attached dialog is  scrolled down. (/) checked with linked PR

column1: [DMN Designer] Expression constraint is not parsed to Range constraint
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
If the data type constraint is set as {{[date( "2016-07-29" )..date( "2016-07-30" )]}} [0], it is not recognized as an range in the [1]. 

The problem is that our {{ParseService}} for parsing Range, doesn't check deeply, what is the type of {{StartNode}} [3]. And then the {{DateValueFormatter}} component fails to replace the leading {color:red}{{date(}}{color} [4].

[0]
 !Screenshot from 2019-03-07 11-11-18.png|thumbnail! 

[1]
 !Screenshot from 2019-03-07 11-11-30.png|thumbnail! 

[3]
https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/blob/master/kie-wb-common-dmn/kie-wb-common-dmn-backend/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/dmn/backend/editors/types/DMNParseServiceImpl.java#L54

[4]
https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/pull/2508/files#diff-e199e1e595037dcb4b465ff36dd13a1f

column1: Edit Scenario Simulation data cells constraint
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
It should not be possible to edit cells in columns whose type has not been set yet; these cells contain the Define valid type placeholder. Once you edit such a cell (you fill in any value) and then remove the value, the cell placeholder switches to Insert value, which is not correct. These cells should not be editable at all.

This defect is caused by keyboard shortcuts implemented as part of DROOLS-2932.
column373:
# Open a Scenario Simulation asset
# Press *Home* on keyboard, navigate (using keyboard arrows) to some data cell that belongs either to GIVEN or EXPECT section
# Be sure given column is not bound to data object nor data object field
# Pres *Enter* on keyboard
# Current behavior: Edit action is invoked

column1: [DMN Designer] Information Item name is empty by default
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
The properties of decision has two sections with *Name* property. One general *Decision Name* and one *Information Item Name*.

The second *Information Item Name* reflects in <variable/> tag of the backing xml file. Its value important for the runtime.

I think we should solve this issue doing two actions:
- Make *Information Item Name* readonly
- Set *Information Item Name* automatically according to *Decision Name*
column404: Set both names manually.
column422: 09/Nov/18 3:36 AM;jomarko;Can confirm is fixed by the linked PR.

column1: [DMN Designer] Add support for optional typeRefs
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
At the moment {{TypeRef}} is a mandatory field within the editor.

This is a hard limitation of use of the Properties Panel bean-binding (it cannot bind to {{null}} values). However the DMN Specification states that {{TypeRef}} are optional (and we are working around by changing the _default_ to {{Any}} - see [DROOLS-3248|https://issues.jboss.org/browse/DROOLS-3248]).

We need to change the UI and marshaller to be able to support _optional_ {{TypeRef}}. This would (probably) require adding a _magic_ value to {{BuiltInType}} representing a "null" selection. It would need to:

- Appear at the top of the "Data Type selector" widget (with label "<None>" or similar)
- Be the _selected_ option when the {{TypeRef}} is the new _magic_ value (this should happen automatically, but worth checking!)
- The marshaller should set the {{TypeRef}} to the _magic_ {{BuiltInType}} if the DMN model (coming from XML->{{kie-dmn-model}}->workbench model) has a {{null}} {{TypeRef}} - the _magic_ value is only to be used _client-side_.
- The marshaller should set the {{TypeRef}} to {{null}} when converting from the workbench model to {{kie-dmn-model}} and the workbench model {{TypeRef}} is the _magic_ value - again, the _magic_ value is only to be used _client-side_.
- Check that creating new data-types does not show the _magic_ value (it uses a different widget, but population of the widget probably iterates all {{BuiltInType}}.

[~tari_manga] [~karreiro] seem reasonable to you?
column422: 06/Nov/18 4:32 AM;tari_manga;If the Stunner/framework of the UI does not support null values, then what you describe sounds indeed the most reasonable workaround.
column423: 06/Nov/18 7:38 AM;karreiro;[~manstis] I try to avoid the use of {{null}} as part of the business logic as much as possible, so a value representing the absence of the {{TypeRef}} sounds perfectly reasonable to me :-)
column424: 06/Nov/18 8:34 AM;jomarko;[~manstis] Hi, isn't this related to any of current epics we have?
column425: 07/Nov/18 8:45 PM;tirelli;I think we can keep it in master only.

column1: [DMN Designer] Decision table output data type is not stored if decision table is generated according to input data
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
The decision table output column data type is not stored, if the decision table was generated according to some input data. 

An example of such table is attached  [^auto.dmn] . This table was created in steps below:
- Create new DMN diagram
- Add an Input Data node : *applicant*
- Add a Decision node: *applicant score*
- Connect them
- Define new data type: *tApplicant*.
-- lang:string (Constraints: "c", "java")
-- open source: boolean
- Set *applicant* node data type as *tApplicant*
- Set *applicant score* node data type as *number*
- Open expression editor for *applicant score* node
- Set its top level expression as Decision Table
- Save and download DMN model
- It will be like the attached

{code:xml}
      <dmn:output id="_E6C7E5E6-45C5-4FC2-A37B-69806046893F" name="output-1" typeRef="string">
        <dmn:outputValues id="_B473BAB4-521D-4FD9-88BC-C28CD497F03A">
          <dmn:text></dmn:text>
        </dmn:outputValues>
        <dmn:defaultOutputEntry id="_85BF133E-380C-4F0E-9E2A-0C5C6493F6B4" typeRef="string">
          <dmn:text></dmn:text>
        </dmn:defaultOutputEntry>
      </dmn:output>
{code}
column404: Create Decision table at first and then connect Input data nodes with the decision node.

column1: [DMN Designer] Decision table output data type is not stored
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
Issue spotted during DROOLS-3214, however probably not related.

If decision table output data type is changed, the change is not reflected in the xml.

Please follow my steps:
- Create new DMN diagram
- Add a decision node
- Set the decision node top level expression as a decision table
- Double click on Output header cell
- Select boolean lets say
- Save the diagram

Check the source, there will be still stored string output data type, like below:
{code:xml}
<dmn:decisionTable id="_DE6CDA18-99D1-4259-9F6D-825209DF7DE8" typeRef="string" hitPolicy="ANY" preferredOrientation="Rule-as-Row">
      <dmn:input id="_EB7B7C02-4131-468C-B1B1-023C39045B66">
        <dmn:inputExpression id="_C72A9C94-130C-4BA5-A529-49BAE217DDFF" typeRef="string">
          <dmn:text>input-1</dmn:text>
        </dmn:inputExpression>
        <dmn:inputValues id="_1EC58DD6-21EB-4822-A333-581363BC325B">
          <dmn:text></dmn:text>
        </dmn:inputValues>
      </dmn:input>
      <dmn:output id="_81248A6E-0239-404A-B891-C7C0BEE6B501" name="output-1" typeRef="string">
        <dmn:outputValues id="_26301186-9EB2-43E8-B6F8-458361E99B45">
          <dmn:text></dmn:text>
        </dmn:outputValues>
        <dmn:defaultOutputEntry id="_EAC89F66-3B9E-4781-B670-1282975F4F1E" typeRef="string">
          <dmn:text></dmn:text>
        </dmn:defaultOutputEntry>
      </dmn:output>
      <dmn:rule id="_EC0CEE6B-E4D5-4DE2-9EE5-86C955933B4E">
        <dmn:inputEntry id="_91AA6110-0A85-4C95-B0B3-D1B084CB0089">
          <dmn:text>"you are right"</dmn:text>
        </dmn:inputEntry>
        <dmn:outputEntry id="_6FACD1CE-8301-413E-8C77-F04AD71B3C78" typeRef="string">
          <dmn:text>true</dmn:text>

25/Oct/18 10:17 AM;manstis;The problem is when the {{InputData}} is first created it has an {{InformationItem}} with {{typeRef}} of (for example) {{feel:string}}.

When it is saved and re-opened this becomes {{string}}. When the Decision Table is created {{string}} does not match any {{ItemDefinitions}} and no column is created.

This conversion from {{feel:string}} to {{string}} did not happen with DMN1.1.

IDK whether dropping of the prefix was a change in 1.2 or whether this is a bug in the marshaller.

The saved XML is:

    <dmn:variable id="_38BEAD43-AF48-4F54-853E-4487929DB80D" name="" typeRef="string"></dmn:variable>
  </dmn:inputData>
  <dmndi:DMNDI xmlns:dmndi="http://www.omg.org/spec/DMN/20180521/DMNDI/">
    <dmndi:DMNDiagram>
      <dmndi:DMNShape id="dmnshape-_1584517F-3FAD-4212-80EE-9ABB66E98140" dmnElementRef="_1584517F-3FAD-4212-80EE-9ABB66E98140" isCollapsed="false">
        <dmndi:DMNStyle>

      </dmndi:DMNShape>

  </dmndi:DMNDI>
</dmn:definitions>

For the future, please do not use jira ticket as placeholder/notebook of every improvement/fix requests, especially ticket marked as "Bug" : it creates a lot of confusion and makes hard to track specific issues.
column435:
24/Oct/18 7:36 AM;jsoltes;[~gabriolo] [~uxdlc] Hello, one more thing to update... the left margin on the Test Editor Tab - see the picture below,
There needs to be some, probably at the same level as the paragraph underneath.

!test-editor-margin.png|thumbnail!
column436: 24/Oct/18 8:15 AM;jsoltes;[~gabriolo] [~uxdlc] Regarding the insert top row, insert bottom row options. I don't really see why are these needed - i think the insert row below and insert row above should be enough for the user. I even confused them with the latter when I tried to use them for the first time. So I think in this case we do a favor to the user when we remove them. Also it would make the menu shorter and more concise.
column437:
24/Oct/18 8:39 AM;danielezonca;[~jsoltes]
Regarding padding/margin on Test Editor Tab we already have it in the list
_Add some padding to right panel the tab titles_
And maybe has been already changed/fixed by [~srambach]. [~srambach], can you please confirm that? 

Regarding contextual menu' there is a shared doc where we are discussing/discussed about that so please read/comment there 
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lHQ1mvmzQcgWbxwkBobIXb9mV6uM3RLbEll8-OHLAFc/edit#heading=h.xi9d8cokx5mq
column438:
24/Oct/18 8:51 AM;srambach;[~jsoltes] The best solution if you can do it, is to add padding to the container rather than trying to margin all the contents - then it's consistent and reliable.

Inline styling isn't a good solution, but just to show you, this would be the element to add it to I think -
<div id="right-panel" class="tab-pane kie-dock active" data-i18n-prefix="RightPanelViewImpl." {color:#FF8B00}style="padding: 1em;{color}">
column439:
24/Oct/18 9:03 AM;jsoltes;[~srambach] sure, I used wrong terminology... I meant like adding any space in general - you are the expert for choosing the right type. Please ignore this part, I did not notice it's already in the description.

[~danielezonca] in the document I was unable to find anything regarding "insert top row" and "insert bottom row" actions.
column440: 24/Oct/18 10:27 AM;uxdlc;[~jsoltes] Thanks for calling out the incorrect menu labels ("insert top row"), they should follow the guidelines outlined in the document ("insert row above".)
column441:
24/Oct/18 10:54 AM;danielezonca;[~uxdlc]
Ok we can change it but keep in mind that "insert top row" is for add a new row as first row and not just above the selected one. IIRC we have also "insert row above" in the menu.
The same for "insert bottom row": add a new row at the end of the table and not just below
column442: 24/Oct/18 11:24 AM;jsoltes;[~uxdlc] I also thought it is just incorect label, but as [~danielezonca] says, it is an whole extra functionality, which I think is not necessary (and ambiguous). i vote for removing these completely.
column443:
24/Oct/18 11:34 AM;gabriolo;[~uxdlc]
So, what's the decision: remove "insert top row" and "insert bottom row" and keep only "insert row above" and "insert row below" ?
What about the "header" contextual menu?  Of course there is no meaning in "above" and "below" with the click being on the header. Please answer ASAP so that I can make the fix quickly, Thx.
column444: 24/Oct/18 11:47 AM;uxdlc;[~gabriolo][~danielezonca][~jsoltes][~ibek] Well this top row, bottom row, and etc would be in the family of ordering and reordering rows (as a feature), yes? Do we have a jira story for that?
column445:
24/Oct/18 11:52 AM;gabriolo;[~uxdlc]
Ordering and reordering is a different feature. 
Now we are talking only of creating the rows, and menus to do that. 
So, which menu items do you think we need to create the rows?
column446: 24/Oct/18 11:58 AM;uxdlc;[~gabriolo] I didn't add these menu items as part of the design, so we should confer with [~danielezonca]? From my perspective, I'm inclined to agree with [~jsoltes] - it seems like a partial solution for new functionality, so it might be ambiguous.
column447: 25/Oct/18 5:22 AM;jsoltes;[~uxdlc] Thank you :). [~gabriolo] Regarding the header menu, I would remove it from there, too. I think there it is even more confusing, since I would expect to have only header-related actions in the header context menu.
column448: 25/Oct/18 8:35 AM;uxdlc;* [~gabriolo] According to the proposed contextual menu "pattern" documented at - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lHQ1mvmzQcgWbxwkBobIXb9mV6uM3RLbEll8-OHLAFc/edit#bookmark=id.nh1jr8q8sik4 - the menu items "insert row above" and "insert row below" are recommended as a general pattern and would align with the DMN menus. I'm a little confused why these aren't suitable? [~stetson.robinson] As you helped with the menu labels, just want to confirm with you as well. ^^ Thanks.
column449: 25/Oct/18 8:41 AM;uxdlc;[~gabriolo] [~danielezonca] Just want to point out that the new grid colors are posted at: https://issues.jboss.org/browse/DROOLS-3151.
column450:
25/Oct/18 10:09 AM;gabriolo; [~uxdlc]
I guess you have now a real working environment to test it, so:
when you create a new scenario asset, you have an "empty grid" with just one empty row.
If now you right click on the "header", and the menu shows you "Insert row above" and "Insert row below", "above" and "below" what are relative to?
If, on the other side, there are three rows in the grid, and the menu shows you "Insert row above" and "Insert row below", "above" and "below" which row are referring to ?
To make it clear, I am not talking of the contextual menu of the "body" of the grid, I am talking only about the menu of the header.
column451: 25/Oct/18 10:34 AM;bdellasc;Thanks for linking over to that JIRA, [~uxdlc]
column452:
25/Oct/18 10:21 PM;uxdlc;[~gabriolo] K, I've looked at a version. The items you are raising weren't part of the design. The original design did not have an "Index" or "Description" header. Instead the starting point was intended to focus solely on the first step which was to create Given and Expect statements. 
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-25 at 9.53.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 
Likewise, there was not a concept of multiple header rows (multi instance.) So I need to double-back a little and ask you a couple of questions:
* If we're now providing an empty scenario row by default (initial view), do we even need contextual menus on the headers? 
* Do we need the Index and Description headers at all? Instead the initial row could offer hint text in the cell:
 |  1  |  _Enter a scenario description_   | _Enter value_ | ...
column453:
26/Oct/18 2:29 AM;gabriolo;[~uxdlc]
About Index/Description header:
Maybe it is possible, but surely it is not just a "delete one line" operation; so, for the moment being I would keep them there.
  /----/
About this header menu: 
Liz, please, *I'm* asking you what to do. I just underlined to you what (from my point of view) could be a little un-consistence. Please tell me, without keeping asking, what do you prefer the interaction to be, I'm not in love with any of those menu, I can live without. If you want them to be removed, I remove. If you want them to be renamed, I rename. If you want a different interaction, I'll implement.
About that document you keep referring to, it can not be considered final by any mean. It is only using the real software while is developed that you may understand what is actually needed, what needs to be changed, and so on and so forth. I'm using it all the day, and whatever doubt or objection I raise is due to the actual usage, being myself not only a "developer" but also a "user".
And that drive to my last consideration: if you were able to use a real instance of the scenario is *great*, but now we need a way so that you may look at what I'm currently doing: my last PR (3095), the multi-instance, has a huge impact and implications, and it is taking a lot of time: to wait for you to see it until is merged in master would be a big waste of time, because surely I'm doing things with "developer" eye, that has never matched, in historical reports, UX one :).
column454:
26/Oct/18 9:55 AM;uxdlc;[~gabriolo] I discussed the items with [~danielezonca] and we agreed on this change list:

- Change “Index” header label to hash sign: “#”
- Change “Description” header label to: “Scenario description”
- Contextual menus: Remove “Scenario: Insert top/bottom row.” 
- Contextual menus in headers: Remove "Scenario: Insert top/bottom row” and replace those options with only Scenario: “Insert row below”
- Eliminate the possibility for the user to remove all scenario rows. Instead, if the user choices to deletes the last row remaining then delete it, but replace it with an “empty” row.
column455: 26/Oct/18 10:19 AM;uxdlc;[~danielezonca] One small "nice to have" item - what do you think about having the Scenario description column being left-aligned versus center aligned?
column456: 06/Nov/18 8:07 AM;danielezonca;Missing part will be tracked by https://issues.jboss.org/browse/DROOLS-3254

column422:
16/Oct/18 7:06 AM;manstis;[~jomarko] I could only replicate when the {{Context}} editor was in this _state_:

 !DROOLS-3149.png|thumbnail! 

Changing the "Decison-1" data-type did indeed lead to the "ContextEntry-1" properties being shown.

The fix I have submitted ensures when the editor is in the shown _state_ that editing the "Decision-1" does not show the "ContextEntry-1" properties.

At the moment we do not support _selecting_ headers (visually; i.e. no blue border around a header). When this is fixed (there is a JIRA assigned to [~danielezonca] I believe) we should be able to improve things. At the moment when the editor is in the shown state and "Decision-1" edited there is no _selection_.

column10: The Drools project.

column1: [DMN Designer] NameAndDataTypeEditorViewImpl needs to hide if the User navigates to the Data Type dialog
column10: The Drools project.
column39: The {{NameAndDataTypeEditorViewImpl}} contains a link to the "Data Type Dialog". When this is clicked on the dialog is displayed and the _source_ {{Popover}} remains visible. The proposal is to close the {{Popover}} if the User clicks on the link to the "Data Type Dialog".

column424: 30/Aug/18 8:04 AM;tari_manga;Thanks [~jomarko]
column425:
30/Aug/18 8:20 AM;tari_manga;I tried to reproduce the problem from the -backend module, but without success: https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/compare/master...tarilabs:tarilabs-20180830

You can use this as a simplified reproducer, so there must be something from UI side which is enriching the model with data which I didn't actually unmarshall in the first place. I can notice for instance an AllowedValues is added to the latter ItemDefinition, and a lot of attributes which I originally unmarshalled as null are actually valorized as an empty string.

I am afraid this is occuring from the F/E side so only [~manstis] can kindly take a look here?

If you find a way to reproduce the problem on the module, I'd be glad to take a second look --at present I don't think is a problem with the converters.
column426: 30/Aug/18 8:24 AM;manstis;[~tari_manga] Sure, I was planning on taking a look - that's why I didn't reassign it to you. I just thought you might be interested to check DMN core too.
column427:
31/Aug/18 11:44 AM;manstis;[~manstis] See https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/pull/2079#issuecomment-417680492

{{DMNElements}} currently have _default_ values of child {{DMNElements}} set to non-null instances. This now causes problems as we have Errai's marshallers call the setters (instead of using the {{@MapsTo}} constructors) the marshallers ARE NOT calling {{setXYZ(value)}} when {{value == null}}. The fix is to remove the instantiation of default objects for {{DMNElements}} and use {{null}} instead. This will account for many of the valorized objects reported by [~tari_manga].

column1: [DMN Designer] Stack overflow when a Context has two Relations
column10: The Drools project.
column39:
Create a {{Context}} with two {{ContextEntries}}. Set both to be a {{Relation}}. Stack overflow :-(

You can have multiple {{Relation}} in different {{Contexts}} it only happens when within the same {{Context}}.

h2. Manual acceptance test
- Top level context, multiple entries of different kinds (/)
- Nested level context, multiple entries of different kinds (/)
column422: 23/Aug/18 10:38 AM;manstis;The problem is that {{RelationColumn.getMinimumWidthOfPeers()}} traverses rows in the parent table, excluding that of the current {{RelationGrid}}, and gets the expression editors' [minimum width|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/blob/master/kie-wb-common-dmn/kie-wb-common-dmn-client/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/dmn/client/editors/expressions/types/relation/RelationColumn.java#L84]. When there are two {{RelationGrids}} this call tries to get the minimum width of the second table, that tries to get the minimum width of the first, that tries the minimum width of the first etc...
column423: 04/Sep/18 9:39 AM;jomarko;[~manstis] Please where can be the Stack Overflow spotted, in UI, in browser console, in server log?
column424: 04/Sep/18 9:43 AM;manstis;[~jomarko] In the browser. IIRC the browser reports a different error (in the popup that occurs, but the browser console shows a stack overflow).

column424:
02/Aug/18 5:22 AM;kgaevski;Hi [~manstis], [~jomarko],

jBPM engine needs SVG to display current active node in a running process. It wasn't mandatory for 6.x, but since 7.0.GA we need to generate SVG for every process before execution, so Designer generating SVG files on save.

But I am not sure is this use case valid for the DMN editor.
column425: 03/Aug/18 12:16 PM;tirelli;SVG is important for DMN as well, but we will need other documentation formats as well (namely, PDF).

06/Aug/18 7:11 AM;manstis;[~jomarko] The BPMN Editor does not save multiple versions (it uses the same file name each time it is saved) so something in DMN is amiss.

This JIRA represents the behaviour of a DMN SVG file being automatically created and saved whenever the DMN file is saved.. i.e. no User interaction required to generate the SVG file other than saving the DMN file in the editor.
column427: 08/Aug/18 10:12 AM;tirelli;[~manstis] sorry, I misunderstood the ticket then. I would say ideally we should disable this auto-generation then as it is unnecessary. If the user wants to save, he can explicitly click to export it.

column423:
05/Feb/19 5:16 AM;danielezonca;[~jomarko] [~manstis]
That ticket is intended to improve full page width for canvas grid component so it is not directly related to this one.
Btw we need to add persistence of column size for sure also in Test Scenario so let me know if the way are you using to implement this can be reused
column424:
05/Feb/19 11:30 AM;manstis;[~danielezonca] [~jomarko] There's no _magic_ to how DMN persists the column widths.

The DMN XML file format supports _extensions_ and hence we've created one to store the grids' columns' widths. 

It's not really re-usable by other editors as it is really specific to the DMN specification.

column1: Rich Text assembly visual style / background image
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
By default i.e. no visual styles applied, there is supposed to be a background image applied (via CSS) to the Rich Text assembly type. The image is `/themes/custom/rhdp/docs/img/white_diamond_background.png`. You can see the styles in `/themes/custom/rhdp/rhd-frontend/src/styles/assembly/_rich_text.scss`.

I discussed this with [~gdoyle], and she felt that, by default, no background image should be applied. A background image could be applied with a visual style however.

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* All Rich Text assemblies currently using the 'No background' visual style should have that visual style removed
* The 'No background' visual style should be deleted
column422:
02/Aug/19 12:25 AM;jordan.white;[~gdoyle] Could you do a UX review of this ticket using the Verification Steps in the PR here please?

https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/pull/3000

Thank you!
column423: 02/Aug/19 8:25 AM;gdoyle;[~jordan.white] The second verification step said "Verify that this is no 'No background' visual style option on the Rich Text assembly here" - want to confirm that this was supposed to say "there is no default background applied to a rich text assembly" (unless you were to choose a visual style or import your own background image). With that said - there was no background image applied so that checked out! There was also no "No background" visual style listed (although we don't need that). All the other ones seemed to be there (y)
column424: 02/Aug/19 10:11 AM;jordan.white;[~gdoyle] Cool, thank you. This specific PR actually removes the 'No background' visual style, as it no longer makes any sense since the assembly doesn't display a background by default (no visual styles).
column425: 02/Aug/19 10:22 AM;gdoyle;[~jordan.white] Oh great, that makes sense! Thank you!! Added the ux_approved label here

column1: Nodes can share a single URL alias
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h3. Description

If an editor accidentally creates 2 nodes with the same URL aliases, it becomes impossible for them to access to node edit form of the node that was first assigned the URL alias AND there seems to be no way for an editor to revert their changes or otherwise undo this.

h3. Developer workaround

h5. Step 1 - Get the node id of the node(s) that shouldn't have the alias

Go here: https://developers.redhat.com/admin/structure/views/view/content 

* Add the Content: ID (ID) Views field to the View so that you can actually see/get the node id
* Scroll down to the preview and take note of the node IDs you need

h5. Step 2 - Remove the alias from those nodes

* Go to the URL aliases config page: https://developers.redhat.com/admin/config/search/path/filter
* Search for the alias and you should see the 2 (or more) aliases
* Remove the aliases for the nodes that shouldn't have the alias

h5. Step 3 - Add a new URL alias to these nodes

* Go to https://developers.redhat.com/[one-of-the-node-ids]/edit and update the URL alias field and persist the form
column373:
* Create a node and assign a URL alias like /test0711191512 and save the node
* Create another node and assign a URL alias like /test0711191512 and save the node

column1: Modals can break if modal height extends beyond browser height
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h3. Description

Certain Drupal modals may become partially unusable by content creators / editors if the contents of the modal extend beyond the height of the modal and browser window and scrolling is not permitted.

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* Compose somehow accounts for the contents of a modal such that all modals should be usable even if the contents for whatever reason extend beyond the expect height/width of a modal.
* The token browser modal specifically can be used/navigated by an editor

h3. Temporary workaround

* Add an overflow: scroll in the meantime to make the token browser usable (and the same goes for any other modals that might suffer from this issue)
column373:
Go here: https://localhost/admin/config/search/metatag/node__assembly_page

Do this:

* Click on 'Browser available tokens'

You should see this:

* The token browser modal will be a fixed height, but the content of the modal is not and will extend beyond the bottom of the modal and beyond the bottom of the browser height AND a user cannot scroll to see the tokens.

* Suspect: path-auto, probably not permission related, URL aliases

Reported by: [~mikgue]
column373:
* Create a Product in a draft state
* Try to visit the product using the /node/[nid] route

You should receive the error/message "you are not authorized to access this page."
column422:
23/Apr/19 4:56 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

I tested this with an Article node type, and I could not reproduce it, so this might be specific to Product nodes.
column423:
23/Apr/19 5:09 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

I just attempted to recreate this with both an old product page (paragraph-based) and a new product page (assembly-based). On my local environment, I logged into an account with only the Content Creator permission. In both instances, I was able to access the product page draft using the node/[nid] route. The only scenario in which I could get the "you are not authorized to access this page." error was when I tried to access the page via an incognito window without authenticating.

I am not sure, in this moment, what I can do differently to try to recreate this issue. My only guess, at this point, is that perhaps the Content Creator that Mike was working with was timed out of their account but the browser didn't reflect that change yet perhaps without a refresh.

column1: Article TOC links need to change color on hover/selection/area
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
Article TOC jump-to links should be changing color from original state #0066cc to #004c98 on hover state and once the reader is at that section. (https://developers.redhat.com/coderland/serverless/serverless-knative-intro/)

Example situation:
TOC has 3 sections: Intro, Middle, End
*Use case 1*: If the reader hovers over "Intro" in the TOC, the color should change from #0066cc to #004c98. When the reader selects "Intro" in the TOC, the scroll behavior will work as it currently does but "Intro" link on TOC will remain #004c98 upon selection.
*Use case 2*: When the reader scrolls to Intro within the article, the "Intro" link on the TOC color should change from #0066cc to #004c98.
*Use case 3*: When the reader scrolls to Middle within the article, the "Intro" link on the TOC should return to #0066cc and the "Middle" link on the TOC should change to #004c98.

column1: URL alias required and content creators cannot set URL aliases
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
Content Creators (users with only the Content Creator role) cannot successfully create nodes because the URL alias field is required but they do not have permission to set a URL alias.

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* Content Creators can successfully create all node types without being blocked in any way by the URL alias field
column373:

* Try to create an Article node
* You will receive a form validation error that the URL alias is required, but you (your role) does not have permission to see/set a URL alias
column422:
30/Apr/19 4:21 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

Pull request: https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/pull/2925

I am reverting the change I made in DEVELOPER-5664 in this pull request.

In DEVELOPER-5664, I removed the permission for Content Creators to
add/edit URL aliases. This was part of an effort to reduce clutter on
Node edit forms. At the time, I thought that the URL aliases for all
nodes were being generated automatically by Pathauto. That is not the
case, so this was a regression.

Furthermore, now that we are using Compose and the URL alias field is
not on the main page causing visual bloat, I do not think that this is
adding to UX clutter.

h3. Next steps

* Review once PR environment builds
