column1: Rollback search_api to 8.1.11 on 2 broken PRs
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h3. Description

After a quick look into this, it seems that there is some confusion within Drupal as to whether or not the search_api module is enabled. I will post a Slack comment that I made on Friday for context:

{quote}I am not sure how/why, but it seems that Drupal thinks the `search_api` module is installed (at least according to the `lightning_config` table's `core.extension`, which I would suspect should be the definitive 'truth' of whether or not a module is considered enabled/installed. However, the Drupal admin interface seems to think that the module is not installed, and the fact that the hook_update_N() cannot be found also suggests the module is likely not installed

I tried installing the module locally, which resulted in a fatal error that I can't seem to get around. I'll rebuild my environment and keep debugging.{quote}

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* In this ticket, the only deliverable will be to get the 2 broken PR builds to build cleanly by downgrading to search_api:8.1.11
* In DEVELOPER-5770, we will actually investigate _why_ search_api hook_update_8105() results in a fatal updb
column373:
View https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/pull/2885 or https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/pull/2872 PR builds and you will see the failure:

{code}
[1BError: Docker container 'rhdpr2885_drupal_1' does not appear to be running. Please use 'docker logs -f rhdpr2885_drupal_1' to investigate any start-up failures.
{code}

{code}
 Module       Update ID   Type            Description                          
 ------------ ----------- --------------- ------------------------------------- 
  jsonapi      8701        hook_update_n   Enable BC: default the new           
                                           read-only mode to "off" on existing  
                                           sites.                               
  search_api   8105        hook_update_n   Update the configuration schema of   
                                           the "Ignore characters" processor.   
 ------------ ----------- --------------- ------------------------------------- 

 // Do you wish to run the specified pending updates?: yes.                     

 [notice] Update started: jsonapi_update_8701
 [ok] Update completed: jsonapi_update_8701
 [warning] Update function search_api_update_8105 not found
 [error]  Update failed: search_api_update_8105 
 [error]  Update aborted by: search_api_update_8105 
 [error]  Finished performing updates. 
        from drupal_install_checker.rb:111:in `drush_updb'
        from drupal_install_checker.rb:30:in `prepare_drupal_for_boot'
        from drupal_install_checker.rb:133:in `<main>'
{code}
column422:
26/Mar/19 12:28 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

[copying from a Slack message I sent out to the dev team]

I am 99% sure that I just confirmed locally that the bug with the PRs builds should only impact two of my open PRs:

https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/pull/2885 and
https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/pull/2872

because the `search_api` module was updated to version 1.12.0 in both of those branches, which you can see in `composer.lock` files. Example:

https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/pull/2872/files#diff-f621e628af31c3ffc85bb5dd895a0566R7036

I still am not completely sure _why_ this particular update hook is failing on our installation. If I cannot determine an obvious fault on our part quickly, I will open up a ticket in the `search_api` issue queue and start some discussion with the maintainers.

For now though, it seems that this was a semi-false alarm in that we don't _need_ to update to that version of `search_api` immediately. We will need to update to it fairly soon though because it is included in the latest release of Lightning, but this at least gives us some wiggle room to address this issue. I know that is somewhat crucial given the Compose functionality deadline.

h3. Next steps

* Ensure my suspicion is definitely correct by updating PRs and making sure the builds go green
column423:
26/Mar/19 12:29 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

[copy and pasting from a Slack message I sent out to dev team]

I forgot to provide an update to my comment towards the end of the day yesterday. Summary: I was accurate with my suspicion that only 2 of my open PRs should be impacted by the 'bug' that is breaking PRs. No action required on anyone else's behalf.

Unfortunately this bug is coming in from the newest version of the Drupal `search_api` module, so this will be something I will need to look at and resolve at some point, but there is no significantly motivating reason that we _need_ to be on the latest version of that module ASAP, so it does not necessarily need to be resolved during this sprint. Instead, I can document it in my current ticket and roll back the version on my 2 impacted PRs.

h3. Next steps

* Update core composer.lock PR also
column424:
26/Mar/19 4:48 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

Given that this task can wait, I am updating this ticket such that the acceptance criteria is rolling back to search_api 8.1.11. I will create a new ticket: https://issues.jboss.org/browse/DEVELOPER-5770 that will address actually resolving the issue of updating to 8.1.12.

Document user roles, permissions, automation, and who has what.

It seems very likely that this is somehow related to content moderation or a module in that family of modules
column373:
Reported in #rhdp-website by Bob Davis

"Is there a reason I’m getting email from Drupal every couple minutes that content is ready to review?"
column422:
25/Mar/19 11:40 AM;joeschram;[~jordan.white] I believe the emails were the result of a product page being moved to "Needs Review" status. That was Jeff Beck in the Mididleware BU, and he emailed David and I directly this weekend for the fix. I changed the status back to "draft" today.

What I don't know is, why so many people were sent the "Content needs review" email…like Bob Davis shouldn't have gotten that.

The work for this ticket is likely to figure out the user roles, who has what, and the automations that fire for each role type.
column423: 19/Apr/19 11:13 AM;jordan.white;[~joeschram] Would you consider this ticket a duplicate (or inclusive in some way) of the requirements of this ticket DEVELOPER-5773? If so, I can explicitly update the ticket description and tag it to make it clear. Thank you.
column424:
10/May/19 6:23 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

This turned into a much bigger effort than I originally anticipated. The permissions/roles are very far from where they should be. I will take note of some of the bigger issues I've noticed thus far below since I might not get in a PR by the end of my day today.

h4. Users with no role

It seems to me that users with no role shouldn't have access to anything. I am not sure if we are maybe trying for something else. I will need to have this discussion, re: direction/strategy, I suppose with Joe and/or Paul or maybe Luke and Jason.

The current status of the no role user is very odd and confusing. Thankfully, we only have 1 internal no role users, so this is not currently an issue. Some noteworthy issues with the no role user:

* Can view all content /admin/content and media /admin/content/media, but cannot interact (edit/delete) any of it. This seems unnecessary to me.
* There are particular actions/views that users with no role have access to that they should *not* have access to. I will not list those here, but I've documented them privately in Slack.
* Can cancel their own account and change their own username
* There are a number of content editing related permissions granted to the no role user, but that user doesn't have permission to edit any content

h4. Layout Manager

I do not think that Layout Managers need the following permissions:

* Content: Administer display

h4. Content admin

I do not think that Content Admin need the following permissions:

* Administer content moderation notifications
* Administer entity browsers
* Administer image styles
* Administer linkit profiles
* Administer media types
* Administer meta tags
** "Control the main settings pages and modify per-object meta tags."

h3. Next steps

* Get all of these changes, and any other necessary permission changes, into a PR, and we can start a discussion based upon the PR environment and permission changes
column425:
13/May/19 10:54 AM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

Also, with regards to the original report of this issue from Bob Davis, he was/is receiving emails from Content Moderation Notifications because he has the Content Reviewer role, and we have configured this rule: `/admin/config/workflow/notifications/manage/ready_for_review?destination=/admin/config/workflow/notifications`

h3. Next steps

* Get all of these changes (discussed in the comment above) into a PR, and we can start a discussion based upon the PR environment and permission changes
* Discuss with Joe which users should receive the 'Ready For Review' notifications and update our config accordingly

column1: automated-tests-user cannot authenticate using legacy login on PR environments
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
The automated-tests-user account cannot authenticate using the legacy login form on PR environments, which has caused a regression in / has entirely prevented our PR testing.

h3. Related

Ian has raised a PR https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/pull/2867 that will allow us to use the SSO method of authentication to provide a quicker fix to this issue so we can test PRs
column373:
* Go to a PR environment like http://rhdp-jenkins-slave.lab4.eng.bos.redhat.com:37863/
* Go to http://rhdp-jenkins-slave.lab4.eng.bos.redhat.com:37863/user/login and click on the Legacy Login button to reveal the Drupal login form
* Enter the credentials for `automated-tests-user` and submit the form
* You should not be authenticated after the form submits

NOTE: If you repeat these same steps but on the stage or Prod environments, you should be authenticated properly to the automated-tests-user account

column1: Improve UX for Product content type between new & deprecated fields
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h3. Description

Currently, there is little visual distinction between the 'old' product page fields and the 'new', assembly-based product page fields on the node edit form. I did my best to group the new product page, assembly based fields using a fieldgroup in such a way that I had hoped would provide a visual distinction, however it seems that isn't as obvious as I had assumed.

+*Approval on Staging Composer branch to flow out when it is released.*+

Mike has suggested we try using a background color to make the visual distinction between the fields more clear.

We need to either split these into different content types or make a clear visual distinction between 'old' product page section and 'new' product page section on Product node edit form 

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* Determine if a background color is 1) feasible and 2) the best way to visual distinguish between these 2 groups of fields
* Include Mike (and other editors if necessary) in the conversation to get feedback on their experience
* Implement whatever is decided to be the best editor UX

column422:
12/Feb/19 3:06 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

Pull request: https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/pull/2829

This resolves an issue that prevented the following links (and
associated link text) from displaying for every Connector:
field_connector_link_1, field_connector_link_1_text,
field_connector_link_2, field_connector_link_2_text and
field_connector_details_url.

We were not properly accessing these values anyway, but in addition to
that, we were not verifying that any value(s) existed for any of the
fields before trying to access them, which resulted in both nothing
being rendered and many errors being thrown in the logs any time the
Connectors page was visited.

I am now verifying values exist, in a preprocessor for the
views-view-fields, and then accessingt those values and setting them in
the $variables array before accessing them in the Twig template.

h3. Next steps

* Review once Jenkins builds the PR environment

column1: Sitemap broken/inaccurate for new product pages
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
We are hooking into the simple sitemap module to provide custom routes due to the custom nature of the routing of our product pages. However, in our recent product experience epic, it was decided that the routing of the product pages should change slightly. Now the sitemap is not reflecting these changes, but instead it still displays the routes generated from the Paragraphs referenced from the Product pages.

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* If a product is using the new design, it should generate these sitemap routes using the reference assemblies NOT the referenced paragraphs
* Product pages using the old design should still generate sitemap entries using the paragraph references
column373:

You should see this:

* The routes listed for Codeready in the sitemap do not reflect the actual available routes

column1: Display status messages block on user login page
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
Currently, if a user authentication fails, there is no error message, or other information, presented to the user to justify the failed authentication. This is really confusing and poor UX. We can use the Drupal core status messages block for this.

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* The status messages block displays to users on the user login route so that they are informed of errors that may occur from a failed authentication
column373:

column1: New Product Pages created in a Draft state can be accessed by anonymous users
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Description

New Product Pages created in a Draft state can be accessed by anonymous users.

h2. Steps to recreate

* Create a new Product node (/node/add/product)
* Use a fake value for Product Code and URL Product Name
* Fill in any required fields
* Within the NEW PRODUCT PAGE FIELDS fieldset
** Check the Use New Product Page checkbox
** Add at least 1 assembly to each of the 3 assembly fields: Content, Downloads Page Content and Getting Started Page Content
* Publish the page in a Draft state

You should notice:

* If you access the page you just created in an anonymous/incognito window, you can still see the Draft version of the Product node

h2. Stakeholders

* ENG: [~lightguard] [~jordan.white]

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* A draft product page should not be displayed at any point until it is published.

h2. Review steps

* Create a draft product page and ensure that it is not possible to visit this page as an anonymous user and the product page does not appear in {{sitemap.xml}}
column422:
13/Dec/18 11:22 AM;paul.robinson;[~jordan.white] do you have an ETA on when this will be done? We are working out when we can go live with the first new product page, and this seems like something that should be done first. 

CC [~sjcox]
column423: 13/Dec/18 1:47 PM;jordan.white;[~paul.robinson] Hey Paul. [~sjcox] and I discussed this ticket yesterday. I am working on it now. I am hoping that I can get up a pull request by the end of my workday. I can update you an SJ on my status of course.
column424:
13/Dec/18 3:26 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

[~paul.robinson] and [~sjcox] I have been testing this locally. It seems that the issue has been resolved for existing Product pages. If you publish a Draft for an existing product page, which is the way we should be updating our product pages to the 'new product pages', then the Draft should respect the typical permissions i.e. not be available to anonymous users.

However, for whatever reason, the issue seems to remain for newly created Product pages. I've listed out clear steps in a 'Steps to recreate' section in this ticket. I will be working on investigating and resolving that issue now.
column425:
13/Dec/18 6:32 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

This issue exists for both the 'old version' of the Product pages and the new version of the Product pages that we are rolling out, so this has likely been an issue for a long time. It seems possible that it went undetected for so long because, presumably, editors would usually put together published product pages first and Drafts would come later as edits were necessary.

h3. Next steps

* Investigate how to access check routes against content moderation states

column1: It is possible to create two product pages with the same `URL Product Name` value
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Requirements

We have a problem with the export this morning where a Test page has claimed the URL for a full product page. It appears that the test page is also using the {{`openjdk`}} URL Product Name field. It should not be possible to create or copy a Product Content type and end-up with two products using the same value for this field.

h2. Stakeholders

* ENG - [~jordan.white], [~lightguard]
* BUSINESS - [~paul.robinson]

h2. Acceptance Criteria:

* It should not be possible to create a Product Page using a {{URL Product Name}} value that is already in use
* If I copy/duplicate a Product page, I am forced to alter the {{URL Product Name}} value before it can be saved

h2. Review Steps

* Create a product page using a {{URL Product Name}} that is already in use and see that you cannot do that
* Copy/duplicate a product page and see that you're forced to change the {{URL Product Name}} value before it can be saved.
column404: Don't use the same {{URL Product Name}} for any product.

column422:
21/Nov/18 8:51 AM;rblake;[~lightguard] / [~jordan.white] Any ideas as to where this image load might be coming from? We're getting mixed content warnings when deploying on MP,  but I can't see the images mentioned being referenced anywhere in our theme, JS or CSS.

cheers,

Rob

Rob
column424: 26/Nov/18 12:51 PM;lightguard;It may be a background in an assembly.
column425:
03/Dec/18 1:37 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

I believe that these 2 errors are a result of image derivates being generated from the Billboard image style at line 566 of ./web/themes/custom/rhdp/rhdp.theme

It is possible that, at the point in execution of Drupal creating these image derivates, Drupal is retrieving the incorrect domain name / base URL due to the proxy on Managed Platform.

h3. Next steps

* Explore changing proxy config in settings.php, but this needs to be done in a way where it will not impact any environment other than Managed Platform
column426:
25/Jan/19 2:34 AM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

I tried regenerating the image styles and flushing the caches to see if that might resolve this issue, but it did not
column427:
25/Jan/19 2:43 AM;jordan.white;h3. Question

-Is there a reason from a server-type perspective why the site might be trying to resolve these particular images using the IP address instead of the domain name? -

It is no longer doing that
column428:
25/Jan/19 2:50 AM;jordan.white;h3. Observations

In the Source tab of Dev tools, I see:

 !Screen Shot 2019-01-24 at 11.47.21 PM.png|thumbnail! 

but in the Network tab, I see:

 !Screen Shot 2019-01-24 at 11.47.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 

These seem to contradict one another, right?

Also, the blue-gradient *is* loading and rendering as desired:

 !Screen Shot 2019-01-24 at 11.49.47 PM.png|thumbnail!
column429:
25/Jan/19 4:21 AM;rblake;[~jordan.white] So on Managed Platform we re-direct all non-HTTPs traffic to a HTTPS endpoint, so it _may_ be that the original request is for the image is trying to get the HTTP version but being re-directed to the HTTPs version, hence the difference in what you're seeing.

Not sure why it would be trying to retrieve things by IP. First guess: We don't specifically set the {{ServerName}} directive in the Apache VHost, so I wonder if that has something to do with it?

cheers,

Rob
column430: 25/Jan/19 11:51 AM;rblake;Seems that correctly setting the {{ServerName}} directive in the Apache VHost configuration for Drupal has resolved this one.

column1: Fix unit-test build issues
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
Summary:
Since the project was cleaned up, and unit tests were moved to the drupal web-root, the unit-tests have been sending the incorrect test status to Github for PR's. There is also another issue with the HTML that karma generates is not being created inside the docker container, therefore it is not viewable from PR's.

This is a major issue, as even if unit-tests are failing the PR will always state that the tests are passing.

Expected:
- PR receives the correct PR status
- HTML report is generated and is linked to PR's.

column1: Eliminate warning/errors upon building the site
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
There are currently 3 errors that arise during the build process of the site:

* drupal/core patch cannot be applied by Composer
** https://www.drupal.org/files/issues/2421001-124.patch
* OpenAPI warnings upon execution of `drush updb`
** The following module is missing from the file system: openapi_redoc bootstrap.inc:276

h3. Acceptance Criteria

* There should be no warnings or errors raised during the build process of the site
column423:
11/Oct/18 5:35 PM;jordan.white;Follow-up to the above comment:

I verified that I was able to run through the entire build process, but specifically the db updates, without any warning.
column424:
11/Oct/18 5:50 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/pull/2663

This eliminates 2 distinct errors that arise currently during the build
process / the execution of setup_local_drupal.sh.

The first is a Drupal core patch that could not apply,
2421001-124.patch. This issue was resolved in Drupal 8.5.x, so this
patch is no longer necessary. I removed it from composer.json. I also
updated our other core patch to a newer version of the patch that had
more user testing reports within the issue queue.

The second error was a 'missing module in filesystem' error for the
openapi_redoc module. To resolve this issue, I created a Phinx DB
migration that deletes that entry from the key_value table. To ensure
that my SQL query would resolve this issue, I locally ran the query via
drush sql-query and re-executed setup_local_drupal.sh, and I did not
observe a warning or error.

h3. Next steps

* Review pull request
column425: 16/Oct/18 11:59 AM;lightguard;Merged, will be live the morning of 2018-10-17

Do we want the actual HTML tags to be included in the REST export of the image in that way? Please let me know what would work best with DCP, and I can work on implementing any necessary changes in Drupal. Thank you.

column431: 15/Oct/18 3:52 PM;jordan.white;CC [~unibrew] Hi Ryszard. Could you take a look at the structure of the JSON object in the comment above and let me know if you think there is anything that will need to change to make this work with DCP? Thank you.
column432: 15/Oct/18 6:57 PM;unibrew;Any valid JSON works for DCP. This field is not going to be searchable, just returned in the results so I'm good with that. Choice of the field name and value format/content is up to you.
column433: 16/Oct/18 11:19 AM;lightguard;[~jordan.white], yeah, I'm happy with this.
column434:
17/Oct/18 2:05 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

[Pull request|https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/pull/2679]

This adds a Media (Image) field to the Connector content type to store a thumbnail to be displayed on the Connectors page. The new field is added to the Connectors REST Export View, which will be consumed by the DCP. In turn, the front-end of our application will make an AJAX call to the DCP and retrieve the relative URL to the image from the DCP endpoint and serve that on the Connectors Fuse page. In the event that there is not an image uploaded to a Connector, a fallback image will display from static.jboss.org.

CC [~lightguard] [[~unibrew]

Ryszard, what exactly are the steps needed to get this field, which I am adding to the REST export, into the DCP endpoint here: https://dcp2.jboss.org/v2/rest/search/connectors?target_product=fuse 

And, Ryszard, am I correct in thinking that the key to that new field will be `thumbnail__target_id` if that is the key in our REST export?

h3. Next steps

* Make the necessary changes to DCP to consume this new field in the REST export
* Review pull request

column448:
24/Oct/18 6:12 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

The fallback images from static.jboss.org are loading now as intended, except for those Connectors which do not have a fallback image on static.jboss.org.

The images uploaded to the new Connector Image field are not currently displaying as expected though. You can observe this by viewing the Facebook connector, which has an image uploaded to the newly created Connector Image field. This is a consequence of the images being retrieved via a client-side script and the export process not having a way to understand that the Drupal image URL paths will not be available after the export process.

I am discussing this with Jason currently to brainstorm other options.

h3. Next steps

* Determine a plan to make the images retrieved from the DCP both exist and make them viewable (as intended) from the site export.
column449: 25/Oct/18 2:59 PM;jordan.white;I attempted to circumvent this issue by accessing the Media entity reference's image field URI via a preprocessor on the paragraph type. I was able to get the image paths alright, but since we are heavily deviating from Drupal's rendering paradigm, I cannot think of a way (that also satisfies the export process) that instructs Drupal to give these values to a Twig template that it doesn't even know about. The closest Twig template to the individual Connectors that Drupal is aware of is the parent `paragraph--connectors.html.twig`, however, we would need to pass the values iteratively directly to the template rendering each individual connector.
column450:
29/Oct/18 10:38 AM;jordan.white;[~tnolan] I am running into roadblocks on this issue. Could you please review my comment above describing the issue(s) I am facing in completing this issue? It seems that the most obvious way to complete this issue is to wait until we migrate to the managed platform and begin serving Drupal as our public-facing site and get rid of the export process. However, we should discuss the urgency of resolving this bug. If it is something we need to resolve ASAP, I will go back to the drawing board.

h3. Next steps

* Review status
* Discuss urgency of this ticket and how to proceed
column451:
31/Oct/18 4:52 PM;jordan.white;h3. Updates

I am not sure how challenging this will be to implement. It is certainly not straight forward or the intended way of doing this, but it does seem like a plausible compromise in the interim. I will explore this option.

h3. Next steps

* Jordan will explore the option of serving the images from the `/images` directory and populating the REST endpoint, that DCP consumes, with those `/images/...` paths

column1: Ebook download UX Improvements.
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
I wanted to capture a few observations on the ebook download UX (given that ebooks are being promoted fairly heavily).

(The download seemed to get hung up on me twice, no clues what was going on.  Reloading the page cured that.)

* The PDF isn't recognized by the desktop browser as a PDF so it doesn't open automatically.  On desktop (Windows) you are just prompted to save the file. I don't know if the file is presenting as a generic mime type (octet stream) because of download manager requirements, but I think the UX would be improved if the PDF had the right mime type so the browser could do the right thing.  
* The download immediately fails with no error on iOS.  Clicking the direct link works to open the PDF and then the right thing happens.  This might be related to the above.  (Maybe it's just me, but I think downloading the pdf for reading on a mobile device might not be an uncommon use case.)
* The text on the download page needs to be improved, on desktop it says: "Thank you for downloading the: Microservices for Java devs".  This seems a bit awkward.   The iOS version is "Thank you for downloading the: Media:+Microservices+for+Java+devs".  See screen shots.
column422: 02/Nov/18 10:26 AM;amcgrana;[~sjcox][~tnolan] regarding pdf on mobile do we even want pdf download on a mobile device?
column423: 02/Nov/18 11:31 AM;rterzi;Why would you intentionally prevent PDFs from downloading?   Mobile includes tablets like the iPad.   People who commute via public transportation tend to download stuff to read to their phones & tablets.
column424:
02/Nov/18 11:46 AM;sjcox;[~amcgrana]Agree with [~rterzi], I think pdf downloads on mobile is common for the general public. I'm not 100% sure if it's as commonplace for the dev audience, but I don't see what we couldn't provide it as an option anyways.

Just read through the description of this bug and concerning the download text, agreed it needs to be changed. I have a recommendation that I attached but open to feedback! I think it would be best if the same text was shown across all devices. 

 !Screen Shot 2018-11-02 at 11.47.13 AM.png|thumbnail!
column425: 02/Nov/18 12:30 PM;amcgrana;[~sjcox] [~rterzi] On mobile particularly ios automatic download from JS is blocked in the safari so the way our download manager works will not work for ios, this is why there is a secondary link to download the pdf. It is likely we will need to come up with a totally different download flow for mobile explaining this or providing a diffrent download screen for ios which will require UX input.
column426:
05/Nov/18 11:08 AM;sjcox;[~amcgrana] Oh I see. I'll create a UX story in our trello backlog. Is there a story open right now in Jira for an updated flow for mobile download? If so, I can go ahead and link the stories. 

Also, what's the priority of this so I can plan accordingly.

Thanks!
column427: 05/Nov/18 11:14 AM;amcgrana;[~sjcox] not sure about a story, I can fix the + between words but I think looking at the mobile flow would need to be a new story. Ask [~joeschram] for a priority
column428: 07/Nov/18 8:39 AM;amcgrana;[~sjcox] [~joeschram] shall I fix the + issue in the short term and create a new UX story for the mobile flow?
column429:
07/Nov/18 10:35 AM;sjcox;[~amcgrana] Yes that plan works. Clean up the mobile version by removing the +'s and have a new story to revisit the mobile flow. 

As for priority, I'll have [~joeschram] chime in, but I know UX is focusing on product work this sprint so we won't get to it until at least the next sprint.

column431:

Something like if its a mobile display "To download the file to your device please click the direct download link"

column1: Blog – Command line presentation update fixes
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Requirements
Some of the code presentation samples are running over the preformatted (<pre>) block quotes due to the sample command lines being quite long. It's been suggested that we convert these to the [code]/Syntax Highlighter presentations but [~rterzi] points out that this method can lead to incorrect character presentations. With this being the case, the <pre> block CSS needs to be adjusted to allow for length lines of code, whether it be through white space wrapping, adding horizontal scrolling to <pre>'s or possibly devising some other presentation container.

Example Post: https://developers.redhat.com/blog/2018/08/29/intro-to-podman/

h2. Design
* N/A

h2. Stakeholders
* ENG
* UX

h2. Acceptance Criteria
* We can verify that we have a suitable presentation for  code syntax that satisfies UX/Design needs and that does not present characters incorrectly or otherwise mangle code samples.

h2. Review Steps
* Preview any post in stage with the revised code syntax example.
column422:
31/Aug/18 12:12 PM;rterzi;Clarification - the Syntax Highlighter Evolved plugin which gives [code] blocks with syntax highlighting can *badly* mangle the post causing many problems.  The plugin authors claim it's a problem with the WYSIWYG editor wordpress uses and one should just always edit in HTML which isn't really reasonable for many people.

The problem is based on strings that need to be turned into HTML entities in the text because they are meaningful in HTML (so <tags>, ampersands & -> & etc.)   The editor/plugin loose track of what's been turned into HTML entities and start mangling.  When the problem occurs it gets worse on each event that triggers this so a simple & gets turned into & then &amp; then &amp;amp;

Ideally we'd find another/better solution for syntax highlighting and nicely formatted code blocks.  I believe I've already opened one (or more) tickets on this that have the details on the wordpress problems.

A quick workaround is scrollable <pre> blocks.   It's not a great solution but it is a start.

Alternatives that some authors use are:
* pasting in images with screen shots (can't be copied and pasted, can't easily be modified)
* Putting their code in an embed via github gists.
column423:
04/Sep/18 4:39 PM;visuale;[~rterzi] I've added a test to stage to preview the Podman article with a couple of different versions of the <pre> block.

Here's a copy of the original article:
[Original|https://developers.stage.redhat.com/blog/2018/09/04/intro-to-podman-red-hat-enterprise-linux-7-6-beta/]

Here's a version with the code wrapped:
[Wrapping Test|https://developers.stage.redhat.com/blog/2018/09/04/intro-to-podman-red-hat-enterprise-linux-7-6-beta/?pre_test=pre-wrap]

Here's a version which preserves the line-by-line display by allowing horizontal scrolling to take place:
[Side-scrolling Test|https://developers.stage.redhat.com/blog/2018/09/04/intro-to-podman-red-hat-enterprise-linux-7-6-beta/?pre_test=pre-x-scroll]

I tried one other method – expand the element width on hover – but Firefox ignores it and the functionality isn't that great in Google and Firefox, either, even though it does technically work (if the element content is less than the width, then the box shrinks to fit it on hover – looks weird).

column428: 11/Sep/18 5:43 PM;visuale;The updated <pre> CSS (allowing for x-scrolling) is now staged and will put in production on 12 September
column429: 12/Sep/18 7:51 AM;visuale;CSS updates to <pre> are now applied in production.

column1: Remove the display of the time from the published date display (formerly - Video pages show the wrong length in minutes/seconds)
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
New description: Remove the display of the time from the published date display. It should be date only. 

----------------------------------------------
The videos have the wrong length in minutes/seconds shown on the RHD pages. The length doesn't match YouTube.

The most recent video from August 16th shows the length as 18:57.  YouTube shows the length as 31:40
* https://developers.redhat.com/videos/youtube/mdZauKsMDiI/

The one from June 6th shows 16:53 vs. YouTube 30:06:
* https://developers.redhat.com/videos/youtube/03LeehvuOJE/ 

The Istio Tutorial No. 2 shows the length as 15:49 while YouTube shows only 6:39:
* https://developers.redhat.com/videos/youtube/OEo99GjUv6Q/

Istio Tutorial No. 1 shows 18:07, Youtube says 5:38:
* https://developers.redhat.com/videos/youtube/stGqKaYlYRA/

Here's one from 2017,  18:56 vs. YouTube 38:56
* https://developers.redhat.com/videos/youtube/3mj6Ni7sRN4/

column1: RHD Blog Wordfence unstyled lock out page, looks suspicious.

column39: Wordfence can return a 'you are locked out page' that is completely unstyled.  If I didn't know any better I'd think I was redirected to a spoofed site.
column422:
04/Feb/19 10:33 PM;visuale;[~rterzi] After reading up on this, it seems that the only way of showing an RHD-themed page is by adding custom templates to the Wordfence plugin itself. I don't think this would be a good idea because the Wordfence plugin is updated fairly frequently and that change would therefore need to be reapplied every time.

That said, Wordfence stated in forum comments that they're working on the option to use a custom template for blocking pages. There is also now at least an option to add some custom text to the blocked page. We could come up with some language that is tailored to the RHD Blog, under Tools --> All Options in the WP dashboard menu.

column1: RHD Blog WP Author Page Top Articles list wrong
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
On the RHD Blog page for an author, there is a list of "Top Articles" that doesn't seem to be correct.  I would expect to see Top Articles by views (within some period) in descending order.  I can't tell what ordering is used currently.  

See Scott McCarty's page (fatherlinux).  Some of the 5 shown are not top articles by any definition.

https://developers.redhat.com/blog/author/fatherlinux/

Top Posts

    Why Infrastructure Parity Matters for Developers Too
    Can't We Just Run Boot2Docker in Production?
    3 Reasons I Should Build My Containerized Applications on RHEL and OpenShift
    Repost – Architecting Containers Part 1: User Space vs. Kernel Space
    A Practical Introduction to Container Terminology

The last one in the list is a top article and is what I would have expected to see first.
column422: 26/Jul/18 2:04 PM;visuale;I'm having a look at this now.
column423: 31/Jul/18 3:41 PM;visuale;Finalized sorting fix should be in production tomorrow.
column424:
01/Aug/18 11:16 AM;visuale;This is somewhat improved – the ordering of articles by count now works correctly, but the articles to retrieve from the DB are incomplete on the author page. I might just try doing this with some SQL queries instead of relying on the WP posts method.

Also, separate problem – something about Rafael Benevides' post data is causing a display error in the admin panel and on the author page, but only when one is logged in as a WP user/admin. I'm not sure what's causing that yet.
column425:
01/Aug/18 11:49 AM;rterzi;Can you tell what the wp posts method is doing?   What data is it using?  Where does it come from?

I'd like to understand the source of the problem - because I think I've seen similar issues in other parts of the site.  If you code around it, the question is where are the other top post queries that might be returning invalid data?
column426: 01/Aug/18 2:38 PM;visuale;[~rterzi] I think I have the fix for this – problem was in plain sight, too. I was using the default author archive loop which, like the other archive pages, will only select the 10 most recent posts with the rest being reserved for pagination. I just have to add a separate loop for the sidebar top posts for the author. Fix should be in place tomorrow a.m. when I can push to prod again.
column427:
02/Aug/18 9:19 AM;visuale;The author page now shows the top posts in the correct order. It is pulling the most recent available data to do so from the blog database (for the total view counts from Jetpack rather than the past 30 days), but those view counts need to go through the server cache.

A separate issue that I'll create is to somehow incorporate the pre-migration data, too, so that articles that have been published longer than 2 years have all of their view counts tabulated and displayed in the WP admin panel rather than just showing what's available from Jetpack/WP.com
column428:
02/Aug/18 11:25 AM;rterzi;[~visuale] - Not sure I understand "It is pulling the most recent available data to do so from the blog database (for the total view counts from Jetpack rather than the past 30 days), but those view counts need to go through the server cache."

So what I think you are saying is the data in the database (from wordpress, not jetpack) shown in some places is only the past 30 days?   And this data doesn't count views that don't hit our servers because they are served by Akamai?  

Data in jetpack/wp.com (not in our database) goes back to mid-Dec 2016 (so covers all 2017 onward).  This counts all views, even those that go through akamai. 

As far as adding the Pre December 2016 migration views, that isn't very important.  I have the data and could give it to you in what ever form you needed if it was easy to add some place, but the 18+ months of history we have in JetPack is good enough unless we need to present life time view counts.
column429:
02/Aug/18 12:02 PM;visuale;Sorry [~rterzi], I didn't word the above very well.  Basically, yes – once the author page (or author's posts in the WP dashboard) are viewed, the count should update to the Jetpack total. The Jetpack API warns not to ping their server every for a count every time, so the view counts have been stored in the WP database, which means that the most recent views aren't likely cached into Akamai right away. Also, the view counts have to replicate onto the 2 mirror instances.

I can look at tweaking this process to get everything updated at once but that'd have to go next sprint as it looks like Lukas has signed off for the day and we're not pushing anything to production on Fridays unless it's some type of emergency.
column430: 03/Aug/18 12:29 PM;rterzi;[~ldary] - any particular reason you marked this as done?
column431:
03/Aug/18 12:48 PM;visuale;[~rterzi] We were just going through the sprint to close items out. I was going to add some notes to this and create a follow-up issue.

Aside from the above comments on how the counts are updated, is there still something that needs to be addressed?

column39:
h2. Requirements

h2. Design
* N/a

h2. Stakeholders
* ENG

h2. Acceptance Criteria
* A timeout is put in place for whenever we check if a service is alive

h2. Review Steps
* Should simply be a code review

column1: RHD Blog Pre blocks not in monospaced font.
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Requirements
RHD Blog <pre> blocks are showing up in a variable spaced overpass font instead of a monospaced font.  This causes things like indentation to not line up.  <pre> and any code/listing blocks should always be monospaced.   Indentation is important and is critical for some languages as it is part of the syntax.

See https://developers.redhat.com/blog/2018/06/26/data-grid-multi-cloud-real-time-game/ 

This issue was in the main site: [DEVELOPER-5089]

h2. Design
* N/A

h2. Stakeholders
* ENG

h2. Acceptance Criteria
* <pre> blocks show a monospace font in stage and production
* A new post is created in stage to allow testing of <pre> and other types of syntax/text formats.

h2. Review Steps
* Verify that <pre> is monospace
* Preview stage test post.
column422:
17/Jul/18 11:12 AM;visuale;Here is a test post in stage. We can try additional format tests here but it has both a <pre> block and the inline <code> formatting as samples, with monospace:

https://developers.stage.redhat.com/blog/2018/07/17/format-test/
column423: 18/Jul/18 10:52 AM;visuale;<pre> formatting in production and stage now show a monospace font, as does the inline <code> formatting, which also had monospace as a default.
column424: 19/Jul/18 11:21 AM;visuale;Stage and Production blog now show the monospace font family in code syntax samples.

column1: Fix search on 404 page
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
The search on the 404 page is not working, looks to be missing scripts these are usually manually updated since they have a generated guid for a name.

https://issues.jboss.org/browse/RHDFEED-691 is the bug

Two options need to discuss with team.

*Quick fix*
Update scripts to new filenames and add test to test script load on 404 page in automated test run.

broken links are:- 

https://developers.redhat.com/sites/default/files/js/js_VkfGuGgBSXSC7BpQs2A5dzrcOFGqbRHJnOCo_v0Zm8k.js

https://developers.redhat.com/sites/default/files/js/js_hzjkyGlL9baJfBPctxyVOq-WuE78yZ-NDXPbkl-tvR0.js

both are referenced in /Develop/git-
developers.redhat.com/_docker/lib/export/static/404-error/index.html

*FutureProof fix*
Look at injecting filename of script using a generated hash value from a build process, removing manual update and add to automated tests.  

Team to decide approach

h2. Review steps
Visit the 404 page and ensure the search works.
column373: Go to 404 try to search for pages.
column422: 15/Aug/18 6:46 AM;amcgrana;solution is working need to get tests running to validate

column1: Learning path cards cannot display 3 lines in title
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Problem

When displaying a learning path in a browser, the third row of a title is truncated. See pic.

https://developers.redhat.com/learning-paths/microservices/

h2. Requirements
* Truncate titles so as to fit on max 2 lines
* Use ellipses (...) to indicate truncation. The ellipses must reside on the second line. See design below.

h2. Design
 !2018-07-18_13-04-19.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Review
* Visit /learning-paths/microservices/ and ensure that no titles run onto three lines
* Read through comments below and ensure the approved cross-browser compatibility option works correctly.
column373: open https://developers.redhat.com/learning-paths/microservices/
column422: 13/Jul/18 5:21 AM;paul.robinson;[~joeschram], [~tnolan]: How do you want this to behave? Should we update the layout to fit all three line in, or restrict the title to two lines of text?
column423:
17/Jul/18 2:15 PM;tnolan;[~paul.robinson] [~joeschram] - Per the original wireframes/designs, the titles were only supposed to go to 2 lines before being truncated. There should not be a third line. I think the heading size changes may have impacted this and where the "break" is. 

Initial page design: https://redhat.invisionapp.com/share/3CE80USVA#/272635890_Learning_Paths_-MVP-_-_Desktop_-_Annotated
column424: 18/Jul/18 3:35 AM;paul.robinson;Thanks [~tnolan]. Do you want the heading sizes changed (so as to fit the content) or the content shortened to use fewer characters?
column425: 18/Jul/18 7:44 AM;tnolan;[~paul.robinson] I'd like for the titles to stay the same heading size as they are now due to the redesign, but be truncated with the ellipsis (...) at 2 lines of text for all screen size card variations.
column426: 18/Jul/18 8:05 AM;paul.robinson;[~tnolan] Thanks I've updated the description on this issue. Can you confirm this is correct?
column427: 18/Jul/18 8:14 AM;tnolan;[~paul.robinson] Looks correct. Thanks.
column428: 18/Jul/18 8:24 AM;paul.robinson;[~amcgrana] this looks like a quick fix for you.
column429:
19/Jul/18 4:38 AM;amcgrana;[~paul.robinson] what may appear as a simple fix, is actually not, 'text-overflow: ellipsis;' only works on a single line not multi line text. there is no bulletproof cross browser solution to do this. there are several hacks some using css only and some css/js solutions none seem ideal it can be done in css for webkit browsers and a -o version for opera but no css only solution for IE or Firefox. see

https://caniuse.com/#search=line-clamp
column430: 19/Jul/18 4:42 AM;amcgrana;[~paul.robinson] [~tnolan] in the short term are we happy to support all browsers other than IE11 and firefox to implement a css only fix. on the two unsupported browsers lines will clip to two but will not show ellipsis ...
column431: 19/Jul/18 10:30 AM;lightguard;[~amcgrana], couldn't we do this server side in the twig template?
column432: 20/Jul/18 6:43 AM;paul.robinson;[~amcgrana] is the problem here that it needs to be responsive? At some browser widths the text flows onto 2 lines, whereas at other widths it flows into 3 lines. I'm not sure doing this server-side with Twig would help, right?
column433:
20/Jul/18 7:47 AM;amcgrana;[~paul.robinson] yes twig would be no help unless its aware of the client screen size.

Its a frontend issue, the only fully cross browser solution is to use JS.

Using js to hack layout is not my favourite approach, one which i usually try to avoid but is sometimes unavoidable.
column434: 20/Jul/18 8:38 AM;paul.robinson;[~tnolan] are you happy to go ahead with the simple approach, even if it results in Firefox users not (yet) seeing the ellipses?
column435: 20/Jul/18 9:12 AM;tnolan;[~paul.robinson] [~amcgrana] Yes, let's move forward with the approach you mention immediately above for now. One thing I wanted to clarify though is that the title should never go to 3 lines no matter the card size or screen size. It should always be 2 lines or less.
column436: 20/Jul/18 9:19 AM;paul.robinson;Correct, it will always be 1 or 2 lines, never 3. Some users will see an ellipses, others not.
column437: 20/Jul/18 9:21 AM;amcgrana;[~tnolan] yes there will only ever be a maximum of two lines, we will just need to chop more words.
column438:
23/Jul/18 8:12 AM;amcgrana;have worked through and without JS the best cross browser option is attached as a screenshot would this be acceptable? [~paul.robinson][~tnolan] !Screen Shot 2018-07-23 at 13.09.03.png|thumbnail! 

there is a js solution using https://github.com/josephschmitt/Clamp.js this could be used to give full support without the gap at the end of the line.
column439:
24/Jul/18 5:29 AM;paul.robinson;[~tnolan] this looks close enough to me. Do you agree?

We'd rather not introduce another JS lib for the cross-browser support, as this is a relatively minor issue.
column440: 24/Jul/18 8:56 AM;tnolan;[~amcgrana] Is there a PR for this that I can review? Looking at the screenshot you provided yesterday, this option will not work unless you can get the ellipses closer to the text. It looks really odd and like a bug/error with it being all the way over to the right. Can we get these right after the last word of the text?
column441: 24/Jul/18 9:12 AM;amcgrana;[~tnolan] Not done a PR as I suspected the solution would not be what was required. With the research I have done there is no way to get the ellipsis to work on multi line text on all browsers without using JS [~paul.robinson] I know JS is not ideal but as far as I can tell it is the only option if what I have done is not ok with UX.
column442: 24/Jul/18 9:15 AM;paul.robinson;OK. Can you check with Luke that he's happy for us to add an extra library. My assumption is that it's not worth the added complexity and page weight. But [~ldary] knows better than I.
column443: 24/Jul/18 9:36 AM;amcgrana;[~paul.robinson] I could put some custom js in just for this particular component, would be less than a full lib, will check with luke
column444: 24/Jul/18 9:50 AM;amcgrana;Spoken with Luke going to implement JS lib to give consistency across browsers and will add functionality since this is likely to be needed elsewhere in the site.

column1: FSW hello-world Page Does Not Exist
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
[~rob.stryker] reported problems with downloads of  

[https://www.jboss.org/download-manager/jdf/file/jboss-fsw-6.0.0.GA.zip]
[https://www.jboss.org/download-manager/jdf/content/origin/files/sha256/39/39bf73f848596a6b19d949622b536f7e35c7773ccc4e987a5fa15c32af842b11/jboss-jpp-6.1.0.zip].

I checked the data in Download Manager and the files are still served, however the thank you page is set to [https://developers.redhat.com/products/fsw/get-started/?] . The page does not exist anymore or it was moved somewhere. Please, either update thank you page link in Download Manager to the right page (product FSW) or recreate the thank you page.
column422:
10/Jul/18 5:05 AM;paul.robinson;The JBoss Portal and Fuse Service Works products are not being offered anymore by Red Hat (I don't know the exact status). Therefore, the product pages on d.r.c were removed.

We could remove the thankyou page, and have the download happen immediately, without redirecting the user to another page. Would this work [~rawb]?
column423: 13/Sep/18 4:22 AM;amcgrana;[~rawb] any feedback on this?
column424: 04/Oct/18 6:44 AM;amcgrana;[~paul.robinson] any update?
column425:
04/Oct/18 6:56 AM;paul.robinson;Removing the thankyou page is really the only option here. Otherwise we'd need to replace it with a page that has the download javascript on. No such page exists, or is desired.

Now when you click on https://developers.redhat.com/download-manager/file/jboss-fsw-6.0.0.GA.zip the download occurs, but without sending the user to the get-started page.
column426: 04/Oct/18 9:18 AM;dhladky;Another solution would be sending the user to thank you page of a different product. Whatever the solution you decide is correct, feel free to fix that, [~paul.robinson]. You have all the necessary privileges to update products.
column427: 05/Oct/18 10:28 AM;paul.robinson;THanks [~dhladky]. There isn't a getting started guide that makes sense for FSW, so removing the thankyou page is our only option.

column1: New Image Style Config Deleted
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Requirements
[~tnolan] has created a new image style to use from the media library, but it gets deleted the next time the server builds. The style is called "Media Cover Image", and needs to be preserved in the configuration so it can be used going forward.

h2. Design
* NA

h2. Stakeholders
* Approval - [~tnolan]
* Eng

h2. Acceptance Criteria
* Image style is maintained even after Drupal server rebuilds

h2. Review Steps
* Add an image from the media library and see that the new image style is available

h2. Engineering
*
column422:
06/Jul/18 9:43 AM;tnolan;Some additional details.

* I added the image style via this page: http://rhdp-drupal.redhat.com/admin/config/media/image-styles and it's machine name is "media_asset_cover_medium"
* I used the image style for a book image on this page: https://developers.redhat.com/books/introducing-istio-service-mesh-microservices/
column423: 06/Jul/18 11:22 AM;lightguard;[~tnolan], if you make a change like that in production, it's very likely it will get overridden and could possibly break stuff the day after when the configuration is synced with the repository in GitHub. [~amcgrana] we need to get that config out of prod drupal and into the repo before Monday morning when the next Drupal prod build happens.
column424: 06/Jul/18 11:47 AM;lightguard;[~amcgrana] you can take the attached file (image.style.media_asset_cover_medium.yml) and add that to the repo.
column425: 06/Jul/18 11:50 AM;lightguard;Sorry, I see this already has a PR.
column426: 06/Jul/18 12:11 PM;amcgrana;[~lightguard] Hi, did I do the right thing with this?
column427: 06/Jul/18 12:25 PM;lightguard;[~amcgrana], yes, you did. I merged the pull request.
column428: 09/Jul/18 1:30 PM;tnolan;[~lightguard] [~ldary] [~amcgrana] - I think this one is all set at least from the UX side. I still see the image on the book page.

column1: Blog – Correct CSS/Favicon image URL path references
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Requirements
A few 500 "File not found" errors are showing in the blog theme. This is due to references to the old /assets/ directory no longer being valid. Affected files were the favicon display and a pair of footer file references. These should be corrected. 

h2. Design
* N/A

h2. Stakeholders
* ENG

h2. Acceptance Critera
* Links to the detected image assets are no longer showing 500 code errors in inspector

h2. Review Steps
* Inspection in browser inspector and WP error monitor for known 500-level errors
* Verify with IT that there are no further error codes
column422: 18/Jun/18 3:58 PM;visuale;CSS and template file references have been updated to reflect the proper location and there are no further 500 error codes in browser inspection. I will verify the errors are no longer present with IT before closing issue out.
column423: 19/Jun/18 3:08 PM;visuale;One additional incorrect path was found and corrected. It will be pushed to production on the 20th of June.
column424: 21/Jun/18 8:48 AM;visuale;Incorrect link paths were corrected and it was reported by Lukas that the server errors have ceased to occur.

*

column1: Some links in production point to http://rhdp-drupal.redhat.com domain
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Requirements
Some links in production point to the http://rhdp-drupal.redhat.com domain, when they should link to the production site URL.

Eg. page https://developers.redhat.com/quickstarts/eap/bean-validation/ has 'Target Product: Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform' which points to http://rhdp-drupal.redhat.com/node/33895

These all need finding and fixing.

h2. Tasks
* Take a dump of the production website. 
* Search for all occurrences of {{rhdp-drupal.redhat.com}}.
* Find fixes for all occurrences. If there are many, it might be quicker to use a database migration script to batch fix the content.

It would also be good to understand how these broken URLs crept in.

h2. Review Steps
* Take a dump of the PR website. 
* Search for all occurrences of {rhdp-drupal.redhat.com} and check there are none.
* Apply the same test on production once live.
column422: 06/Jul/18 12:29 PM;lightguard;These are all coming from the quickstarts.
column423: 10/Jul/18 10:56 AM;lightguard;Pull Request at https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/pull/2521
column424: 13/Jul/18 6:22 AM;velias;Looks like problem is patched now, thanks

column1: Share image info is missing from the og:image in page header
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
I added a share image to the homepage and it is not showing up in the header as the og:image. This image is needed for proper sharing and unfurling when sharing our site URL via social media sites, such as FaceBook and Apps such as Slack. 

You can review the page code and see that even though I attached an image, and it looks like the Drupal meta tags has the setting to use that image, the og:image is not being added to the page. 

You can also use the FB share debugger to see the alerts which includes the lack of the og:image. https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/sharing/?q=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.redhat.com%2F

h2. Acceptance Criteria & Review Steps
When you go to https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/sharing/?q=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.redhat.com%2F 
# you no longer see an error for the image in the warnings section
# you see the new share image
 !share-image-homepage.png|thumbnail! 
in the link preview section
 !fb-share-image-current.png|thumbnail!
column422: 05/Jun/18 9:43 AM;tnolan;[~lightguard] When you have a chance, can you provide some steps to review/verify this one? I didn't see a PR. Is this something I can do in Drupal Prod?
column423: 05/Jun/18 6:05 PM;lightguard;Yeah, [~tnolan], you can test this in prod no problem. All of the items will show up in the source of the web page towards the top between lines 191 through ~218.
column424:
06/Jun/18 8:54 AM;tnolan;[~lightguard] Thanks. I think we're closer. When I use the debugger now, it does recognize that an image should be there. However, in the code the og image is being referenced from a rhdp-drupal URL. This is live in Prod and the Drupal.

"Error while downloading http://rhdp-drupal.redhat.com/sites/default/files/styles/share/public/share-image-homepage.png?itok=OS1h6w8I with HTTP response code: 502"

Facebook debugger: https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/sharing/?q=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.redhat.com%2F
column425: 06/Jun/18 11:51 AM;lightguard;[~tnolan] next sprint has DEVELOPER-4614 planned which will fix the issue of the rhdp-drupal URL being used.
column426: 06/Jun/18 12:50 PM;tnolan;[~lightguard]Ok, thanks. It would be great if this (4614) could be worked on early in the sprint. Feel free to mark this as done.
column427: 08/Jun/18 12:06 PM;ldary;[~tnolan] if you could add some Acceptance criteria and Review steps that will help us get the process in place better.
column428: 18/Jun/18 10:35 AM;tnolan;[~lightguard][~ldary] - I added some acceptance criteria. Let me know if that is enough detail and if you need anything else.
column429:
03/Jul/18 11:47 AM;tnolan;[~ldary] [~lightguard] - I just checked this again since it looks like DEVELOPER-4614 is done. I am getting a new error message for the image: 

Error while downloading http://developers.redhat.com/sites/default/files/styles/share/public/share-image-homepage.png?itok=OS1h6w8I with HTTP response code: 404 

I also tried to remove the itok parameter at the end and I still get a 404.
column430: 03/Jul/18 12:47 PM;lightguard;[~tnolan] yep, I found that out yesterday too. There's another issue with this since that image isn't actually used anywhere on the site (displayed to the user), it isn't picked up and exported from Drupal. I need to create a ticket and get that work done.
column431: 05/Jul/18 9:20 AM;tnolan;[~lightguard] Ok, thanks for the info. Can you post the other issue here or link it to this bug once you create it? I'd like to keep an eye on it since it impacts this bug.
column432: 05/Jul/18 4:39 PM;lightguard;[~tnolan], please see DEVELOPER-5175 for follow-up
column433: 16/Jul/18 12:10 PM;lightguard;[~tnolan] will you please test this now to see if it works for you?
column434:
17/Jul/18 9:52 AM;tnolan;[~lightguard] Thanks. This looks good now! 

As I add additional custom images to other pages on the site, will I need to follow any specific set of steps for this to work going forward? Or as long as I'm using the og:image field and adding the image to the Drupal media library, it will work automatically?

column1: Cheatsheet download is not always triggered
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
Summary:
When downloading the advanced-linux-cheatsheet commands pdf the download is not always triggered, and the user subsequently has to click on the ' If you have any problems with the download, please use the direct link' link in order to download.

ENV:
Mac OS
Chrome: Version 66.0.3359.139 (Official Build) (64-bit)

Steps to repro:
1. Navigate to https://developers.redhat.com/cheat-sheets/advanced-linux-commands/
2. Click on the "LOGIN TO DOWNLOAD" button
3. Login to account

Expected:
Download is triggered (once)

Actual:
Download is triggered not always triggered.
column422: 19/Jun/18 5:52 PM;dcoughlin1;I can't seem to reproduce this bug. Could it have been triggered because the tests were running in parallel and triggering multiple downloads at the same time? Currently, if the download is attempted within 30 seconds (this may apply to all media downloads) of the previous media download, it will not trigger. This was a solution to multiple downloads happening because of the automatic page refresh. I can set it to 10 seconds, but it seems that the best solution would be fixing the automatic page refresh.

column1: Outage Messaging is not working
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Requirements
Site redesign has removed some of the placeholder elements used for site outages from existing on pages where they would be necessary. Replace the placeholders and write tests to validate that the exist in the expected places.

h2. Design
* NA

h2. Stakeholders
* Eng-only

h2. Acceptance Criteria
* Outage messaging notifications created in Adobe Target display when the corresponding activity is enabled
* Placement of outage messaging is consistent across the site due to the new theme

h2. Review Steps
* Run sample script from PR using Dev Tools which mirrors the script used in Target on any page
* View that an outage message is displayed
column422: 13/Jul/18 5:49 AM;ihamilto;I'm not sure what the definition of done is for this work? Could we please get some review steps?
column423: 22/Jul/18 11:42 PM;joeschram;Hey [~ldary], why is this one blocked?
column424: 23/Jul/18 7:28 AM;ldary;[~joeschram] there are a series of blocked items due to work I'm trying to get done on our scripts. Currently the unit tests are not running off of our new code, and I've got the fix for this one wrapped up in the changes in our script for the unit tests.
column425: 14/Sep/18 10:21 AM;ldary;Scripts and documentation have been checked for accuracy. Also had Patty move the activities for these into the RHD workspace, so visibility should be better.

column1: Topics navigation link underline not flush with lower border in Firefox
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:

column1: WP/RHD Blog New Site CSS issues
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Requirements
There seem to be issues with the CSS styling for Wordpress since the RHD site redesign, some issues have been addressed but possibly not correctly.  The definition of "done" for this is 2-3 parts
1. fix the obvious problems
2. Ensure that the RHD Blog/Wordpress uses consistent styling with the rest of the site.
3. Make sure the styling for text, including technical content, is reasonable on the main site.

Known issues:
1. The styling for links seems to be done incorrectly, a small font size keeps getting used for links that winds up being incorrect depending on what type of elements the link appears in.
   * last week the small font was fixed for links that appear inside of list elements.
   * But now I see that a link that appears in an H3 has a different/tiny font compared to the H3.

2. Bold vs. normal is hard to see in regular text.
3. The normal font size for blog text seems quite large compared to the rest of the site.



h2. Design
* N/A

h2. Stakeholders
* ENG

h2. Acceptance Criteria
* Formatting is matched between the RHD Site and RHD Blog

h2. Review Steps
* Compare RHD Site Header and Footer between RHD Site and RHD Blog in identically-sized browser windows (Chrome and Firefox)
column422:
17/May/18 11:07 AM;rterzi;See the above screenshot - Notice the tiny text for the link vs. the rest of the h3?

Also that text probably didn't need to be an h3, but bold is too subtle.

* There seems to be extra spacing after the link text.  Note the screenshot where it appears there is a space before the closing paren.

However the italic link font weight appears to be much lighter.  In the screenshot you'd think the regular one was bold and the italic isn't.

column431:
31/May/18 6:38 PM;rterzi;Re the default font size for the blog, [~visuale] wrote: "This is actually set that way on purpose. I'd have to find the guide for it but we had made a few changes to formatting last year to make articles clearer. One of the changes was to increase the font-size and reduce column width to make the content easier to read (e.g. more blog-like and less dense like a newspaper article or technical paper)."

But has that font size choice been reviewed in the context of the new site  [~joeschram]? 

Note: For the most part we are publishing technical articles, not conversational blogs so that large font looks out of place to me when I compare it to other sites (dzone/infoq).

column1: registration and login broken and logged in without being asked for password
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
Today I went and registered a new account for testing purposes and the flow was really weird and borked.

1. go to openshift.io
2. click signup
3. enter data in developers.redhat.com (used manderse+gluster@redhat.com as email)
4. get to screen abuot getting email to verify
5. verify in email
6. goto developers.redhat.com in same tab as #4 and try and click login and nothing happens. I do it several times.
   various errors in log (see attachement)
7. I click login a few more times and then open new tab..click login - Magic - now i get page asking to verify user info ...note I have NOT been asked for password. That can't be right.

thus in short - login button broken and when reload i'm logged in without being asked for password and shown my personal details.
column422: 04/Apr/18 11:17 AM;paul.robinson;[~velias] FYI
column423:
05/Apr/18 3:48 AM;velias;Verify email action creates SSO session in keycloak (if link from email is opened in same browser where original registration occurred), so user is not force to login again after this until SSO session timeout.

Looks like Keycloak javascript adapter used on RHD website has some trouble in the first tab.

Looks like javascript adapter recovered when new tab was opened and started to login correctly into SSO session existing in Keycloak.

So I do not see anything wrong on Keycloak server side, problem is in javascript side in RHD website itself. Problem looks like https://issues.jboss.org/browse/KEYCLOAK-1165 but it seems even Keycloak team was not able to reproduce and patch it.

[~paul.robinson] your team is in charge of website javascripts, feel free to move this issue to yours team.
column424: 16/Oct/18 8:53 AM;amcgrana;[~paul.robinson] I can't replicate this entirely but have some issues, I think this needs a discussion as the required behavior?
column425:
16/Oct/18 11:49 AM;amcgrana;[~tnolan] could you look at this from a UX perspective, the script issues seem to have resolved themselves.

The flow seems a bit odd when you hit the developers site after validating your email, the site shows a login button, clicking it automatically logs you in since you already have an SSO session from the email validation page.

Should we already detect the session and not show the login button?
column426:
26/Oct/18 4:43 AM;amcgrana;Agreed to change and check for login state at page load, blocked until keycloak is working in dev blocked by: untilhttps://issues.jboss.org/browse/DEVELOPER-5453
[~jordan.white] is working on it
column427: 14/Nov/18 6:15 AM;amcgrana;On hold due to RHEL release for stability reasons, is that ok [~paul.robinson]

column39:
h2. Requirements
Creating this ticket so we don't lose track of the issue. There are probably other tickets that are needed.  The RHEL blog has an old link for the developer blog which doesn't work.

First:  Go to  http://developerblog.redhat.com/   Note that it redirects to https://rhdevelopers.wordpress.com/.     

1. We should get the redirect  http://developerblog.redhat.com/   to go directly to the current blog. [~visuale] can you create what ever tickets are needed to get the right people to correct the redirect?  I suspect that redirect is controlled by corporate?

2. On the RHEL blog, https://rhelblog.redhat.com/,   scroll down to Other Red Hat Blogs, to see the bad link (and bad text) for the RHD blog.    We need to get whoever owns the RHEL blog to fix that.  (I think Mike Guerette is putting us in touch with the right person.

3. https://rhdevelopers.wordpress.com/  isn't redirecting.   Is that something we can fix through what ever remenants of the rhdevelopers VIP account?

This site is marked private by its owner. If you would like to view it, you’ll need permission from the site owner. Request an invite and we'll send your username to the site owner for their approval.

* N/A

* ENG

column1: Slow network is detected. .... Fallback font will be used while loading: https://overpass-30e2.kxcdn.com/overpass-heavy.woff2

column39: Shouldn't we copy those fonts to developers.redhat.com and let Akamai to serve it ?

column423: 14/May/18 9:50 AM;ldary;Had to wrestle with this one a little bit. Right now we're using a CDN because theoretically we should be reaping the benefit of that across RH web properties, but in looking at the other sites it seems like everyone is just using Akamai for their own copies. Talked with the Customer Portal team to see if there was any particular reason they weren't using the CDN and there wasn't. I did discover that we can probably do better with our font loading though, so it won't be such a slow-down for loading the site.
