column1: Blog posts are not searchable
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
Summary:
When a user searches for a blog post via the search page, blog posts are not listed in the search results.

Steps to repro:
1. Navigate to https://developers.redhat.com
2. Search for "Red Hat JBoss Data Grid 7.0 is out"

Expected result:
Blog posts should be included in the list of search results.

Actual:
No blog posts found in search results.
column422: 30/Apr/18 8:59 AM;paul.robinson;[~ihamilto] is this fixed now?
column423: 30/Apr/18 11:06 AM;ihamilto;[~paul.robinson] No, this is still not fixed. The only way to view blog posts in search results is by selecting the "Blog posts" option to filter results.
column424: 30/Apr/18 11:10 AM;ihamilto;Assigning this back to [~ldary] so he can have someone take a look, unless this is one for Rysiek?
column425: 30/Apr/18 11:30 AM;ldary;Just checked this one, and if I put the title inside quotation marks it does find it, so I'm guessing that it is an issue with priority of display rather than actually not showing up. It seems like we should prioritize blogs over forums, but that may be for someone on Mark's team and [~tnolan] to discuss.
column426: 01/May/18 6:55 AM;paul.robinson;Thanks [~ldary]. I've put this onto the backlog as it doesn't have anything to do with the Summit work and is not critical IMO.
column427: 11/Sep/18 8:15 AM;amcgrana;[~ldary] [~paul.robinson] Looking at this can we get the search appliance to prioritize "search param" complete phrase and return first how is the result scoring done?
column428: 11/Sep/18 8:18 AM;paul.robinson;[~unibrew] might be able to help here
column429:
09/Oct/18 5:40 AM;amcgrana;[~paul.robinson] [~joeschram] I emailed Ryszard, the response is as follows:-

_*I actually noticed it when I was mentioned in the task and tried to do something with it. However, after spending considerable amount of time I didn’t find out why it lands so low in the results and I wasn’t able to apply any quick search scoring tuning to fix it. Therefore, I got back to my priority tasks.
Can this simply wait for Fusion introduction? How important or urgent is it?*_

In light of this, what do you want doing with the story? 

I could implement a frontend solution but would require calling the search twice.

Or can we wait until Fusion?
column430: 10/Oct/18 9:30 AM;amcgrana;Blocked awaiting feedback from [~paul.robinson][~joeschram]
column431: 11/Oct/18 5:21 AM;paul.robinson;I agree, we should probably wait for the Fusion migration to complete. We are also migrating all the blog articles into the new Drupal article format. So a lot of disruption in that area coming.
column432: 11/Oct/18 7:52 AM;amcgrana;Blocked by https://issues.jboss.org/browse/DEVELOPER-5172 Implement Fusion

column1: RHD Site Search, Content Type 'Blog Post' 5-10 year old entries, NO RHD blogs
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
1. go to the RHD search page
2. Select content type 'Blog Post'
3. Do not enter a search term, click search.

OR click this link - https://developers.redhat.com/search/?f=sys_type%7Eblogpost 

The returned content is 5-10 year old blog posts from BlogSpot, and Google Feed Proxy.  There is not a single article from the RHD blog on the first page.
column422:
26/Mar/18 4:53 AM;lkrzyzanek;I checked that and the only trouble is that it's sorted by relevance and not by created date.

[~ldary] You need to add "&newFirst=t" to your query. Something like this:
https://dcp2.jboss.org/v2/rest/search/developer_materials?tags_or_logic=true&filter_out_excluded=true&from=0&query=&query_highlight=true&size10=true&sys_type=blogpost&newFirst=t

Then you got correct sorting.

[~rterzi] I see the switch button from "relevance" to "most recent". When you use it then you got correct sorting.
see: https://developers.redhat.com/search/?f=sys_type~blogpost&s=most-recent

I think this is more UX question. I would recommend to do "mosrt recent" sorting by default when search box is empty.
column423: 26/Mar/18 8:22 AM;ldary;Tagging [~tnolan] as this would be her call. It seems like the age of the item should have some correlation to how relevant it is, but I don't know if there is a way to do that is there [~lkrzyzanek]? As in, older items should be less relevant when there are newer items of similar weight.
column424:
26/Mar/18 9:33 AM;tnolan;[~ldary] [~lkrzyzanek] - I agree with Luke that the relevance sort should be prioritizing newer content first. The other issue is that we are indexing a LOT of blogs outside of RHD. While these blog posts could be helpful, we do have a larger issue and a content strategy decision around these and if we should be including them. 

Short term solution: For relevance (default) sort: See what can be done to change the priority of our RHD Blog posts among all the other blogs being indexed and prioritize newer posts first. 

Longer term solution: Work with [~joeschram] to go through the entire Blog index list to either remove all the outdated non-RHD Blogs or remove all the outdated non-RH blogs as identified in this list https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1M97lszQ5EvaDn_c-g8iDIkQ8MxNzfTSoIZRYdKy4hFk/edit#gid=1351984549
column425: 26/Mar/18 9:45 AM;lkrzyzanek;Sounds reasonable. Let me investigate how to do so in ORG-3831
column426:
26/Mar/18 1:25 PM;rterzi;A few thoughts:

1. Some feed aggregators seem to indexed, planet.jboss.org and feedproxy.google.com.  So it might be worth reviewing whether those should be indexed.  (They might be the source of some of the non-RH blogs.)
2. it would be helpful if blog content that was indexed was tagged with the blog it came from, and it was possible to filter for specific blogs, RHD OR JBoss,, or classes of blogs like Red hat Developers == RHD AND JBoss, or All *.redhat.com blogs,  Upstream community projects that are considered Red Hat projects.
column427: 27/Mar/18 8:28 AM;tnolan;[~rterzi] Can you create a new Story for your 2 thoughts above? I agree that we need to take a look at these, but further work would need to be prioritized and will most likely not be looked at until after Summit. As far as the bug goes, I believe this is resolved.
column428: 27/Mar/18 11:00 AM;rterzi;For context, currently Libor's work in [ORG-3831] seems to be working to prioritize < 1 year old content.  However as of 2018-03-27, the piece to try to prioritize RHD content does not appear to be working.  Reposts of RHD articles on non-Red Hat sites are being shown instead of the RHD content.
column429: 10/Apr/18 8:50 AM;ldary;Query has been adjusted to coordinate with the search service: https://developers.redhat.com/search/?f=type~blogpost

column1: after updating email the auth/login flow results in "You are already logged in dead-end"
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
I had by accident used manderse+review@redhat.com instead of manderse+preview@redhat.com on my test account.

Went and updated the email by logging in to developers.redhat.com and go to settings/profile. All good so far.

On first login after that to https://manage.openshift.com/openshiftio?cluster=starter-us-east-2a I end up not being asked at all who I am, and be told to verify my email.

First error here is that this page has no logout button whatsoever - nor even info on who I'm logged in as.

Anyway, when I receive the verify email I click the link and now end up on page saying "You are already logged in".

Again, no info on who I'm logged in as, no logout button nor anyway to get to the next step.

Only workaround I found was to use incognito mode to get past it.
column422: 11/May/18 8:54 AM;paul.robinson;[~lkrzyzanek] what systems do you think are involved here? Looks like just RHD and OSIO Keycloak servers.
column423: 22/Oct/18 3:55 AM;amcgrana;@paul is this an openshift, keycloak issue and not Developers.redhat.com?
column424:
22/Oct/18 5:44 AM;paul.robinson;It looks like just RHD and OSIO Keycloak servers to me.

[~lkrzyzanek] or [~velias]: can you confirm, and if so move the issue?
column425: 25/Oct/18 8:29 AM;velias;It is RHD Keycloak. But in reality "You are already logged in" is a problem in Keycloak itself, we can't do anything with it :-( We reported it to the KC team, but not resolved still as I know.
column426: 01/Nov/18 7:39 AM;paul.robinson;[~velias] do you have an issue link?
column427: 01/Nov/18 8:32 AM;velias;RHDENG-1523 which points to upstream KEYCLOAK-5179

column1: [STAGE] Not possible to navigate directly to /register
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
Summary:
When navigating to https://developers.stage.redhat.com/register, there is a redirect to production.

Steps to repro:
1. https://developers.stage.redhat.com/register

Expected:
User lands on staging kc registration form.

Actual:
Error occurs:

We're sorry ...
Invalid parameter: redirect_uri
column422:
26/Mar/18 11:36 AM;paul.robinson;I assume this is happening due to the /register page in Drupal having the production URL hard coded in it. To see it:

# Login to Drupal via: http://rhdp-drupal.stage.redhat.com
# Visit: http://rhdp-drupal.stage.redhat.com/register/edit?destination=/admin/content%3Ftitle%3Dregister%26type%3DAll%26field_topics_target_id%3DAll%26moderation_state%3D
# Observe the code: {{code}}</script><script>var keycloakAuthUrl = "https://developers.redhat.com/auth/"{{code}}. Notice the hard-coded production URL.

This may have got the staging URL when the page was pushed via Awestruct.
column423:
27/Mar/18 8:42 AM;paul.robinson;I've temporarily updated the JS on http://rhdp-drupal.stage.redhat.com/register as suggested in my comment above. It is currently correctly redirecting to staging keycloak. however, this will be overwritten when the production content is synced with staging.

We need to find a way to make this JS work in all environments.

column1: Cards on Learning path show last modified date, must be "publish date"
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39: I thought this was video resources only, but now see it is for most/all card types.
column422: 26/Feb/18 6:19 AM;paul.robinson;[~ldary] FYI. Something else to go with the existing LP issues.
column423:
11/Sep/18 8:01 AM;amcgrana;[~mikgue] do you want a published date or created date or possibly a first published date?

published would change every time the item is changed.
column424:
11/Sep/18 8:40 AM;mikgue;Good question. My original request was to have a first published date, but you've given me more to consider.

Ideally, there's a date that's automatically displayed (e.g. publish date per your description above), but a manual override of both date and label. 

So, Publish date will be the default showing.  If a change is needed, the author manually overrides (maybe after clicking a tick box?) the date and label for the new date.  The label is a text field where the user types in whatever is required.

HTH
column425: 12/Sep/18 2:13 PM;tnolan;[~mikgue] I've had some other discussions similar to this in regards to the article pages. The UX recommendation is to allow for space to have the original publish date (not create date) as the primary display option and then if the item is updated, we would display a last updated date with it. This allows us to maintain history but also show that items are being updated. Thoughts?
column426: 12/Sep/18 2:58 PM;mikgue;I'm fine with this standardized approach. Thanks.
column427: 09/Oct/18 6:29 AM;amcgrana;[~mikgue] just picking this up to implement, do you have an example page where this can be seen, there are no steps to reproduce in the story.
column428:
10/Oct/18 9:29 AM;amcgrana;[~gdoyle] [~tnolan] Have agreed there is no room for both dates, blocking story awaiting feedback from [~mikgue].

[~mikgue] is this still an issue?
column429:
16/Oct/18 11:39 AM;mikgue;I'm fine with the original request of doing the publish date only.  

Is there anything else that's needed?
column430: 16/Oct/18 11:44 AM;amcgrana;[~mikgue] thanks will get this sorted.
column431: 17/Oct/18 4:26 AM;amcgrana;[~mikgue][~tnolan] this date already displays the node.field_published_date, or the node.field_video_publish_date so I think we don't need to change anything unless I have misunderstood what is required now.
column432:
17/Oct/18 6:23 AM;mikgue;Then I'm confused.

If this had already displayed "publish_date", then I wouldn't have submitted this ticket to begin with.  Somehow modified date is showing up and this is not correct.  What am I missing?
column433:
18/Oct/18 6:31 AM;amcgrana;[~mikgue] [~tnolan] Looking further into this, the data template has a field for published date, if this is left blank no date is displayed. This is a manual entry field and optional.

If there are any dates that are incorrect this can only be because of user entered data.

Do we always want to display a date? If so I can use the created date unless the published date is populated.
column434: 19/Oct/18 7:44 AM;mikgue;Good by me to have a manual entry version. [~tnolan]?
column435: 19/Oct/18 8:49 AM;amcgrana;Thanks [~mikgue] that is the existing functionality so if we are all happy to either show a manual date or no date then This ticket can be closed, [~tnolan] is this ok with you?
column436:
19/Oct/18 11:48 AM;tnolan;[~amcgrana] Thanks for the suggestions. So if I understand, the default value would be the automated/system field of first published date and then there would be an optional, manual "override" field for the content authors to use. Is that correct? 

If override has a value, then display that, otherwise show system first published date.
column437:
23/Oct/18 3:35 AM;amcgrana;[~tnolan] The system fields are created or last published there is no first published, so default would need to be one of those dates. Created is normally close to the first published date.

The current behaviors are no date displayed if no date input on the data template.
column438:
23/Oct/18 8:28 AM;tnolan;Ok, thanks for the info about the 2 fields [~amcgrana].

[~fearlsgroove] - I'm curious how you've solved this for other sites you've worked on. Is there a way to get the first published date as an automated value? We don't want to use create date for the displayed value as content could potentially be worked on for multiple days/weeks, before it's actually first published to the site.
column439:
24/Oct/18 9:09 AM;amcgrana;There is a plugin for first published date https://www.drupal.org/project/publication_date

[~jordan.white] do you think that would be ok to install, I am keen we don't add too much plugin bloat.
column440:
24/Oct/18 10:29 AM;jordan.white;[~amcgrana] Do we need access to a publication date for entities that already exist and have already been published on the site, or will this just be a feature that can be used on newly created entities?

The module you reference seems to indicate in its description:

"IMPORTANT: For nodes that were published BEFORE the installation of this module, we can not know the exact date of publication, so $node->published_at will initially contain the creation date."

and furthermore, in the issue queue (https://www.drupal.org/project/publication_date/issues/2983348):

"...after installing the module the published_at does not contain the creation date, it is empty"

There is a patch for that issue, but I would have to take more time to review the patch and test it locally.

It looks like there was a Drupal core issue to resolve this about 5-6 years ago (https://www.drupal.org/project/drupal/issues/1838918), but unfortunately, it lost steam I guess.

I think I will need a little bit more time to consider this as it seems we need this data stored for all entities, including those that have already been created and published. I am not sure if Drupal stores any data that could be used to somehow determine the first date of publication, so that might complicate our efforts for existing entities. Going forward, with newly created and published entities, it seems that the best path forward is to investigate the functionality of the publication_date module with the latest patch in the issue (1838918) that I referenced.

Please let me know if you need further assistance from me. I'm not sure how things like this fit into sprints here. Just let me know. Thanks!
column441: 24/Oct/18 11:16 AM;amcgrana;[~jordan.white] [~tnolan] [~mikgue] From my perspective I guess it would be ok for new items moving forward to get the published date and legacy items to get the created date up to Mike and Tiffany I guess.
column442: 25/Oct/18 1:23 PM;tnolan;[~amcgrana][~jordan.white] [~mikgue] - I'm totally ok with having a new field for this going forward and understand how this would not be in place for older content. Will there be an option to overrride it with a manual entry?
column443: 26/Oct/18 4:40 AM;amcgrana;[~jordan.white] [~paul.robinson] Since https://www.drupal.org/project/publication_date is only beta1 for version 8.x are we ok to use it. What is the process for installing third-party plugins into our Drupal system?
column444:
29/Oct/18 11:53 AM;jordan.white;[~tnolan] Yes, it looks like editors will be able to manually set a publication date as they would with the 'created at' field for example.

[~amcgrana] I am not sure what our team's policy is regarding contrib module's release versioning. I think that it would be reasonable to use this project though as long as we vet it thoroughly on our local environment(s) before deploying it. I think that I said this earlier, but the latest patch in this issue will be required: https://www.drupal.org/project/publication_date/issues/2983348

We should be managing all PHP+Drupal dependencies with Composer, so we could include this as a dependency in our composer.json file, update the .lock file and then you would have to enable the module and export the core.extensions.yml configuration.

If I could assist you with that process, just let me know. I'd be happy to.
column445: 31/Oct/18 1:07 AM;lightguard;Do we have sign off from [~tnolan], [~sjcox], or [~mikgue]?
column446: 31/Oct/18 7:25 AM;mikgue;I honestly don't understand the final solution (buried in other things atm), but if Tiffany and SJ are good with it, so am I.
column447:
01/Nov/18 9:52 AM;amcgrana;Added module for published at filed to all nodes.

for learning path cards now published_at date will be populated when an item is published.

can be overridden with field_published_date in template or field_video_publish_date on video learning resource.

if date is currently blank then will remain blank until item is updated.

For example, the height should be closer to 185px at 1024 size when the info panel moves to the top. 
 !card-too-tall.png|thumbnail!

!LP-tablet-padding-change.png|thumbnail! 
# We really need to be able to use abbreviations for the times. min instead of minutes, etc. We don't have enough space to be spelling all the times out. What are the options to fix this?
# Around 1024 breakpoint, the gray background moves to be the same width as the cards. It should go to the top of the content area and be a consistent 15px wrapper to the card collection.

column1: Blog search fails (when not logged into to wordpress)
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
Searching the RHD blog via the search box on blog pages fails.  The URL changes to include the search parameter, but the top level page is returned as if the search parameter was being ignored.

The search results page is being returned quickly as no search was performed and the page is being returned out of cache.

EDIT: I believe the problem is the cache is ignoring the presence of URL parameters when making decisions about what is cacheable and whether to return a page out of cache or send it on to the wordpress server.

-At times, searches appears to work correctly if you are logged into wordpress. - 

It is possible this is related to other wordpress caching problems mentioned in [RHDENG-1909].
column373:
# make sure you are logged out of wordpress (Wordpress has different auth than keycloak)
# go the the top level blog page - https://developers.redhat.com/blog
# Note that you see a snippets of the most recent blog articles 
# Enter a search in the search box to the right, click search.
# Note that the URL changes to https://developers.redhat.com/blog/?s=rhel  (where rhel is the search term)
# Check whether you got a page with search results or the same top level page you previously saw.
column422:
08/Feb/18 11:22 AM;visuale;[~lkoranda] the description here notes that being logged into the admin will likely return results whereas being logged out will not would indicate that at least part of the issue is the difference between cache settings for non-admin (public, max-age=1800) and admin users (private, no-cache).

Would changing the length of the public cache timeout be helpful?
column423:
08/Feb/18 12:09 PM;rterzi;I think it may be more fundamental than cache timeout. - 

https://developers.redhat.com/blog/?s=rhel  and https://developers.redhat.com/blog/  should *NOT* be equivalent and yielding the same object, which it seems like what is happening.
column424:
08/Feb/18 12:14 PM;rterzi;Also, sometimes when logged in (as a WP admin) and hitting the main page (/blog) I get the WP admin header and sometimes I don't, which makes me think I'm getting the page out of cache.

But does that also mean that potentially some non-admin user might get a cached version of the page that includes the admin header?
column425:
08/Feb/18 2:35 PM;rterzi;Clarification - it seems at times *any query parameters* for the main blog page  /blog/?p=453617 or /blog/?s=rhel are ignored. 

At first it seemed to me to be dependent on whether you are logged in or not.  But that doesn't work reliably. 

Maybe the first question to answer/problem to solve - If there are query parameters for /blog/  should they be ignored to make the page cacheable?   I think the answer is no.  And, I think that is part of the problem.
column426: 03/Mar/18 2:08 PM;visuale;Since Lukas has applied the parameter allowances for Akamai, I have now seen an actual search results page every time I've tried a string in the last couple of days. There is a strange problem with results, though, in that they're quite incomplete. I'm addressing this in a separate issue.
column427: 04/Mar/18 5:25 PM;visuale;Improvement to actual results being tracked here: https://issues.jboss.org/browse/DEVELOPER-4754
column428: 14/Mar/18 12:17 PM;visuale;As mentioned in above comment, the results page is not being returned but the results themselves are incomplete. That is being addressed in this issue: https://issues.jboss.org/browse/DEVELOPER-4754

column1: RHDP Search bar appending spaces with +
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
Summary:
When searching via the site navigation search bar for a term containing spaces (for example "Red Hat JBoss Data Grid 7.0 is out") the spaces are being replaced with "+", resulting in 0 results found.

Steps to repro:
Using a windows machine with either IE 11 or Edge:
1. Navigate to RHDP homepage
2. Using site search bar, enter "Red Hat JBoss Data Grid 7.0 is out" and trigger search.

Expected:
Search page is displayed with a list of results containing "Red Hat JBoss Data Grid 7.0 is out"

Actual:
No results are found, and in search field spaces have been appended with + (see screenshot).

column1: "Bad Request" when attempting to download PDFs from the download manager
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. To Reproduce

# Make sure you are logged out of the RHDP website
#  Visit https://developers.redhat.com/promotions/building-reactive-microservices-in-java/ or https://developers.redhat.com/promotions/migrating-to-microservice-databases/
# Select "DOWNLOAD PDF"
# Login (if you don't see the login screen, you probably didn't log out correctly). I used LinkedIn social login.
# Observe: https://www.dropbox.com/s/n09efieoz7981b4/Screenshot%202017-10-16%2009.00.49.png?dl=0
# Observe: URL looks something like: https://developers.redhat.com/download-manager/rest/keycloak?state=7b967be9-7d49-471d-93e2-c74dbb78f177&code=j7bwnYx-ySrO5FZ7UEDG2ZuhcSBSpxcvDzIr84I6BNQ.1670df58-fd13-434a-ab82-d69e9a60fb1d#!

h2. Probable root cause
The problem seems to be caused by PDF links (on the download manager) being opened in a new tab. There seems to be some JS that become uninitialised when this happens. I think the fix is to prevent any links to files on the download manager from being opened in a new tab.

h2. Other observations
* The JDG product download from /downloads worked correctly.
* "Migrating to Microservice Databases" was last updated (in the download manager) on Tue Oct 10 11:39:27 EDT 2017 by dcoughlin1. This download has worked correctly since then, so it seems to not be caused by a config issue in the download manager.
column422: 16/Oct/17 4:29 AM;dhladky;I can not reproduce this issue neither with direct Jboss account nor when using LinkedIn social provider.
column423: 17/Oct/17 3:52 AM;dhladky;Hi, so I was able to reproduce it in production in the end. It would be nice if we have synchronized staging environment, where we would be able to test broken things. I spent quite a long time before I realized what is the problem, because the stage was out of date and did not have the broken code.
column424: 17/Oct/17 7:38 AM;paul.robinson;[~dhladky] the staging jobs in CI seems to have been running successfully for a while (https://redhat-dev-jenkins.rhev-ci-vms.eng.rdu2.redhat.com/view/developers.stage.redhat.com%20(Staging)/). Can you describe what made you think the environment wasn't synced?

column1: Cheat sheets showing up as both WEBPAGE and CHEAT SHEET in results
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Requirements
It looks like Cheat Sheets are being displayed as both a WEBPAGE and CHEAT SHEET content type in the search results. Each cheat sheet should only be showing up once as a CHEAT SHEET. 

h2. Design
Not needed.

h2. Stakeholders
Engineering: [~dcoughlin1]

h2. Acceptance Criteria
Scenario: User searches for a cheat sheet and activates both webpage and cheat sheet filters on Search page
    *Given* The cheat sheet exists
    *Then* I should see the cheat sheet appear as only a CHEAT SHEET and *not* also as a webpage
Scenario: User searches for a book and activates both webpage and cheat sheet filters on Search page
    *Given* The cheat sheet exists
    *Then* I should see the book appear as only a CHEAT SHEET and *not* also as a webpage

h2. Review Process
* Visit the search page of the PR. Notice that the CHEAT SHEET no longer also appears as a web page.
* Visit the search page of the PR. Notice that the BOOK no longer also appears as a web page
column373:
* Go to https://developers.redhat.com/search/?q=cheat+sheet
* Apply filters for Cheat Sheet and Web Page
* See some results that are duplicated for a single cheat sheet such as the Git one
column422: 19/Oct/17 10:43 AM;ldary;[~lightguard] if this looks like it might not get done while I'm out on leave we will probably want to pull it out of the epic so we can complete the epic this quarter.
column423: 19/Oct/17 11:42 AM;lightguard;There's actually going to be more than just cheatsheets. We're currently indexing the whole website, regardless of what the content type is in Drupal. Videos will be duplicated, quickstarts, cheatsheets, etc. I'm not sure if we can do some logic in the DCP river to check the og:type of a webpage. That's probably the better fix.
column424: 20/Oct/17 5:52 AM;paul.robinson;[~lightguard] I believe that most of the pages you mention have the {{<meta name="DCP:WebpageSearchExclude" content="true">}} element in the page source. This instructs the DCP to ignore them and prevent this duplication.
column425: 20/Oct/17 11:29 AM;lightguard;Oh, yes. I'd forgotten about that. Maybe we simply need to clear the web page collection in the DCP.
column426: 27/Oct/17 3:52 AM;ihamilto;[~lightguard] anyone working on this in the next sprint? If so could we get some context for estimation. Thanks.
column427: 10/Nov/17 10:54 AM;dcoughlin1;These should be removed upon next index. All cheatsheets have been updated to be "Excluded from search" in prod
column428: 14/Nov/17 11:34 AM;dcoughlin1;We need to have the index ran manually to remove current "Webpage" references from DCP.
column429: 15/Nov/17 11:23 AM;dcoughlin1;[~unibrew] - Here is the ticket we have for the DCP duplicates issue. I've moved it to blocked for now since Akamai is currently preventing us from clearing the index.
column430: 15/Nov/17 11:28 AM;unibrew;[~lkoranda], can we whitelist DCP machines' IPs at Akamai to sort out this issue?
column431: 17/Nov/17 6:35 PM;dcoughlin1;[~lkoranda] [~unibrew] - Just wanted to follow up and see if you needed anything from me.
column432:
20/Nov/17 4:44 AM;lkoranda;We can't whitelist DCP because this is behind external PHX2 IP.
Few details about why Akamai protection blocked it:

- All requests were going to path: /sitemap.xml
- The rate control that blocked the IP was Page View request, which has thresholds of:

Burst: 18 requests per second
Average: 12 requests per second

- User agent: Apache-HttpClient/4.3.5 (java 1.5)
- IP location: Phoenix, US.


----
Total requests denied: 2,757
Time frame: 10:20 GMT – 12:00 GMT November 08,2017
HTTP Method: GET
 
HTTP request headers:
 
Host: developers.redhat.com
Connection: Keep-Alive
User-Agent: Apache-HttpClient/4.3.5 (java 1.5)
Cookie: BIGipServer~prod~rhd-webapp-http=442959114.20480.0000
Cookie2: $Version=1
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate


*If someone can shed some light on what is causing issue and why is it crawling so aggressively that would be really beneficial. Maybe once we have some essential information we can look for some workaround.*
column433:
20/Nov/17 5:18 AM;unibrew;Well you could whitelist whole PHX2 :D

Thing is that it's requesting sitemap.xml so often because it couldn't reach it. Otherwise the reindexing is downloading this file only once per day. I'm just guessing but what Akamai probably really has blocked us for is the indexing of the website itself. The indexer works in the way that it downloads the sitemap and then downloads all HTMLs listed in the sitemap.xml. The problem is that there is no speed limiter implemented on downloading those subsequent htmls. So, I suppose we DDOSed Akamai while indexing the HTMLs and then on the next run indexer got stuck on trying to download sitemap.xml and looped infinitely.

If no fix can be applied on Akamai level to allow us index the website with no speed limits then the indexer needs to be reimplemented. This requires whole release cycle of DCP which is quite time consuming and all the effort will be lost since it's a deprecated system that in near future will be replaced.

[~lkoranda] I suppose there is no trick on F5 level to slow down our outgoing requests? :P Any other options you could see?
column435: 20/Nov/17 7:34 AM;unibrew;That's a very cool idea. [~vladimir_v] Could you do it, please? :) I think we would need it only on musketeers nodes.
column436: 21/Nov/17 8:17 AM;vladimir_v;[~unibrew], that's what I suggested week ago, to go directly to origin and bypass Akamai :) You can have a lag between version of the site from origin and the cached version from Akamai. If you want this change make a ticket for us.
column437: 21/Nov/17 10:03 AM;unibrew;[~vladimir_v] ah ok, I misunderstood you. I thought your idea was to point the indexer against https://origin-developers.redhat.com/sitemap.xml which wouldn't work. This trick with /etc/hosts is something I didn't think of and makes the whole solution a brilliant one :) I'll write the ticket. Thx
column438: 23/Nov/17 9:16 AM;unibrew;[~dcoughlin1] Vladimir handled the server side configuration and the indexer is running correctly now.
column439: 27/Nov/17 11:42 AM;dcoughlin1;[~unibrew] - Good deal! Thanks Rysiek and [~vladimir_v]!

column1: Cheat sheets not showing up in search results
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39: Per DEVELOPER-3846 we should see cheat sheets in the results for on-site search. However, if I search for linux and then select the cheat sheet filter, I do not see any results.
column422: 30/Jun/17 11:40 AM;lightguard;Based on the query in the last comment of DEVELOPER-3846: http://dcp2.jboss.org/v2/rest/search?sys_type=cheatsheet and what we're currently doing in the search: ttps://dcp2.jboss.org/v2/rest/search/developer_materials?tags_or_logic=true&filter_out_excluded=true&from=0&query=linux&query_highlight=true&size10=true&sys_type=cheatsheet the main difference looks like the endpoint of the rest service being used. I'm not familiar enough with the DCP to know what the differences are. [~paul.robinson], [~dcoughlin1], or [~unibrew] may have some more insight.
column423:
03/Jul/17 5:13 AM;unibrew;The /search endpoint is an old/legacy search that was implemented for DCP1, unless specified it searches through all content in DCP so it obviously finds the cheat sheets.
In DCP2 we introduced registered queries like /search/developer_materials which can be more align with the use case and most importantly reconfigured without code changes.
The bug is related to the fact that the query by default searches through a certain list of types:
{code}
jbossdeveloper_quickstart
jbossdeveloper_demo
jbossdeveloper_bom
jbossdeveloper_archetype
jbossdeveloper_example
jbossdeveloper_vimeo
jbossdeveloper_youtube
jbossdeveloper_book
jbossdeveloper_event
rht_knowledgebase_article
rht_knowledgebase_solution
stackoverflow_question
jbossorg_sbs_forum
jbossorg_blog
{code}
Before the new search page was released all the types were enforced in the executed search URL, just like it is on the /resources page. Now however it relies on the default. Considering that you plan to decommission /resources we could tune those default query settings to suit the /search page better.
So, please let me know what types to add, I already know about rht_website and jbossdeveloper_cheatsheet. Anything else?
column424: 03/Jul/17 6:19 AM;unibrew;btw. I've added the jbossdeveloper_cheatsheet type to the list of types searched by default so I think you can consider this task to be done.
column425: 03/Jul/17 8:13 AM;tnolan;Confirmed that this issue resolved now! Thanks [~unibrew]. I noticed an issue with the date display though and logged a critical bug for that to be resolved - DEVELOPER-4259

column1: Add loading image while waiting for results
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Requirements
The amount of time to return search results can be multiple seconds. There should be an image showing that loading is happening so users do not get confused.

h2. Design
* Use previous loading graphic

h2. Stakeholders
* Engineering-only

h2. Acceptance Criteria
* When a new search is done a loading graphic should appear in the results area
* When more records are loaded a loading graphic should appear in the results area
* When a filter or sorting is changed a loading graphic should appear in the results area

h2. Review Steps
* Do a search from the home page or search page
* Should be a loading graphic displayed while the search is done
* Change a filter and sorting
* Should be a loading graphic displayed while the search is done
* Load more results
* Should be a loading graphic displayed while the search is done

h2. Requirements
The plus sign "+" should not be visible to users in the search box once they perform a search from the header search box. The plus should also not be sent in the string to Adobe Analytics in the DDO. 

h2. Design
* No new design needed

h2. Stakeholders
* Engineering-only

h2. Review Steps
* Perform a search using the search box in the header and you will see the plus signs in place of spaces on the results page.
* The plus should not be sent in the string to Adobe Analytics in the DDO. 
** Use the Omnibug Chrome plugin to validate a search term (evar41) does not have the + sign

So, if you can get a set with just a few, like do "fuse jboss" and then content type of "Demo". That'll give you less records. Then just click "Load More" until it disappears. You'll see that the last item is duplicated.

column425:
21/Jun/17 8:41 AM;ihamilto;[~dcoughlin1] if this ticket is no longer relevant please close so it is removed it from the proposed sprint.

Edit: ignore me! I'm looking at the wrong sprint :)
column426: 21/Jun/17 8:51 AM;ldary;[~dcoughlin1] and [~ihamilto] I'm still seeing some duplication. Example would be to query for "fuse" and then filter by Quickstarts. I think the issue is because the "from" parameter needs to be 1 less than the number of records loaded the code is actually doing one less than the index of loads rather than the quantity. So the pattern should go from=0, from=9, from=19, from=29 it is currently going from=0, from=9, from=18, from=27

column1: URL History update duplication
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Requirements
Navigation history is being updated on the return of every search query, and occasionally duplicated. Correct cases where duplicate history is entered and ensure that going back will reload previous state correctly.

h2. Design
* No new design needed

h2. Stakeholders
* Engineering-only

h2. Acceptance Criteria
* History is never duplicated
* Navigation back in history will resolve and execute based on parameters in URL

h2. Review Steps
* Navigate to /search
* enter a search term and press enter or push Search button
* add a facet
* add another facet
* note the number of history entries in the back button should correspond to 4
* Clear All facets
* should have only one more history entry
* hit the back button
* should see previous search updated (or until facets are put in querystring at least previous search term)

column1: Remove Mobile CTAs from product pages with broken links
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Requirements
Get Started and Download CTAs that link to the product's /hello-world or /download in mobile view should not be displayed if the product does not have the corresponding page. This is causing a broken link errors in product pages such as Openshift and .Net

If only one of the 'Download' or 'Get Started' links is missing, then just remove the button. If both links are missing, remove the "BUILD SOMETHING TODAY" box altogether.

h2. Design
No design needed.

h2. Stakeholders
* UX: [~tnolan]

h2. Acceptance Criteria
No tests required, as the broken links are picked up by broken link checkers.

h2. Review Steps

* Open https://developers.redhat.com/products/openshift/overview/ check only the "download" button is present

column1: EU Cookie Banner won't permanently dismiss
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
To reproduce:

# Visit https://developers.redhat.com whilst in Europe (or appearing to be in Europe)
# Observe the EU cookie banner
# Click the cross to dismiss it
# Close tab
# Open a new tab and visit https://developers.redhat.com
# Observe that the EU cookie banner returns

I'm pretty sure it should never come back, once dismissed. I think that (ironically) cookies are used to implement this, so a user should never see this again on the same browser, unless cookies are cleared.

h2. To Review
# Run the reproduction steps above and ensure that the cookie banner does not re-appear.

column1: Rsync to staging and production file system locations fails as it tries to delete .snapshot directories
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
The filesystem locations on filemgmt.jboss.org used for production and staging are backed up and hence contain a .snapshot directory.

The rsync command we use to rsync to these directories passes the {{--delete}} option and will therefore try to delete anything on the receiving side that is not present on the sending side. As the {{.snapshot}} directories are only on the receiving side, it tries to delete the directory, but this fails, causing the entire rsync process to fail.

The {{.snapshot}} directory should always be excluded from the rsync process.

*Definition of Done*

* It is possible to rsync to the production and staging locations on filemgmt.jboss.org

column1: Drupal UAT: All links point to ".html" extension pages
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39: The links on the product page navigation menus and site primary navigation menus all appear to point to destinations that end with the ".html" file suffix. This should not be the case, as all URLs on the site should end with '/'
column422:
28/Jul/16 5:28 AM;rblake;This is a side-effect of exporting the site to a static HTML dump using httrack. It adds the .html suffix to any HTML resource and then when it does the URL re-writing within the exported HTML, links to the .html versions of other pages. AFAICS there is no way to disable this behaviour in httrack and there is no way to hook into the URL re-writing process. 

Also to be considered here is the different site structure produced by Awestruct (the current way the site is generated) and httrack (the tool we use to generate the static dump).

Taking the containers section of the site as an example, Awestruct produces the following site structure on disk:

{code}
/containers/index.html
/containers/adoption/index.html
/containers/benefits/index.html
/containers/overview/index.html
{code}

It is the above structure that I assume necessitates the trailing slash URL structure on the site. Using the above structure a trailing slash on the URL works as Apache interprets it as a request for a directory and by default will serve the index.html within that directory. This is also why I assume the current site 301 redirects any links that do not end in a slash.

With the httrack export structure for the above we get:

{code}
/containers.html
/containers/overview.html
/containers/adoption.html
/containers/benefits.html
{code}

So quite a different site structure and one in which a trailing slash on the URL will not work without some re-writing rules (there is no index.html).

Broadly I think the requirement here is that all of the following URLs are seen as the same after migration for SEO purposes:

# http://developers.redhat.com/containers
# http://developers.redhat.com/containers/
# http://developers.redhat.com/containers.html

And so on through-out the site. Assuming I am correct and that having the .html suffix is permissible, then the simplest fix I can think of is to have a mod_rewrite rule that says that broadly runs the following pseudocode:

{code}
If URL ends with '/', then remove trailing slash
If !URL ends with .html, then suffix .html
{code}

We would also need to disable the current 301 redirect for non-trailing slash URLs to trailing slash URLs.

I'm not up on the SEO intricacies of doing the above, but my assumption is that Google will see things as the same because it is still getting a response for the trailing-slash version of the site. In addition the use of the canonical tag points any "SEO juice" to the URL prior to migration. This definitely needs to be run passed someone who knows more about SEO than I do.

So before we move ahead on this with a fix, we need a decision from a business/SEO perspective as to whether or not the .html suffixed pages are acceptable or whether we need to maintain the current '/' suffixed URL structure.
column423:
28/Jul/16 5:37 AM;paul.robinson;What Rob suggests makes sense to me. Given that matching the current behaviour is not a simple fix, I think we need to understand what the problems are here. I see two:

1) The URLs don't look as nice as they did before. I don't see this as a critical thing to fix.
2) We may lose SEO. I think the use of canonical tag will resolve this, but I would want an SEO expert to provide input here.
3) Bookmarked URLs will break. Correct use of Apache redirects will resolve this.

So to summarise, i think Rob has all our important issues covered, but we should check with an SEO expert.

column1: Content fetched from DCP will always show the final_base_url in Drupal and not the local environment base_url
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
When we push content into Drupal using Awestruct, we use two different parameters to determine the URLs that are generated for the site. These parameters are:

* {{base_url}}: The environment specific URL of the site e.g. in the case of production Drupal: http://developer-drupal.web.prod.ext.phx2.redhat.com/
* {{final_base_url}}: The final URL of the site when is has been exported and is publicly available e.g. http://developers.redhat.com

When pushing content into the DCP as part of the Awestruct process, we must use the {{final_base_url}} value otherwise resources and other latest content will point to a URL that does not resolve to visitors of the publicly available site. This has the downside that when visiting the Drupal instance, you will always be directed to the public version of the site when clicking on a resource or latest content link because it too is using the {{final_base_url}} value.

It may be desirable for content to be linked relative to whatever environment it is running in rather than absolutely using {{final_base_url}}

*Definition of Done*

* It is possible to have content retrieved from the DCP linked relatively no matter which environment it is viewed in
column422:
26/Jul/16 12:10 PM;rblake;[~paul.robinson] / [~lightguard] Could either of you confirm that I am correct on this? I'm not 100% sure, but that is my suspicion.

cheers,

Rob

So, when browsing http://developer-drupal.web.prod.ext.phx2.redhat.com the links should look like http://developer-drupal.web.prod.ext.phx2.redhat.com/demos/jbossdemocentral-brms-coolstore. When browsing http://developers.redhat.com/ the links should look like http://developers.redhat.com/demos/jbossdemocentral-brms-coolstore.

1) Temporarily have the Drupal build of the site point to dcp.stage.jboss.org. This will prevent the production DCP getting Drupal internal links. however, the staging DCP will get staging links whenever the staging build of the site runs. So not ideal, but at least it doesn't mess with production.

2) Update the JS code that displays the links to re-write them. This ensures that the links stay in the current environment regardless of what the DCP actually returns. We already have code to fix for when we shared a DCP with www.jboss.org. See: https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/blob/master/javascripts/search.js#L113-L122

column1: Export fails because Drupal cron is already executing
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
By default, Drupal 8 configures itself to execute cron every 3 hours. A problem arises if we try to run an export whilst cron is running as part of this schedule.

As part of the export process we invoke cron on Drupal to ensure that the sitemap.xml is up-to-date with all pages. If cron is already executing, then this part of the process fails.

*Definition of Done*

* Disable automatic execution of cron on Drupal instance by default
column404: Wait until cron has finished executing and then manually run the export process again.
column422:
22/Jul/16 8:06 AM;rblake;[~paul.robinson] Another one to schedule. 

I believe this may be the cause of 'http://default' appearing in the sitemap.xml (but I cannot verify for certain). PR https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/pull/1296 introduces a fix to work-around that problem. Additionally the export simply fails if cron is already executing, causing the build to fail. The workaround is to simply kick-off the export again if it happens.

My feeling is to keep an eye on it and see how much we run into it and perhaps schedule this as a UAT issue or perhaps later than that.

cheers,

Rob
column423:
27/Jul/16 2:50 PM;japplebe;I’ve gone through the issue and while testing it manually I wasn't able to find any issue with accessing the sitemap.xml while the cron was running. I ran  cron at the same time regenerating the sitemap.xml manually. I was able to access sitemap.xml during cron run. Which leads me to the suggestion that this could be a timeout issue or could also be handled by adding a retry with a delay inside the ruby script in drupal_page_url_list_generator.rb. Since I’m not familiar with ruby, I would appreciate it if someone could make some modifications and get back to me if not resolved.
http://opensourceconnections.com/blog/2008/04/24/adding-timeout-to-nethttp-get_response/
column424: 27/Jul/16 4:22 PM;lightguard;Wondering if it makes more sense to add Faraday as a gem dependency here and use https://github.com/lostisland/faraday/blob/master/lib/faraday/request/retry.rb instead.
column425:
27/Jul/16 5:01 PM;lightguard;Not sure how to test this if [~japplebe] isn't able to trigger it manually. I have a patch locally:


{code:ruby}
    # Implementing a simple retry mechanism
    retries = [30, 60, 120] # I know this could take a while, but we want to make sure this is actually going to work#
    sitemap_contents = nil
    begin
      sitemap_contents = Net::HTTP.get_response(sitemap_url)
    rescue StandardError => e
      @log.warn("Caught #{e.class} while attempting to fetch the sitemap. Message: #{e.message}")
      delay = retries.shift
      if delay
        sleep delay
        @log.info('Retrying sitemap fetch')
        retry
      end
    end
{code}
column426:
29/Jul/16 6:59 AM;rblake;The problem here is not fetching the sitemap.xml, its the invocation of the cron URL whilst cron is already executing.

The cron URL is exposed on {{http://<drupal_url>/cron/rhd}}. Hitting this URL remotely causes Drupal to invoke cron. The problem I believe is that we have Drupal configured to run cron by default every 3 hours. If that process has already started and you then make a request to the above URL, the your request will time-out after 10 minutes causing the export to fail.

At the minute I can't see any reason for us to be running cron on a 3 hourly basis in Drupal. We run the export at least every hour, so we know the longest time between cron runs in 1 hour. Therefore my proposal would be for us to configure Drupal to have automatic cron invocation disabled and just rely on the fact that we can trigger cron as part of our build process if we need to.

In terms of how to test it, my assumption would be:

# Go into Drupal and kick off cron
# Run the export in the environment that cron is already running in and see what happens
column427: 29/Jul/16 8:57 AM;japplebe;If the export is run every hour at least then its better to disable the automatic cron as the manual export will eventually run the cron every hour.
column428: 29/Jul/16 4:00 PM;lightguard;I have to say I like [~japplebe]'s idea. Let's disable the automatic cron and just run it manually. With only having one slave running the Jenkin's job it actually means we wouldn't hit this issue because they can't build concurrently.

column1: Incorrect base URL is sent to Searchisko when running Awestruct against Drupal
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
We use the site.base_url to set the base URL of the site. When using Drupal, this is set to the hostname of the VM not the final destination. For example in production, the base_url is set to:

http://developer-drupal.web.prod.ext.phx2.redhat.com/

and not 

http://developers.redhat.com

The reason for this is so that the content loads correctly when viewing Drupal. The export process rewrites the links to be relative so that it works correctly when delivered via developers.redhat.com.

The problem with the above is that we send the incorrect base_url into searchikso. For searchisko, we need to send developers.redhat.com and not developer-drupal.web.prod.ext.phx2.redhat.com.

*Definition of Done*

* The correct URL is sent to searchisko given the final destination of the site once
column422: 11/Jul/16 2:44 PM;lightguard;You can set the variable `final_base_url` in `_config/site.yml` to test this out. Looks like there may be some overriding in the client layer via JavaScript, but you can verify by looking at a  searchisko query. Fixed in commit `c7d57d7`
column423:
26/Jul/16 12:21 PM;rblake;[~lightguard] I'm going to re-open this one as it appears this is not fixed. We're still seeing the Drupal URL being pushed into searchisko as part of the production build.

cheers,

Rob

column1: Login/Logout is not working on export of site from Drupal
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
The login and logout links are always present on the exported version of the site from Drupal. Clicking on either does nothing.

*Definition of Done*

* Login and logout links work as expected
* Either login or logout is shown depending upon whether or not the user is currently logged into the site.
column422: 27/Jun/16 11:26 AM;lightguard;This would be a CORS issue. If you load the exported site up with a URL that is approved it should work just fine.
column423: 14/Jul/16 10:21 AM;dcoughlin1;[~lkrzyzanek] - We are having issues with login on http://developer-drupal.web.stage.ext.phx2.redhat.com/, can you add that to the CORS configuration? If you need any further information, please let me know.
column424:
14/Jul/16 10:49 AM;lkrzyzanek;Staging Keycloak allows everything. It's not problem in CORS.

Look at the URL: https://developers.stage.redhat.com/auth/realms/rhd/account/realms/rhd/protocol/openid-connect/login-status-iframe.html?client_id=web&origin=http://developer-drupal.web.stage.ext.phx2.redhat.com

It's not correct URL.
column425: 19/Jul/16 12:37 AM;lightguard;Fixed this on staging, prod may require a CORS entry for developer-drupal.web.prod.ext.phx2.redhat.com if it isn't already there. I'm not sure about the export though.
column426: 19/Jul/16 12:53 AM;lightguard;This was a config change in the rhd.settings.yml file
column427: 22/Jul/16 6:49 PM;dcoughlin1;[~lkrzyzanek] - The product drupal build uses production keycloak. Can you add http://developer-drupal.web.prod.ext.phx2.redhat.com to the production origin log? I think that should fix the issue with login.
column428: 27/Jul/16 5:57 PM;dcoughlin1;[~velias] [~lightguard] [~paul.robinson] - How can we get logout to work properly? We need the redirect to go back to http://developer-drupal.web.prod.ext.phx2.redhat.com. Does Keycloak need to be modified in order to allow the redirects to go to their respective base urls?
column429:
28/Jul/16 3:45 AM;paul.robinson;The logout URL is passed by the client. See: https://github.com/redhat-developer/developers.redhat.com/blob/master/javascripts/sso.js#L18

Although, I’m not sure why that URL wouldn’t be set correctly.
column430: 28/Jul/16 4:47 AM;velias;[~dcoughlin1] Keycloak's configuration had been updated yesterday or two days ago to allow http://developer-drupal.web.prod.ext.phx2.redhat.com domain. But website have to send correct redirect_url in logout request to keycloak to let keycloak know where to redirect back.

column1: Not all links appear to be re-written in export of site from Drupal
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
Browsing around an export of the site from Drupal, it would appear that not all links get re-written properly. Two examples that I have found just by browsing the front-page:

* Technologies -> Red Hat Developer Toolset still points to the Drupal instance
* Developers Salary Survey still points to the Drupal instance

My first guess as to why this is happening is that the links in the page are suffixed with a "/" whereas in the sitemap.xml there is no trailing "/". I suspect that Httack sees the trailing slash and determines that the page is trying to link to a directory rather than another page, sees that it doesn't have that directory in its fetch list and hence leaves it as is.

It is worth noting that the content has been exported OK e.g. the .html file exists where you expect it to.

*Definition of Done*

* All incorrectly re-written links are investigated and resolved

# /ticket-monster/****html5/index.html

The URL being created is currently only reported if there is an issue creating it and it is retried. It would be useful if the URL being created was reported at all times so that we can at least sanity check what content is being pushed into Drupal.

*Definition of Done*

* Check that all content is being created on the expected URL
* Output the URL that is being created in Drupal at all times

column1: Bind mount of _docker/drupal into Drupal container causes deployment issues
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h3. Problem

Currently we bind mount _docker/drupal into the Drupal container via this definition in the docker-compose.yml for each environment:

{code}
drupal:
    ...
    volumes:
      - ../../drupal:/var/www/drupal
{code}

Essentially this means that Drupal is using part of the Git checkout as its workspace. This is causing several problems when I'm trying to get the pull request job to work:

# Because the Drupal container is running as user root, any files or folders touched by the root user cannot be deleted by the Jenkins slave with a subsequent job runs. This causes any subsequent job to fail, meaning that we need to be very vigilant to make sure this does not happen. As a work-around, I have managed to synchronise the apache user id and jenkins_developer id to ensure file ownership permissions are correct.
# As a side-effect of the above, when developing on your local machine and running the Drupal instance, if you do not have the same id as the jenkins_developer (1000), parts of your Git repository suddenly become unreadable/unwritable. The only current solution is to 'chown' the repository back to something that works for you. This would suggest that we need to allow the user to parameterise the uid of the apache user based upon their environment, or list it as a known problem
# It is not possible to run a "retest this please" or re-run a build where Drupal is already running because of the bind mounted '/var/www/drupal/web/images' and '/var/www/drupal/web/fonts'. When Jenkins tries to reset the workspace to re-run the job, it cannot remove these directories as they are in use by the drupal container. The only way around this would be to add a pre-checkout step to all Jenkins builds that stops all containers first. 

Given the above, my feeling is that using the `_docker/drupal` directory as a bind mount that is written to by the Drupal container is not the correct way to be doing things and is going to cause us more problems in the future.

h3. Potential Solution

My initial thought is that an alternative approach is to 'COPY' the _drupal directory into the Drupal container at build time. This means that the Drupal container can happily write to this file-system without impacting upon the Git repository checkout. This should resolve all file system permission issues above and also prevent us from having to configure pre-checkout build steps to stop any containers. So this would mean a change to the Dockerfile for the Drupal container to include something like:

{code}
COPY . /var/www/
{code}

A down-side I can see to this is that each time you run the container, you have to wait for composer to install again. I don't immediately have a solution for this, but I think we may just have to roll with that. 

Secondly we have to now explicitly bind mount in the rhd.settings.php and rhd.settings.yml files as the main drupal filesystem is no longer bind-mounted. So the docker-compose.yml would end up looking something like:

{code}
drupal:
    build: ../../drupal
    ports:
      - "80"
    links:
      - drupalmysql
      - searchisko
    volumes:
      - ./rhd.settings.php:/var/www/drupal/web/sites/default/rhd.settings.php
      - ./rhd.settings.yml:/var/www/drupal/web/sites/default/rhd.settings.yml
      - ../../../images:/var/www/drupal/web/images
      - ../../../stylesheets/fonts:/var/www/drupal/web/fonts
{code}

The rhd.settings.php and rhd.settings.yml files would need to exist before the container starts otherwise the bind-mount will fail. This is not a problem for the drupal-dev, drupal-staging and drupal-production environments as these files willl contain only known values and therefore don't need to be templated.

However for the drupal-pull-request environment, the rhd.settings.yml file needs to be templated, so the templating process needs to be split into 2:

# Create the rhd.settings.yml file before starting the container so the bind mount will work
# As soon as the container has booted, template the contents of the rhd.settings.yml file with the correct endpoints

column1: Importing content into Drupal should be idempotent
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
In order to support the deployment of changes to a Drupal containing existing content, the content import process must be idempotent.  

*Definition of Done*

* The content import process can be immediately re-run against a Drupal instance that already contains the exact same content and finish without error
* The content import process can be run against a Drupal already containing content to import a single new piece of content
* The content import process can be run against a Drupal already containing content to edit an existing piece of content.

column1: Do not trigger automatical download when user visits download landing page again (after back button usage).
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
When you download something from /downloads page then you ends on page with thank you box + JS starts download. It's quite common then you click around and it happens that you use back button in browser. Once you visit the page again the JS triggers download again.

This needs to be detected and do not to trigger automatical download again. If user needs to download it again then he can use "direct link" in thank you box.
column422:
18/Mar/16 9:02 AM;lkrzyzanek;You can achieve this by simple check on Referer attribute.
If Referer is from Download manager (start with https://developers.redhat.com/download-manager/) then you know that request comes from download manager - then it's correct start download automatically.

If Referer is from anything else (like another page on website) then it's obvious that's back button usage.

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/referrer
column423:
18/Mar/16 9:25 AM;lkrzyzanek;Checked again and referer header is not in place because of redirects resp. of browser cache (in case of back button).

Another solution would be to store in browser html5 storage the information what download (what URL) was triggered and when. On next page visit  (including download again resp. back button) JS would check if the download URL was triggered in last let say 10 minutes and if yes then do not trigger download again.

column1: Document proposed Drupal Architecture
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
In order to communicate our ideas to Phase2 we need to produce a document that they can read prior to our initial meeting at the beginning of May.

The document should contain:

1. A diagram showing the eventual Drupal Architecture.
2. An explanation of the key pieces in the diagram

In particular it should cover:

1. How content is automatically added. This covers things like Video and Quickstart pages.
2. Which pieces of the architecture live on the VPN and which off the VPN (and thus publicly exposed)
3. How content is exported. E.g the static content to the production Apache server
4. Where testing occurs
5. How content is created and modified by content editors
6. The content workflow starting from the template and ending with an editable content type. 

h2. Definition of Done
* The document has been reviewed and approved by [~lightguard], [~lincolnthree], [~ihamilto] and [~rblake].
column422:
14/Apr/16 5:07 AM;paul.robinson;I've created three documents to hand to Phase2 prior to our engagement in early May. Please review them from the perspective of the Phase2 consultants. Will they understand them? Are we conveying the key facets of the project? Also, note that i've renamed the 'phases'. The first production release is now called '1.0' and the idealized eventual architecture is '2.0'. Hopefully this is clearer.

1.0 Architecture document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1u8ofn-P5WVdFi8HrLZPRtyqjYNUIJr4BRjfU45XaMDA/edit#
2.0 Architecture document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dWnKDsBK3ZAIOflyQtI7PIn9vwa007ICMTStLiWQ_QY/edit#
Content Workflow document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1vklnQU99QJU5uu6-07LKPKlLrp95aCbgG01pfDCCSWE/edit#

I don't think the definition of done is complete yet. I'm just providing the above docs for review.

column1: Deployment of site via github repo (Spike)
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
In order to support quick roll backs then the site should be deployed via a github repo.
The idea would be that the out put of awestruct or drupal be pushed to a volume. This volume would be then committed to github and then rsynced to the apache server. 

This is a spike to have a think about how this architecture would look like. 

It is done when there is some more documentation on how to go about this. A new ticket would do.

column39:
See: http://developers.redhat.com/products/eap/download/ and http://www.jboss.org/products/eap/download/

Notice that both '7.0.0 Alpha' and '7.0.0 Beta' are shown. Only zero or one early access download should be shown. E.g: https://www.dropbox.com/s/xjpjhnf3pjcn36b/Screenshot%202016-01-05%2015.57.58.png?dl=0
column422: 22/Feb/16 1:35 PM;paul.robinson;This needs reviewing from a UX viewpoint ([~tnolan]) and also needs acceptance criteria, as it's quite complex to decide what to show.
column423: 02/Jan/18 2:50 PM;tnolan;[~paul.robinson] I do not think we should be showing an alpha or beta release in the All Downloads table. Is that a programming change or would it be up to whoever owns adding the downloads in Download Manager to remove them?
column424:
11/Jan/18 6:00 AM;paul.robinson;[~tnolan] the owner of the artefacts can hide them in the download manager, and they will disappear from this page. 

However, the problem this issue reports is when there are these releases:

{code}
7.1.0 Beta
7.1.0 Alpha
7.0.0 GA
{code}

Currently all of those releases would be shown by default. But I think we should only show 7.1.0 Beta and 7.0.0 GA. This could get much worse if there are many pre-GA releases for a product.
column425: 11/Sep/18 8:07 AM;amcgrana;[~paul.robinson] [~tnolan] to confirm do we want to default to beta and ga only. if there is an alpha and no beta show the alpha and GA?
column426:
11/Sep/18 8:17 AM;paul.robinson;[~amcgrana], correct, as long as the Alpha of Beta is for a release version that is higher than the highest GA.

These are the rules:

# Always show the highest version GA. This might not be the latest GA release, so ordering by date won't work. Sometimes products do G.A releases on older generations. E.g. after EAP 7.0.0 was released, there might have been an EAP 6.6.0 release for those that can't do a major update yet.
# Only show a pre-GA release (e.g Alpha or Beta) if it is for a version higher than the highest GA release. E.g show 'EAP 7.1.0 Alpha' if 'EAP 7.0.0 GA' is the highest GA release. 
# Only show zero or one pre-GA releases. E.g. don't show 'EAP 7.1.0 Alpha' if  'EAP 7.1.0 Beta' exists.

The response from the download manager should state if the release is GA or not. However the ordering of Alpha vs Beta might need hard coding. I'm not sure how it was done.

column1: AngularJS is being loaded as a standalone JS tag on the home page
column10: Website related issues  for http://developers.redhat.com
column39:
h2. Requirements
AngularJS is not used site-wide. Therefore including it on every page is a waste of bandwidth and processing. We should restrict its inclusion only to the pages that use it: /resources (being removed from site eventually), /stack-overflow, and download pages. Note: another solution would be to replace AngularJS with web components on these pages to handle the same functionality.

h2. Design
* NA

h2. Stakeholders
* Engineering-only

h2. Acceptance Criteria
* AngularJS is not included on pages not listed above
* AngularJS is still included on pages listed above

h2. Review Steps
* Visit the following pages and note whether the "angular" object is defined in Dev Tools (should be undefined on pages not listed above):
** home page
** /products/fuse
** /search
** /topics/dotnet
** /stack-overflow (should be defined)
** /products/fuse/download/ (should be defined)

column1: [RH-SSO 7.2] [RH-SSO 7.3 TP CD] Split os-sso module into version specific RH-SSO and common RH-SSO modules
column39:
The RH-SSO 7.2 for OpenShift and RH-SSO 7.3 TP CD for OpenShift images utilize _os-sso72_ and  _sso.config.launch.setup_ (former _os-sso73_) module, respectively:
* [RH-SSO 7.2 version|https://github.com/jboss-openshift/cct_module/tree/master/os-sso72], 
* [RH-SSO 7.3 TP CD version|https://github.com/jboss-container-images/redhat-sso-7-openshift-image/tree/sso-cd-dev/modules/sso/config/launch/setup/73] which currently combines both:
* The part necessary for configuration and launch of some specific version of the RH-SSO product (e.g. _standalone-openshift.xml_ and _openshift-launch.sh_ scripts), with
* The part common to all RH-SSO images -- not changing when the version of the underlying RH-SSO product changes (e.g. _import-realm.json_, _index.html_ files, or majority of the files located under _launch_ subdirectory).

_Acceptance Criteria:_
The change should split current _os-sso72_ module into two separate modules as follows:
* Keep the common (not changing across RH-SSO versions) part under _os-sso-common_ module, and
* Place the RH-SSO version specific (changing part) into _sso.config.launch.setup_ RH-SSO module.

This way the code duplicity (currently present) will be eliminated -- if there's a bug common to all RH-SSO images, it will be enough to correct it in _os-sso-common_ module (and not in each RH-SSO image version).

column1: [RH-SSO 7.2] [RH-SSO 7.3 TP CD] Consume standalone-openshift.xml from upstream standalone-ha.xml
column39:
The RH-SSO 7.2 for OpenShift and RH-SSO 7.3 CD Technology Preview for OpenShift images currently keep own, fixed-form copy of _standalone-openshift.xml_ configuration file:
* [RH-SSO 7.2 copy|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jboss-openshift/cct_module/master/os-sso72/added/standalone-openshift.xml]
* [RH-SSO 7.3 copy|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jboss-container-images/redhat-sso-7-openshift-image/sso-cd-dev/modules/sso/config/launch/setup/73/added/standalone-openshift.xml]

Since such fixed copy gets outdated very quickly, it leads to issues when outdated _standalone-openshift.xml_ configuration file fails to launch with most recent Keycloak server overlay Zip archive.

_Acceptance Criteria:_
The change should introduce new _sso.create.configuration_ module (the _/72_ and _/73_ variants of it, respectively), basically doing two things:
# Retrieving latest version of _standalone-ha.xml_ from upstream for specific RH-SSO product version,
# Modifying such _standalone-ha.xml_ into form expected by _standalone-openshift.xml_:
 ## This includes introduction of "XML anchors" like {noformat}<!-- ##SSL## -->{noformat}, or {noformat}<!-- ##MGMT_IFACE_REALM## -->{noformat} (see above links to existing copies to get the finite list of all these required anchors),
  ## And transformation of _standalone-ha.xml_ to _standalone-openshift.xml_ by adding parts, necessary on OpenShift platform (e.g. OpenShift log formatter etc.)

        -
          name: cheserviceaccount-token-6ch7l
          readOnly: true
          mountPath: /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount
    ...

{code}

column1: Error when starting an empty workspace

30/Nov/16 5:49 AM;ibuziuk;Actually, the problem is coupled with particular stack  - "Java-MySQL" which is used as default for empty workspace creation.  Basically, "Java + MySQL" stack comes in two machines (DB / DEV_MACHINE) - container for db & container with Java runtime. The problem with db container creation is coupled with a fact that there is no CHE_WORKSPACE_ID env var specified and workspace id is an empty string and OS service can not be created. So, I tried two ways of tackling this issue so far:

1. use the same workspaceID for db container, as for Java container
2. generate random workspaceID for db container

first approach fails because workspaceID is used as unique OS service name:

{code}

column1: Corrections needed information about Controller and OpenShiftStartup strategies in operator docs
column39:
[~filippe.spolti] has found some statements in teh template docs such as:

"In some authoring environments, you might need to ensure that several users can deploy services on the same KIE Server at the same time. By default, after deploying a service onto a KIE Server using Business Central, the user needs to wait for some seconds before more services can be deployed. To remove this limitation, you can configure the environment to use the controller strategy. Do not make this change unless a specific need for it exists; if you decide to enable controller strategy, make this change on Business Central and on all KIE Servers in the same environment."

"To enable controller strategy on a KIE Server, set the KIE_SERVER_STARTUP_STRATEGY environment variable to ControllerBasedStartupStrategy."

These statements are outdated. Controller strategy is enabled on single authoring and must not be enabled on HA authoring (or KIE server control fails). There is no more need for switching a server to the controller strategy at all.

I need to find and remove all such statements; moreover this also needs to be done for 7.8 and possibly 7.7 docs.

[~vidya_iyengar] I am requesting inclusion in this sprint, because I want to hand template docs over for QA at the end of the week or early next week.

column1: Missing information regarding kie server configuration when used with smart router in "Installing and configuring Red Hat Process Automation Manager in a Red Hat JBoss EAP clustered environment"
column39: Currently, in the chapter -[ 3.4 Clustering Process Servers with Smart Router|https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_process_automation_manager/7.5/html-single/installing_and_configuring_red_hat_process_automation_manager_in_a_red_hat_jboss_eap_clustered_environment/index#clustering-smartrouter-install-proc] we did not specify that kie servers should be unmanaged (not managed by controller/Business Central). This information is captured in the knowledge solution: [https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3772521|https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3772521].

column423:
19/Feb/20 12:07 PM;csherrar;[~aparedes]

Hi Adriel,

Would adding the following note to the prerequisites of 4.3 encapsulate the information provided by Biljana?

{noformat}
[NOTE]
====
Smart Router does not require {KIE_SERVER} to be configured as unmanaged.

An unmanaged {KIE_SERVER} does not connect to the controller.

If you connect an unmanaged {KIE_SERVER} to a Smart Router and register the Smart Router with the controller, {CENTRAL} can contact the unmanaged {KIE_SERVER} by using Smart Router.
====
{noformat}
column424:

column425: 24/Feb/20 12:03 PM;porcelli;better ask [~cristiano.nicolai]
column426:
01/Mar/20 11:03 PM;cnicolai;[~csherrar] would suggest a few tweaks.


Smart Router can be used with a managed or unmanaged {KIE_SERVER}.
An unmanaged {KIE_SERVER} does not connect to the controller.
If you connect an unmanaged {KIE_SERVER} to a Smart Router and register the Smart Router with the controller, {CENTRAL} can connect with the unmanaged {KIE_SERVER} but does not allow to change any configuration, like changing deployments. You can still Manage the process instances using the Manage section from {CENTRAL}.
column427:
02/Mar/20 6:55 AM;csherrar;[~cristiano.nicolai]

I modified your suggestion slightly and will adopt the below note.

[~bkramer]
Hi Biljana,
If you would like to add or change anything in the following note please let me know.

{noformat}
[NOTE]
====

You can use Smart Router with a managed or unmanaged {KIE_SERVER}.

An unmanaged {KIE_SERVER} does not connect to the controller. If you connect an unmanaged {KIE_SERVER} to a Smart Router and register the Smart Router with the controller, {CENTRAL} can connect to the unmanaged {KIE_SERVER} but you can not make changes to the configuration, such as changing deployments. You can still manage the process instances using the manage section in {CENTRAL}.
====
{noformat}
