column1: BC HA on-prem setup does not include shared storage for Maven repository
column39:
The current documentation includes setting up one NFS share. 

In the BC node setup procedure at https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_process_automation_manager/7.5/html/installing_and_configuring_red_hat_process_automation_manager_in_a_red_hat_jboss_eap_clustered_environment/clustering-dev-con#clustering-bc-configure-standalone_proc:

- In step 1 the share is mounted as /data

- In step 3 the value of org.uberfire.nio.git.dir is set to /data

This creates shared storage for the niogit repository.

However, Business Central also includes a built-in Maven repository. In the default setup the BC pushes KJARs to this repository and then the KIE server pulls the KJARs to deploy them.

In the present process, there is no shared storage for the Maven repository. This means every KJAR will just get pushed on the one node that happens to be handling the "build and deploy" operation. If the KIE server happens to connect to another node, it will not be able to pull the KJAR. To the user, this wiill probably look like "deployment failing randomly"/

The process must be modified to include setting up shared storage for the Maven repository either on the same NFS share or on a different NFS share. This is a documentation bug because the process is in the documentation; however, it reqires dev research first to work out the correct process.

[~adriel.paredes] - please work out the process.

Also FYI:

[~porcelli]
[~vidya_iyengar]
[~rhn-support-hjoy]
[~ederign]
column422: 11/Dec/19 10:31 AM;csherrar;[~mramendi] Ack, thanks
column423:
13/Dec/19 9:03 AM;mramendi;So thanks to [~spolti] I now know how this is solved in the cloud Authoring HA deployment.

    JBOSS_KIE_ARGS="${JBOSS_KIE_ARGS} -Dorg.guvnor.m2repo.dir=${kieDataDir}/maven-repository"

and previously kieDataDir is set to the shared PV mount.

Should we also be setting org.guvnor.m2repo.dir in on-prem HA deployment?
column424: 16/Dec/19 8:36 AM;aparedes;[~mramendi] [~csherrar] I think is a good idea to add maven dir in on-premise ha deployment doc
column425:
16/Dec/19 9:18 AM;mramendi;[~aparedes] but how do we do it?

Currently we have

  <property name="org.uberfire.nio.git.dir"
     value="/data"/>

And /data is our NFS share.

What I would guess would be:

  <property name="org.uberfire.nio.git.dir"
     value="/data/niogit"/>
  <property name="org.guvnor.m2repo.dir"
     value="/data/maven-repository"/>

Is this correct?

Also, this breaks compatibility with 7.5, but as 7.5 was tech preview I guess it's ok?
column426:
16/Dec/19 9:28 AM;aparedes;[~mramendi] what you wrote is perfecto, you are an NFS expert now! Everything inside /data will be shared across the nodes so anything we need to share should have its own subfolder in /data shared directory.

And yes, since 7.5 was tech preview I would probably not change it and I would just improve this from now on (7.6).
column427: 16/Dec/19 9:45 AM;mramendi;[~csherrar] yay we worked out the required change, can you please get it into the docs now?
column428: 17/Dec/19 10:00 PM;mramendi;[~csherrar] can you please confirm you have enough to take this over?

column1: Errors in Getting started with decision services
column39:
In the "Getting started with decision services" document ( https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_decision_manager/7.3/html/getting_started_with_decision_services/index ) I found the following errors:

* In "2.4. Defining the traffic violations DMN decision logic" ( https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_decision_manager/7.3/html/getting_started_with_decision_services/dmn-con_decision-service-getting-started#dmn-gs-defining-decision-logic-proc ) at point 17. there's a missing 'then', so it should say

17. In the parameter cell below Driver.Points + Fine.Points, enter if Total Points >= 20 *then* "Yes" else "No". 

* In "3.1. Testing the traffic violations using test scenarios" ( https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_decision_manager/7.3/html/getting_started_with_decision_services/test-scenarios-intro-con#dmn-gs-testing-test-scenario-proc ) at point 7. both Speed Limit: and Actual Speed: should say "leave blank" instead of "-"

* In "4.1. Executing a DMN service using the Decision Server REST API" ( https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_decision_manager/7.3/html/getting_started_with_decision_services/dmn-execution-con#dmn-execution-rest-proc ) all the example requests are wrong: the name of the artifact is "traffic-violation" all in lower case so also all urls in the curl commands should use the same name in lower case. E.g.:

curl -u wbadmin:wbadmin -H "accept: application/xml" -X GET "http://localhost:8080/kie-server/services/rest/server/containers/Traffic-Violation_1.0.0/dmn"

should be

curl -u wbadmin:wbadmin -H "accept: application/xml" -X GET "http://localhost:8080/kie-server/services/rest/server/containers/traffic-violation_1.0.0/dmn"

"leave blank" - adopted.
"traffic-violation" - adopted for all instances besides terminal output examples.

column1: RHDM 7.2 Installation guide for JWS missing instructions
column39:
The KIE server assembly for JWS is the same for RHDM and RHPAM. Although RHDM does not require a datasource, a web.xml in the KIE server contains org.jboss.narayana.tomcat.jta.NarayanaJtaServletContextListener, which depends on specific libraries being on Tomcat's classpath.

The following part of the RHPAM documentation should be included into the RHDM doc: 

Copy the following libraries from the offline Maven repository to the JWS_HOME/tomcat/lib folder: 

org.jboss.spec.javax.transaction:jboss-transaction-api_1.2_spec
org.jboss.integration:narayana-tomcat
org.jboss.narayana.jta:narayana-jta
org.jboss:jboss-transaction-spi

which can be found in https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_process_automation_manager/7.2/html/installing_and_configuring_red_hat_process_automation_manager_on_red_hat_jboss_web_server/process_server_zip_file_installation_and_configuration#jws-jdbc-config_install-on-jws
column422:
21/Feb/19 3:22 AM;vidya_iyengar;[~emmurphy],
please check if this needs to be fixed for 7.3 doc as well.
column423:
21/Feb/19 12:02 PM;phillip.hagerman;The PAM install guide linked above references "the offline Maven repository".  This source for those libraries is not defined, which is a problem for users going through the ZIP install steps since they will likely not know where to get approved libs to satisfy the dependencies.

The actual process is more complicated than the documentation makes it seem.  here are the steps the user would need to take in this case.

They can be found by downloading the Red Hat Decision Manager 7.2.1 Maven Repository from the product downloads page.1
Download this zip file and unpack it into a temporary location.
copy the following files to the $JWS_HOME/tomcat/lib directory:

$TEMP/maven-repository/org/jboss/spec/javax/transaction/jboss-transaction-api_1.2_spec/1.1.1.Final-redhat-1/jboss-transaction-api_1.2_spec-1.1.1.Final-redhat-1.jar
$TEMP/maven-repository/org/jboss/integration/narayana-tomcat/1.0.0.Final-redhat-1/narayana-tomcat-1.0.0.Final-redhat-1.jar
$TEMP/maven-repository/org/jboss/narayana/jta/narayana-jta/5.9.0.Final-redhat-00001/narayana-jta-5.9.0.Final-redhat-00001.jar
$TEMP/maven-repository/org/jboss/jboss-transaction-spi/7.6.0.Final-redhat-1/jboss-transaction-spi-7.6.0.Final-redhat-1.jar

column1: default JMS JNDI queue name is not correct in WebLogic installation guide
column39:
- RHPAM7.0
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_process_automation_manager/7.0/html/installing_and_configuring_process_server_on_oracle_weblogic_server/wls-configure-proc#wls-jms-queues-create-proc

- RHPAM7.1

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_process_automation_manager/7.1/html/installing_and_configuring_process_server_on_oracle_weblogic_server/wls-configure-proc#wls-jms-queues-create-proc

- RHDM7.1

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_decision_manager/7.1/html/installing_and_configuring_decision_server_on_oracle_weblogic_server/wls-configure-proc#wls-jms-queues-create-proc

Documents say that default queue name is as followings

KIE.SERVER.REQUEST       jms/queue/KIE.SERVER.REQUEST
KIE.SERVER.RESPONSE     jms/queue/KIE.SERVER.RESPONSE

But   kie-server.war/WEB-INF/weblogic-ejb-jar.xml looks like :

 https://github.com/kiegroup/droolsjbpm-integration/blob/7.11.x/kie-server-parent/kie-server-wars/kie-server/src/main/ee7-resources/WEB-INF/weblogic-ejb-jar.xml

e.g.  KIE.SERVER.REQUEST default JNDI mame is different.

Document               jms/queue/KIE.SERVER.REQUEST
weblogic-ejb-jar.xml   jms/KIE.SERVER.REQUEST   ('queue' is not included)

Default name in these Documents is not correct.

I have documented the correct JMS JNDI queue names in the WLS install doc. Can you please review and verify it once and let me know what do you think.
Also, are these changes applicable to all the versions from v7.0 to v7.4? Can you please confirm?
I have provided the rendered output links as well as the GitHub source below:

[WLS installation doc RHPAM doc preview|http://file.pnq.redhat.com/~kaldesai/BXMSDOC-4022-RHPAM-WLS/#wls-jms-queues-create-proc]
[WLS installation doc RHDM doc preview|http://file.pnq.redhat.com/~kaldesai/BXMSDOC-4022-RHDM-WLS/#wls-jms-queues-create-proc]
[Github source|https://github.com/kaldesai/kie-docs/pull/33]

Please review the following sections:
*4.3.4. Create JMS queues*
Procedure --> Step no. 4 --> JNDI name 

*4.3.4.1. JMS queues for Process Server*
Please check Table 4.2. Required JMS queues for Process Server ---> *Default value* column

Earlier it was *jms/queue/KIE.SERVER.REQUEST*, now it is *jms/KIE.SERVER.REQUEST*
WLS doc is reflecting the correct JMS JNDI queue names. 

Thank you.

column423:
20/Apr/18 10:46 AM;emmurphy;At Rajesh's request added case management known issue:

CHAPTER 1. CASE MANAGEMENT SHOWCASE KNOWN ISSUE
When you start a new case in Business Central, the list of users who are assigned to one of the case
roles should appear in the case list. However, in this beta release the cases are not listed in assigned
users' case lists.
To work around this issue:
1. Terminate all running case instances in the container where this case project is deployed.
2. In the Execution Servers perspective in Business Central:
a. Change this container’s runtime strategy to Per Case .
b. Restart this container.

[~bsremac] reviewed.
column424:
20/Apr/18 11:07 AM;bsremac;[~emmurphy]
I would leave the introduction paragraph as it was, because this last version looks confusing.

1. A new case is not started in Business Central, but in Case Management Showcase App. However, new cases can also be started using the Kie Server remote API without interaction with a user interface of any kind. This is why I think that specifying the mean used to start new cases is maybe better to be left off.

2. "the list of users who are assigned to one of the case roles should appear in the case list." - it is not the list of users which is expected to be shown in the case list, but rather started cases. This case list is expected to be shown only to users who are assigned to one or more case roles of the started cases. Again, I think that the initial version was clearer about this.

column1: Disable jBPM capability in Realtime Decision Server for BRMS installation
column39:
In BRMS, jBPM capability of kie-server has to be disabled. It means that users have to set these system properties

{noformat}
org.jbpm.server.ext.disabled=true
org.jbpm.ui.server.ext.disabled=true
{noformat}

It is automatically configured by BRMS installer or overwritten by EAP deployable. But in other cases, users have to do it manually so need to update our installer guide.

h3. JWS/Tomcat

* 2.7. Installing Red Hat JBoss BRMS on Red Hat JBoss Web Server
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_brms/6.4/single/installation_guide/index#installing_jboss_brms_on_jboss_ews_2

AS IS:
~~~
14. Define the btm.root system property and location where Bitronix configuration file is placed in: 

...

CATALINA_OPTS="-Xmx512M -XX:MaxPermSize=512m -Djava.security.auth.login.config=$CATALINA_HOME/webapps/business-central/WEB-INF/classes/login.config -Dbtm.root=$CATALINA_HOME -Dbitronix.tm.configuration=$CATALINA_HOME/conf/btm-config.properties -Dorg.jbpm.designer.perspective=RuleFlow -Djbpm.tsr.jndi.lookup=java:comp/env/TransactionSynchronizationRegistry -Dorg.jboss.logging.provider=jdk"

...

Important

On Microsoft Windows systems...

set "CATALINA_OPTS=-Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m -Djava.security.auth.login.config=C:\apache-tomcat\webapps\business-central\WEB-INF\classes\login.config -Dbtm.root=C:\apache-tomcat -Dbitronix.tm.configuration=C:\apache-tomcat\conf\btm-config.properties -Dorg.jbpm.designer.perspective=RuleFlow -Djbpm.tsr.jndi.lookup=java:comp/env/TransactionSynchronizationRegistry"
~~~

TO BE:
~~~
14. Define the btm.root system property and location where Bitronix configuration file is placed in: 

...

CATALINA_OPTS="-Xmx512M -XX:MaxPermSize=512m -Djava.security.auth.login.config=$CATALINA_HOME/webapps/business-central/WEB-INF/classes/login.config -Dbtm.root=$CATALINA_HOME -Dbitronix.tm.configuration=$CATALINA_HOME/conf/btm-config.properties -Dorg.jbpm.designer.perspective=RuleFlow -Djbpm.tsr.jndi.lookup=java:comp/env/TransactionSynchronizationRegistry -Dorg.jboss.logging.provider=jdk -Dorg.jbpm.server.ext.disabled=true -Dorg.jbpm.ui.server.ext.disabled=true"

...

Important

On Microsoft Windows systems...

set "CATALINA_OPTS=-Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m -Djava.security.auth.login.config=C:\apache-tomcat\webapps\business-central\WEB-INF\classes\login.config -Dbtm.root=C:\apache-tomcat -Dbitronix.tm.configuration=C:\apache-tomcat\conf\btm-config.properties -Dorg.jbpm.designer.perspective=RuleFlow -Djbpm.tsr.jndi.lookup=java:comp/env/TransactionSynchronizationRegistry -Dorg.jbpm.server.ext.disabled=true -Dorg.jbpm.ui.server.ext.disabled=true"
~~~


h3. WebSphere

* 3.7. Adding Custom JVM Properties
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_brms/6.4/single/ibm_websphere_installation_and_configuration_guide/index#add_custom_jvm_properties

Add these properties to "Table 3.4. Properties Required for Realtime Decision Server"

~~~
Name : org.jbpm.server.ext.disabled
Value : true
Description : When set to true, disables the BPM support (for example, processes support). Must be disabled for BRMS.

Name : org.jbpm.ui.server.ext.disabled
Value : true
Description : When set to true, disables the Intelligent Process Server UI extension. Must be disabled for BRMS.
~~~

h3. WebLogic

* 3.1. Setting Environment Variables
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_brms/6.4/single/oracle_weblogic_installation_and_configuration_guide/index#setting_environment_variables

Add 2 entries to "Properties Required for Realtime Decision Server"

- org.jbpm.server.ext.disabled: When set to true, disables the BPM support (for example, processes support). Set to true
- org.jbpm.ui.server.ext.disabled: When set to true, disables the Intelligent Process Server UI extension. Set to true

Also change " Set the following custom properties in a single environment variable:"

AS IS:
~~~
JAVA_OPTIONS="-Dkie.server.jms.queues.response=jms/KIE.SERVER.RESPONSE
 -Dorg.jbpm.designer.perspective=ruleflow
 -Dorg.uberfire.start.method=ejb
 -Dorg.uberfire.domain=OracleDefaultLoginConfiguration
 -Dorg.kie.executor.jms.cf=jms/cf/KIE.EXECUTOR
 -Dorg.kie.executor.jms.queue=jms/KIE.EXECUTOR
 -Dcom.sun.jersey.server.impl.cdi.lookupExtensionInBeanManager=true"
~~~

TO BE:
~~~
JAVA_OPTIONS="-Dkie.server.jms.queues.response=jms/KIE.SERVER.RESPONSE
 -Dorg.jbpm.designer.perspective=ruleflow
 -Dorg.uberfire.start.method=ejb
 -Dorg.uberfire.domain=OracleDefaultLoginConfiguration
 -Dorg.kie.executor.jms.cf=jms/cf/KIE.EXECUTOR
 -Dorg.kie.executor.jms.queue=jms/KIE.EXECUTOR
 -Dcom.sun.jersey.server.impl.cdi.lookupExtensionInBeanManager=true
 -Dorg.jbpm.server.ext.disabled=true
 -Dorg.jbpm.ui.server.ext.disabled=true"
~~~

column1: 7.4.6.6. Delete Existing Fact Columns
column39:
The [section|http://ccs-jenkins.gsslab.brq.redhat.com:8080/view/Topic%20branches%20-%20BRMS/job/doc-BRMS-User_Guide-branch-7.0-la-preview/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/index.html#sect_column_types] contains sub section *7.4.6.6. Delete Existing Fact Columns* that should be updated in the following way:
- Invoke new column wizard - link Adding Column section
- Select Delete an existing fact option
- Click Next
- Provide column header, optionally hide column
- Click finish

As the procedure is not complex, the picture *Figure 7.16. Delete an existing fact* could be probably removed.

column1: 7.4.6.5. New Fact Field Value Columns
column39:
The subsection *7.4.6.5. New Fact Field Value Columns* of [section|http://ccs-jenkins.gsslab.brq.redhat.com:8080/view/Topic%20branches%20-%20BRMS/job/doc-BRMS-User_Guide-branch-7.0-la-preview/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/index.html#sect_column_types] should be merged with the *7.4.6.4. Field Value Columns* sub section because there are no more two separate options for setting field of an existing fact and a new fact. Attaching also some procedure:

- Invoke new column wizard - link the section 7.4.5. Adding Columns
- Select *Set the value of a field* option
- Click Next
- Select either existing pattern (select box) or create new one (button)
- Click next
- Select field that you would like to update
- Click next
- Provide list of acceptable values and default value, both optional
- Click next
- Provide column header, hide column - optional, according to your data in second page of wizard you can *update engine with changes* or *insert fact logically*
- Finish the wizard

column1: 7.4.6. Column Types and 7.4.7. Advanced Column Types content
column39: The content of sections *7.4.6. Column Types* and *7.4.7. Advanced Column Types* in [user guide|http://ccs-jenkins.gsslab.brq.redhat.com:8080/view/Topic%20branches%20-%20BRMS/job/doc-BRMS-User_Guide-branch-7.0-la-preview/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/index.html] should reflect the default and advanced options from BXMSDOC-1920.

column1: Migrated project cannot be imported to the workbench
column10:
AppFormer is a low code platform to develop modern applications. It's a powerful tool for developers that
can quickly build applications by mashing up components and connect them.
column39:
If you try to clone migrated project you will see all other project which were in the same repository before migration and nullpointer exception dialog is displayed after migrated project is imported to the workbench.

There is a workaround: if you delete git-remote from the repository, the project can be imported.

This is reproducible on 7.1.1 and also on 7.2.0.
column373:
# Create 2 projects in a space in RHDM 7.0.0
# Clone the space repository
**  git clone .niogit/spacerepo.git
# Run migration tool on the cloned repo
** ./migration-tool.sh -bt [path_to_cloned_repo]
# Import first project repo to RHDM 7.1.1
** First error: both project are available to clone
# Select first project
** Second error: Nullpointer exception dialog is displayed.
column404:
# Open a terminal in migrated repository directory and remove git remote.
# {{git remote remove origin}}

column1: Adding "Target Div" component to a page causes Unexpected error to appear
column10:
AppFormer is a low code platform to develop modern applications. It's a powerful tool for developers that
can quickly build applications by mashing up components and connect them.
column39:
Trying to add "Target DIV" to a page causes unexpected error modal to appear.
This is a regression on in 7.14.x branch (7.2 product). In 7.1.1 product this was working without errors.

[~davidredhat] I'm not aware of any changes in this area, but this is now reproducible reliably. Could you please check / reassign?
column373:
see attached video for steps to reproduce the issue

1. Go to Pages
2. Create new page called "a"
3. Select components on the right, drag and drop "Target Div" navigation components onto the page.
4. Set Div Id to any value and click OK

Expected behavior:
target div component is added to the page
Actual behavior: 

  - Unexpected error modal appears, containing error 

{code}Uncaught exception: Exception caught: CDI Event exception: CommandType=CDIEvent, BeanType=org.uberfire.ext.properties.editor.model.PropertyEditorChangeEvent, BeanReference=org.uberfire.ext.properties.editor.model.PropertyEditorChangeEvent@48b8, FromClient=1 sent to [unavailable] Caused by: CDI Event exception: CommandType=CDIEvent, BeanType=org.uberfire.ext.properties.editor.model.PropertyEditorChangeEvent, BeanReference=org.uberfire.ext.properties.editor.model.PropertyEditorChangeEvent@48b8, FromClient=1 sent to [unavailable] Caused by: (TypeError) : Cannot read property 'c' of undefined{code}

EDIT:
semi-working workaround exists: click Ignore and click OK (as in step 4) again - the component is added to the page, BUT it has different ID that what user set in the dialog.
column404: After Unexpected error modal appears, click Ignore, then click OK again.

column1: Imported projects have wrong config on Git repository config
column10:
AppFormer is a low code platform to develop modern applications. It's a powerful tool for developers that
can quickly build applications by mashing up components and connect them.
column39:
This is the correct format for "origin" config:

[remote "origin"]
	url = https://github.com/porcelli/NewSampleGH.git
	fetch = +refs/heads/:refs/remotes/origin/

But this is how we get when Importing:

[remote "origin"]
	url = https://github.com/porcelli/SampleTest.git
	fetch = +refs/:refs/
	mirror = true

Notice that we need remove the mirror and change the fetch to have the correct format.

column1: Maven compiler uses undesired system properties
column10:
AppFormer is a low code platform to develop modern applications. It's a powerful tool for developers that
can quickly build applications by mashing up components and connect them.
column39:
Maven compiler is not ignoring system properties, set on users machine, that can break its build.

List of properties that should be ignored or set to default, when compiling project using our maven compiler
* "maven.main.skip" - Skips compliation of sources (maven property)

// will be updated with more properties, if we manage to identify more of these

Basically right now users can setup system properties, and these properties will be used in maven compiler. 


Pasting conversation from IRC for more background & information.
# 
{code:java}
<dhanak> mdessi, imho this line might inject the system-properties - https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-common/blob/93cfbdf1401aabe0b2ae56e5fe74ab651e0b3a67/kie-wb-common-services/kie-wb-common-compiler/kie-wb-common-compiler-core/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/common/services/backend/compiler/impl/external339/ReusableAFMavenCli.java#L214
<mdessi> dhanak, AF-1459 pushed, let me try what you have found :)
<dhanak> mdessi, should happen in the posted method - on #221 Properties buildProperties = AFCLIReportingUtils.getBuildProperties(); I can see "maven.main.skip" being passed to compiler
<mdessi> dhanak, ok, we have to decide what is our desidered behaviour filter this env var during the test or remove completely the env var readed
<mdessi> dhanak, I prefer the first option otherwise we have to pass to our compiler tons of vars
<dhanak> mdessi, porcelli ^^ what is your suggestion? :)
<dhanak> mdessi, I am not sure, what could happen later ,when it is integrated into workbench?
<mdessi> dhanak, usually in the maven_opts we put the amount of ram for maven
<mdessi> dhanak, and this will be used in our compiler
<dhanak> mdessi, And if user decides to set some option that could eventually break builds of our compiler?
<mdessi> dhanak, if breaks our compiler breaks every maven build of the code, we could parse and decide what erase and what permits
<dhanak> mdessi, not sure I follow, so if there is a system property that breaks maven build, we detect it and remove?
<mdessi> dhanak, we could before to use they in the reusable, but we have to decide which vars to stop
<dhanak> mdessi, basically we could have a whitelist/blacklist of the properties that break the builds, correct?
<mdessi> dhanak, in the ReusableMavenCli
<mdessi> dhanak, yes
{code}

column1: Git repository not accessible due to "Unable to complete your request, The following exception occurred: null"
column10:
AppFormer is a low code platform to develop modern applications. It's a powerful tool for developers that
can quickly build applications by mashing up components and connect them.
column39:
When you try to open any asset in a given repository, this ends with

"Unable to complete your request, The following exception occurred: null"

It makes the whole repository inaccessible, and the only current remedy we have is this:

$ git clone system.git/
$  cd system
$ git branch -a // find out the user's branch
$ git push origin --delete <USER_BRANCH>

This error only happens for a specific user - if you log into different user, you can access the same resources without any errors.

Unfortunately, we do not have a consistent way of reproducing.
Let us know what could help in investigation.


Acceptance criteria:
Investigate this issues and provide information to the customer. Confirm whether it is reproducible or not.

Many properties when setting in system level, doesn't seem to take priority over the default value. For instance, 'drools.dateformat' are not overridden by the value I defined in System Properties.
column422:
14/Aug/18 1:22 AM;jhrcek;Hello [~prego]. Could you please take a look at this and estimate how much effort it would require to fix this?
As it turns out it's not just customer issue, but also blocks my attempts to make some tests more robust.

What I want to achieve: I would like to disable incremental build in workbench for some tests using system property -Dbuild.enable-incremental=false which is specified in [AppSetup|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-distributions/blob/master/kie-wb-parent/kie-wb-webapp/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/backend/AppSetup.java#L108]. However the system property doesn't have any effect and as per manstis's investigation it looks like those system properties are overwritten by ApplicationPreferencesLoader (see google groups discussion in description).

column1: Workbench Rest API - deleting space sometimes randomly takes more than 10-30 seconds
column10:
AppFormer is a low code platform to develop modern applications. It's a powerful tool for developers that
can quickly build applications by mashing up components and connect them.
column39:
There is a couple of integration tests in [kie-wb-distributions|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-distributions/tree/master/kie-wb-tests/kie-wb-tests-rest/src/test/java/org/kie/wb/test/rest/functional] that test workbench rest api (managing projects, spaced, maven build etc.).

These have been failing very often as described in [this PR|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-distributions/pull/778]. For example failure see [this|http://janhrcek.cz/random-failures/#/class/org.kie.wb.test.rest.functional.ProjectIntegrationTest/method/org.kie.wb.test.rest.functional.ProjectIntegrationTest].

We found that they're failing in the step when spaces are deleted in `@AfterClass` - quite often it takes more than 10 seconds to delete the space and the client request times out. This seems to be happening randomly no matter the size of space being deleted (even space with just 1 empty project).

For now I increased client timeout to 30 seconds, so that these tests don't fail so often.

TODO the goal of this task is to find the root cause of the slowness. To make the investigation easier I create an `@Ignore`-d test in the PR above which, when disabled, clearly demonstrates this behavior.
column422:
27/Jul/18 4:43 AM;jhrcek;This behavior is not easily reproducible locally. When running tests locally on my machine all the "delete space" requests take about 1 second.

I connected to jenkins slave via ssh while the tests were running and repeatedly took stack dumps via jstack while the long "delete space" calls were in progress. I found the following stack trace elements were present in most of these cases:

      	at org.apache.lucene.store.FSDirectory.fsync(FSDirectory.java:327)
     	at org.apache.lucene.util.IOUtils.fsync(IOUtils.java:472)

It seems quite possible that this is the root cause. Knowing this I'll investigate this more locally..

Here's stacktrace for completeness

column423:
09/Aug/18 9:22 AM;jhrcek;Here is the summary of my findings: 

- Probable cause: Disk IO (niogit & indexing operations) comparatively slower on jenkins slaves.
- Reported 2 issues in indexing implementation:
     * Redundant indexing being done (reported in [RHPAM-1455|https://issues.jboss.org/browse/RHPAM-1455])
     * NPEs being thrown from LuceneIndexProvider (reported in [RHPAM-1459|https://issues.jboss.org/browse/RHPAM-1459])
- I’d also like to disable incremental build to make the tests less “IO intensive” (By supplying `-Dbuild.enable-incremental=false` when starting wildfly which runs the workbench - see [AppSetup|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-distributions/blob/master/kie-wb-parent/kie-wb-webapp/src/main/java/org/kie/workbench/backend/AppSetup.java#L108], but this is currently impossible due to regression [AF-1408|https://issues.jboss.org/browse/AF-1408].

I think it is good idea to prioritize investigation and fixing of these indexing issues before we merge multiple branch support and infinispan indexing which will introduce more logic around indexing!
column424: 13/Aug/18 1:35 AM;jhrcek;When these issues have been fixed / investigated, we need to unignore tests ignored in [DROOLS-2803|https://issues.jboss.org/browse/DROOLS-2803].
column425: 16/Aug/18 4:29 AM;jhrcek;[PR|https://github.com/kiegroup/kie-wb-distributions/pull/778] merged. Additional work on this will be tracked in the jiras mentioned in [second comment|https://issues.jboss.org/browse/AF-1310?focusedCommentId=13617052&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13617052]

column1: [IE] Project Explorer disappears after editing pom.xml file
column10:
AppFormer is a low code platform to develop modern applications. It's a powerful tool for developers that
can quickly build applications by mashing up components and connect them.
column39: When you change something in pom.xml file and then switch the view of Project Explorer to "Project View", Project Explorer disappears and you are redirected to the asset list.
column373:
# Create a project
# Create a DRL file
# Open Project Explorer
# Switch to repository view
# Open the pom.xml file
# Change something in the pom.xml file
# Save the changes
# Switch to Project view

When you switch to the Project view, the content of Project Explorer disappears and you are redirected to the list of assets (see attached screenshot). The issue is Internet Explorer specific.
column422: 25/Jul/18 6:12 AM;bsiskova;I am closing the issue as it is not reproducible anymore.

After deleting a project an error modal shows in Library Screen.
Error text: Unable to complete your request. The following exception occurred: 'd' is null.
There is no stack.

column1: Angular UI executes requests twice when transitioning from one UI tab to another
column10: Mobile Services
column39:
We do have a problem on UPS Angular UI:
* clicking on the navigation TAB does trigger HTTP request twice, when moving from one page/view to a different one.

Clicking on the same tab (and no transition happens), we get the requests for that view only once.


I also think some weird page-reload is happening.... 

clicking on the current TAB, and not navigting... all is good; request only once :-)

So attempt to fix it:
https://github.com/aerogear/aerogear-unifiedpush-server/pull/784

but it's still there...
column422: 23/Feb/17 11:21 AM;mwessendorf;[~lucas.holmquist] [~edewit] [~lfryc] In case one of you has an idea, on that, we'd appreciate a comment
column423:
23/Feb/17 1:38 PM;mwessendorf;[~pmdarrow] do you have an idea ? 

Or [~bleathem] ?
column424: 23/Feb/17 9:26 PM;bleathem;Debug it, see how many times the click listener is getting invoked.  Then move down the stack until you get to the http request invocation, and see where the duplication is happening.
column425: 23/Feb/17 10:31 PM;mwessendorf;[~bleathem] ah, great ...! Never thought about that ;-)  It's all minimized crap. I think [~edewit] and [~lucas.holmquist] even ran in the debug/developers mode the other day.
column426: 24/Feb/17 4:15 AM;edewit;[~mwessendorf] when you run in developer mode you can debug it. [~bleathem] seems both requests come from angular but it's using a es5 router might be the combination of the two. [~mwessendorf] maybe we can go back in git history and see where it was introduced?
column427: 11/May/17 9:39 AM;jgallaso;The fix has been removed since it causes problems when embedding the admin-ui.tgz node module in other UI frameworks.
column428:
28/Aug/17 9:50 AM;roregan;h2. Verification steps
# Navigate to http://testing.pbrauncios.skunkhenry.com/
# Create any project with a client app or use an existing one.
# Inside the client app, navigate to the push tab on the left hand menu
# Click "Enable Push"
# Navigate between the "Analytics", "Variants", "Sender API" and "Activity  Log" tabs
# Using developer tools in your browser, notice that only one request is sent per endpoint:

{code:java}
/api/v2/ag-push/rest/applications/
/api/v2/ag-push/rest/metrics/messages/application/
{code}

Note: navigating to "Activity  Log" tab will fire an additional request to /api/v2/ag-push/rest/metrics/messages/application/.  This is to ensure that the metrics get fetched. When I removed this extra call to the endpoint I sometimes seen that the html page for that tab would not load.

column423:
09/Sep/16 9:09 AM;yoann08;That is correct. I used the UPS migrator to create the schema i believe. I have one installation and i've always seen this issue. I don't think its a modelling problem as the vast majority of device registrations go without error.

Seems Ok to me:

CREATE TABLE category
(
  id bigint NOT NULL,
  name character varying(255),
  CONSTRAINT category_pkey PRIMARY KEY (id)
)

CREATE TABLE installation
(
  id character varying(255) NOT NULL,
  alias character varying(255),
  device_token character varying(4096),
  device_type character varying(255),
  enabled boolean NOT NULL,
  operating_system character varying(255),
  os_version character varying(255),
  platform character varying(255),
  variant_id character varying(255),
  CONSTRAINT installation_pkey PRIMARY KEY (id),
  CONSTRAINT fk_q1c2n4kjui158w3t1llg99koq FOREIGN KEY (variant_id)
      REFERENCES variant (id) MATCH SIMPLE
      ON UPDATE NO ACTION ON DELETE NO ACTION
)

CREATE TABLE installation_category
(
  installation_id character varying(255) NOT NULL,
  category_id bigint NOT NULL,
  CONSTRAINT installation_category_pkey PRIMARY KEY (installation_id, category_id),
  CONSTRAINT fk_dttushnsf13kdwywyba8njqv7 FOREIGN KEY (installation_id)
      REFERENCES installation (id) MATCH SIMPLE
      ON UPDATE NO ACTION ON DELETE NO ACTION,
  CONSTRAINT fk_ox56uwmry1x6kfoi3dkw1to8o FOREIGN KEY (category_id)
      REFERENCES category (id) MATCH SIMPLE
      ON UPDATE NO ACTION ON DELETE NO ACTION
)

column1: Charset related CocoaPods problem in Digger OSX
column10: Mobile Services
column39:
h3. What
{code}
 export LANG=en_US.UTF-8
{code}
Line above should be added to Bash profile in OSX nodes. I've seen this problem locally and also in OSM4.

Although the warning below says we should have that line in {{~/.profile}}, I had local success when I put that line in my {{~/.bashrc}} file.

We should do it in digger-installer Ansible role.

h3. Why

CocoaPods fails to install pods for project : https://github.com/feedhenry-templates/helloworld-ios-swift
Perhaps there is a file with a different encoding somewhere.

I've googled and saw that having {{export LANG=en_US.UTF-8}} is recommended.

column1: Don't use 'become: true' in buildfarm installer
column10: Mobile Services
column39:
*What*
'becomde:true` is used [here|https://github.com/feedhenry/buildfarm-installer/blob/55f8e0acb314f9c310c97611d0590ca3b005a2eb/android-sdk/tasks/main.yml#L45] and [here|https://github.com/feedhenry/buildfarm-installer/blob/55f8e0acb314f9c310c97611d0590ca3b005a2eb/android-sdk/tasks/main.yml#L59]

To run a task as the sysadmin user, point to the kube config file. example [here|https://github.com/fheng/rhmap-ansible/blob/6544a1e28716e828e37f779e9c2abadffd85a3a4/playbooks/tasks/preflight_checks.yml#L30]
column422:
19/Jun/17 11:55 AM;lfitzgerald;*Update*
become: true is used to become the super user
kubeconfig=config file is used to become the OpenShift system:admin

In the case of `oc cp` and `oc rsh` we can execute these as a non admin user so we don't need to add this anymore. sorry.

We can keep the kubeconfig value in the default in case we want to use it in the future.

column1: Fix issues with Nagios check for macos node in buildfarm
column10: Mobile Services
column39:
h4. What

Currently, the Nagios container within a Buildfarm 2.0 project attempts to check the health status of a macOS slave via Jenkins. There are some issues with the check in its current state. 

Firstly, it appears to assume https and when using a self signed certificate, the check will fail. [~pyates] hit this when testing on core team cluster which uses self signed cert. This is likely the case if Jenkins has been configured to use a http route also

Secondly, the container currently requires a jenkins username and password to be set as environment variables. This is fine if using the standard login, but this wont work when Jenkins is using oauth tokens for login

ping [~lfitzgerald] I think we should look at prioritising this issue
column422:
25/Sep/17 8:09 AM;lfitzgerald;[~pgough] agreed. Will get this one pointed today and in the sprint. This one needs to be fixed for GA. 
cc [~ngough]
column423: 27/Sep/17 7:28 AM;pgough;Check is done via Jenkins which looks at the mac node. The check used the external route but best to do the check via the internal dns so it doesnt have to hit the router

column1: MacOS slave credential generation is not resilient to inventory changes
column10: Mobile Services
column39:
*What:* Refactor/fix code for credentials generation\[1]. Current implementation is not resilient to inventory changes when multiple macos slaves are used. 

*Why:* E.g: if first entry of macos group in inventory file changes, credentials on some nodes might not be updated. That will eventually result in inability to reconnect to slave.

\[1] https://github.com/aerogear/digger-installer/blob/cb823f41b61b46a60361c1ba549e159e87d9b20b/provision-osx/tasks/configure_buildfarm_node.yml#L6-L41

column1: Missing dependency on expect module
column10: Mobile Services
column39:
h4. What

With changes made in [https://issues.jboss.org/browse/AGDIGGER-229|AGDIGGER-229] to allow the user to use an ssh key with a password, an additional dependency on the python module "pexpect" was introduced.

We should automate the installation of this dependency if required.

h4. Why

This is not installed during the process if it is missing and the result being the playbook fails.

h4. How
Ideally we would install this using Ansibles yum module. However the rpm provides a version lower than that required by Ansible so as of now there are two solutions.

1. Install it via pip (may introduce an additional dependency on pip)
1. Install it via yum and use the shell command to handle the input
column422: 09/Nov/17 7:24 AM;pgough;Solution for now was to go with the pip install because this would be supported across multiple os. Verified by [~colum.foskin] in linked pr

column1: GCM Topic name encoding issues

column39:
